리뷰:
I seen lobster in the window and wanted it. I was highly disappointed when I sat down and noticed they were selling half a grilled lobster, which was small I might add, for 39 euro.

That said, I switched to the Seabass. I seen someone with it and it looked good. I also asked the waiter and he recommend. It was very good. One in our party still got the lobster and complained about the size and price. The salmon dish was also good. Last but not least one person got the French Onion soup which he said was cheesy and good as well.

As far as the atmosphere, its tight in there. Had to move a table for people to sit down. Also, the smoking sucked, as usual. A memorable experience from start to finish. We were dining as a big group, and from the moment we stepped into the restaurant, we were immediately greeted by one the staff at the restaurant who made everyone feel welcomed, even the young ones in our party.

Service was professional and felt sincere, and they really did their best to make sure their guests felt comfortable and looked after.

The food was delicious. Everyone in our group loved the food. Beautifully seasoned and expertly executed dishes.

It was a beautiful way to end our Paris vacation and made a positive lasting impression. Will definitely be dining here again in the future. Great customer service.  The server did not rush us order and the portions were quite large.  Food quality was outstanding.  Crepe flambeed with Cointreau was delicious. Very nice place. We were not that hungry so we ordered a few smaller meals like onion soup, fish soup and Caesar salad, and everything was fresh and tasty.
I was expecting the fish soup to be a bouillon with fish parts, but it was a crme soup instead I cannot blame the restaurant for my mistake.
Caesar salad was very good but was missing some croutons.
Onion soup was tasteful, but be aware that the amount of cheese on top is huge, what makes the soup pretty salty.
The staff was extremely friendly. Very nice place  Even though its located in a very touristy area its does not feel that way at all! A lot of local people eating there which a good sign. Very friendly stuff and food is really great. We paid 60 for two for 2 course meal which is really isnt expensive!

Can definitely recommend this place!

리뷰:
The decor is simple but this was the nicest food we had in our month in Europe! The waiter and chef understood coeliac and also my husbands soycornseafood allergies. They said they can adjust any meal we chose to suit allergies. The menu is different each day. There were 56 starters, mains and desserts to choose from. All the food we ordered was amazing! We were just going to order mains but the mains were so good we wanted to try the desserts and the desserts were all perfect! Absolutely incredible food. Everything was delicious and prepared well. The restaurant is intimate setting with not a big amount of seats. But the food was the best thing about it  everything tasted great. We dined here on a short trip, the meal was beautiful!
The service was friendly and quick, regularly checking on our table and food.
The food itself was perfectly cooked and I rarely enjoy all course but couldnt fault any of these courses. Highly recommend, wasnt too busy and was very good overall. We had an excellent dinner, the food was very good and the service was great!
The foie gras was amazing and I had the best grilled eels in Paris. We had lunch at this place during weekdays. It was generous and delicious French cuisine with a touch of Korean flavor.

리뷰:
Dressing up your crepes every which way.  Very large portions depending on your age.  We could not finish our order in one sitting. Unfortunately,  reheating it is not the same.  The lineup at this location is constant and continuous. We were curious after walking by this location several times and decided to try it. Once you've waited patiently to get to the counter to place your order, you'll need to wait another 1015 minutes as you watch them cook it. No seating,  standing only.  Cash only and these well priced crepes will be, on average, less than 10 euros. The halal crepes are 1012 euros. Please tip, the three men on duty never stopped. Absolutely delicious.  We ate one salty one and one sweet. They were both spectacular.  They allowed us to mix ingredients that were not in the menu.

After eating both crepes,  we didn't eat anything else the whole day. A delicious crepe restaurant tucked away on Mouffetard street. Each crepe is practically big enough to feed two. We ordered one savoury and one sweet crepe, split them and were more than satisfied by the end. Our chefserver was very friendly with everyone he served. We waited no more than 10 minutes, which flew by as the surrounding area is a rich example of Paris. Wouldn't Return.

My absolute biggest regret on a 5 city 25 day trip. Probably because it can only be described as the perfect hungover feed  or my palate isn't suited for ham, cheese and potatoes.

Ham and Cheese were funky  it was a sort of off funk which I can only attribute to the ham. Portion is huge, but full of potato.
Not many words other than I tried to pick out and salvage the salad.

Pictures look nice but taste was awful. Not for me.

Cash I came on a Monday around 1120am. Thankfully there was no line. Small space with a few bar seating available. Mostly a take away shop. You can see the staffs making the crepes in advance. I ordered, La Savoyarde with no potatoes for 10 euro. The staff suggested to replace the potatoes with mushrooms which I gladly accepted. It took about 7 minutes to make my crepe.

The crepe is huge. It has so much filling inside. It can feed 2 people easily. A bit too much ham though as it was very salty. I would like to return to try their sweet crepes.

리뷰:
Absolutely perfect! We were seated without a reservation and the food was amazing! We will definitely be back for the duck breast as it was so tasty.

Would recommend! This is a good place for a quick weekday lunch they have lunch specials every day with lunch formula entree du jour  plat du jour at 18 euros. The plat du jour changes every day and is around 13.5 euros. Other than the lunch menu du jour, theres their regular menu with lots of options. Note that the regular menu items are not part of their lunch formulas. The dishes use fresh ingredients and generally taste hearty. Lots of people come here during their lunch breaks. Set in a beautiful neighbourhood of Paris, this cute restaurant is set on the corner with a nice terrace
The food was excellent and very good service. Price was also good for the quality
Nice selection of wines by glass or bottle
We had to wait about 10mins for a table, but it was a warm night and very busy Great food, and kind staff. Try fried shrimp for an appetizer plus duck for the main dish see photo, its absolutely fantastic. A few Asian mixes on the menu Japanese, Thai, etc. Around 2030 euros per person for lunch. What a wonderful find  we stumbled in le Petit March as we wandered around our hotels neighborhood. The energy coming from the restaurant was wonderful  we were seated within 15 minutes of arriving, without a reservation, at 830 pm. We had a delicious meal  the team was very conscientious of our glutenfree needs. The food was great  flavors were subtle but delicious. The team was so nice, too. We would recommend the asparagus with crispy pancetta and the mushroom risotto for sure! The steak was lovely  the mash potatoes definitely stood out! Worth the visit!

Living in the UK and frequently traveling to Europe, I can tell how hard it is to find a Korean restaurant run by Koreans. But here it is. The staff is very welcoming, the food is very well presented even with very authentic Korean cutlery metal chopsticks!. I genuinely enjoyed the entree and the main I ordered. Highly recommend 

      . One of the best and authentic korean food places in Paris!

Tried their kimchi pancake, kimchi stew and stir fried pork and they were all so delicious, very similar to what i had in Korea! Kimchi was very fermented and sour which i loved. I visited this restaurant last Sunday, and unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience. Even though it wasnt rush hour, they seemed severely understaffed, with only one server handling all the tables. Service was slow, and while the server was polite and doing his best, the chef was constantly yelling at him, even in front of customers, which made the atmosphere uncomfortable.

As for the food, it arrived late and tasted awful. It was actually stinky, and I couldnt even take more than two bites. The stew had white bubbles, which made me suspect it was old or spoiled. Overall, a very unpleasant experience. Best korean restaurant I have been so far, food is amazing, the staff are really polite and helpful,  went there twice on our holiday to Paris. And anytime I will be over , am definitely going to Gatt, just gorgeous food, a must try, don't miss the korean cocktails and the drinks. the kimchi is top notch,200 recommended Very nice experience in this restaurant, very tasty food waiters are listening to us and were able to add 3 more person to the original reservation 10 people.

First of all,  the taste of the food at this restaurant is not bad. However, I do not recommend this place. The reason is simple they overcharged me without my consent.That day, after finishing my meal, I asked for the bill from the owner a gentleman, probably Korean. The bill showed 39 euros. I indicated that I wanted to pay by card, so the man brought out the payment machine. I tapped my Visa credit card on the machine. After a moment, he asked if I needed a receipt, and I said yes. I didnt pay much attention to the receipt and left with my family.After leaving the restaurant, I was organizing my things and took a closer look at the receipt. To my surprise, I noticed that he had charged me 40 euros, which was 1 euro more than the bill.I understand that some establishments might expect customers to leave a tip, but that doesnt justify him taking extra money from me without asking. Even in the U.S., where tipping is almost mandatory, its clearly shown on the bill. If this Korean owner had asked me beforehand whether I was willing to leave a tip, I might not have refused. But his decision to take a tip without my consent made me very uncomfortable.Thats why I do not recommend this restaurant at all. It made me feel that he is dishonest. If he is willing to take an extra euro from a customer's credit card without permission, how can I trust the quality of his ingredients? How can I trust that he wouldnt cut corners with the food to make more profit? At this restaurant I visited a few days ago, I met the best kimchi stew of my life! It is not a Korean food with a strange taste modified to suit the local area, but a real depth and taste of the original Korean food! The smallsized seafood green onion pancake I ate as an appetizer was also excellent. I understood why many certification stickers on the restaurant show window were attached. It will be a very valuable experience not only for Korean travelers who miss Korean food but also for French people who are curious about Korean food culture! I highly recommend it! Had dinner here after a bit of shopping. They had vegan options and were kind enough to make some swaps. A little expensive for what you get but they make up for it in service and the ambiance of the place.

Ambiance 55
Service 55
Food quality 45
Food portion 45
Price and value for money 45

 lifewithaua Absolutely AMAZING service, the food is delicious, and really reminds me of food from traditional Korean restaurants. Unlike any other Korean place in France! I would eat here every day. It was a pleasant and yummy surprise I highly recommend this restaurant for those who are looking for authentic Korean food. Everything we tried there was very good and we were finally satisfied after trying a few places nearby that claim they are Korean restaurants but couldnt make the food the way they were if they were made by Koreans. Also everyone is nice!! I will be back when I revisit Paris in the future.

We both the normal corn dog, mozzarella corn dog and the tteokbokki. Both corn dogs were delicious, would recommend the mozzarella one though and the tteokbokki was so good I loved the large rice cakes that were used and the sauce was so yummy. Service was great, the person who served us was so lovely and spoke great English, the shop was busy but the food still came in great time and the price was all super reasonable, cheapest tteokbokki we have found in Europe! The name is corn dog paris but we ordered the Gimbap and Korean toast. The toast was okay but the Gimbap was horrible. Maybe dont order these two dishes. I recently visited Corn Dog Paris, also known as Daoul Bun Sik though I'm not entirely certain about the name.

I sampled their teokbokki, fried chicken, and their corn dogs. While I was familiar with the flavors of the teokbokki and fried chicken from other eateries, I found them to be quite good and reasonably priced. The standout for me was the fried chicken with honey and garlicit was exceptionally flavorful.

Located on a quaint street in Paris, the restaurant is a bit challenging to locate, and the space itself is cozy, making it less suitable for larger groups.

One minor suggestion would be for the establishment to refrain from seating customers near closing time, as this can inadvertently make them feel rushed. I experienced this firsthand, as staff seemed eager for us to vacate our table towards the end of the evening. Despite this, I would rate my experience at Corn Dog Paris 4 out of 5 stars, as everything else exceeded my expectations. Very good food exactly like in Korea! The owner was so nice and friendly, and even gave us service. We had gotten some side dishes but they had pork and the owner changed it without us asking and gave us more delicious food! I also had mentioned how I missed cheese tteokbokki and the owner made it for me with the cheese!! Would definitely go again when I miss Korean food. I came here to try it today and it was delicious! Its a must if you are looking for a Korean food experience. I had the teokbokki classic with ramen and cheese and it was perfect!

Authentic Japanese food ive been craving to have in France.
Great great great! food!

only downside is a bit too little space and slow service to enjoy the great great food bitter smile.

Wanna come back  It is a small place so you may wait for a while when  you come. We waited under rain about 15 mins and around 15 mins for food is ready but it's worthy. The food is really delicious and I highly recommend salads and tempura. I tried the matcha and fried rice it's really nice to combine with the food but the water is a bit hot so be careful if not you would burn your tongue. For dessert I recommend the daifuku. It's red bean mochi. Very authentic Japanese udon restaurant, the portion is quite small so make sure you add extra udon if you have better appetite. But the udon here taste just like the ones I took in Japan, and all the staffs here are Japanese. VERY Recommend Some of the best Soba Noodles and tempura we have ever had. Great lively atmosphere and friendly staff and service. Looking forward to visiting again. This is a small fastpaced udon shop! Kudos to all staff to keep this vibe going all night, speedy ordering and serving. The line doesn't go down at all! The atmosphere is so fun some people might call this stressful we finished our meal within 15mins. We had tamagoyaki and tempura udon. The tamagoyaki is not sweet and packed with flavours which surprises us. The tempura is so good! The flour batter is super light and loves the vegetable tempura as well! The udon is a bit overcooked which is expected in this environment.

리뷰:
We had a very nice experience here. The KFC was particularly good, and the other dishes had a nice spice to them. We were served quickly. This is the most cutest korean restraunt ever ive been to!
The decor, the service and specially the owners are absolutely warm and welcoming
The food is soo comforting and delicious
Definitely going back to the place.
Lovely experience all in all Came to visit Paris and wanted a good Korean meal. Our friends suggested this and we all went. Really good options. We just love the Beef noodle soup and the variation of Korean side dishes that make it so special eating at Deajang. Highest recommendation if you like Korean! We had our dinner here. And we were pleasantly surprised that we could find authentic Korean food in Paris. We enjoyed the kimchi and the side dishes. We especially like the chapchay and the soupstew. Highly recommend it.

Its been a while since I had such good Korean food in Paris but to be fair I havent been back in a while with so many Korean restaurants in town recently, I knew I had to try at least one of them, and I was not let down at all.

The dishes were all flavourful, the rice was fluffy and the soups were delicious!

My favourites were the fried chicken, the soybean paste soup and the grilled pork dishes ! We chanced upon this korean restaurant just downstairs our airbnb. The food is so so good! Definitely authentic taste of Korean food. We had the soodunbu tofu soup and tteokbokki. High recommended to come try their food. Service staff was friendly and they know French, English and Korean. I went to a Korean restaurant and I was a bit disappointed with the salty and plain taste of the food.
I'm sorry. I couldn't post a good review I recommend do not missed this restaurant

Excellent food and nd service I love it  Authentic Korean food. The grilled meat set is classic and did not take too much time. Highly recommended. Most importantly, the staff here are super nice and cute  yes very cute indeed

This restaurant is highly recommended for its combination of good food, attentive service, and a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience. Whether youre dining alone or with a group, the environment strikes a perfect balance between comfort and sophistication, making it an ideal spot for various occasions.

One of the standout items on the menu is the truffle pizza. If youre a fan of pizza or just looking to try something unique, the truffle pizza is a musttry. The blend of earthy truffle with the rich, cheesy toppings creates a mouthwatering dish that appeals to both casual diners and food enthusiasts alike. The pizza has a thin, crispy crust with just the right amount of toppings, offering a flavorful experience without being overwhelming.

Beyond pizza, the menu offers a wide variety of dishes that cater to different tastes, all prepared with quality ingredients. Service is prompt and friendly, ensuring that your needs are met efficiently. Whether youre coming for a casual meal or a special celebration, this restaurant delivers a wellrounded experience that will leave you satisfied and eager to return. Clearly, this pink building is popular, but we were able to snag a table for three on the bottom floor right away for an hour around noon on a Saturday.

Atmosphere is stunning and take the time to walk all floors to see it. Service is phenomenal and drinks and food even better.

Their Bellini is only 10 Euros and comes in a large glass filled to the top. So refreshing!

The pizza that crust, burrata, and truffle pasta were so good. My wife says the pasta is her favorite in the world. So delicious! I would definitely recommend Pink Mamma. It was a perfect anniversary dinner for my husband and I. Every dish was exceptional and such high quality. Portions were larger than expected which was great! A must visit in Paris. As an Italian by blood and frequent visitor of Italy, this place lived up to the hype. I was seated promptly at my reservation time. The meatballs were incredibly moist and tender. The truffle creme pasta was unlike anything Ive had before. Focaccia carbonara was delicious. Lastly the setting is very picturesque. Amazing all around. Ambience was perfect for conversation and enjoying. Servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. Food was absolutely amazing!! Totally worth all the hype and the prices werent even bad. Will definitely return someday.

It's easily the best Korean restaurant I've been to. Friendly and fast service as well as really tasty dishes. Dupbap with fried chicken and spicy sauce was great! Have been here so many times, ordered on ubereat too. I have tried almost all the popular dishes on the menu. Perfect every time, authentic korean with typical dishes that are hard to find elsewhere. Toppoki, cold noodles, fried chicken, seafood pancakes, jajangmyeon are my favourites. A bit more expensive than other korean restaurants around, yes, but you pay for the quality of food and a great service! Had dinner here with my wife tonight and was deeply disappointed. We were advised against the dishes that we actually wanted to order just because we said we don't like "too much spicy food", unfortunately the owner immediately assumed that we only eat no spice at all and literally forced us to order very bland and sweetened dishes, simply  pointed at pictures of 3 dishes and said "choose now" not to mention the relatively expensive prices. It is not worth the confusion in the reservation process where we almost ended up standing in the queue outside because they did not understand us. At the end of the dinner the owner asked us whether we liked it  when we gave him our honest opinion he exclaimed a fake laugh and just walked away.

To sum up the experience all I can say is I am better off cooking my own Korean food at home, it tastes more authentic than the food cooked by Thai and Indian kitchen staff here. Cute and family run Korean Restaurant. The daughter spoke in English so she could help us with selection. It's such a nice and warm atmosphere. Biggest disappointment since a while. The waitress took the wrong order, and brought me a pork dish instead of a chicken one. I did not realize until I went away because they made me pay extra for the dish. When I went back and asked the reason why I paid extra, I discovered that they made me eat pork when I would never eat it nor order it. They were so rude about it and refused to give in and make a gesture. The owner acted like I was lying about what I ordered and was so mean about a mistake they made and refused to own up to it. WOULD NEVER GO BACK, what a horrible way to treat customers.

Very happy about this restaurant. It really reminded me of South Korea. Authentic food flavours, good quality food and a good variety of options. The place can be a bit crowded but the service is very good and polite. We were served more rice with no extra. All the entries were very tasty. The serve Korean beer Cass to make mekju. I would recommend it. As a korean person, was going to rate it a 3 star but had to rate them a 2 because they only gave us 4 bonchon instead of 6 like all of the other tables. When we asked for the fishcake bonchon they said they dont have that but the table next to us got it.. so.. theyre lying.
The tofu soup is BAD. not authentic at all, its just salty water with chili oil ontop.. WHO USES CHILIOIL FOR THIS DISH? what the heck.

The spicy chicken is also boneless and tastes super chalky. Very bland.

Honestly the 4 bonchon's that we did get were good  flavorful, but the main dishes are not authentic at all  lacked a bunch of the deep flavors korean dishes should have. It was perfect. Very large quantities and still steaming when the meat and noodles arrived. What a feat. It was also very quick much much quicker than your average french or even Chinese in France. Super tasty too. Highly recommend. We came around 9pm and almost did not wait yet the place was packed and some people had to wait outside after us. 33 euros for 2.large dishes. Inexpensive and fulfilling This is one of the best and legit Korean places in Paris, been going for years!! Service is fast, food is fantastic  both meals and Korean BBQ. Do expect a queue on FridaySaturday nights. One of the best Korean restaurant in Paris! I've been there several times and it's always good! Most dishes are spicy... The side dishes are good. Good atmosphere too...

주소: 45 Rue de la Convention, 75015 Paris, France
리뷰:
We had an excellent experience at this authentic restaurant! The food was outstanding. The service was topnotchvery friendly and attentive staff who made sure we had everything we needed. We had an absolute blast and can't wait to come back. Highly recommended Really excellent food. Very friendly staff. Probably everything feels a bit too rushed but it is always better to get food quickly rather than wait for hours.
As for the atmosphere, get ready for a sauna it's so hot in there. And probably you feel relieved that food comes so quickly so that you can leave early.
Hence the 45 for service and atmosphere.
We have been there twice and will be back many more times for sure. I came here twice during my 2023 trip to Paris because it was that good. The service is friendly, prices are good and of course the food itself is authentic and delicious. The only con was that when I visited it was really hot and this establishment doesn't have ac. No ac  open flames  hot interior but it's still worth it for the food! Very cute place and the food was delicious! The staff was friendly. I would highly recommend checking out this place if you're craving Korean food or just wanted to try it out.

We didn't get the skewers but next time we want to try it Place was small and it got busy. I felt it was a bit overwhelming for the service. However, they were smiling and accommodating. Food was delicious especially the lamb skewers! Will be back!!

Although, the Korean cuisine was not the best I ever had, when you are in Paris and are craving traditional Korean cuisine, this will do the job. In addition, the owner provided excellent service, he went out of his way to provide us with great service and he even gave us a large bottled water as part of the service, other places would charge about 3.50 euros for bottled water that size. The soup comes to the table and it is still boiling so it's a bit hot to eat. However it is so delicious. If youre a big fan of tofu and spicy I believe beef tofu soup is good for you. They have dinner set which you can have the starter and kimchi and pickles. The owner is really friendly and he offers the big bottle water freely. That is so nice of them. I came back on Sunday but unfortunately it's closed. When I travel, I always want to find a very authentic Korean food, and I found this!  I trully enjoy the staffsand owner's care and a very delicious meal set. Freshly made, served hot, great seasoning, very soft tofuu in a Kimchi Jiggae. And... really, such big amount of rice  hot soup will always be a great friend with hot and big scoop of rice. Banchan, perfectttt  The Korean owner is attentive to customers needs. Seafood Ramen was with a lot of small seafoods. The best Korean taste with French perfection. First start with super friendly owner and comfortable cozy atmosphere.  Next cute menu and very reasonable prices per potion.  Next consume one of the highlights of korean cuisine in Paris.  Location is just a short walk from the Eiffel Tower.  Highly recommend and will return!

Best Korean food in Paris.
If you want to try authentic dishes that Koreans eat everyday, this is the right place. The owner chef was nice and kind to all guests. It is small restaurant, nothing fancy but definitely should try! Nice little Korean restaurant. The food is tasty and they also offer the chance to try some Korean drinks  be prepared to be surprise not your usual wine or beer but good discovery. The price is correct not expensive. Seoul Toque is the best Korean restaurant in ParisI,a Korean girl who is picky about food, verified it!! Ive been to three times during the 5 days of my Paris trip  Their food is authentic like my moms cooking. note my mom is really good at cooking  I could tell all the ingredients were so fresh while I was enjoying the perfect combinations of them. The place is small but its really cozy and the welcoming from the two chefs adds a delightful touch to the dining experience. Im eagerly looking forward to returning to Seoul Toque on my next visit to Paris! The food was very good!
And the workersowners was very friendly too! Very attentive and kind.
It is a cute little shop away from all of the bustling from the main centre of the city. Wonderful experience in this little piece of Korea. The owners are incredibly kind and the food was a small trip to Seoul.

If you are near the area, it's a cozy place to enjoy a different meal.

주소: 30 Rue Vieille du Temple, 75004 Paris, France
리뷰:
There are three restaurants on the same street owned by the same boss. I went to the authentic one with old bar, tiny seat with good food. Next time I will try their other restaurant that looks more spacious. I can confidently say that this restaurant is by far the best dining experience I've had in Paris. From the moment we stepped in, the staff made us feel incredibly welcome. He was not only friendly but also fun, kind, and extremely polite.

Now, onto the food. The tartare steak was simply outstanding  fresh, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. Every bite was a delight. The dessert was a sweet conclusion to the meal, and the wine selection complemented our dishes perfectly.

Overall, I loved everything about this restaurant, from the food to the service to the atmosphere. I'm already looking forward to my next visit and highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience in Paris. The cheese is the star  of this charming place.
The tarte tatin is really good!
The ham sandwichthe bread is perfection.
Coffee  is on point.
The ambience is transportive.
The service is NOT.
And at the end of the day no matter how much I like the rest of it, I cannot come back to a place that isnt welcoming.
There are too many places in the Marais that make you feel cared for, to come back to one that doesnt. Very average. Suggested by a friend and was disappointed. You won't be mad if you go here, but just don't set your expectations too high and it'll be fine. Don't get the duck confeit though. Very packed table setup, you're eating with strangers almost, but it's a nice patio. Food was worth a tight squeeze of a restaurant. The duck confit was crispy and moist, the beef bourguignon was rich and tender, the French onion soup was rich but not overwhelming. Greta beer selection and food is responsibly sourced.

리뷰: Tried a lot of local cuisine and this was by far the best meal I had in Paris! The Sam Gye Tang was so fruitful and the chicken fell right off the bones!! Honestly best Sam Gye Tang Ive ever had, and Ive even had it in Korea! Amazing meal and cant wait to come back! Bravo! I accidentally deleted my previous reviews but again, I would recommend reservations for here to eat, really good and authenticgreat owner and staff! 1010 Ive been searching for a good restaurant in Paris and this one definitely hit the spot! Went for a samgyeopsal and I was definitely pleased. The banchan selection was nice and also ordered a Kimchijeon with a dope dipping sauce. To top it off, the staff were friendly and kind! Definitely recommend this joint for a nice Korean BBQ! Ill definitely be back soon. Thank you! I visited there by chance but it was fabulous! As a Korean, I can say their dishes are really authentic. Sometimes Korean restaurant outside Korea can be too westernised and easy to lose its original taste, but this restaurant has exactly same vibe, taste, and authenticity as the one in Korea. I liked not only the taste of food, but also staffs! The pork bibimbap there was really nice, also the Korean chicken wings as the starter! The server also was kind. Only drawback is that the bibimbab was a bit cold when it arrived. Anyway the food there was nice and you can go for a table of 12 people when you book quite early. Not my favourite Korean restaurant but it is a good qualityprice restaurant, I would love to try the barbecue there one day.

주소: 64 Rue Vieille du Temple, 75003 Paris, France
리뷰: Absolutely sensational. This was one of our favourite meals in Paris. The food is outstanding  rustic, sincere and delicious. The service was faultless, and the staff were graciously forgiving with our broken French. Book as early as possible so you don't miss out! Had really high hopes for this place  maybe I didnt order the right thing but I wouldnt return. The beef rib was too tough with too much fat and tendons in it. Everything else to include the service was on par but needed more than just a few good bites from the meat. I was there with my colleagues while working in France. My friends who live there suggested me to try out steak in this restuarant. It was well made with good quality ingredients. I also ordered lamb chops too. It was juicy and tender enough. I kind of like everything about this restaurant except the fact that we were asked to leave once finished our foods as another group of people were coming in. I wished we could have more time drinking more wine and so on. Can't recommend highly enough. Friendly people who are evidently passionate about the food. We had kidneys and the entrecote both of which were cooked to perfection. Gorgeous rustic setting, with a roaring fire for the meat. Great atmosphere. Oh, and the blood sausage is superb. Had a wonderful experience here. The atmosphere is very intimate and smells amazing in there with the grill next to us. The staff was very friendly and made sure we were comfortable.  We enjoyed the duck and the t bone, which was cooked to our liking. They did check to make sure of this. The sides were just fine. Nice wine selection.

리뷰:
We had the regular tasing menu and it was amazing! The dishes and the wine pairings were outstanding.  The depth and intensity of the flavors was truly scrumptious.  The fish courses were elegantly and perfectly prepared. The steak course was by far the best steak Ive had in my life. So dang yummy and compared to prices in California where were from it was a bargain! Mange! Dining at Dessance in Paris was an unforgettable experience that tantalized our taste buds and left us with lasting memories. We had made reservations for the tasting menu with wine pairing, and I must say, it was a delightful culinary journey from start to finish.

One of the highlights of our visit was the opportunity to sit outside. The outdoor seating area offered a charming ambiance, allowing us to soak in the vibrant atmosphere of the city while enjoying our meal. The setting felt intimate yet lively, creating the perfect backdrop for a special evening.

The tasting menu was a beautifully curated selection of dishes that showcased the chef's creativity and attention to detail. Each course was presented with artistic flair, and the flavors were nothing short of exquisite. From the first bite to the last, it was clear that each dish was thoughtfully crafted, with a balance of textures and flavors that danced on the palate.

The wine pairing was equally impressive. Each selection complemented the dishes perfectly, enhancing the overall dining experience. The staff was knowledgeable and passionate about the wines, providing interesting insights into each pairing, which added an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal.

Overall, our experience at Dessance was a true celebration of culinary artistry. The combination of delicious food, excellent wine pairings, and the lovely outdoor setting made for a memorable evening in Paris. If you're looking for a fine dining experience that offers a unique twist and a focus on seasonal ingredients, Dessance is definitely worth a visit. It's a dining experience that beautifully captures the essence of Parisian cuisine, and I can't recommend it highly enough! Came back to Dessance after 7 years last time in Paris. The experience was just as great as the last time and lived up to the memory.  I had the land  sea menu, and some of our table had the vegetarian. They were both amazing. Service was excellent and attentive. Food was intricate, balance and fab. Highly recommend. This is the experience of a lifetime. Every dish is more unique and absolutely delicious than the previous one. Im a foodie and Ive been all over the world but Dessance is the place Ill always look forward to. Very good pick in Le Marais district! Refreshing vegetal or flexitarian cuisine with a tasty world twist. Modern decor, comfortable setting, attentive and welcoming service. I recommend!

리뷰:
We were looking for a place for dinner before seeing the lights on Eiffel Tower after sunset. To avoid the usual tourist trap places, we walked a little bit away. In a side alley we found this restaurant.
It is not very big but nice and clean.

Ordering food was a little bit funny, as we both don't speak French. With an English menu and some hand gestures we were able to get what we want.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Korean dishes were very tasty and a very welcome contrast to local food classics.
The toilettes were the cleanest I have seen so far in whole Paris.

I recommend the bibimbap with beef and the hot sauce that comes with it.

Thanks to the hosts for a very pleasant diner. Great Korean Food! Had the menu with a salad as a starter, the gyozaspancakes and the beefvegancalamari bibimbap  all very tasty and delicious. The place is close to the Eiffel Tower. The waitress was super friendly and helpful with the menu and welcoming. Food with the taste of Korean hands.
It's nice. It's friendly. It's wellrounded.
Give him a hug We really enjoyed the place, the personnel and the food. They seems to have lots of Korean customers which is a good sign. Just remember their food is mostly pretty spicy. And about the interior decor, I would have expected more Korean vibe. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is cozy ! The servers are very nice and it's really close to the Eiffel Tower ! I had a really good time here, would recommand it 100 !

주소: 65 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
리뷰:
Its really great to have an authentic Korean food in Paris , its surprisingly to have good food like in S Korea , nice dishes and appetite, kimchi. Truly an authentic Korean meal no wonder so many Korean celebs have visited this resto!!
I highly recommend trying Bossam as an entre boiled pork slices served with tofu and fresh oyster kimchi and the yuzu roll cake as a dessert.
Some people may find that certain Korean dishes can be quite salty the sauted ones or cause too much heat in the bodyfor example personally due to excess use of black pepper in jjigae, so it's best to do a bit of research to know how to balance your meal choices and avoid stomach upsets later on.
All in all, it's an experience not to be missed and Id love to come back to try their famous sundae soup! Was craving some gamjatang , one of my favorite back when I lived in Korea. So glad we found this place! The food was not adjusted to tailor to the locals tastebuds in anyways and instead very much loyal to the authentic taste and spice level.

Will come back every time I go to Paris. Sambuja has so many options for entree, plats, and drinks and all the dishes I have tasted  black sausage based soup ssundae gukbap, steamed pork belly with tofu and kimchi and soft tofu soup are authentic and flavorful. The service is efficient and they have big tables for different size of groups. I will definitely come back! We are from LA ,CA which is really good Korean foods place but Bossam is the best place here that I have ever eaten. It is really nice and best quality ever. We really enjoyed foods and services.  Really recommend to my son or anyone to visit Paris. Soondaegook is also good.

I didnt have great expectations before I went here, but as soon as I saw tables of French older gentlemen, I assumed it must be good!

And it was!  The servers wear white shirts with ties and were kind and accommodating.

The food I had was exceptional.  The French onion soup, or just onion soup, as they call it here  was delicious  not the best I w ever had  but delicious.  It was the Omble chevalier or Artic Char fish that had me licking the plate clean!!!

The interior needs a bit of a loving update, but we sat on the cafe chairs outside and the corner is absolutely charming! What a restaurant ! We just loved it ! Very cosy Parisian vibes with its interior decoration and French cuisine they brought to the table. It was freaking delicious ! We had onion soup and orange duck, both so yummy ! Waiters are super funny and friendly, we will definitely come back again. Thanks ! Authentic French dining experience in the heart of Paris. We went there after exploring Le Marais and it was perfect! The ambiance is simply beautiful, and the service was topnotch and professional. Truely a perfectly authentic Parisian experience. Food was absolutely delicious and the service was amazing. We shared everything. Loved our first time trying escargot, then the classic onion soup, beef bourginion, creme caramel and the prettiest strawberry dessert. Ooh la la! If theres one thing for sure, this is the friendliest service you will find in all of Paris! Our server was full of energy and so kind! She allowed us to try to wines and find the perfect one, ensuring that we would fully enjoy the glasses of wine that we purchased. The onion soup was the best weve had in Paris, the cheese was not too thick and hard as it has been at other places. The signature dish bourguignon was very good, as was the escargot. The service was very fast! The atmosphere is also very lovely, facing a quiet street, not sitting in the street like other bistros.

리뷰:
Traditional Korean restaurant with cooking course. The owner is extremely cute, I feel like I'm in Korea!! The food is super delicious and feels like eating at home  This place serves authentic Kimchi Jjigae that's even better than what I've had in Korea! I was craving genuine Korean food, and I'm so glad I found this spot. The portion sizes are generousI even ordered an extra bowl of rice just to savor every last drop of the soup. The owner was friendly and welcoming too. I highly recommend it!

   !! The service was great and the owner was super lovely.
As a korean living abroad, I do love the food there so much.
I can proudly tell its real authentic Korean cuision.

Ill surely visit Midam when I visit Paris next time and will recommend the place to my friends living in Paris and planning to visit Paris.

Thank you for the truly wonderful experience. A small restaurant ran by Koreans. I dont feel that the bibimbap is that authentic though, I feel its missing an element that I cant quite identify. Bof, it didnt satisfy my bibimbap craving 

That said, it was a nice experience  the staff were efficient and friendly. menu25euro, 3 plates, delicious

Super good! Every dish is delicious, and the set meal includes soup and dumplings, which is very costeffective. The owner's service is also very good. But you have to queue up almost every time, so come early if you re hungry. The portions are HUGE. We ordered Tangsooyuk sweet and sour pork, it said it was for 2 people, and Jengban Jjajang black bean noodles large size which said they were for 2 people as well, but 3 of us struggled to finish the dishes. The dishes were delicious and prices were affordable. The restaurant is relatively small and gets busy very fast, so come early! Food tasted exactly like what I had in Korea, very good. Highly recommend.
Every portion is enough for 23 persons. Make sure you order right amount.  I have heard this restaurant for specialityJjajang, Champpong, Tansuyuksince over 10 years. Side dishes for Dakgalbi was good as well. Finally I have tasted them with friends. Glad to find here. I can recommend to my Korean friends. The service was attentive even though it was busy.

 One minus thing   only noodles and sauce not much ingredientsvegetables in Jajjangmyeon

 tips  no reservation accepted.
We went on Saturday dinner
1.  Better to arrive at least 15 mins before.
Today we have arrived 10 mins before opening, we are lucky to take the last table. The first service has finished around 20h 30.
2. Tangsuyuk comes faster than other main dishes, so it's better eat Tangsuyuk while waiting for other dishes. Their sweet and sour pork dish is delicious but the sauce is too sour for me and it reduces the quality of the dish significantly.  I love their black bean noodles or in other words, I love it.  Their food offerings are also numerous!

Indulge in Parisian authenticity at this hidden gem, where the flavors of Korea shine through in every bite of their delectable jajangmyeon and tangsuyuk. The owners and staff go above and beyond to ensure a delightful dining experience, making every visit feel like a warm welcome. The food was so delicious!!     We ordered a lot. It was quite pricey but definitely worth it!  We went here for lunch the food was okay but not great. The portions were small and the dishes pricey. We ordered the teokboki with cheese, and their taste was far away from the authentic ones. The soup was okay we enjoyed the Korean veggies pancake, but again it tasted more like inspired to Korean ones. The best Korean You will have is here.

Recommend buying 2 meals combined for ultimate experience tteokbokki  chicken, the best chicken Ive had in my life.

Service is exceptional. If you want an authentic Korean food experience, then I wouldn't recommend it.

The food was average the fried chicken was a bit soggy, the pancake was not crispy, but the kimchi noodle was okay.

The food was not bad, but not good or memorable as well. There are definitely better choices in Paris. 610

리뷰:
Quaint French restaurant near the Eiffel Tower with white linen table clothes and excellent French food. They have a menu with 2 or 3 courses for lunch and dinner. Seating capacity for 2430 people. Reservations are recommended.  Plates were beautifully presented, and the flavors were excellent in every course. Not a bad bite all night, for everyone at the table. We visited Paris with our kids and wanted to experience a traditional French cuisine experience. This restaurant was perfect for our family. Beautiful quaint restaurant and amazing food, what else could we want! We had the Duck a l'Orange and the salmon. Both dishes were exquisitely done. Escargot was also tasty as well at the desserts we tried. I wish we lived closer so we could visit more frequently. Definitely worth trying if you're in the area. This is it!  A super friendly, family atmosphere.  The signature Foie Gras is home made.  I wished to try every menu here.  I would definitely come here again.

The Feux d'artifice, fillet, was so tender, though well cooked outside.

The only thing, the volume of desert Crme Brle. Very big, but can we blame?  No!  Hahaha.

Im really grateful to my friend who took me here! Hidden gem close to the Eiffel tower.  I had ratatouille and fillet mignon with gratin potatoes.  Everything was well presented and delicious, while the service was friendly and intimate.  The restaurant is charming and feels authentic.  This was a great experience for a tourist couple like us.  I won big boyfriend points. Family owned. Best pate Ive had!!! Fabulous food. Attention to every details on your plate. Crme Brle is a must! WOW, you wouldnt get these  in the US.

리뷰:
Absolutely loved it
We took the pork and beef combination grill. It was so good. The service is also really lovely.
I will definitely go again I love everything here, foods were so good like I cannot even find something to complain. Kimchis the best we ordered it like twice and it came as a big portion. Staffs were very nice and helpful. You dont have to grill by yourself because they will do for you.

I would recommend this restaurant! Ordered the beef set for two. Meat is not marinated so will dip in sauce. Like the side dish better and would come back for lunch instead of dinner. Service is quick and friendly. 5 stars for the weekday lunch special! A super nice Korean restaurant to try !
We shared pork raviolis and fried caramelized chicken  both were super good and fresh !
We shared a beef faux filet bbq and every side dish was super good and home made
They explained every single ingredient and shared their experience. Staff is super friendly ! We loved it and will test it again  Absolutely amazing! We came to visit France, specifically Paris and didnt know where to eat until we stumbled across this delicious restaurant. It is really cozy inside as well outside, perfect for the summer. We choose to grill some meat and for my friend whos vegetarian, was also a lot to choose from! The most authentic Korean restaurant weve ever been to in all Europe! You really see and taste, that they know what theyre doing. Im actually speechless because it was so tasty. We will definitely come back to France, especially for this restaurant, can only recommend. The staff was super nice as well and really helpful, they spoke great English and explained everything in detail to us. Thank you for being so kind to us, we will see you again!

The broth here is on the sweeter side, the beef in pho is not the thin sliced one just stating a fact not complaining. The menu is simple and perfect for those who dont like to choose. Worth the line, this is what one needs for the cold rainy windy days in Paris. I went to Paris for 4 days and I ate here 2 times! The Pho was huge and the broth is flavorful and sweet from those bones and so good! My favorite would be Bun Bo tho because every bite I had was full of flavor and freshness from the fresh vegetables, i normally dont eat fresh mint leaves but this dish has a place in my heart. My boyfriend who never had Vietnamese food said its the most healthiest breakfast I ever had  its just so good and the beef in both Pho and Bun Bo are just chefs kiss, so soft and tender and flavorful and just sooo good. The spring rolls are freshly made and fried and cost 1 per piece, like are you kidding me?? I went to some random street food stall and paid 6 euro for 3 spring rolls that were a frozen and not delicious at all, this place is a gem, I recommend to arrive at the restaurant around 11.1011.20 a.m. and you will get in the restaurant so quick or maybe the first round of customers 
P.S. The place is small you have to share the table with other people and the bathroom is also clean. Authentic Vietnamese pho in Paris! Portions are huge and prices are reasonable. Be prepared to queue as its quite a small restaurant but well worth the wait. Hidden gem in Paris serving up some topnotch pho. The broth has a perfect balance between savory and a touch of sweetness, though it might have MSG, as I felt quite thirsty afterward.

Its a super tiny place, fitting just 22 seats, so expect to get up close and personal with your dining neighbors. Despite the cramped space, the line moves quickly since people dont tend to linger too long.

The service was fantasticfriendly and fast, with the soup arriving piping hot.

If youre not up for the cozy dinein experience, Id say takeaway is the way to go. Pho is with thai basil no cilantro was visible, but I guess its in it too. Meat in the pho were very tender, soup was flavorful.

Bo bun was very refreshing and stuffy. Both were very authentic food. So food in general, i recommend.

Big disadvantage was space. Too small, you gotta sit with other group of people, and waiting is around 30mins.

But even though, I will visit here again.

주소: 59-61 Rue Saint-André des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
리뷰:
They gave away my reservation and we had to wait over an hour for our replacement table BUT...

It was worth it.

The staff were very apologetic for the inconvenience and compensated a drink off of our bill.

Our server was very friendly and fun. He was fluent in French, Italian, and English. Very impressive!

The food was excellent.

We're from the US and typically when I order escargot the snails are out of the shell and soaking in garlic butter.

Here the snails are in the shell, so it's a bit of effort to get the snail out of the shell if you're not used to it, and the taste is more natural since they're not soaking in the garlic butter.

And the Onion Soup aka French Onion Soup is spectacular.

I order French Onion Soup from any restaurant that offers it, and this was Top 3 maybe Top 2 I've ever had. Note, it's way less salty than the French Onion Soups I've had in the US.

Overall, I'd probably make an effort to go to La Jacobine any time I go to Paris. Absolutely delicious! The best meal we had in Paris. We almost went back for a second meal. The staff was friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The food was extremely flavorful and left us wanting to lick the platesbowls. We had French onion soup, Duck Tajine, Raviolis, Escargot, Cheesecake and PistachioAlmondRaspberry tart. The Duck was out of this world good. The raviolis were rich and extremely tasty. It makes my mouth water thinking of this meal, every dish was absolutely delicious. If you dont have a reservation, be prepared to wait for a no show or them to accommodate you, as it can be an hour plus. They gave my mom and I wine while we waited. Overall 1010 recommended and cant wait to go back next time Im in Paris! One of our favorite places to eat while in Paris. The best onion soup weve had. Incredibly friendly staff with a great atmosphere. Reservations are highly recommended, otherwise plan to arrive 1520 minutes prior to opening and theres potential you will be able to get a table without a wait. This was my go to since I missed it last time in Paris. It really is a cute place with line ups before opening. The sever was really kind and helped me figure out how to eat the escargot properly.  The duck confit, amazing . The most vegetables I've got on a plate in Paris. The French onion soup was also very good. This place was a blast!! We went there without any reservation walk in customers and waited about 2 hours for the table, and Im telling you its totally worth the wait! We ordered french onion soup, duck fillet with mushroom sauce and duck leg confit. All the dishes were utterly delicious and mindblowing like a real piece of culinary art!!! Another great French style dining experience. I highly recommend this place!

This restaurant has a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere indoors yet also offers an outdoor space for dining. The food was good but not the best. For instance, the japchae served to me was microwaved and some parts were overheated so it turned out too hard or chewy. On the other hand, I found their spicy pork packed with flavors. Their plating presentation also deserves a compliment. I recently had lunch here and really enjoyed my meal!
I chose the crpe de kimchi and bibimbap from the lunch set menu, which was accompanied with soup and three sides with the bibimbap.
I asked for a vegetarian bibimbap with tofu, and the restaurant kindly accomodated my request.
The food here is very delicious  I highly recommend this place! I recommend getting their spicy calamari, barbecue salmon and bone free chicken wings ! The tofu salad wasnt my favourite but the waiters were super friendly ! Hidden gem that deserves giving it a try . It was the first day that restaurants  reopened to the public, so you can imagine how excited I was to be able to eat out again. A lot of restaurants that we wanted to visit continued to serve meals only as takeouts due to lack of terrace space. Goui Paris was one of those that had the possibility to serve meals outside as they are located in passage Choiseul.
Unfortunately the dine in experience wasnt as great as I would have hoped, the bibimbap I ordered was just lukewarm, the stone bowl wasnt hot enough to cook the raw egg inside, no chili sauce was offered I had to ask for it. I had to ask several times for the tap water and there werent even that many people The side dishes also came much later. Taste and flavor are ok, I have tasted better Korean dishes in Paris. Price wise on the high end, I would not recommend if you have other choices one of the workers was unnecessarily rude towards us from the minute we stepped in the restaurant. she was ignoring us all the time when we tried to order, then when we tried to ask for water because she didnt bring any even though the food was already served and also when it was paying time. note that it was not busy, she was on her phone all the time.
food was okay but did NOT enjoy at all her behavior and being around there. felt uncomfortable the whole dinner.

Wow ! MON DIEU ! I loved this food. Super authentic and the best hosts . I recommend the barbecue and everything else on the menu tbh. Quiet and calm place to enjoy a meal with friends and family. The Somek was  best korean restaurant in paris!
we got the japchae, spicy pork, and kimchi stew. everything was awesome. very clean, nice environments, and servers were amazing. definitely coming back for next trip This is the best Korean restaurant in Paris even in Europe ,without doubts.  I was looking for decent Korean restaurants, not fusion but real Korean food. And here is the right decision.!!!! Best Korean food in Paris! The flavors are great and I always feel welcome. The place is very friendly and well kept. Its like a home cooked meal with a homey atmosphere. Definitely recommend it! Everything about this place was fantastic! The ambience, food, cutleries and staff were  authentically Korean. The staff were a family so it added to the quality of service!

When I visited Paris last year, I ate so much that I visited again. I think I ate there 34 times while traveling because I have kids! All the food was delicious, especially the chicken, although the number of pieces looked small, each piece was as big as a fist and was delicious. The owner was kind and the side dishes were so perfect that I didn't even think of Korea while traveling! Nice service and atmosphere is calm, but bbq was too watery and food was not complex enough. No spice either, and kimchi was disappointing unfortunately. We wont be returning anytime as not worth the price We visited for the first time today, and ordered the Korean bbq for 2.  The proprietor was helpful in explaining it to us since we'd never had it before.  The portion size was decent, and the food was delicious!!  We will definitely be back! We were on our way to Palais Garnier when it came to lunch time, after checking many restaurants we found this Korean restaurant and we decided to give a try! This spot is so cozy the main floor was full and We were seated on the second floor, the staff was so kind even we dont speak French they were so patient taking our order, the food was so delicious  we loved the chicken and raw beef honestly to be in a touristy area the food is so good and the price is so reasonable. I recommend it!!!!! Pretty authentic Korean restaurant with comfort  homey vibes. We ordered many dishes soondobu, bulgogi, rabokki, mul nangmyeon, but most of them are too sweet, but overall it was good and the portion was big.

I think overall this place is lovely, it has lots of charm and a very interesting parings of galette options. Unfortunately the goat cheese one I ordered was a bit of a miss of textures and balance when it came to the ingredients.

However my friends plates seemed to be more balanced and flavorful when it came profile. Lovely galetterie with excellent service. We arrived at midday when it opened and could get a table straight away. My galette complete with onions and tomatoes was easy to ask without ham and it was amazingly well balanced and filled to the brim with cheese, which paired well with the tomatoes and onions. My husband's goats cheese galette was good but not amazing. Our sweet crepes were delicious, i suggest the apple and caramel as that was better than my husband's chocolate. It was a little pricey at 52 euros, but not awful pricing for the quality and area. We were nearby and the kids wanted crepes. We found this place and it definitely didn't dissapoint. We hadn't had galette before but the family enjoyed their dishes and kids loved their crepes. The cafe was super busy but the 2 waiters accomodated our big group and didn't miss a beat in a busy Sunday lunch service. Lovely! We have been to this cafe almost 8 years ago. We loved it then and still love it. As a family we traveled to Brittany 3 years ago and tried many crepes et cidre. This time we tried the one with goat cheese, crme of truffle and chicken with sauce of mushrooms. Also ordered a pitcher of cidre. The cidre had great flavor of the countryside perhaps a farm in Normandy and had the sweet smell of apples but with a dry pucker in the mouth. The service is amazing and it is super fast if you get there before the crowd! These crepes were amazing and we loved all of the options. They had many gluten free crepes and also had both sweet and savory. They are a small family owned business and they operate so quickly! It was great to sit down and enjoy a lunch by their open air seating options in the heat of June. Highly recommend the salmon and leek crepe.

주소: 6 Rue de la Vrillière, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰:
This place offers great value for the money, and I must say, it's surprisingly good! The food arrived at lightning speed, which made me wonder if it was prepared in advance. However, that didn't take away from the experience. The chicken was moist and juicy, bursting with flavor, while the steak was cooked to perfection.

The salad was fresh and vibrant, and the escargotwhat a treat! They were delightful little morsels that really showcased the essence of French cuisine, especially considering the price.

The service was decent, but the only downside was the state of the toilets. Unfortunately, they were quite dirty, and theres only one for the entire establishment. It seems that in France, they sometimes forget that the bathroom is also part of the dining experience!

Overall, if you're looking for a place where you can enjoy delicious food without breaking the bank, this spot is worth a visit. Just be prepared to hold it until the end of your meal! We were looking for a place to have dinner and found this little gem. It was really crowded but they were able to squeeze us In however I would recommend booking a place in advance. The onion soup was really great and the Chicken was also exceptional. Service was great and the food is also not super heavy on the pocket. Will highly recommend trying the place out. Our all time favourite restaurant in Paris! Great food, reasonable price and good service. Indulge in flavours of French cuisine  duck confit, escargot and many more! Excellent gem, about a 20 min stroll from the louvre, but well worth it. Very busy but service was quick.  Food delicious and good prices 64 euros 3 beers, 2 mains, 1 side, 2 desserts.  Definitely worth a visit! Came during the Olympics after visiting some museums. Good to great food, in a truly French atmosphere. The eggs mayonnaise were incrediblebest mayo I've ever had. I had a salad and my husband had the entrecte. They were satisfactory without being extraordinary. The green beans, though, were super simple and excellent. We split the profiteroles for dessert Chou pastry, nougat ice cream, semi sweet chocolate sauce, and almond slivers. As memorable as the mayonnaise. Prices were normal for Paris. Service was good, as long as you remember that in France, waiters do not check on you every five minutes and everything takes time.

카테고리: cafe, restaurant, food, bar, point_of_interest, establishment

리뷰:
Come here for the famous truffle pasta and pizza. In the beginning I was not to excited for the queue weve already reserved online, and we still needed to wait for an hour before getting seated. It was also not clear on how to wait, no clear sign and we still need to ask the waiter to make sure we got noticed.
But the food was fantastic! And the service once we seated was also fine. My family and I came here for the iconic truffle dishes, and they surely did not disappoint!! We got sat in the main dining area, under the beautiful tree. Our server was wonderful and gave us great recommendations on winedrinks. We were crazy about the truffle so ordered 2 pasta dishes and 1 pizza. I could eat the pasta forever, it was amazing! Would recommend any of the Big Mamma restaurants! Enjoying Pink Mama, we thought wed enjoy this spot. And we did, but most dishes needed a bit more salt. The space is stunning and we got a table right away for lunch around noon on a Tuesday. To drink, we enjoyed the Bellini Spritz, which is 10 Euros and a healthy pour. To eat, we shared the burrata, the zucchini, the melon, and the prosciutto. Everything was good, but again, needed salt to bring out the flavors. Ober Mama in Paris offers an exceptional Italian dining experience. The ambience is warm and inviting, with every detail carefully curated. The food is topnotch, full of authentic flavors and crafted with precision. A mustvisit for lovers of fine Italian cuisine! I was craving Italian after coming back from Milan.  Parma e Meloni and Aperol Spritz usually, so I googled and found Ober Mamma close to me that is highly rated.
It did not disappoint !  Our server, who happens to be from Milan guided us to an incredible meal.  Everything was delicious!  Our server was very attentive.  Gave us enough time to talk and catch up while making sure we have everything we need.
This looks like a famous spot for birthdays and gathering.  While it was packed, it wasnt as loud as I would expect.   We still had a peaceful and very delicious meal.  The hosts made very thoughtful decisions in placing guests making sure we are all comfortable even with a packed restaurant.  We were in the interior of the restaurant under the beautiful glass ceiling and artfully decorated with tree branches.
We will definitely be back!
카테고리: meal_delivery, meal_takeaway, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment

리뷰: The food was very delicious and it exceeded my expectation. I had ordered the Dolsot Bimbimbap. The restaurant staff were courteous and helpful. Very well connected by Metro line M4, this restaurant is highly recommended for anyone looking forward to an enjoyable Korean cuisine experience. Authentic Korean food but should make a reservation before coming. Gets busy quickly. I've had better Soft tofu stew soondobu jiggae but overall nice ambiance and price. Came again and got japchae which I highly recommend. Bathrooms clean. Fantastic food and felt very close to what we experienced when visiting South Korea. We had two bibimbaps, a kimchi jeon and shared a bottle of makgeolli. The banchan side dishes are included with your meal. Service was fast and efficient. Definitely worth a visit to make a change from the typical French bistros. Id love to come back here someday. All dishes were really tasty, tteokbokki was specially great and spicy in a good way! The best one we have ever tasted, along with the fried chicken. The amount of food is really generous, and they even give you kimchi and some salad. The woman and staff are really nice, attentive and quick. 10 out of 10  The food is decent. The restaurant is small, and it can get packed pretty quick. The have indoor AC. The place is nice and clean. Price is reasonable. You can get full meal 23 for salad, mando, fried cake, and main dish

주소: 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
리뷰:
Be ready to be in queue. We went there on Monday evening but we had to wait for 30 minutes to get the table, they have only walking in system, not table booking in prior. The system was quite intriguing. The food was great with an amazing service. Every thing is so quick. The ambiance is amazing. The cost is worth too. Must try restaurant as it has started from 1968. Looks can be deceiving! This restaurant boasts a high Google Maps rating 4.24.3, possibly due to its historical significance, but don't let that fool you. The food quality was a major disappointment. The french fries tasted like they'd been reheated multiple times, and the meat was simply inedible. Sadly, I cannot recommend this place based on my experience. The fastest serving of food I ever had! Incredible! It tasted pretty good, and the prices were very cheap. The service is quick and efficient. One downside other tables are very close yours  so its a bit cozy

Id definitely recommend this place.

Here's a polished version of your new review



The fastest serving of food! Incredible! It tasted pretty good, and the prices were very cheap. The service is quick and efficient. One downside is the seating people are so close that you're practically at the same table. Despite that, this place is worth recommending. I checked Google for restaurant near me, and found this place with over 22k reviews in Google, and have to try it.  I have never seen any place with so many reviews!  Then I found out this is a restaurant with hundreds years of history, with very reasonable price.  We tried three appetizers, two main dishes, two desserts, and coffee, and happy with all the food we tried.  The waiter is very efficient, he wrote the order and calculated the check total on the table cover paper which is very special.  We are lucky to find this special place. we have been here for dinner 2 times and we have not been disappointed even once. The food is at a great price, the atmosphere and vibe of the restaurant is very authentic. The place was packed, they seated us at a table where someone was already sitting. The food was good, but the waiter didn't warn me that the duck breast was medium rare, so it was pretty bloody, which I don't prefer.

It's a very delicious udon restaurant, but I wonder why it's listed as Tonkatsu Pikachu Tonkatsu instead of Sanukiya. There are so many people and the taste is so so so. It is operated as a Japanese ramen restaurant called Shinukiya. A common Japanese restaurant in Korea

리뷰:
Had an excellent dining experience at this Korean restaurant. Foods  were all delicious. Highly satisfied with the food and service. Will definitely be back! Beef intestines BBQ is tasteless. Good taste of pig feet and chicken feet. Portions are small. Cold noodle is good. In general, not very authentic Korean food. We loved the kimchi pancake and the pork bbq. The hotteok was a bit flat but the taste was good. We ate outside in a pleasant, quietroad setting. On the pricey side of course, but then again... Paris! Many Koreans were eating there too. We will go back gladly!! Delicious food and noticeable quality, friendly staff, efficient service.

We were just a bit too close to the other clients and chairs were not very confortable especially when you need to move every 10min as people go back and forth.

I recommend it for the good food, the quality and friendly staff. Note that the place also offers a great intimate atmosphere, so it is a good spot during covid season. A bit of green could be added to the terrace  Already come back several times.
Really recommend to book the table in advance.

Warm service, scrumptious dishes and huge portions! Visited with my husband and friend for lunch. We had artichoke tarts for starters delicious!! followed with 7hr cooked lamb shoulder, pork cheeks, and veal kidney. Seasoning of all our dishes were perfect and we all scraped the sauces with bread  Highly recommend. Great find! Saw this as a recommendation from several bloggers, did not disappoint! We ordered eggs as an appetizer and I swear they are the best eggs and mayonnaise I have ever tried in my life! As the main we got antrecot and duck, both were amazing, but duck is just pure gastronomic gem. Also the red wine I tried was way better than you expect for the price. Overall, 910 I visited here yesterday evening after not having gone for 15 years. The first time I came here I was 18 years old and freshly moved to Paris. The dishes changed my brain chemistry and as a dumb American made me realize how real food should taste. Very Julia child of me, I know. I am happy to report that the food is just as good 15 years later. I love this please. Delicious and unpretentious and the staff is incredibly kind and helpful. Wonderful experience. Thank you!!! Fantastic French food. We tried the ravioli, and from the daily lunch menu we had the veal filet, the dourade filet, and the pumpkin soup and everything was exceptionally good. Of the lunch menu, perhaps the only thing that was a tiny bit disappointing was the dessert, but thats just nitpicking.

Our server, Pauline, was incredibly nice and attentive. She made great recommendations and answered all of our questions. you know what? Le Petit Pontoise is a true gem in the heart of the city, offering me an exceptional French dining experience. The intimate ambiance sets the perfect stage, but it's the food that truly captivates. Each bite was so delightful that I found myself closing my eyes to savor the exquisite flavorsa first for me.

The knowledgeable staff's passion for French cuisine shines through in their fantastic recommendations. The foie gras was a standout, with amazing feeling in your mouth and sauce that was simply divine. The pork cheek was the perfect main dish, it is so good that i want to pitch the recipe.

so sorry we didnt say thank you to the chef, Le Petit Pontoise is a mustvisit for anyone seeking a memorable culinary journey. Highly recommended!

이름: 모란 식당 le seul spécialisé dans les aliments nord-coreens
리뷰:
Impressive Korean food. The fried chicken is delicious, the soup tastes super good. Have tried several different Korean restaurants in Paris, but this one is definitely better than most of them. Highly recommended! The owner guy is so friendly and kind!! Eventho he does not smile all the time, don't afraid to talk to him he will give you everything you need. I found this restaurant from my friend, and comparing to south korean foods it was definitely different both food  restaurant vibe but in a good way!! Food was yummy, he gave us extra dumplings a lot! I will definitely visit again. My nonkorean friends also really enjoyed the food. Excellent Korean food! Visited the restaurant in May and now I still miss the cold noodles here. North Korean restaurant in Paris to try!

As a South Korean, It was definitely an experience.

The owner seemed a bit cold or unfriendly but who cares if the food is nice.

Ive tried cold noodle   la nordcorenne for the first time and it was a must even if it could be quite odd if you are not used to cold noodles and fried soft shell crab with salt and pepper was also a nice choice, even though it could not be a usual Korean food you see at Korean restaurant.

I will go again next time I am in Paris!! Excellent North Korean food restaurant. I tried Pyeongyang naengmyeon Pyeongyangstyle cold noodle, abai sundae North Koreanstyle Sausage, Yukgaejang Spicy duck soup and corn pancake. Every single food was great, even the side dishes were good. The owner looks blunt, though actually he is kind and nice, He was very kind to us. If you come to Paris, and you wanna try North Korean cuisine, this is a musttry spot.

Lovely Isabel Malang There is a separate men's store, and the male staff who tells you to try on cute clothes and recommends various items is very friendly. It's good for buying brands and shopping, but I just don't like it and it's not fun. There are many small galleries and small fashion brands. Overall it wasn't bad. It has a bit of a local atmosphere, but there are various shops and restaurants, so it's not a bad way to kill time. There are many restaurants in and around the market.
I really enjoy shopping!!
However, there are a lot of dog walks so be careful of poop

주소: 8 Rue Croix des Petits Champs, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰: The steak we ordered was the best steak I've ever tasted in my life! So soft and juicy!! The mashed potatoes was amazingly tasty with the flavor of butter  And I loved ratatouille even though I don't like vegetables in general. Escargots were also good!! Classic French cuisine restaurant with wine and cocktails The ratatouille was awesome. We also liked goat cheese plate. The service is very fast and attentive. The place is very cosy. Very kind wait staff, very tasty food, and very enjoyable experience. We had the lobster soup which had a generous amount of lobster! We also had the ravioli and ratatouille, both of which were very flavorful. Ravioli is a smaller portion, ratatouille has a generous amount of vegetables and there is bread served. Very conveniently located bear the louvre. For dinner on the second day 611 in Paris, we found a restaurant next to our hotel. I was lucky enough to meet the kind proprietress. The service was very warm, the snails were delicious, the drinks were good, the steak was average, and the overall meal was very enjoyable. Excellent restaurant for lunch!! If you are visiting the louve, this place is also a must when you are hungry. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious! Friendly staff who spoke English! Very impressive dining. Would recommend the escargot and cream ravioli!!

리뷰:
Nice place, simple setting. This meal was the hottest meal I have ever eaten, it comes in a plate that is still boiling. Its was a very big portion but I feel that the taste could have been better. Great Korean dishes. Including BBQ. But be ready for the smoke and the smell. I liked all the food I tried and it's the original Korean food. But I would expect a better design inside the food here was magnificent! food was amazing, everything was clean and met my expectations. service was excellent and the waitress kindly took some time to assist me with the menu. definitely coming here again and i recommend this to everyone ! We ordered lunch box and tteokbokki with cheese, both were very mild and not authentic taste. Kimchi was good, I could taste that it is freshly self made. One bottle of water of 50c was 8 euro. The location was very good, just next to the Westfield shopping mall. Air conditioned indoor sitting and patio sitting options.
Cute little place with super nice Korean staff.
Food was just ok from a Korean point of view.

The Japchae and Bibimbap are good.  The seafood pancake is okay and some area is not fully cooked.  The side dishes are very limited and the portions are small, and you need to pay extra for the kimchi, which is disappointing and not normal for a Korean restaurant. We tried the bibimbap and their fried chicken and it was good and tasty and good portions. Food came out quite fast, service was really friendly. Great Asian food with cute little atmosphere.
The food was perfect. The chickens were tender and the chilisweet sauce made this extremely delicious.
The beef and rice were well cooked and the sides made it extra tasty.
It is highly recommended to give this place a try Very authentic meals and I have never had cream tteokbokki before. It was so creamy and delicious really loved it The first Korean restaurant that I ate in Paris, not gonna lie, it is delicious. Should come here earlier than open hour or you will have to queue up for a while.

The staff is nice and speaks good French. All the dishes are good, even though I would like it to be more spicy and with more kimchi.
Overall it is a good place to go to enjoy some Korean food.
