리뷰:
The shop was pretty small but it was cozy about 5 small tables  counter seats.
I tried a matcha bingsu and my kids tried a strawberry bingsu and a mango bingsu. All of them were very tasty and looked amazing. Unfortunately,  they don't accept the restaurant ticket swile card. Hope they will accept it sometime soon ! I tried their matcha bingsu, it was my first time eating bingsu and I liked it. But the taste of red bean filling in the matcha bingsu was too dominant for me, almost as if it was a red bean bingsu. Other than that, the matcha ice cream was perfect. I wish the matcha bingsu was pure matcha, Ill try mango or oreo one in the summer  Real Korean bingsu!!
Super nice except long queue on the weekend. I tried watermelon bingsoo, and vanilla ice latte. I will definitely comeback to get another flavor of bingsoo, so good! Coffee was good at start, but overtime couldnt drink anymore. I also wanted to try fish cookie with beans filling, but it is available only in weekends. Overall, really cute yet small cafe around 20 places to sit. Delicious matcha bingsu. The owner is nice enough but seemed a bit weird when i asked for a glass of water for my daughter. He didn't have any teas without sugar and the matcha latte was overly sweet. Stick with the bingsu.

리뷰:
Good place!
If you are looking for a different experience and taste try this restaurant which serves halal meat.
We tried honey garlic chicken not enough sauce however the quantity was good.
We tried korean fried chicken as well it was nice it was beautiful! Thr servings of the food was great. Staff is friendly and helps.
Food is of great value  we were three people and spend around 45 euros! I will definitely come back! We ordered the 8 piece honey fried chicken and I'm not sure how to describe it.. it didn't even taste like fried chicken.. But their mixed vegetable rice and chicken rice were quite ok. But the fried chicken served with it really disappointed me. Hope you will adjust the formula. I had a chicken bibimbap and it was very nice. The price is a little bit expensive. The staff members are all smiley and kind however, our waitress was quite abrupt in her serving style but she did make an effort to be kind and smiling. Should it have been slightly less expensive, I would say that it is as good as Janchi but for now Janchi remains the best. The large portion fried chicken8 pieces didnt eat before taking pic cost 14. It is too less chicken and the sauce is too liquid. Taste not bad but definitely not worth the price. If you come here order the bibimbap instead, 16 and you will feel much more satisfying. Very nice and warm place to have lunch. Eating on the bar front of the kitchen was an amazing experience. Fresh made good and various taste. Dessert were amazing!

리뷰: Delicious and authentic Korean food   Very friendly staff. I recommend the jjajangmyeon with the fried pork tangsuyuk or the kimchi pork with soft tofu dweji bulgogi. Well done!  I can't believe itthis restaurant is amazing. The food is authentically Korean, and the quality is excellent. highly recommend. The food was probably the best Korean food I have tasted. The portions are very filling. Try the korean bbq pork or pork and calamari. The two korean ladies are very friendly, helpful and quick. Excellent food. Excellent service. Can't recommend enough!! Very clean, friendly and good Korean food! I had jajangmyeon and sweet and sour pork at Paldo and it was the best! The Jajangmyeon was very delicious, with a deep flavor but not too salty and seasoned just right. In particular, the pork sweet and sour pork was crunchy yet moist on the inside, which was truly excellent. While eating here, I felt comfortable and warm, like I was at home. The staff were very friendly and the service was fast and excellent. This is a really great place to experience the taste of Korea while in Paris. I would definitely like to visit again!

Believe me, I waited for so long to live this french cuisine experience and it did not disappoint at all!
Snails and frog legs were something out of this world! Duck and beef for main courses were also amazing!
Service and attention were remarkable.
Overall, a pretty complete and remarkable experience as expected.
I would definitely come back of course! I came here as a walkin client, and the waiter asked if I wanted to have the table inside or outside. I chose outside as it was nice to see people passing by on the street.

My only concern was that the table where I ate moved every time someone passed. This annoyed me.

The servers were polite and accommodating, especially the guy who served me.

I had the Menu of the day for 19 snails for the starter and Lamb's shoulder with candied eggplant for the Main. I also Ordered a plate of frog legs to try for the first time.

I was not too fond of the snails, perhaps because I had tried a different style of cooked snails. The Frog's legs were tasty, but I found nothing special about them. However, the Lamb shoulder and eggplant were quite delicious. The meat was really soft, and the eggplant was yummy. I rarely eat eggplant, but this one I could eat every day.

I would come back to try more of their dishes. I was so happy to find a decent looking restaurant in Paris, which doesn't look, feel or smell like a pub. This felt like a classy place and it was a very nice unique touch that we could try frog's legs alongside the snails. Dishes were cooked to perfection and I've found the waiters very kind which is unusual for Paris Great place with an air of fancy! This place was beautifully located, the facility is very well maintain, classic look, very clean, and comfortably me to sit in. The staff were very nice, service was extremely good, fast, friendly, and we did not have a problem to order in English. The atmosphere was great and they have this funny habit of moving the tables closer to the customer once you are seated.
FOOD the food was great, we had stale and it was perfectly cooked to medium term, very juicy, and absolutely delicious, no overly salty, not heavy on sauce and the meat was reachable to the bone by utensils. We also had the famous snails and frog legs. On the snails, oil was a bit too heavy, herbs were natural and rich but I felt there wasnt too much flavor there. For the fog legs they were fantastic! I was so afraid of the taste, saltiness, sauce, and others, but I must say, it was so easy on the palate, nothing to exaggerate on flavor, and really delicious even for a first timer!  Additionally, we had the beef tartar which was very good and rich in natural flavors. I still think the place it a tiny bit overpriced. We went out for lunch here. We tried their escargot, beef stew and the salmon. They were all delicious. We decided to come back for dinner and tried the other flavors of their escargot, plus their beef tartare and grilled steak! Quite fast to get a table even we dont have a reservation. Well definitely come back.

리뷰:
We had the barbecue grill option, with fried kimchi pancakes and tteokbokki rice cakes with cheese as a starter. It was so good, and the service was very nice to us! Love the food and cleanliness of the barbecue pits. Flavours were on point and quite authentic. The kimchi pancake was thick and packed full of deliciousness, would love it to be more crispy. The meats were fresh and delicious.

Service wise, the restaurant gets quite busy and it feels a little understaffed. One thing I didnt like was that the seats were quite close to each other so its quite a squeeze.

Definitely a great korean restaurant place in Paris to try. Second time in 10 days. Have already planned my third. My favourite Korean BBQ in Paris. Really great food. Cosy but slick decor. Diverse clientele, comfortable background hubbub of multilingual conversation, warm atmosphere. Eating amidst people obviously enjoying themselves makes everything taste better.

Efficient, friendly, helpful staff. I leave super satisfied and feeling lucky to have somewhere to go when I want a guaranteed lovely evening. Particularly when combined with a post dinner drink with the wonderful folk running The Honey Moon bar across the road. Currently my favourite 12. they seem to be famous for their bbq but we tried the cold noodles again and I love it!! I usually don't like cold food but this cold noodle has changed my taste. In addition, it goes well with spicy stirfried chicken feet I was a bit disappointed in this dish because the chicken feet were too soft and nothing but spicy. Boudin are not too special. The space is very nice and clean, the staff is enthusiastic. I'll probably come back to try the baked goods. The Bulgogi was delicious and so were the side dishes! The waitresses were really nice, and we had good music too.

Highly recommend this place if you are looking for fresh flavorful falafel! Its a small cute place which was extremely crowded. The decor was decent and service was quick. Their mint lemonade and fresh juices were amazing. The portion are large and can be shared. Food was delicious and the falafel wrap was a balanced meal with lots of vegetables in it. This restaurant should have good taste because there was always a queue in front of the restaurant , even though it was neither lunch nor dinner time.
Personally this was the first time that I ate farallel. I simply did not like it.
The atmosphere is like the one of a first food restaurant. The staff were nice. All the food looked very healthy.
I did not eat all the dishes up so I took them away. The portions of plats are quite big for me.
All the guests around me seemed to eat pita pains or  sandwiches. Good falafel in the center of Paris!  The sandwiches are plentiful, we ate them without a side dish and were very satisfied.  As there was a queue, we took it to take away, the queue for this option moved very quickly! I loved this place so much that I had to go back for more. The falafel was on point and I didnt want to miss out in trying the chicken option. Im glad I went back for more. There are more options that I want to try like their stuffed eggplant. Im getting hungry again.

You can either get your sandwich to go or eat inside. There arent that many places around there to sit down if you take it to go. I suggest you wait a bit and try to get a table inside. You can try a plate which is almost impossible to eat on the go.

Def a place you need to try while in Paris. A modest falafel eatery situated in the heart of the Jewish quarter. The service was prompt and amicable, with no wait for a table on our rainy Monday visit.

We tried the cauliflower 13 for a few pieces!, a falafel plate 19, and a chicken liver pita sandwich 16. Comparing prices to our recent experience at Miznon, this spot leans toward the pricier side.

The food, while flavorful, didn't quite reach an exceptional level. The smalltype falafels were more crunchy than crispy. The industrial pitas lacked fluffiness and were somewhat tasteless and dry.

Considering these factors, a return visit seems unlikely.

리뷰:
Au Bougnat is in a relatively quiet corner of le de la Cit. We came here after reading the review from Rick Steves and was pleased that we did.
After a tiring day of sightseeing, Au Bougnat was a convenient place for a hearty dinner.
The mains were all great, their Foie Gras, not so. Perhaps we got an odd batch? Either way, their standard menu is excellent. Excellent stop for lunch on a rainy day! I had the duck leg confit, my wife had the salmon. Everything tasted amazing! Service was friendly and timely. Great atmosphere with mostly locals at lunch. The host was super friendly and sweet, delicious 1010 meal. We got the pea velout soup with feta and a few specials. One of the best meals Ive had in Paris! The fish special was incredible. Was recommended this place by several tour guides and it did not disappoint! We ordered the snail casserole, cold gazpacho soup, beef and carrots, and steak and fries. While I was not a fan of the gazpacho as there was an ingredient I did not know, my family devoured it, along with all the other food we were served. Highly recommend this place to anyone in the area. Great find. Romantic style with authentic French food. Great choice, great value too in 'plage du jour' however we did our own and went for the escargot,  veal casserole, seabass which was succulent and divine. Had the vine de Chen.. fermented wine aperitif that worked well with the rich snail sauce. Friendly French relaxed service too.

리뷰:
I really loved this place! Its not too big though they also have seating downstairs that i didnt check out, so it isnt too small either, so it feels very cozy, especially for something like eating a fondue and drinking wine on a cold daynight.
We ordered the Mridionale fondue and it was amazing!!  as someone who isnt the biggest fan pf strong smelly cheese, this was the perfect middle ground! The herbs and tomato take just a little bit away from the sharpness of the cheese, which made it perfect for me, and it tasted perfect!
I love that both bread and potatoes were served with the fondue while some other places only include bread and potatoes are extra. It is reasonably priced and in the heart of Paris which is wonderful! Totally recommend this place! I would strongly advise to book before going tho as it gets crowded pretty fast! Great authentic French  Swiss restaurant. We started with the three cheese toast  salad and the goat cheese with honey toast  salad. Both were delicious. He raved about the house red wine and I loved the peach Kir. We shared the Normandy fondue. It was amazing. It's served with the classic boiled potatoes and bread. They really live up to their name "Bread, Wine, Cheese". The staff was very friendly and helpful which we especially appreciated given our limited French. Would definitely go back, would love to try the raclette and dessert. Great experience with food, service, atmosphere. A journey in the several regions of France with their best cheese samples . An experience of tasting the combination of cheese, honey , wine and different types of bread. Super recommended I visited this amazing restaurant in 2017. I wanted to make sure that I could get in so I made a reservation online. My flights changed and I let the restaurant know and they were more than flexible to work with me for the reservation.

The point is, the staff at this restaurant are absolutely wonderful. Thank you!

Now to the food. After some deliberation, we decided to go with the fondue. We ordered the Mridionale, emmental, Beaufort, comt, kirsch, white wine, nutmeg, garlic, salt, pepper with tomato and herbs. It came with bread and potatoes. We also ordered the plate of mix ham. Each bite was better than the next. We shared an order of green salad, and the Vikings Salad. We also tried the House red and white wine.

We couldnt possibly think of ordering dessert, but we did. We shared the Negresco, which has coconut and vanilla ice cream with melted chocolate and whipped cream and the L'impriale, which of tangerine sorbet with melted chocolate and tangerine liquor

I cant think of a better meal to have upon arrival in Paris.

Thank you chef! Absolutely amazing. The food and the staff are great. The red wine was delicious. Very important for us is that the staff is kind which is the case here. Absolutely. We went with our 5 years old kid and we enjoyed a great family lunch together. We will come back here the next time we are in Paris. I told the owner that I had one of the best meals there and I was sincere about it.

주소: Monnaie de Paris, 11 Quai de Conti, 75006 Paris, France
리뷰:
I went there in June 2024.
Service and food were outstanding. I had the lunch menu paired with wine and it was amazing. The dishes I enjoyed the most were the asparagus and the famous artichoke truffle soup. But honestly the entire experience was amazing.

The service was perfect. Flawless during the entire experience.

If you have the opportunity to go , I strongly recommend to. A top experience for food lovers while in Paris! Located in a beautiful historic building overlooking the Seine River the restaurant is highly rated for a reason! Perfection at all levels from the service, atmosphere and of course the food! Loved that the chef was saying hello to everyone and that the waiters were showing their personalities! Throughly enjoyed it! Still amazed that they were demoted to 2 stars by Michelin guide in the last couple of years when everything they do only seems to get better. I visited twice in 2021 and 2022 and both times amazing experiences. The restaurant enjoys a unique and monumental setting in Paris 6th district inside Htel de la Monnaie where all decor speaks elegance and luxury. The service is very attentive. Sommelier gives great advice. The food is outstanding with a great balance between classic and creative. Portions are generous and flavours are distinctively rich. Presentations perhaps are too old school and not as elaborated as could be expected. The absolute most epic culinary experience Ive ever been a part of! Guy Savoy, his staff, the ambiance, and of course the amazing dishes all came together to make something so memorable! If you want to experience a great restaurant without shedding a large amount, make the noon reservation and get their lunch menu with 7 courses. It has a big value for money. I have some extra items from the truffle menu.

The food is very good, I also feel its very subjective and they have several menus.

What was amazing was the service, they were always smiling and helpful. They gave me extra servings of the soup and truffle brioche that was incredible.

리뷰:
Best food experience in Paris. Their tasting menu, at 95 Euro, super worth it. I was stuffed and satisfied at the end of the meal. Every dish was special, tasty, and looks so good. Service is attentive, and they even let me take away the baguette that I couldn't finish. One of our best dinners while in Europe.

The view was pretty decent too.

Overall, a great experience. There was a hiccup with a garnish that my wife has an allergy with, that the server didnt take ownership for she ordered a plate to share that didnt say had nuts, and didnt mention it when she ordered or when it was brought to the table, but we would clearly see on top of the dish but the rest of the service was flawless and great so 45 there.

Food was stellar and the lemon tart desert was one of the best weve ever had. Le ToutParis offers a dining experience that is as much about the views as it is about the food. Situated with stunning panoramic views of the city, its a perfect spot for anyone looking to enjoy a meal while taking in the beauty of Paris. The vistas from the restaurant are breathtaking, providing a pictureperfect backdrop that enhances the overall experience.

As for the food, we were particularly impressed with the mashed potatoes. They were incredibly smooth, almost velvety, and seasoned to perfectiona simple dish elevated to something truly special.

Le ToutParis is a fantastic choice for a memorable meal in Paris, where you can enjoy both exceptional cuisine and some of the best views the city has to offer Food Quality 
Le Tout in Paris exceeded all expectations, becoming our favorite restaurant during our trip. The French onion soup was the best I've ever had, even in the August heatit was absolutely worth it. The lobster was cooked to perfection, the sea bass was delightful, and the ratatouille was bursting with flavor. To top it all off, the chocolate tart souffl was to die for.

Ambiance 
With its beautiful view, Le Tout provided the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable dining experience. The atmosphere was quintessentially Parisian, making every moment feel special.

Service 
The service at Le Tout was impeccable, with attentive staff who enhanced the overall experience. Every detail was thoughtfully taken care of, allowing us to fully enjoy our meal.

Overall Experience 
Our entire experience at Le Tout was a perfect 1010. From the phenomenal food to the stunning views and outstanding service, it was a dining experience that will be cherished and remembered.

Recommendation If you find yourself in Paris, a visit to Le Tout is a must. Whether you're savoring their divine French onion soup or indulging in the chocolate tart souffl, you're in for a culinary treat that will stay with you long after the meal is over. Out of this world experience from start to finish. The team is warm and welcoming.
The food is exceptional and overflowing with flavors and the decor was exquisite! I only wish Id dined earlier so I could have enemies the beautiful terrace view!

주소: 54 Rue du Dr Finlay, 75015 Paris, France
리뷰:
Its a really really amazing restaurant. With fresh Sashimi, the Nabeyaki Udon is tasty, especially the Katsudon here is delicate but when you open the box you definitely will be astonished because it very huge and also yummy.

Further more , you can also see the cook deal with the Sashimi with cautious attitude, really respect to the cook.

Strongly recommend this restaurant, I think you will enjoy the food here , never regret. 55!
I definitely recommend this place. As a relatively small corner restaurant, my family went there for lunch expecting an okay experience. Instead, we found a gemstone restaurant that we will definitely be eating at again. First of all, the service was perfect. The restaurant was supposed to close at 215, and we came to the door 30 seconds if not a minute late. They still accepted us as customers and were very kind. The chef made wonderful food and they were very accepting and happy to serve us. The food was also magnificent, as earlier mentioned. The gyozas were the best weve ever had, and the quality of the ingredients was perfect. The sushi had perfect ratios of fish to rice, and we loved it so much! The fish was also fresh and delicious. This is a perfect family place, and it is so delicious! 100 recommend it for you and your family! Coming back after 2 years . They changed the menu after covid, which made us stop coming.   Surprisingly, they  put back the old menu, which are really great  and delicious  . Japanese restaurant.  Fresh tuna nd salmon.  Price affordable. Love the tempura. BEST JAPANESE RESTAURANT IN PARIS!

Backstory This place was my favorite restaurant since I first ate here back in 2018. I ate here for almost every week until Covid hit. I got really devastated when I came in 2021 and learned that they changed it to a ramen place. I literally cried and never came back

Very happy to learn that the sushi chef came back last Aug and I had to come and see if everything was as before

Ambiance is like before. Cozy and simple.

Service is very good. The chefs are amazing and very nice and friendly!! The waiter was very nice and was very accommodating and made sure all our requests where met.

Food was great as always. Just like before. Everything was fresh and big cuts. The  plates are very generous. The sashimi tuna, salmon and scallops literally melts in your mouth. The best fatty tuna thon grastoro. The tempura wasnt like as before, they were still good but they were better before.

Prices were higher than before but still cheaper than other places with the same quality of food. The price is very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food.

Bonus they take reservations.

I highly highly highly suggest this place. This is the best sushi place in Paris. Amazing quality sushi run by a Japanese family.
The food is so fresh , authentic and tasty and so different from the so many sushi places that resembles fast food. Highly recommend it.

We came across this restaurant while walking around the area. We wanted something quiet and not touristy. This was exactly what we were looking for it is on a quiet street so no people watching but it was perfect for us.
We were amazed by how good the service was and the food was amazing!!!! Really it was so good. We had the hummus, escargot,  and beef appetizer. The escargot the best weve had in Paris!!! We will be back for dinner without a doubt! Fantastic food, the atmosphere is very welcoming and warm. The escargot was phenomenal, a musthave! The dinner was great, my recommendation would be the sea bass as it was light and tasty. One of the best sauces we've ever had with the sea bass! Highly recommend stopping here after a long day of visiting Paris. We were greeted with a warm welcome and a lovely bread basket. The escargot was so delicious in the garlic pesto sauce. The angus steak is a must order. It was beautifully cooked and it had a wonderful sauce. We also recommend the steak tartare. It had amazing flavors when paired with the potatoes, tiny tomatoes and olive! The service was great and our server very friendly. We enjoyed the dinner at La Calche and look forward to coming back. Incredible food, service and overall dining experience. We were even given a special candle on our dessert to celebrate our honeymoon. Highly recommend! Restaurant staff is amazing. Every single thing we ate was top notch from the escargot to the steak to the chocolate with pistachio sauce.  An evening wonderfully spent. I'm glad we stumbled onto this Parisian gem.

I felt like i was having a meal at my familys house except that no one in my family can prepare food this good. HIGHLY recommend Managed to squeeze in for lunch. So glad it worked as the food was fantastic. Tastes, presentation were 5 star. Staff was helpful   and friendly. Would absolutely recommend to anyone close to the Eiffel Tower. Wonderful lunch at an amazing price.

주소: 56ème étage Tour Maine Montparnasse, Tour Maine Montparnasse, Av. du Maine, 75015 Paris, France
리뷰:
4.5

Incredible view. They do city views right. Unfortunately they dont do meat right. Good news thoughthe point of this outing was the viewwhich, again, was spectacular. Wait staff was also super friendly and funny, and it felt like they genuinely wanted our night to be good. And it was. Justif youre a foodie and thats the primary try goal, I would go for drinks rather than get a reservation and the fixed menu. Pro overlooking the city of Paris.
Cons food not that great. The chicken is very rich to the plate, beef is just ok, the crab and fish salad had over ripe tomatoes. Wine is ok. Spent 165 euros. Paid for atmosphere. Could have been better if close to the windows but we have to have the special menu which doesn't look  sound appetizing. The building looks round down. The lower level looks scary and abandoned. On our first trip to France, this stuck out as not only our worst experience, but the only thing on our vacation that we seriously wish we could have had a "do over" on. Yes, the view is beautiful, but I would have to imagine that you could get a much better experience just about anywhere else.

The building was old, stuffy, and felt like it was in need of some serious updating. You go out of the beautiful French architecture and go into a building that was built in the early 70s and get the sense that it hadn't been touched since.

Our wait staff didn't speak English and I will admit my bad for not speaking French, but just bailed on us and had a different waitress come to take our order. Our table was not her area, so we never saw her again. Nor did we see our waiter again.

The drinks ordered were warm, even for a signature cocktail. Would have loved to have had an opportunity to order a glass of wine, but they never came back.

I ordered the pork chop, and more than 13 of it was pure fat! As a cook, this was unacceptable to me. You are better off reducing that fat and using the flavor in so many other recipes, rather than the customer throwing it away. It is such a waste of the animal, and so unappealing to the consumer.

We skipped dessert as we just felt like not only was our patronage not appreciated, but we just were an inconvenience for them. It took over 20 minutes of waiting for someone to come by at which time I had to waive my hands to flag down the manager to ask for the check.

I can't give a stronger recommendation to SKIP this place. There are so many other great places in France, that we wished we could have experienced those instead.

The pictures show the meal before and after. What was left on the plate was pure fat! Food is terrible, to the point I couldn't eat. The restaurant is old and the carpets are very dirty. Has a weird smell. The only thing you can actually enjoy is the view. However, windows need to be clean so u can enjoy a clear view. I booked the restaurant for my moms birthday in February. Very sweet that they tried their best to choose a table near the window and prepared a little candle for her.

The dishes serves like a standard French restaurant, the decoration and taste valued the price.

Waiters were very attentive and spoke many languages.

Will definitely come back for a special day!

리뷰:
Ive read some of the other reviews and I have to say my experience at Les Ombres far exceeded my expectations. It is often the case that a restaurant with such proximity to a major tourist attraction rests on its laurels but the staff could not have been more obliging, the offering more inventive, the food more delicious or the setting more romantic. Sun streamed in through the glass the day we dined and it was nothing less than magical. I have no notes and wish to say nothing except thank you! The only good thing about this restaurant is the view of the Eiffel Tower. You are given a set menu with choices of 5,6, and 8 dishes. Main course dish is either fish or pigeon or both depending on which set menu option you choose. Theres no music in the background. Drink selection is very limited. Incredible place for romantic dinner. The staff    is very polite and pleasant. They helped to create romantic atmosphere. The quality of the  food is excellent. You can take photos from the roof with Eiffel Tower as well Good view. Location was lovely.

Food was mediocre, poor for the price you pay. The steak was dry, overcooked and had little flavor. Fish was very good. Desert was a flavorful nectarine and sorbet.

Drinks menu was also limited and there were only 4 bottled beers on the menu.

There was no flexibility on the menu as one person at the table was not allowed to choose the bigger menu while the rest of the table wanted the smaller menu.

The waiters were kind and attentive.

Overall, the views are great, the food and experience were underwhelming for the price. Loved this place for a magical dinner experience. Loved the view of the Eiffel Tower. Food was extraordinary and different from the norm. The atmosphere and even walking in to the restaurant was beautiful. Only complaint was that it was pretty hot in the room before the sun went down, but it didnt damper our time there. Highly recommended this place.

주소: 12 Rue de l'Hôtel Colbert, 75005 Paris, France
리뷰:
Truly exceptional. The chef's concept was a welcome surprise, different from many Michelin star restaurants. The menu is seasonal of course and the overall experience is worth writing about. The wine pairing was well worth it, varying between wine and sake.  We left thoroughly amused, satiated without being overly full, and only a little bit tipsy. We sat in the mineral lounge, which I preferred. Highly recommend. Dont miss this unique dining experience. The service was especially interactive because you are not told the dishes in advance and get to discuss flavors between courses. Perfect to celebrate a special occasion. Highly recommend winesake pairing as well as sitting in the cave! Excellent dining experiencewith the fusion of French and Japanese cuisine being exceptionally wellexecuted. Every dish was cooked and seasoned to perfection. My personal favourites were the lobster soup and the pork. The lobster soup had a rich, robust flavour, and the hint of spiciness added a wonderful depth to the dish. The pork was incredibly tender and cooked to perfection. Their wine pairing was also good as well.

The staff were very professional, offering detailed explanations of the menu. The interactive element of guessing the ingredients in each dish was also unique and interesting, adding an engaging twist to the meal. Even though sometimes can be challenging. They also took the time to thoroughly explain the restaurants sustainability concept, from reusing broken plates to utilising every part of the ingredients to minimise food waste.

The basement seating area is nice, but the only downside is the lack of mobile signal or WiFi, which we were informed before being seated. While I understand the restaurants aim to encourage guests to focus on the food, it would still be better to have internet access downstairs.

Overall, its a good restaurant and definitely worth a special visit when youre in Paris, especially if youre a fan of Japanese cuisine but are looking to try something new. I would recommend it! An exceptional experience! The restaurant is intimate and the service is personable and very professional. The flavors are complex and interesting, and unique among the many restaurants in Paris. Omakase at its best. Nice people, creative, well executed food, nicely presented. Some dishes are spectacular. Only personal drawback Uninspired barsomething piano music in the background that does not make any sense. But this place deserves a visit. The wine and sake  pairing also worked well.

Update Fall 2024 In six months, prices were raised significantly. Prices just turned
From from fair to borderline expensive. This i had to lower the rating to four stars.

리뷰:
I had an amazing experience at Mashita! The food was incredibly authentic, with rich flavors that transported me straight to Korea. The Dak Kangjeong and Jaeyuk Bokkeum were especially delicious. The staff was friendly, attentive, and the ambiance was cozy and welcoming, perfect for both casual dining and a special night out. If youre in Paris and craving Korean food, this place is a mustvisit. Highly recommend! The lunch menu offered a set, but Im a loyal fan of raw beef, so I decisively ordered the beef tartare bibimbap!

 The ingredients were fresh, the beef tender and smooth. Although the rice was slightly undercooked, mixing it with the egg and sauces oily fragrance didnt detract from the overall taste.

There were no complex innovations in the dishes, just simple home cooking done well

Overall, its a great little diner spot! It was beautiful Experience
Amazing Korean food really enjoyed it lovely dessert with coffee
Toilet was so nice too
Best experience! I can say that this is the best Korean restaurant in Paris. Reminded me a lot of Korean cuisine that I had when I lived there! Missed this so much!  Perfect dinner authentic Korean food
Super service
A little bit crowded but excellent price to value
Some real artisans, worth to try

주소: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré, 75008 Paris, France
리뷰:
To even say it was a fantastic dinner would not even begin to explain this place.  It has the best service from the time you sit down to the time they call you a taxi.  From the wine pairings to the caviar, I have never had a better dinner.  The tasting menu is a walkthrough culinary wonderland. I highly recommend and hope to go back when visiting Paris again. One of my favourite restaurants in the world with a great captaincy by Mr. Frchon. The service is exquisite and delivers a personalized experience with spot on recommendations and explanations. The food is outstanding with a great balance of innovation, creativity and tradition. A great respect for the ingredients in their cooking techniques, combinations and presentation. To breakup our run of Michelin dinners, we decided on a lunch that offered the same full dinner menu at Epicure. I figured that it would be a long lunch which turned out to be a four and half hour lunch. Yes, the longest lunch of our lives. And it was worth every single minute!

The restaurant inside Hotel Le Bristol is gorgeous. We were met with a beautiful arrangement of flowers and rugs of pinks and violets. The warm reddish tones continued into the dining room where we were greeted with warmth by the staff.

The food here was exceptional with not a single course veering off in excellence. It ranged from the signature caviar with potato mousseline smoked in haddock with buckwheat crips and sour cream dressing, full of umami to the perfectly cooked langoustine in lemon and thyme, onion mango and broth flavored with coriander and citrus fruits. The candele macaroni with black truffle, artichoke and foie gras filling in parmesan cheese, and black truffle juice reminded of a similar dish at Acquerello in San Francisco in visual appearance and ingredients.

Out of the entire lunch full of numerous courses, there were three highlights. The salmon from Scotland in powder of tandoori spices, fennel and cucumber with mint oil and rice vinegar was stunning. Simply, it was the best cooked salmon Ive ever had in my life so far. If salmon is this good in Scotland, I wonder what other types of seafood exists in Scotland Before this, the best salmon I had was from Alaska. The hen breast poached in a bladder was incredibly moist that it cut like butter and the green asparagus with morels that accompanied it in a wine reduction with crayfish and golden chanterelles with Xeres was incredible. I immediately had a flash back to the piece of chicken served at La Grenouille in NYC some 16 years ago which was the best Ive ever had until this dish. To continue this momentum the trolley of macarons and chocolates were incredibly flavorful. I believe she said that the macarons were made on the premise every day. We love macarons and to hear my wife say that these are the best macarons Ive had so far brought immense joy.

To mark our honeymoon, the staff spread red rose petals and an edible sugar sculpture on our table during dessert time. They were genuine, warm, attentive, and clear professionals at hospitality. They made us feel special and well cared for throughout our 4.5 hour lunch for a very memorable experience.

Merci beaucoup, Epicure! Everything was almost perfect, the food, staff, atmosphere.
Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for fine dining. Some of the foods looked like a piece of art. If you don't mind paying the higher price, definitely try the tasting menu. It's hard to describe just how good this place is. We've done Kei and Le Clarence in Paris which were both phenomenal and this edged out both of them. There were literally no misses as far as the plates go and I enjoyed how tasty and yet creative and sometimes cerebral each course was. There was always a play on color, texture and sometimes temperature executed with perfect finesse. It's french cuisine yes but it wasn't completely bound by that. The salmon for example was crusted with tandoori spice and came with a raita like sauce, quite a pleasant surprise.

리뷰:
That was the first restaurant we visited while in Paris. The service was exceptional! Props to the lady assisting us for our needs. With regards to food, overall everything was tasty but in my view some details I would like to see took away the 55 rating like the crispy skin on the fish. Description of the dishes was quite complicated but in my view they were quite simplistic. I found quite odd the approach of serving 14 of a chicken breast for a main course. Dessert was just OK. We had diners here with chill out atmosphere, the place is lovely. The food itself I would say good but yet special to my opinion. The ingredients were fresh, tasty but still feel like something missing here. The service is excellent any how it was a Nice and chic restaurant. I rarely write negative reviews, but I hope this helps fellow tourists in Paris make an informed decision. For a restaurant that pride themselves as being in the Michelin Guide listing, Grand Coeur was a huge disappointment.

The service was extremely slow. We endured a 30minute wait just to have our orders taken and an additional 40 minutes for the first set of entres to arrive. Given the table's limited size, the four entres were served in two separate batches, resulting in another 30minute delay in between.

The oysters were not properly shucked out where the muscle is still very much attached to the shell, and we were provided with wrong cutlery, forcing us to wrestle with them using a huge entre spoon. As a chef, I found this oversight inexcusable and funny.

The main courses took almost an hour to arrive, i had a glance at the other 3 tables on my side that were also left waiting with an empty table and angry faces. Our table was never wiped clean inbetween courses, and every new dish dropped on our table had to be on top of a dirty clutter.

The food was disappointingly bland and lacked any discernible flavor. Our high expectations were completely unmet, and we left feeling disheartened. Our dinner, intended to be a memorable conclusion of our trip in Paris, stretched from 8 PM to 1145 PM and was nothing short of a disaster.

Thank you but wont be coming back, nor recommending. The interior is sober, bit dungeon like feel  but there is a nice terrace for when the weather is nice. The dishes were good and portions too. The dessert of sorbet and cream sauce was disappointing felt like melted ice cream soup. The chef is clearly a cook more than a patisserie chef. Terrific food. The veal chop was the best I have ever had, without question. Dessert was terrific as well.

Sadly a little disappointed after the upbeat reviews. On the plus side the service by the owner was efficient and his wine recommendation excellent.  And the place itself was charming and a pleasant place to eat. However the food was largely average albeit not overpriced except for the large prawn.
The snails average the croquette of pig trotter really didn't work as it was runny and lacked flavour the duck OK but the breast had shrunk, the veal chop the best dish. The single large prawn didn't work at all for the price. Sadly the rum baba was dry and had zero taste of rum. Creme brulee was better. Wow, this was a highlight of our trip to Paris. Small place, small menu  that means they prepare and serve from scratch beware the large menu that usually means dishes are sourced elsewhere and just reheated. Food was excellent and very flavourful, and they have a great selection of French wines and other beverages to compliment any meal. Cozy, small restaurant run by a couple. The pork shank and fish dish were delicious. Entrees were reasonably priced. Dessert was so so. Service got slow when they got busy. Delicious dinner enjoyed here. If you want seasonal menu items cooked beautifully this is the place for you. We enjoyed lapin and pork rib mainentrees, and seasonal berry desserts. Washed down with refreshing cocktails and a bottle of crisp pouilly fume. Highly recommend eating here to get away from the standard tourist menus! Came here due to the good Google reviews. Unfortunately the quality of the food didnt live up to our expectations. We were a bit late due to the rain but the owner welcomed us very warmly. The table was a bit sticky. My starter was ok, nothing special. The other starter was a soup and the taste was just blend. My main dish was white fish, again ok. The other main dish was duck and the meat was quite dry. The desert was too sweet. Overall very overpriced meal and not worth it.

주소: 15 Quai de la Tournelle, 75005 Paris, France
리뷰:
What an exceptional restaurant, its certainly worth the expense and might have the best lunch view in Paris. From beginning to end, top marks from the staff and culinary team on delivering an unforgettable experience with food and wine to match. I will eagerly await my next meal at La Tour dArgent! I didn't have high hopes for a vegan meal andor experience based on the menu options, but resolved myself to have this experience with close friends, even if I wasn't excited about the menu.

That said, with a simple request for a vegan option, I am forever grateful for the curated meal and experience at La Tour d'Argent!

NOTE Our party reached out ahead of time to request a vegan option for me I highly recommend doing that if you have this dietary request.

As a party of five, we requested one vegan meal in our party and it was one of the best vegan meals I've ever had... and likely the best meal and dining experience of my life.

This experience NOT only didn't disappoint, but as a vegan, I felt like the entire meal was explicitly prepared for me. Every single course was curated for my vegan lifestyle and pallet. I never felt like any of the courses were an afterthought.

There was so much thought, care, and preparation involved to ensure my vegan experience not only met but exceeded my expectations.

It was FANTASTIC!!!

Thank you for proving me wrong and, as a vegan, providing me with an exceptional meal and experience! Absolutely exceptional Michelin starred restaurant. There's a strict dress code of jackets for men.
We had the five course tasting menu for 380 each. This was a surprise menu in that they didn't tell you what you were going to get. It did include their signature duck dish.
Wine is a speciality. They have over 300,000 wines in their cave and a heavy book acting as a wine list.
The service was superb and the food was outstanding. This was my first Michelin star experience and it lived up to expectations. The staff was warm and helpful  answering all my questions. The dining room and view are breathtaking. As for the food, it was spectacular. We did the seasonal tasting menu and every dish was perfectly balanced. I can only describe it as art! It was great experience with excellent service from the team right after I placed booking. They helped me for the pass, waited for us to reach the restaurant due to horrible traffic in Paris during Olympic and when we arrived they had accommodated us with warm and welcoming feeling. Food is great and they derserve to be pride of being oldest restaurant with high standards in Paris. If you can afford, I would like to encourage you to try Finding good food in Paris is not difficult but this is legend and it will worth every penny you spend.

주소: Avenue Gustave Eiffel 2ème, Tour Eiffel, Av. Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
리뷰:
Its hard to miss the beautiful atmosphere and outstanding 5 star service you receive at this restaurant. Of course the food is presented very well and tastes as you expect. A great experience and worth the price. Once Our recent visit to Le Jules Verne was nothing short of spectacular.

From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warmth and professionalism by the exceptional staff, including Ines, Tiffany, Ann, and everyone else who contributed to our unforgettable experience.

The ambience of the restaurant is simply enchanting, especially as the sun begins to set. If you're planning a visit, I highly recommend making a reservation around sunset to fully enjoy the breathtaking transition from day to night.

While every seating area offers a unique and beautiful perspective, the window seats are particularly magical, providing unparalleled views that complement the exquisite cuisine.
Speaking of which, the food at Le Jules Verne is truly outstanding.

Every dish is a masterpiece, artfully presented and bursting with flavor. The combination of the food, the views, and the topnotch service made our evening here one for the books.

Thank you, Le Jules Verne, for an extraordinary experience. We can't wait to return! We were unable to book a meal on our anniversary but we were able to get a lunch reservation for the weekend that we were celebrating.   From start to finish our experience was spectacular.  We were wished a happy anniversary at the start of our meal and we even got a beautiful dessert with the same sentiment.  The service was wonderful, charming and well coordinated.  The food was delicious and well presented. We booked this restaurant before it got its second Michelin star.  We experienced second star service from the start and only realized that the restaurant got its second star after we looked it up while we were there after I noted that the service was better than I expected.  Thank you for giving us such a wonderful experience for our special occasion!  Your second Michelin star is well deserved. We recently had the pleasure of dining at the restaurant located at the Eiffel Tower with my family, and I must say it was an absolutely incredible experience. From the moment we entered, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality that made us feel truly welcomed.

The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the 7 course meal that we indulged in. Each dish was a culinary masterpiece, expertly crafted with exquisite flavors and presented beautifully. The attention to detail and the use of fresh, highquality ingredients truly showcased the skill and creativity of the chefs.

But what truly made this dining experience exceptional was the breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. As we enjoyed our meal, we were mesmerized by the iconic landmark standing tall before us. The twinkling lights and the enchanting ambiance created an atmosphere that was nothing short of magical. It was a sight that left both my kids and myself entranced throughout the entire meal.

Not only was the food beyond exceptional, but the service was also impeccable. The staff at the restaurant were kind, caring, and attentive to every detail. They went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was nothing short of perfection. Their genuine warmth and hospitality truly made us feel special and taken care of.

I cannot express my gratitude enough for the wonderful memories that were created that evening. The restaurant at the Eiffel Tower truly exceeded all expectations and made our day truly unforgettable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a dining experience that combines extraordinary cuisine, stunning views, and exceptional service. The restaurant is certainly worth it's Michelin stars with it's exceptional food and service.

The dishes are flavorful and full of techniques.

The view is breathtaking too.
Although, in addition to booking in advance, you'd still need to be early as window seats are first come first serve.

Songsan is among the very few traditional Korean restaurants of Paris. The staff is almost entirely Korean, the food is tasty and authentic, and the restaurant is modern. Most tables are busy with persons from the Korean community, which is an excellent sign. We loved it, and we will come back! Service good, food Tasty, portion was quite generous.
Cox's approved  It's like the food I eat in Korea. Moderately spicy and sweet. Like Korea, the food you order comes out quickly and the menu is diverse, but most of them are above average in taste. Bossam and Budaejjigae are impressive, and Koreanstyle Chinese food is also good. The chicken was a little disappointing, but overall it is a Korean restaurant that embodies the taste of Korea well. Delicious food and large portions. The bim bap boeuf was especially good. The service was attentive and food came out quickly. I do recommend reserving ahead, but they were able to fit us in when we called the day of.

The only negative to note is the tables are very close together, so much that your chair is touching the wall or the chair of the person behind you.

However, we had a very tasty and filling meal with the 28 menu, and will be happy to return! Nice and delicious lunch with , salad and gyoza

주소: 44 Rue Vieille du Temple, 75004 Paris, France
리뷰:
Our first restaurant in Paris and set such a high standard! Food was great, service was wonderful thank you to Tom!, wine recommendation was good and restaurant is small and cozy. Make sure to reserve! It was packed.

Bill came to be around 231 euros for 5 people. We ordered 2 entrees, 5 mains, a bottle of wine, and 1 dessert. The dinner was impeccable. Best meal we had so far in Paris, and one of the best dinners in general. Very well balanced flavors and perfectly cooked. The service was excellent. Tom was our server, and did a fabulous job! Merci Beaucoup! One of our favorite spots, if not the favorite spot, of our trip to Paris. Tiny little place so make sure to book in advance, but both the upstairs and downstairs are lovely.

The escargot was unique. Came with edible shells that were super tasty. The duck was a standout as well.

Great service and solid portions for the price. Cant recommend enough. Beautiful little restaurant in a cute neighbourhood with excellent classic French food and great service. The ambience is perfect for a relaxing meal. We had the escargot starter based on a recommendation, and it was so good and addictive we had to order a second portion. Duck fois gras was also very tasty. For the mains we had duck breast and rabbit  both were deliciously favoured and perfectly cooked. The wine list offers excellent choices to pair with the various dishes and at a reasonable price for us coming from London. Deserts and ice cream rounded the night off perfectly. Big thank you to Tom  Marine who looked after us so well, we left very happy. We will be back next time in Paris 100. The food was superb with a very caring and excellent staff. The smoked Stracciatella starter was definitely a highlight in both flavour and texture.

The staff spoke perfect English and all in all for 77  for two people with starter  wine  2 mains, definitely a recommend for a little more special occasion. Would go again

It's probably the best dinner I had during my stay in Paris! Traditional French dishes, everything was delicious.  Personnel was friendly and helpful. I would definitely visit again if I'm back in town! Really popular restaurant serving typical French cuisine. Make a reservation or you will be disappointed. The Prix Fixe four course menu was good value and the food was really tasty. The dining room has an atmosphere and a buzz about it. The staff were friendly even though the were really busy. Great dinner would definitely go again. A very authentic French restaurant! You know a place is authentic and old school when you order pt de campagne, they would provide you with a jar of Cornichons! The staff and owner are all very friendly. They have a special menu everyday so make sure to ask for that. The standard baguette that they provide is also fresh and warm. Overtoasted baguettes  way too crunchy. Terrine and steak were alright. Fries were good. Coq au vin had good sauce but dry chicken. Wine was ok.. Expected a bit more from the reviews. Fabulous! A friendly, personal and high quality restaurant without any pretentious elements. The food is great, authentic french cuisine with large or even oversized portions. The staff are friendly and engaging and appropriately attentive.
We had aperitif, starter, main course, cheese course and dessert all for a very reasonable fixed price 47E. I can't recall a better value meal in Paris.

This gastronomy is a fusion of French and Japanese food. We came here for the lunch menu. The food are good and in big portions but they stay quite classic and not as creative as other restaurant. 4 cf list Michelin Star Challenge
French restaurant with a Japanese chef that assumes his origin.
We have a lot of Japanese chefs in Paris. This one is actually the second restaurant from a Japanese chef Neige d t, review to come but a big backlog
The nice thing is that the Japanese origin are fully assumed but yet its not a Japanese restaurant, its a French one at the end of the day. So its not just the quality of execution and its precision that you enjoy, but you also have a little bit of exoticism without taking any gustatory risk.
The crowd was casual lunch casual for a one star . I went there with a friend to catch up. I did  feel I was not the only one.
It does deserve its star. Wow. One star Michelin restaurant absolutely impeccable, everything was perfect from food to service. Lovely experience high recommended, but not for everyday meal, it's perfect for special occasions and romantic dine. Gorgeous wine list, but not cheap. The general experience here is very good. You are well received and well served. The plates are beautifully dressed and very tasty. The cook is perfect. We are going to miss your delicious tapas but we are looking forward to visiting Pilgrim in its formule gastronomique. Also looking forward to the upcoming opening of the Comptoir which I'm sure is going to be a hit! We visited in the past during the tapas format and were curious to try the proper full menu experience. We loved the dinner menu and the wine pairing. We particularly liked the "veau and asparagus" as well as the light dessert made of cheesecake and sorbetbouquet de tagetes. We'll be back again!

리뷰:
I like the atmosphere and the service. The food was not bad but I expected more for the price. The salad with chicken liver was pretty good, the soup was interesting but it was served cold, I think warm would have boosted the flavour. The mashed potato and potato gratin were very good, the fish was flavourless, so not good. And we got the roasted chicken, which was juicy and fine again lacking flavour a bit. however, there were still some chicken feather's in there. I pointed this out to our server and I think they got offended. I mean I know it's not hair, but still it's not very pleasant to have chicken feather's in your food. Fulfilling lunch stomach, mood and spirit! We ordered Tuna as starter with sweet and spicy grilled avocado. The sauce is refreshing and well balanced, not too sweet. Main dishes were Fish of the day, Chicken and Lamb. Fish fried just right, taste of freshness and tender, sauce balanced with the fishy taste, perfect but not for eater preferring strong taste. The chicken with the burnt rosemary over dish was tender with marvelous taste of baked chicken. Usually for health sake I skip the skin, but for this dish only the bones were left. Lamb was divine. So tasty and tender, in my mouth I refused to chew and swallow. I wanted it to last in my mouth. All the side dishes were amazing. The mashed potato was smooth with mini potato chunks. The best potato I have ever tasted. Too full for dessert, but I believed strongly that those would be great, too. Atmospheric restaurant with a magnificent chimney with a real fire. The staff are super efficient and pleasant. Food is rustic and very well done. Decent selection of wine by the glass. Memorable for being unusual! Went there for a corporate event. The setting is amazing with a fireplace and a very noce open grill.

The set menu was an artichoke soup and a veal roast.

The soup was OK, I just hate when you market a dish as truffle artichoke soup and then you go searching for that truffle taste which is no where to be found.

The veal roast was cooked to perfection. It lacked seasoning though and the jus was runny and missing the bold flavours you expect from a veal jus.

Will I come back? Maybe, probably not. The food and staff are great. We had the set menu with Cod and butternut squash soup. We also ordered the lobster special of the day. The waiter helped choose excellent wine options. The food was delicious and cost about 73 per person with two bottles of wine on a table of 5.  Highly recommended.

My second time here, and I really enjoy this restaurant for more than 1 reasons. First of all, the food is well curated, the menu has a gastronomic concept where you expect nothing less than a great plate.

I started with eggs filled with crabs and then for the main course beef with shallot sauce, mushrooms and potatoes pure. The fish plate was same delicious and very colourful as well. This is one of the gastronomic restaurants that have the better relation between price and valuetaste.

The place was fully booked and when you see the dinning room like this, it makes the experience even better. The last thing to congratulate is the server, which is serving to 40 people in the same time and he is always on top of this game energic, funny and super responsive. Outstanding French cuisine. The food was top notch and presentation was delightful. For appetizers I had the mackerel, crab ravioli, and scallop. The mackerel was smoked and came with vegi, herbs, and very tasty complementing cream sauce. We ordered their Sea Bass, pork roasted since 8 AM, and Pigeon not on the menu. Each one is unique and exceptional in taste.  The waiting staff spoke fluent English and were very friendly.

The restaurant is small and fills up quickly.  Highly recommend making reservation from their website. It is very easy. We had the chef menu and it was very delicious. The service was also excellent. We would definitiv recommend the restaurant! The food was pretty good. I ordered a set from the lunch menu. I had the pigeon pate, beef cheek, and the rice pudding. They were all great. Would highly recommend it. Unique and very tasty cuisine. Not too pretentious which is a good thing  you can actually eat there, not degustate.
Personal recommendations are sea bass, vitello tonnato and lemon desert.
Vine from tresoir section is a gem, but all others are also good.

리뷰:
Perfect foie gras and onion soup. We hunted for the best classic French food and found it here. Presentation of the dishes was chic. Setting was beautiful too, like something from a movie. The lovely female waiter was so kind as well.
The cocktails could be fresherhave more of a kick, but the food trumps any drawback with the drinks.
Overall, fantastic dining. This restaurant didn't meet our expectations. The snails were disappointing, and while the duck was decent, the service was lacking. The crme brle tasted like it had gone bad, so I didn't eat it. We experienced long wait times, and it felt like the waiter was rushing to get rid of us. On the positive side, the wine was excellent, and the prices were reasonable. A nice choice to go if you want taste traditional French food. We ordered the Foie Gras, the onion soup and snails for the starter. And beef steak, brass And duck drumstick for the main dishes. They are really delicious! Here is a fantastic spot for good food in Paris. The location is very convenient, situated in a vibrant area that's perfect for peoplewatching while you enjoy your meal. The food is topnotch, with each dish bursting with flavor and authenticity. The staff here are wonderful  friendly, efficient, and always eager to ensure you have a great experience. A mustvisit for anyone who loves good food and a pleasant atmosphere. We had an amazing dinner. We each ordered the Entre  Plat  Dessert. Everything was absolutely delicious and the presentation of the food was great. The service was excellent. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Great taste and quality food! I was craving some Korean cuisine, so I came to this place and I was more than happy. The chicken here is amazing, because it reminds of 1990s old school fried chicken from Seoul. So if yall crave some nostalgic old Seoul food, strongly recommended.  HHOORRRAAYYy!!! I finally get to eat authentic Korean food! OOHh it was so yummy and tasteful!  I have  
Hot bibimbap with beef and Pago Juice can.
I love the Kimchi!!!

The restaurant was pretty small to me and was nice to have extra room in the back. It took awhile for me to get my turn for table. I understand with large group of people are coming in and I'm by myself. The waitress was amazing and nice she can speak English.

I thought their outside sign was kind of small or hard to spot them right away. I realize they are in small area. One of the better korean restaurants in Paris. This time we tried the crab soup, two person portion. I away like to order these big pots of soup to share with another person. Blue crab and vegetables, slightly spicy. Heated continuously and warmed on your table. So the food stay warm to taste good. A cold crab soup will be too fishy otherwise. Its hearty and comforting even in warm weather IMHO. For 3 people, we shared bulgogi beef and nengmyeon cold noodles on a hot summer day, it was perfect! Food tastes really good and service was fast. We came here mainly for the cold noodles as there is only a few Korean restaurants serving this dish  The quality of food served had deteriorated. I lived here about 7 years ago and it was one of the best Korean restaurants in the neighborhood. However, during my recent visit, I was shocked by how bad the crpe was in the lunch menu. It was so dry and tasteless, like chewing cardboard. The beef main dish was also not good. Meat was dry, but seasoning was greasy yet bland and quite sweet. The lunch menu was around 1823. But I would prefer to pay more money to get better quality food. I will probably visit again at dinner to see if I should remove this restaurant from my list...

The entres are small and really good, so if you are two or more persons, you can order more. I would have liked to try all the entrees. The riz au lait was  I didnt know anything about this place before going there, but seems like in 2018 it was a Michelin rated restaurant. My wife and I had kimchi jiggae and bulgogi, and we were both pleasantly surprised. The kimchi jiggae paired extremely well with the bulgogi. I would definitely recommend these two dishes as a pairing, but beware, the kimchi jiggae is a bit spicy. I wish there was delicious Korean cuisine restaurants in Texas, like this one. Loved every single bite of the food here!!! Favourites were japchae, the pajeon and the stir fried pork! Japchae was flavoured very well and the pajeon was super crispy. The pork slices in the stirfried pork dish was super thin and cooked real good.

A definite must try if you are looking for legit korean food in Paris. The service was great! Menu is simple and they have the essential korean dishes. The food was clean and good, but not super impressive. I would definitely recommend. Seems to get busy so it should be best to reserve ahead of the visit. Very tasty and cozy korean spot in Paris. I would definitely recommend the fried korean galette and the beef tartare as starters, they were really delicious. As for the main, I wasnt too impressed with the salmon bowl but the pork was great.

We went there during lunch hour, super packed but service was fast! We had dumplings for starters, very delicious. Then we shared the spicy miso ramen, broccoli and mushrooms stir fry, and also slow cooked pork i think its called buta kakuni. I couldnt recommend the pork enough, so soft, tender and super tasty! Just had a delightful meal at Lai Lai Ken!

The service was efficient and quick  leaving me feeling content and satisfied. While the decor is a bit plain and the lighting too bright at night the food more than makes up for it!  The fried chicken is an absolute musttry and the wonton soup is perfect for warming up in winter.  Overall, a great spot with excellent valu for money!  Contrary to what many people say, this is not a japanese restaurant, but an asiatic one.

The food was good, it had good taste and good quantity.

However, as youll see in the picture, the gyozas were stuck together, which is not great.
Unfortunately, the mapo tofu was not spicy, adapting to the local palate is good, but they went a bit too far here.

And finally the price was a bit excessive, as it ended up costing 21 for a meal with almost no meatfish, which is normally what makes a meal expensive For years I've looked for good ramen in Paris and I think that finally I found it. The atmosphere of the restaurant is fantastic, mixing France and Japan with a cosy environment where finally conversation are possible without shouting. I think the price is a bit higher than the competitors on the same street but definetly there is a reason and it remains affordable and proportionate to the quality of the food. I ordered an ebi yakisoba that was very mildly seasoned. It had the wok hay char which was nice, but the overall experience was underwhelming. It's also not cheap for what it is, even the normal yakisoba was about 1314. However, the service was quick and they were very nice and polite.

Incredible menu  so creative. Absolutely delightful. We came with a family of 4. Beautiful presentation. Well priced. Veal was so fresh, soft and perfectly cooked. Scallops delicious. Kind and attentive waiters and staff. After reading reviews on this restaurant we decided to try as we had Vegan and Gluten Free dietary requirements. Staff reassured me that my meal was Gluten free, but proceeded to give me a vinaigrette salad which is not gluten free, vinegar is not gluten free. Disappointed that these needs couldn't be met efficiently, especially for the price of the food. Service was fantastic apart from this, worth a try if you eat meat and have no allergies. This is our first time in Paris and by far the best meal we have had. We do not speak French but felt very comfortable with the service we received and to top it all off the food was absolutely excellent. I will recommend this restaurant to anyone who is coming to Paris! Friendly staff. However, it is filled with food that is close to French home cooking and perhaps that is why it is filled with only older locals. It doesn't have a French feel and is not good for the price. Honestly if u North American food will be taste very plain for us i didnt like anything and special menu of the day tuna fish was just so dry. Steak was okay nothing compared American with all good review I disappointed I dont like nothing even salmon tartare was taste mayonnaise not good I dont know maybe they pay for reviews but it not best and all mans workers except are server was staring at my friend wrong way very impolite they staring so much make us uncomfortable place is so small for price we pay could be better specially when they called themself  French restaurant portions small drinks expensive. Maybe my taste just spoiled but not my style of food

The food was incredible  the beef and duck were hands down the best we've ever tasted, cooked to absolute perfection. The service was lovely, with such friendly and attentive staff who made us feel very welcomed. The wine was absolutely amazing, and the prices were surprisingly reasonable for the quality.
Highly recommend this place. Have been multiple times and have never been disappointed.  The service is always friendly with a laugh and smile.  The food is fresh and tasty with generous portion sizes.   Must not miss! Absolutely loved this place and would highly recommend it to everyone. Service was fantastic. The three course meal was really reasonably priced and so delicious. The duck was fantastic and the selection of little deserts was so good so great to be able to have a little bit of all the deserts. Such a an amazing find! As starter we asked for a burratina. Then for mains we asked for magret de canard and the today special which was veal.
For finishing we asked for a crme brle with pistachio.
With the form discount we pay like 22 euros each so it was really worth it.
Totally recommended. We had a late lunch and staff were super helpful throughout. Great cafe feel at their outside seating. We did two course meal starter and main and it did not disappoint. Check it out!

Amazing experience. The food and service were unlike anything I've ever experienced! Incredibly attentive and accommodating staff. We were given a small history of the house as well as a very through description of the wonderful food. They accommodated my husband's vegetarian diet and it was equally as delicious as everything else and the bartender made us some amazing Mocktails. Best experience at a restaurant we've ever had in all of Paris Recently I had a pleasure of dining at this restaurant, and It was one of the best fine dining experience ive had in Paris. If you want true culinary experience and love to discover unique flavors you must go here. Its a cozy place where you can enjoy kitchen view if seated on a first floor. Staff went above and beyond to make our dinner unforgettable. Many thanks! Very nice experience in one iconic building in paris. The service was extremely good, the waiter was kind and explained us all the history and myth of the house and its ancient owner. Recommended. It was an overwhelming experience last nite that 3 courses of meals turned out to be 7 dishes with surprising presentations and quality. Even every meals even the entree and mains were small serve. We were full. Would highly recommend to do five course to make the dinner more complicated. Had absolutely delightful experience at the restaurant. The food was delicious, and don't get fooled by the small portions  after the whole set I was definitely good to skip breakfast the day after.
Very yummy, and the tastes opening more at every stage and each new one completing and building up on the previous one.
I think I'm ready to take the plane just for the brioche and the asparagus mousse only.
People really friendly. This time I happened to dine alone, but I didn't feel alone for a second.
Definitely coming back again
