주소: 6 Rue du Général Estienne, 75015 Paris, France
리뷰:
A huge fan of Korean culture, including music, dramas, and especially food, I was delighted to discover this amazing Korean restaurant in a quiet neighbourhood. The food  Seafood pancake, Samgyeopsal, and Sesame ice cream  was exceptional, and the service was fantastic! I really appreciated the recommendations of the staff who were very warm, welcoming and helpful.  
I can't wait to go back again.
NB There's air conditioning, which is a huge plus. I had lunch here, enjoying the Korean food, which was genuinely authentic. The dishes were fantastic, bursting with flavor and made with quality ingredients. Every bite was a delight, making it a memorable dining experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for truly delicious Korean cuisine! When pass in front of a Korean restaurant and you see that all the clients eating were Korean, it was a invitation for me to try it and I loved it. Great typical food, well cooked and presented! The service was also nice. It was a very good experience and I hope you enjoy it too! Found this place by chance. It was first experience of Korean food for me and my wife and I can say, that we were lucky to try this food here and enjoyed our dinner a lot. First of all, as newcomers, we asked waiter what we should try and it was best choice. Unfortunately I have forgotten names of dishes, but in such places is to ask what best dishes to try. Liked experience a lot. Enjoyed that meat was cooked in front of me and all the entremets we received. Taste of some probably could be to spice for unprepared person, but I liked everything and meat was superb. Also enjoyed a talk with owner after our meal, it was really very pleasant. My recent visit to Kohyang left me deeply disappointed and frustrated. As soon as I entered the restaurant, I sensed judgment from a nonKorean waiter who scrutinized my friend and me from head to toe. It looked like he was trying to figure out where we were from. Even though we made it clear that there were two of us, he just ignored us and acted like he didn't get it. We tried FOUR times to talk to him, and he responded in English at the end. Even though we were the only ones waiting to be seated, it was so strange how the waiter couldn't understand simple french such as deux personnes

Once seated, the bad treatment didn't stop, as this waiter kept ignoring us and chatting with other tables nearby. It was only when a Korean lady came and assisted us with our order. Our main courses came without the side dishes, and when we asked for sauce and extra items, we had to wait even longer. This whole experience left us feeling really frustrated and annoyed.

I felt like the waiter was discriminating against us, which made this the worst dining experience I've ever had. My friend, who was with me, wasn't Korean or French, but we both felt like we were treated unfairly. I hope that management will take my comments seriously and address these issues to make sure that all customers are treated with the respect and professionalism they deserve!


After reading your reply, I must express my disappointment with your attitude as a restaurant owner. I want to clarify that upon entering your restaurant, we greeted with "Bonjour." Also, we did not raise our voices at anyone. I am very distracted by your distortion of the facts. As customers, we understand what it means to be busy and when we're being intentionally ignored. We never believed we were more important than others. All we sought was equal treatment. A simple apology would have sufficed!  Thank you, but we cannot take the risk of returning. No, we have decided never to come back, and we will share everyone we know about our experience.

A fine restaurant with a cosy environment, especially if you're on a date or meeting friendsfamily. I'd been here with friends and I had a good time overall. They have a good variety of food and drinks. We had ordered cocktails, which were pretty good. The pizzas were decent at best. The only disappointing dish was the truffle pizza. The ambience adds to the whole experience. Great place to enjoy a delicious meal! The food was excellent! The service was amazing  quick and responsive. our server Antonio was awesome and gave us great recommendations on wine and food. Definitely worth dining here! We were blown away from the warmth of the staff and the quality of the food. Try the burratta and for main the truffle pizza, you wont be disappointed! Truffle pasta is extremely strong, if you dont like truffles LIKE A LOT. You wont like it. Other than that everything is amazing. Server was superb and extremely friendly with helping us order. I will be back next time I will be in town for sure. The truffle pasta here is absolutely delightful, with a rich and flavorful sauce that perfectly complements the tender pasta. And their tiramisu? It's a masterpiececreamy, perfectly sweet, and truly a chef's kiss. It's usually a busy area, but you'll get your seat on time if you have reservations. Highly recommend! Very popular which made it quite noisy.  The utensils were cute.
Pizza was great.  Pte et ravioli were salty. The tiramisu was a bit too creamy with few ladyfinger part. The price is a bit high considering the portion of dishes.

Visited for lunch. The queue was not very long and it was flowing quite fast!
Service was relatively fast and friendly, but I wouldnt define it as high end.
We ordered the cordon blue that was delicious as well as the round croissant with eggs and salmon. Dessert absolutely FABULOUS! We had the Mount Blanc and I would recommend it to absolutely everyone! Staff were really friendly. Made us feel very welcome. Hot chocolate was divine, best of my life but would recommend sharing with a friend even if youre a chocolate lover as it is very rich. Great range of pastries and other food too. Beautiful venue. Angelina Paris is a quintessential Parisian experience. The moment you step inside, you're transported to a world of elegance and oldworld charm. The Mont Blanc, the star of the show, was absolutely divine. It perfectly balanced the sweetness of the chestnut cream with the light meringue. A true delight for any dessert lover.
The French toast was a pleasant surprise. While the exterior was golden and crispy, the center was a bit drier than expected. Nonetheless, it was still enjoyable. The hot chocolate was undeniably rich and decadent, with a velvety texture. However, it was incredibly sweet, almost to the point of being overwhelming. Be prepared for a sugar rush!
The ambiance of the tea room is undeniably charming, with its ornate decor and soft lighting. The service was competent, though not particularly exceptional. Overall, Angelina Paris is a mustvisit for those seeking a taste of Parisian luxury, but be prepared for a hefty price tag to match the experience. Arriving for a late breakfast, I found this place to be a gem that exceeded my expectations. It had been on my researched and saved list of places, and I wholeheartedly recommend it. The classic and beautiful decor set a charming ambiance. The service was topnotch  professional, welldressed, and the staff knew their roles impeccably. The food was outstanding, living up to its slightly higher price point with quality that matched. The breakfast menu was exceptional, offering a variety that left me thoroughly satisfied.

Additionally, they have a shop located in front where you can purchase pastries and other homemade products, adding to the overall experience and convenience of the visit. There was a small queue, but we were in in less than 15 minutes 1pm, Saturday, Sept 2024.

Excellent food for brunch and the highlight was the thick hot chocolate! We ordered Le Brunch screenshot attached to share between two.

리뷰:
Absolutely great experience
We had the pleasure of dining in this wonderful restaurant. It was a truly memorable experience. The food was exceptionally delicious, the wine pairing outstanding and the service impeccable.
And while not cheap the price is reasonable compared to other restaurants in Paris in the same class.
Thank you to Christopher, for the wonderful service  unfortanetly I didn't catch the name of your female colleague The food was amazing and the service exceptional! They were very accommodating of our dietary restrictions. Definitely one of the best dining experiences I have ever had! We came to France for our honeymoon and this was our first Michelinstarred dining, one of 9 around France during our trip. Out of sheer luck in timing, we caught LOrangerie when it was upgraded from a 1star to a 2star Michelin restaurant earlier in the year. Located inside the Four Seasons George V, the restaurant has just 6 tables inside with large windows facing the beautiful courtyard of the hotel and Le Cinq, the 3Michelin starred restaurant next door. The amount of money the hotel spends on flowers daily is astronomical but the opulence shows as is beautiful.

To start, this place is underrated. The Chef provides 3star quality food at 2star pricing. When we were done with our honeymoon, 7 of the 9 Michelin trips were to 3starred restaurants and we thought LOrangerie was better than half of these at twothirds the price.

The pescatarian menu is inventive, well balanced in preparation and flavors, and creatively displayed. Most importantly, it was downright delicious. The simplest things like bread were served with seaweed butter which was full of umami and incredibly addictive. The baby squid with fresh herbs, watercress, and matcha was perfectly soft combining just the right amount of umami flavors. I can say that it was the best tasting squid Ive ever had in my life so far. Then the next course of green asparagus with cloudy rice fermentation and blended mousseline was perfectly cooked. Normally, asparagus is prepared with heavier elements such as butter and cream but this sauce was light, acidic, and counterbalanced by crunchy veggies. I probably had asparagus at every Michelin dinner during our trip and this was easily top 2, possibly even my favorite. Every dish kept hitting with the spider crab, the milky morels, langoustine, sea bream, and blue lobster. Both my wife and I were blown away by the flavors.

This great momentum was slowed when the desserts came as the two courses lacked the flavors of the savory courses prior. Perhaps something with a bit more citrous and acid to lighten the palate and start the salivation as the Pompona vanilla vacherin with candied Carpentras strawberries lacked depth of flavor and finishing the dinner for something richer and sweeter than a Samana chocolate and sea grapes?

Beyond the food, the staff here were wonderful. They are friendly, genuine, inquisitive, and caring. When I was looking through the wine list and commenting at the amazing prices compared to the US, they even brought over the larger wine list from Le Cinq for me to browse while dining. The next night, we were back at the hotel to dine at Le Cinq and when I walked past some of the staff on my way to the bathroom, they remembered my face and asked how our dinner was going at Le Cinq. The server even remembered that I was wanting to try a Coche Dury Meursault and asked if I had gotten it at Le Cinq. They made us feel like friends who were checking in to see how we were doing even when we werent dining there.

This is an exceptional restaurant, especially for its price. If they continue this path and fine tune the dessert, 3stars may be coming their way in a few years. Were planning on coming to this restaurant every time were in Paris and to say hello again to the wonderful staff.

A bientot! I went there twice this week. Because the first experience was so good, I booked another one two days later. The food is excellent, the service is very nice. Each dish is the ingenuity of the chef, plus the careful interpretation of the waitress, and more importantly, the taste of each dish is great and unique! Michelin 
This restaurant is located in the beautiful Four seasons hotel. The entrance is breathtaking. The restaurant is very elegant. The food was amazing. Its a seafood tasting which was a first for me because I love meat but this restaurant did not disappoint. The way the chef put mixed and combined different types seafood with the different spices was  amazing. The flavors are soo unique. I loved the blue lobster dish. The desserts were amazing as well. Highly recommend. michelinstar tastingparis france lorangerie fourseasonsseychelles

Tried the korean bbq..meat was tender and juicy. Great combination with the vegetables and sauces. Entres are generous, better to be shared. Excellent meals!! It definitely reminded me of Korean food in Korea. We finish every single thing of the plate. We do offer great portion. We will definitely come back when we miss authentic Korean food. Highly recommended. The taste is amazing omg, just go and try it!!
We ordered the Korean flavor and the lamb, believe me they will surprise you.
But the pork we ordered only had two ribs  in the pics ...... a bit strange Visited on a Friday evening and ordered bbq. Experience was almost like dining in a restaurant in Korea! Lots of side dishes and they even served us complimentary dwaenjang guk Korean bean paste soup.

We also ordered cold noodles and it was very good.

Overall a good experience! Would come back again for sure when we crave kbbq.

Also they take Amex. My favourite Korean restaurant in Paris!
Highly recommend!!! Love all the side dishes as they really taste like authentic homemade grandma style ones. And the meat is always on point.

주소: 140 Rue du Faubourg Poissonnière, 75010 Paris, France
리뷰:
Food This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in Paris that weve been to. Their flank steak was perfectly rare and their garlic parsley butter complimented the steak so well. Their french fries were SO addicting and flavorful, and this is coming from someone who doesnt even like them in general  I honestly could not stop eating them! Also, their snails and beef tartare had amazing flavor and seasoning. Everything we ordered was perfectly seasoned and had amazing flavors! Definitely the French food experience we were looking for!

Service Our waiter was one of the kindest and most attentive waiters weve had! We definitely didnt experience any typicalrude French service that France is typically known for.

Ambiance Felt like a cozy diner experience with highquality food! It also seemed like a favorite for locals. Good food served in this traditional Parisian brasserie. Menu offers a variety of options at very good price. Staff is nice. Few seatings available outside. Booking can be made ahead. Suitable for groups. Great place, amazing value for money I thoroughly recommend the duck breast it was absolutely exquisite! For desert we had Parisbreast and cherry clafoutis and they were both very tasty although Parisbreast was a little bit too sweet.
All of that staff were very friendly and attentive, which completed the atmosphere.
We paid 61 for two main courses, two deserts and a large bottle of sparking water, which I think is amazing value for money for Paris. Steak needed some salt but was perfectly cooked medium and the fries were good but not sure how fresh they were. Our server was lovely and the wine was pay for what you drink which we enjoyed! Will go back again. Very nice French brasserie with very nice food and pastries. Can highly recommend this restaurant when in the neighborhood of Paris Nord train station. Excellent service also but my only gripe is that the tables are too close together. We had to squeeze in between other tables to sit down at our table. It would be a nicer affair if there was more room between tables. Anyway, the Paris Brest dessert was to die for, excellent! We all ordered it, all 4 of us.

리뷰:
Celebrated my birthday at this lovely authentic french restaurant!
Love the vibes, services and great food here!
It's a small yet cozy place, reservation would help you to secure good seats. We are lucky that we got two bar seats! Stumbled across this restaurant on our first night in Paris. The food, service and atmosphere were incredible. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris. We were lucky to get a table for four when arriving around dinner time, but this place is indeed small so would recommend a reservation ahead of time if possible. We ordered Escargots as an appetizer, and beef, stuffed duck breast Wednesday special, sea bass, and steak as entrees. The duck breast is a bit dry, but all other dishes had great flavor and tender texture as they should be. The crme brle at the end has appropriate level of creamy sweetness and crispiness. Highly recommend for a casual French cuisine experience. Very nice and cozy restaurant.
For starter we chose escargot and mussel which their tastes were unbelievable delicious and above our expectation.

Our main courses we chose duck breast which was mixed with sweet sauce and it was  delicious again. My friends ordered beef steak which was larger than their expectation , they were only rare, medium rare and medium. My friends told me that it is delicious and worth trying.

For dessert creme brullee was nice and not too sweet. Icecream nougat was also delicious, the tastes were mixed with sour from berry and sweet from milk icecream.

Will definitely visit again next time very good food and good service!
the confit de canard texture was nice, the crispy skin, tender meat, and juicy fats of the duck was perfect.

another dish i order is the marget de canard, the duck breast is medium rare which is just nice and the sauce was flavourful with some fruity taste

staff was very patient and helpful to explain in english

리뷰:
Our experience at dinner was excellent, in fact I even had lunch the same day to sample the lunch menu and both were extremely good with a stand out mention for the fresh herbs used in the salad an extraordinary combination that really delivered a new TWIST on traditional French cuisine. I discussed this with the chef and it was very excited to get the feedback as I think it is a signature part of his cuisine. Exceptional service also from his wife and the other brigade members.

We will definitely be back definitely worth a detour! Love their Vietnamese Salad and their steak, the Bordeaux wine they recommended was ok, will definitely want to try their different menus next time. We got so lucky finding this little gem.  Reservation is a must. The owners are obviously passionate about food and serving. My Scotish grouse with red wine sauce and grilled eggplants was probably the best meal of my 10day trip in France.  The wine list was also vast and very good. The place looks very inviting, being located on a small street in a touristy area.  The service is kind and not very formal.
The food was amazing, I really liked it.  Dishes weren't  "super creative" not like fine dining at all, but not quite ordinary either.  Interesting, original, with a twist, but simple and tasty  at the same time. Having finished both challenges all the Parisian stars under 365 days and all the 3 stars in France  follow me for all the reviews and updates Im now redoing most of them and testing some more Michelin.
I went to this one by chance, simply because I arrived way too late for the Michelin Star in front , and they were kind enough to accept me for a late lunch.
Whats interesting here?
I thought that I would appreciate more the meat the chef is a country guy who loves his game and it was the beginning of the season but surprisingly I loved his take on the sea. Especially with the usage of citrus not for acidity but for the fruit flavor. Its not very common and very pleasing.
The service is very nice, the staffing is normal for a standard Michelin. The nice touch is that the chef is active in the dining room, so you get to see and meet him.
The crowd was chilled. Family on holidays, friends and I guess people from the surrounding or working in the surrounding .
A solid Michelin

리뷰:
We thoroughly enjoyed our 4course dinner at JJ Beaumarchais. Seated at the patio window, we got to people watch and have our own little quiet cozy corner of the restaurant. My husband is not keen on seafood, yet he loved the meal, especially the cod! Everything was so delicious, cooked well with high quality fresh ingredients, and healthy. Nothing was overly salty nor greasy, and we left with happy tummies and wallet!. Definitely book a table here if you want to take a break from traditional French dishes. Extraordinary. The meal at JJ Beaumarchais was not only delicious but surprisingly healthy too. The choice of ingredients were dominated by vegetables and fish, and seasoning was used in moderation, so the meal was low in fat, salt, and cholesterol, yet achieved a level of satisfaction usually associated with heavier dishes. Service was friendly and efficient, and the environment was quite pleasant. Very reasonable prices too! All around excellent. We were looking for a special place to celebrate our time in Paris. JJ Beaumarchais caught our attention based on the comments of visitors and its rating on Google. We went to check it out and were intrigued by the fact that we would be served a menu chosen by the chef with 4 or 5 dishes specially prepared for each night. We added to the uncertainty and expectations of what would be served, observing the neighboring tables. The dishes that followed us on our unknown journey were compositions with fish, seafood and vegetables. An explosion of flavors with fresh ingredients, enhanced by the seasonings and sauces of the dishes. Highlights include the octopus with tempura, the flounder fish with roasted lettuce and a delicious dessert with cherry ice cream with a lemon mousse and a cupcake. Matching the spectacular dishes, the service staff is extremely attentive and thorough in their explanations, very friendly, offering excellent tips on pairing drinks with the dishes. Surrender yourself  to the atmosphere and flavors of JJB and make your time at the tables in Paris more special and unforgettable than ever. Now this is an experience. Elevated small plates focusing on seafood and vegetables. I could feel my palate expanding during this dinner.

One of our top culinary experiences in Paris, and thats saying something. Do yourself a favor and stop by JJ for a special night. This place is truly exceptional, I would give it more than 55 if possible. The quality and value of their food are unbeatable, with four courses costing 46, and five courses priced at 59. In addition, when we ordered a glass of wine, our waiter was generous with the pour.  We had missed our original lunch reservation due to a delayed flight, but we were delighted to have made it to dinner instead. The menu is a surprise blind menu, and changes daily based on the fresh ingredients available that day.  Each dish is distinct and flavorsome, but with all elements wellbalanced, such as the combination of asparagus, pistachio, and pumpkin seeds or beetroot, cherry, and tomato. My favorites were the langoustine bisque and grilled mackerel, but I can't wait to try their new menus in the future. Overall, a fantastic dining experience!

Worth the hype!! Food was delicious  vibes were incredible. A few notes

1. You NEED a reservation and it is incredibly hard to get one. It opens 2 weeks in advance and even though I checked the DAY OF, it was already booked up. We ended up using our hotel concierge to make the reservation, so if you have access to that kind of in definitely utilize it.

2. Would recommend going slightly earlier in the evening, before sunset, so you can enjoy the views as it transitions to evening time. We are at 930 so it was already very dark  still lovely but different experience

3. Our service was alright  waiter was not particularly helpful and a little bit short, but did an overall fine job.

4. Food  only complaint is that our pizza wasnt super hot when it came out. Flavor was AMAZING but I am very temp sensitive, so that was a little bit of a bummer. Recommendations are the truffle pizza, beef carpaccio, and the puff pastry dessert that you dip in chocolate

5. The wine I posted in the picture was delicious! Highly recommend  This was hands down the best restaurant experience that we had in all of Paris. Our waiter was incredible and kind. He had the best recommendations for food selections. The food was high quality and delicious. It was the best restaurant environment that we had encountered. 1010 we will be back every chance we get. I was a little worried that this would he a tourist trap given its location in the Louvre, but it ended up being one of the best dinners we had in Paris.

The vibes and the service were stellar. The food was delicious. We had the burrata salad, the pulpo, and the truffle
pasta, with sorbet for dessert. I get the sense that everything on the menu is amazing. Next time, Im definitely
getting the truffle pizza! While the food and ambiance at this restaurant were excellent, how we were welcomed into the restaurant was shockingly terrible. The two members of staff at the door are unfortunately unprofessional and clearly incompetent.  Their behavior completely ruined what could have been a pleasant experience. I expected much better. We had to wait to be seated, and the process was a bit disorganized. Our waiter seemed a little grumpy, which detracted from the experience. However, the food and drinks were 1010. Improving the service would make a big difference. Despite this, it's a beautiful place to have lunch on a spring or summer day.

If you are Asian, I strongly recommend avoiding this restaurant due to their discriminatory treatment. I made a reservation for 1000 PM last Sunday, excited to try French cuisine. We arrived at 930 PM but were completely ignored while other guests were seated. I thought it might be because we arrived early, so we waited until 1000 PM, yet still received no attention.

After waiting until 1020 PM, one of the servers finally approached but prioritized taking orders from two ladies behind us. I stood up to seek help, and she eventually noticed when I went straight to the reception. She seated my husband and me, along with the other two ladies, at a table in the middle, but the servers continued to ignore us while serving the tables beside us. When I inquired about this, they claimed they were too busy.

After I complained to the manager, they offered us a table, but who wants to eat there after being treated like that? Why were they too busy for us but not for others?

The service we received was unacceptable and felt distinctly discriminatory. It was clear they didnt care about us as Asian customers. If you want to enjoy your time in Paris, I suggest staying away from this restaurant to avoid a negative experience. Nice place for varieties of seafood. This, incredibly, huge restaurant has been around for decades. Chicken breast is soft and juicy. One dish may not be enough to fill one meal.  Order a plate of seafood to share before the main course. 3course meal is highly recommended. A very traditional French restaurant. Has been there forever. Good for oysters. However, I go there once a decade to have the escargots, the mussels and the profiteroles and they are simply wonderful!!! The art deco design of the dining room is undoubtedly the highlight of this restaurant. While the cuisine reflects the standard offerings typical of chain establishments, the dishes are still enjoyable. The service staff are polite and helpful, but due to the restaurant's large size and numerous tables, it can sometimes be challenging to get a waiter's attention. Historic brasserie in the heart of Paris, exceeded all expectations with its authentic atmosphere and classic French cuisine. We enjoyed a wonderful lunch that perfectly blended tradition with the charm of local Parisian life.

We started with the French onion soup, which was richly flavored and deeply satisfying, with just the right amount of melted cheese on top. The crab and mussels were fresh and expertly prepared, while the salmon was perfectly cooked, delivering a beautiful balance of flavor and texture. Every dish was a testament to the kitchen's mastery of classic French dishes.

What made the experience even more special was the vibrant atmosphere. The restaurant was filled with locals, giving us an authentic taste of Parisian dining culture. The art deco surroundings and bustling yet relaxed vibe added to the charm, making La Coupole a mustvisit for anyone seeking an iconic Parisian dining experience.

Well definitely return for another meal!

주소: Opéra Garnier, 1 Pl. Jacques Rouché, 75009 Paris, France
리뷰:
The pancakes were amazing! So good!
The other food was very good too, but I definitely recommend the pancakes  The lobster roll was a lot of roll and very little lobster, but still good. Although for that price we did expect more lobster.
The service was very nice as well, our waiter was very friendly and gave good advice. And because of the live music which we could hear everywhere on the terrace but wasnt too loud because they used boxes on the terrace the atmosphere was great too.
The prices were a bit on the high side but because of the quality it wasnt too bad.
Would definitely recommend! Fantastic dinner with great friends. Wonderful service. Very reasonable prices for the food and wine. Extensive wine selection. the only thing I didn't like was the portion of lamb chops. Very small and not enough to fill me up. I was excited to take my 9 year old to a "fancy" dinner here, but I left feeling disappointed.  She had a great time, so that is what matters the most.

1. I ordered a med rare steak, and it came out before our drinks. Well done.  Less than 3 minutes after I had ordered it.

2. They corrected the steak but didn't bring back my silverware.  I waited nearly 6 minutes, and the steak was then cold.

3. They said they were bringing bread, but it arrived just before dessert and after our food had been removed.

4. The entire dinner felt VERY rushed.  We booked a 6pm dinner so we could beat the rush and take our time. We were in and out in under an hour.

5. When the bill was dropped off, the waiter kindly told us that a tip was an appreciation of the service.

The good
The atmosphere was beautiful, my daughters chicken was delicious, and the amazing man singing live music was the best touch of all.

Don't take it off your list. Just be aware! This was, without a doubt, the worst meal we've had in Paris so far. Don't be deceived by the beautiful scenery and decorthe food quality falls far short of acceptable. I was utterly shocked by the 125 rack of lamb we were served. While some fat on lamb is expected, having threequarters of it be inedible is unacceptable, especially at this price point. When we raised our concerns with the waitress, we were dismissively told, 'lamb is fatty,' with no acknowledgement of the issue. Despite our disappointment, we paid the full amount, accepting our misfortune. The small portion of meat that was edible was severely underseasoned, though the accompanying salt, pepper, and side sauce somewhat salvaged it. It's unclear whether the problem was poor fat rendering or simple carelessness, but we were thoroughly disappointed. The only positives were the good wine and the friendly staff. The ambiance was pleasant, but it's certainly not worth the price for the lamb chops. Took my daughter here to celebrate her birthday , it turns out to be a disaster.

The waitress was pushy and you can tell they will always ask you to order the expensive wine.
Food serving is small. The seabass comes with rice and no other sides. They make you pay extra for the sides. we ordered 2 beef fillet. The waiter mixed up my mediumwell with my friend rare medium. Service and attentiveness simply wasnt there. Food is average and its really not worth the .

We had 4 adults squeezed to a small table. No space or basket offered to put my tote bag so I had put my bag on the floor. Ended up my bag was smeared with some butter on the floor.

The worst is yet to come. I was locked in the washroom. The lock was stuck and handle came off when I tried getting out!! Fortunately I got my phone with me and called my Daughter who came over to help. The French guy outside who spoke no English kept speaking. I was really frightened and sweating inside the stuffy toilet. Finally after a few struggle, I came out.
When I complained to the lady manager , she was unsympathetic and dismissed me.

Totally disappointing.

Le Gentil in Paris is a unique restaurant that beautifully blends French and Japanese cuisines, offering a creative and memorable dining experience. The dishes are not only delicious but also presented with artistic flair, sometimes incorporating 3D art, making each plate a visual delight as well as a treat for the palate. The pricing is very reasonable considering the high quality and craftsmanship of the food.

The restaurant attracts a diverse crowd of Japanese, international, and French customers, which speaks to its broad appeal and excellent reputation. However, due to its popularity, its always busy, so reservations are essential to ensure you get a table. Such an amazing small, family owned restaurant featuring a fusion of French and Japanese flavors. Each dish is perfectly executed and the owners couldnt be more welcoming.

While you cant go wrong with your order, the shrimp appetizer and basque cheesecake dessert are absolutely divine! Cant wait to come back next time Im in Paris. Such a cosy little restaurant with a great menu, atmosphere and service!

We had a wonderful time dining here! Small restaurant serving a small menu with a Japaneseinspired dish in each course. Service is swift and friendly. The ambience is lovely and they seem to attract locals as well as visitors.

Everything was done with care and attention, and the taste is overall good. Although I feel there are too many types of sauces and ingredients on each dish so not everything is in perfect harmony. Personally I prefer simpler dishes with a focus on the main ingredient. Hidden gem in the 7th district.
Our experience was excellent!
The restaurant is neat, simple and elegant.
The service was great!
We had as starters 
 crab croquettes so good! fresh ingredients and well fried
 pork trotter I was doubtful at first but it was so good !
For the dishes, we tested 
 cod fish with black rice and veggies AWESOME!!
 canette with panisse a sort of fried chickpea it was perfect
We were really full but didnt regret ending our dinner with a cheesecake! So airy and perfectly done !
Do not miss it !!

리뷰:
My family asked me to go, so I went without expectation, and as soon as I went in, I saw a turtle in the fishbowl It was amazing, so I stared at it all day and looked around, and there was something like a printing press I picked a picture of someone I liked, and I was so happy that I went wild There was a huge fishbowl inside, and it was so cool to see several stingrays and sharks passing by After looking around the aquarium, I ordered a drink and mango smoothie. It was really cool and delicious The owner gave me cookies as a service, and I saw the perfume there, and it smelled really good. The atmosphere of the shop was bright and simple My parents were satisfied, too It was really good A very creative cafe, Beautiful surrounding good A beautiful aquarium cafe with a tropical sea concept located in Gapyeong. Not only does it have a great view because it is on a high floor, but it also has the sea indoors with sharks and stingrays swimming around. The shark is a gentle black tip reef shark, but do not put your hands in the tank as safety accidents may occur. Occasionally, stingrays will hit the surface and make fun of you. In addition, the butterfly koi and cichlid tanks were beautifully decorated. If you pass by Gapyeong near Seoul on the weekend, it might be a good idea to stop by. It's not cheap, but it's good to go with kids, parents, and boyfriend.

This is Ade restaurant.
Personally, the table next to the swing chair is my favorite spot.
Fish come often!

리뷰:
Honestly, this place is way overrated from all the social media buzz.
You can get better and freshoutofthe oven croissants elsewhere. Croissants were quite hard. We ordered the eggs as well, and they were way under done!
Coffee was mediocre.

The only buzz here is the famous hot chocolate and cream. Did it live up to our expectations? Probably not...was too sweet for my liking.

We decided to visit this cafe due to all the buzz it has gotten recently from a certain Netflix drama..
But was the food worth it? No. You can get better and cheaper breakfast elsewhere.
Only positive was the waiter we got quite a rarity to find a polite and friendly waiter in Paris! We heard this was the best cafe in Paris.  Well it definitely was the best cafe on our trip.  The hot chocolate was phenomenal, the best Ive ever had.  The quiche and the rest of the food were also great.  The staff provided world class service.   A lot of influencing happening all around us, entertaining to see it in action. The best cafe on Saint Germain des Pres in my opinion. Stylish and traditional cup, cutlery, location and service. All of it adds to the experience and you get a good breakfast in a location where you say Im in Paris. The croissants are classic, good bread and eggs are cooked well. The hot chocolate with cream seems to be the specialty here and its one of the best I had. This is a must for me whenever I go to Paris as I went here twice in three days. Theres a lot of people taking pictures around you of the cafe, themselves so be ready to be filmed  Went for breakfast around 11ish. Few items were already finished.
The food overall tastes above average but the prices are just ridiculous.

The coffee tastes really bad and that too in such a small cup priced at 9 euros.

We were visiting Paris for few days so we tried few more cafe's nearby, and they have better quality with significantly cheaper prices. Great hot chocolate with whipped cream, that is for sure. Amazing ambiance. Is the food and drinks worth the price? No. You can definitely find a cheaper menu across Paris that has equally great dishes. If you really want to go, I say eat a pastry beforehand and go only for drinks. The hot chocolate is velvety and the whipped cream honestly tastes like it was milked right before it got to our table it was tooooo good.

Caf Kitsun Palais Royal is a lovely spot with a prime location. While the coffee is certainly above average for Paris, it doesn't quite reach the heights of worldclass brews. It's a nice spot to relax and peoplewatch. The best part is its location in a beautiful park, which makes it a perfect place to unwind. Drinks were very average, literally something you can make at home yourself haha. Seating place in the garden was very limited as well and dont bet your chances on getting an empty one during the weekend. The park benches make for quite good alternatives.

But I must say I really like the logo on the cup. The only good thing really  This Cafe Kitsune was perfect. The Coffee was amazing and they really have a universal flavor profile. No matter where you go the flavor is consistent Gotta love that. This location is perfect because after you get your coffee the park is right there where you sit and enjoy the view or find a quiet corner to read. Visited a few of the Kitsun cafes in Paris, the coffee is so smooth and not overly roasted, I am a big fan. Looking at the previous photos of the location it appears the space has been scaled back to consist of an order and take away shop with only outdoor seating facing the park. Note Google Maps may lead you to the street entrance which is no longer open so you must walk around to the other side of the building to find the shop and enter. Recommended if in the area. One of the best locations a cafe can have! In center of palace royal with a great view of the garden. Staff were extra nice and the flat white was delicious.

리뷰:
We recently visited this coffee roastery and shop that offers a selection of African and American coffees, with a special focus on Guatemalan beans. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable, which made the experience enjoyable. They offer more than a dozen types of singleorigin beans, but only two were available for tasting, which felt limiting. Prices range 4.4010.00 for 100g .
We purchased four different kinds of beans to try both as espresso and drip coffee, but unfortunately, none met our expectations. The coffees either lacked complexity or were overly acidic, leaving us disappointed with the overall taste. While the variety and expertise are impressive, the actual flavors fell short for us. Amazing place to spend time. Coffee is great and they have small bites to eat. There is some comfy seating near the front and then as you move deeper into the Cafe there are lots more seats. Service is great, in both English and French. There is a piano as well, which was great to see someone playing.
It's an awesome place to read and study. A NatureLovers Haven with Freshly Roasted Coffee
My friend recently discovered a hidden gema naturefriendly cafe that offers an unforgettable coffee experience. The atmosphere is incredibly serene, with greenery all around and a cozy, ecofriendly vibe that instantly puts you at ease.
The freshness and depth of flavor in the coffee were unmatchedeach cup was rich, aromatic, and full of character. You can really taste the care and craftsmanship that goes into every brew.
Sitting back and enjoying a freshly roasted cup of coffee in such a beautiful, natureinspired setting was an absolute treat. If youre a coffee lover who appreciates a sustainable, naturefriendly environment, this cafe is a mustvisit. Ill definitely be back for more! Great place for coffee, every day you can try the variety of the day for coffee. Best coffee  Cappuccino so far in Paris. Highly recommend, great service and very friendly staff, multilingual as we don't really speak French but the staff speaks English and even Spanish, not sure what other languages are available but won't have issues at all if French is not your forte.
Great prices. Will be able to have. Abite, there is soup of the day and on our visit luckily got empanada served with salad empanada is like a Paty pastry filled in this case with either chicken or veggies. Offers also alternative milk, oats milk. We visited multiple times in or short visit to Paris. Superb coffee. One of the best. I could have stayed here all day. Sitting outside with a view of the Notre Dame. If you love coffee, drop by!

Great vibe in the shop too! Highly recommend if youre looking for a brunch place in Paris  Modern and popular cafe. It can get very busy on weekends. Good coffee, good music. Expect to pay a one euro premium compared to other local cafes. No laptops. Love that. We come here very regularly and it is always busy. Queue is fasting moving and staff are friendly. Coffee is probably one of the best in Paris with 2 different blends to choose from. Cakes are also delicious. Coffee was excellent, best coffee we had in Paris. 리뷰: Wonderful place for coffee and desserts. The coffee was perfect, and we tried the Yakgwa and matcha tiramisu I love tiramisu and this was a really good combination, recommend going to this place after walking down or up to Montmartre. The staff were incredibly kind and friendly, will definitely go back when Im in Paris again   Incredible service and attention to detail. Such cute interior and zen atmosphere. Everything is delicious, the drinks and the sweet treats are amazing! One of the best Korean cafes in Paris! If you want your coffee in peace, this is your place. The Japanese design and peaceful environment allowed me to sip and think about my day before I ran outside. The coffee was strong but didn't taste strong and still was delicious. If you like syrups in your coffee they had a few flavors. A cozy refuge for incredible coffee in the 9th. It feels like the proprietor has invited you into her living room to enjoy a pace change, a nice conversation, and the kind of warmth you only get from good food made with love. The coffee is exquisitely roasted, light to medium, which makes Jijis work on the espresso machine really stand out. The espresso work is solidly third wave but the ease and softness of the space connotes a simpler, more casual time in high end coffee shops. This is really a special place, stop by early to avoid crowds. came here w friends today the lady at reception was so nice and its prolly the best cafe ive been at since living here no joke so glad we found this spot everything is delicious you cant go wrong !! she even slipped us a pistachio cookie it was very delicious you could really taste it and i was left feeling fuzzy and warm all day j thinking of this visit,, will definitely come again

This might be Londons best marinated raw crab!! Ma Eum in Pimlico serves up authentic Korean dishes. We started off with the makgeolli alcoholic beverage served in a teapot. The beef tataki was tender and delicious. Trying the soy marinated raw crab for the first time was an amazing experienceI absolutely loved it and highly recommend it. The Korean fried chicken in a sweet and spicy sauce was a definite winner, as always. We paired our dishes with flavourful kimchi fried rice and an incredible beef bulgogi bibimbap. Overall, Ma Eum is one of the best Korean restaurants Ive visited in London! This is a cute Korean cafe owned by the sweetest people in Paris. Ive gone frequently for the BTS events that they organize and you can tell how much effort that they put into these events. I always have a really fun time and feel very welcome. If you ever have the opportunity to go for one of the BTS events, you should definitely go. Make sure to reserve your spots fast on their website though, because they sell quick!

Even if you are not a fan of BTS, this cafe is not to be missed. The owners are so sweet and kind. You can really tell that they enjoy what theyre doing and they put in so much hard work and effort to create such a genuine and great experience every time that you go there. The food and drinks are as delicious as they are beautiful and the cafe is decorated with care and style.

I started learning Korean by myself 4 years ago, but Ive never had the confidence or opportunity to speak it with other people until I came here. The owners really make going to this cafe so special. If you are learning Korean you can practice with them and feel encouraged to continue studying. Ive always felt so welcome here as the owners remember you every time you come back. You can really tell how much they care about the people that come to their cafe. This cafe is truly a hidden gem and I would recommend visiting if you have the chance. Cannot recommend this caf enough! The decor and ambiance set up such a comfortable and comforting mood which was perfect to unwind and take a break from the city pace. Anyone can instantly notice the attention to detail from the owners to give customers the best experience. They also sell beautiful clothes, items and accessories, wonderfully curated! I purchased the prettiest glass which I use every single day now.

Also, if you're indecisive on the menu like me, trust the owners' recommendations! I was recommended the Korean plum tea  and I loved it! I got to taste the hodugwaja  pastries as well, so delicious!

Finally, the owners are truly so kind and lovely, they made me feel so welcomed and even took time to chat with me, which really shows how much they value their customers. Thank you so much!

What more can I say? I truly had the best healing time and if I lived in Paris I'd definitely be a regular. Can't wait to go back! A very enjoyable shop visit
First of all, maeum must be a mustvisit for every kpop fans! It's a bit of a shame that they don't take reservations, but it was acceptable and I only had to wait for about 20 minutes. It's not a big shop, it's even a bit small hahahahahaha. But the dcor is pretty pink and pink!
The price of the menu is acceptable, a little expensive, and there's not a lot to choose from, which is a pity. If you order a smoothie and a drink, it will cost over 10 euros per person.
The attitude is really super nice! We ordered a smoothie and ate it very slowly, then she came to care if it was not to our liking, nor if it was not tasty or something. But it was actually a bit cold because it was too cold hahahahaha, so she brought us a cup of hot water!!! Let us warm up! omg she was sososo sweeeeet.
The shop manager is purely Korean Before leaving, he will chat with you, giving you stickers and candies as little gift, and teach you a few words of Korean, which is really cute. He also gave us little BLACKPINK stickers because he knew we were here to travel.
All in all, it was a really good experience. If you like kpop and have enough time, you should definitely come there! I discovered MAEUM on Instagram several months ago and have been following along with their posts and stories ever since, hoping to get a chance to visit one day. I finally was able to visit and was not disappointed!

The shop is super cute. The decorations were beautiful and the atmosphere is cozy and relaxing. I had a blueberry bingsu, which was the most BEAUTIFUL dessert Ive ever had! It was also delicious 

The owners were truly some of the nicest people Ive met at a business in Paris! They were so kind, from offering me extra condensed milk for my bingsu to taking time to ask questions about me. I also got to practice a bit of my very, very limited Korean.  It seems like they truly see their customers as human beings, and not just as a means of income, and you can feel the difference. I will definitely be coming back here one day to have another  !

It mixes history and quality in a great way.
The part they could definitely improve is the kindness of the staff. No smile nor hello when you arrive. A bit touristy unfortunately but definitely a place to try. A must stop for coffee and tea lovers. It is so incredibly difficult to find rich velvety Cappuccino or Flat White in France but this place will not disappoint. The decor is absolutely beautiful. Old World Charm in its best edition. Will be back! The cafe has a nice atmosphere and vibe. But it is a bit pricey for the quality it offers. The Madeleines with chocolate sauce were not as good as I am used to from other places in the city. The double espresso was ok but again I had better.

All in all a good choice to flee from the rain before going to the Louvre, but don't expect the best food you ever had. The place is so whimsical. They have coffee beans in drawers and the traditional burlap sacks.

I ordered the cafe viennois and it was delectable. It was mostly whipped cream which is what I was feeling that day. It came with the usual tiny chocolate square.

I was only going to get a drink but oddly next to my seat, there was a platter of desserts inside a glass case. At first, I thought they were only for display and not fresh, but the server assured me it was all real. Since they all looked enticing, my friend and I decided to share one. We pointed to the one we wanted most on the count of 3, and thank god, it was the same tart. Suffice to say, we had good taste I especially loved the crunch of the pistachios. I visited a cozy cafe during my last holiday in Paris and absolutely loved its tranquil ambiance, classic decor, and delicious dessert and coffee. The cakes and ice cream were so mouthwatering and refreshing, especially after a tiring walking tour of the area. I highly recommend this cafe to anyone who wants to enjoy a peaceful and tasty break in Paris.

리뷰:
If you're finding a place to eat and you happen to be on Yelp doing it, some of the stars are a bit misleading due to sympathetic ratings. Like this one. It's a 4 cause the people are nice inside and the food wasn't gross.

But really, it's just a simple cafe with a simple menu selection. Something like the crazy croissant makes you think it's gonna be... crazy. It's really like your average croissant with eggs and a slice of turkey inside.

Food is very basic, the place is small but it turns over quickly. If you're a tourist, go experience a meal at a classic bistro instead. Great food. Small space but with excellent ventilation system. We couldn't smell the eggs cooking eventhough it is an open space and you can see the kitchen. The waiters are super friendly.
The only thing that I was uncomfortable with is the long line. People wait outside while you eat and they can watch you through the window. It felt a bit awkward. Great cafe! Pancakes were good, latte was well balanced, avocado toast was fresh. Great service, layout is done well for the small space, would love customs on the chair lol Delicious vegetarian options! It's a pretty small restaurant so if you want to skip the line, go right as they open up. I got a crazy stuffed croissant sandwich and the salad it came with was just bursting with flavour. The drinks were yummy and service was very fast. Definitely a recommended breakfastbrunch place in Paris if you're looking to be satiated until the afternoon. Glad we made it for breakfast today.

Amazingly fresh food and friendly environment.  Cant wait to come back.

We had pancakes, gluten free toast with eggs and mushroom with pesto.

Additionally a basket of fresh breads with jam.

Fresh orange juices and coffee. Recommend!

주소: 6 Pl. Saint-Germain des Prés, 75006 Paris, France
리뷰:
What an amazing cafe! I booked a table in advance, and yet I was given the choice to pick the room and my own seat, which I did appreciate very much. I could sit back and relax while taking in all the Parisian people and life. Lunch was exquisite, from beginning to end! Since I was in Paris for a very short visit, I had to overindulge  their old fashioned hot chocolate and pastries are a delight to the palate. Service is fantastic and ambience makes you feel right at home. Will definitely be back. Just had the most divine breakfast here. The wait staff are on another level. So fantastic  They are extremely busy but still so polite and attentive. Food was very tasty. We had the Hemingway and chose the omelette which was delicious. Hot coffee   Highly recommend this amazing experience   We came here for brunch and had a lovely time. Our table was right at the front, allowing us to enjoy a delicious brunch while watching the street and people.  It was a wonderful atmosphere. Our server was very friendly and attentive, which made the experience even better. We really enjoyed the taste of the coffee as well. Even though the interior of the restaurant is small, it's definitely worth a look inside. My husband and young son and I had breakfast at this gorgeous Parisian establishment during our stay in winter. The hot chocolate was absolutely divine, as was the coffee, juice and all breakfast items we ordered. The breakfast we ordered was plentiful and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience there  a bucket list item of mine for a long time! Being winter the cafe wasnt packed which we loved, as we could immerse ourselves in the atmosphere of the cafe. Id definitely come back on our next trip to Paris! Very nice food, excellent service.
Our waiter was helpful, patient, friendly and funny which added a lot to the experience. I'm very happy he helped us and not the scowling person that was waiting on other guests by throwing menu's on their tables and endlessly clinging glass while cleaning tables.
Went on a warm Saturday evening at 2000 and got a nice table outside in minutes, not as busy as I expected.

리뷰: Great coffee and cakes selection. I had a latte with lemon cake which was fantastic. The service was great and very helpful. They also sold decaffeinated coffee. They have a vast selection of beans for sale. Ethiopian, Kenyan, Rwandan, and South American. The coffee is OK, but nothing special. 2,9 for an expresso is the double as compared with Italy. But you are near Eiffel  Tower. Can be quite crowded. Did not taste the cookies. Toilets are clean. Always very polite and very kind staff Their coffee is exceptional in this district!  Great local coffee shop near the Eiffel Tower. Set in a very upscale neighbourhood, this cafe provides a great cup of cortado or flat white Really great coffee, they use their own roasted beans. Also close to the eiffel tower if you want to take a walk and enjoy the fresh air. The cafe itself is also very cozy

A tiny little cafe with great vibe  industrialminimalist. The banana cake is heavenly good, so is the tea and cookies and avo toast. Impossible to get a space on weekends. Lots of other Japanese theme shops nearby. The cherry scones are so good. The hot chocolate with oatmilk is so smooth. Incredible coffee with attention to detail, definitely the best Ive had in France. Friendly staff who go out of their way to make your experience comfortable and its located in a cute Rue. Ill be back for sure, especially as its vegan friendly and environmentally friendly. Nice little coffee shop. Although, it can only seat a handful of people, the atmosphere is very nice and cozy. As a student, it would probably hard to fully study there but some light work is possible.
The coffee is really tasty and its possible to eat a little something. I really enjoyed it ! Cozy and very very good homemade granola with soy yogurt and rhubarb compote! Loved this place
I come every time Im in Paris. The cafe creme and avocado toast are amazing! And the banana bread is the best in town. They also have a cookie thats very unique and tasty!!

리뷰:
We had cappuccino and lemon cake  both good!

Small, lovely place and relaxed atmosphere. Would come again. This place is always going to be in my lovely memory as this is where I met my aunt for the first time and than she discovered matcha   I was only going through Paris on my road trip and stopped only for coffee and dog walk with my aunt. Also I got some lovely coffee beans to take home. Barista was super kind and coffee met all expectations. Great coffee, oat milk alternative, very relax. Enjoyed our visit today, it is a bit out of the sightseeing area. Super service with Eka and nice coffee! We did have a nice moment in this little cafe. One of the best specialty coffeeshops in Paris! Amazing coffee! And look at this latte art its made with oat milk!

Exceptional coffee.
I ordered an espresso of the Ethiopian origin. It was flavourful, quite fruity.
The cardamom bun was also amazing. Soft, moist and absolutely scrumptious l.
Great service. Very small place great quality coffee and pastries. The babka roll was a bit dry by the cardamum roll was perfection. Really nice little coffee shop, not too busy, seems a hidden gem I think. Nice outside seating as well as some indoor seating. Thought it was independent but it was a small chain I think. Had an oat milk flat white, my go to back in the UK. Not the cheapest coffee at nearly 7, but really nice coffee beans used and overall one of the best oat milk flat whites Ive ever had. Highly recommended for any UK tourist if your into your oat flat whites. i was here with my parents, their coffee brews are pretty good! i had their cardamom roll , which was heated up slightly, it wasnt the freshest but still had a good cardamom flavour but it could definitely have more and be more spread evenly through the bun Very small, cozy place wirh delicious foods and drinks! I had a chaud Matcha Latte, it was perfectly slightly sweet and a banana bread fluffy, juicy and very tasty 1010! Would recommend

리뷰: One of the best cafes in the area. Wonderful atmosphere and amazing coffees. There are bakery options, but it's not a show. Just good! Limited seating available inside. Definitely a grab and go type of coffee shop, not to chill and stay inside. Had the pistachio latte and it was SUPER!! Place was a vibe but prices were pretty high for coffee We had coffee here for all 3 days in Paris. We tried the pistachio, salted caramel, and honeycinnamon latte. Their coffee is so smooth and the flavors blend perfectly. Its not sweet, but lightly flavored so you still have a great coffee flavor. They have the order counter and some bar stools in the inside and a few small benches outside to sit. The staff is also really kind and drinks are ready pretty fast even with a long line. Great coffee and chai latte, we are really surprised how good everything tasted. Despite the queue, we were served really quickly. We will recommend the caf to others. I tried a flat white with oat milk. The taste is amazing. The store looks cozy. I like the design of the store. There are some seats indoor with table and also the outdoor place right without table.

리뷰:
The Eggs Benedict is outstanding  I highly recommend trying it! The cappuccino and cortado are also fantastic. It's a small place, but the staff is very friendly, making it a truly exceptional spot in Paris. I absolutely love it  Arriving with high expectations for brunch, we were delighted by the exceptional quality of the food. I highly recommend savoring the Parisian toast and the pain perdu they truly stand out.
Aptly named, this establishment is undoubtedly a pearl nestled in the heart of Paris. A bit overhyped, arrived during breakfast time on a Saturday, a line quickly built up. They were pretty busy so they tended to try to make people leave right after people finished their food, so everything could feel pretty rushed. Food menu is interesting, pretty average though but not cheap. I would try if you are around the area, but won't necessarily line up a long time for it. Great spot for breakfast and coffee or tea. They have a lot of matcha and Asian flavors infused into breakfast fare. The flavor combos are unusual but delightful.

Timing is everything because its a small space. Your experience will vary a little bit depending on where youre seated, hope not to be seated near the kitchen entry, you will likely be bumped and jostled but the food is worth it. Great coffee, although we had to wait a while now I understand the long wait was due to the amount of coffees to go they have to prepare for their second location, read below

P.S I unfortunately need to change my opinion, based on the service at the other location 4 rue Perronet not indicated on the google maps. The drinks are prepared here and then delivered there, causing them to be served barely lukewarm. The two tables next to ours complained about the same thing. My paper cup tea was served more than half empty, which i think is scandalous considering this is just warm water. The waiter filled it up after request though, but reacted very passive agressively after i brought my half empty cup to the counter. Finally, the same waiter kicked us out later saying they are closing when it was 1530. The cafe closes at 6pm according to google maps, and since we saw other people coming in, this just feels like a good excuse to make us leave. The overall experience is bad, and is a shame since I hoped to enjoy it the second time I came here. This will be the last though

리뷰:
Delicious food for an affordable price in this area. The service was wonderful, as the staff friendly and fun. We dont speak French but they spoke Spanish! Our daughters crepes came with a Colombian flag and a nice message, such cute touches to complement our lunch. Our server also gave our daughter a desert as a gift and she loved it. We all Kraft with our tummies happy and a big smile  Delicious food, good value. Very attentive staff. My crepe even came with a NZ flag after they asked where we were from. We sat outside so it was great for people watching and resting our feet. Definitely recommend. Happy cafe in more ones than one. Great service warmth, care and engagement. Not at all pretentious.
Yummy crepes savoury and sweet plus the cheese cake.
Super location too without the tourist prices.
Highly recommend. It might feel like a tourist trap at first, but the food is delicious! And the service was amazing. Very friendly, would definitly recommend if you are looking to grab a quick snackrest. Honestly, the food here seems a little overrated to me. I don't want to say it was bad, but I simply expected something more. This was just a plain crepe with cheese and tomato. Anyone can make one of these at home for a fraction of the price, even if they have no cooking skills. It doesn't add to the pleasant feeling that the seating areas are very cramped and the staff probably didn't think too much of us, because the food was also served to guests who arrived long after us and before us. I have to admit that the guys who run the business are huge sympathizers, but unfortunately that doesn't make a good business.

The cafe is cute and small, with not much seating. The cookies are so delicious! I had the matcha cookie and I will definitely get more of them when I get the chance. The cutes little cookie and coffeematcha shop in Paris! Went to this place because of its great google reviews and it did not disappoint. From the cookies to the design to the staff treating us  everything was 1010. Matcha cookies were the best we have ever had, not too sweet, the perfect consistency and prices were reasonable. The staff treating us was extremely nice and even shared some secrets on how they make their cookies. It was just an overall great experience.
The place is quite small and has only two seats inside and two seats outside, however, if you want to sit down and these would be taken, a very cute park is close nearby. And if you are a matcha fan, their sister store Matcha Social Club is just around the corner and offers great matcha but also the cutest matcha merch!

The biggest recommendation for dear Jane! Dear Jane is a quaint little coffee shop here in Paris. The coffee is amazing and the cookies are scrumptious. My favorite cookie is the Matcha. I frequent this place and Im always welcomed by warm and friendly ownersstaff. The only drawback is that the place is so small that it only truly seats 2 people at a time. Therefore, this is more of a takeaway place. Cant recommend this place enough! By the way, these cookies are better than Levain in NYCIYKYK  We bought milk chocolate and matcha white chocolate. The milk chocolate is a bit too sweet but I love their matcha white chocolate cookies. I recommend ! The price is also reasonable compared to other viralhyped cookie places in Paris. Best Cookies in Town! We tried the Pecan Nut Cookie and the Salt Choco Cookie. They were perfect! Huge Chocolate Chunks inside and perfectly soft! 1010 would eat them again I forgot to take pictures because I ate it too fast

This humble and charming cafe hidden in Paris lesser tourist areas is absolutely worth a stop. With terrific espresso, this is a perfect place for a mid day cappuccino with friends or to show up early with a book. As a side note, theres a great collection of academic coffee books for the someday cafe owners to browse.  lovely, sunny spot for a pause among the Parisian streets. Impeccable coffee and little cakes! Tranquil and easy atmosphere for reading or conversing with a friend, would definitely recommend for a coffee date! Just had one of the best Flat Whites ever. Perfect temp and taste. Ill surely revisit this coffee shop!

Came back the following morning to confirm my previous opinion. Nothing changed. It hits right where it should. Love the professionalism and respect for the coffeemaking process. Hexagone Cafe is an artisan coffee shop that ticks all the boxes. They even have a hand me down hifi amplifier, pumping out cool vibes. Opens at 8.30am. It has great coffee. The owner makes it carefully. The place has a constant stream of customers. The place has a good vibe.

i love this place! super cute interior and friendly staff and the food was amazing. it reminded me of my time in korea, very authentic. the sesame latte was not sweet enough for my personal taste but i like my coffee extremely sweet unlike most people. i highly recommend but you should come early because there arent many seats. you can take away too though. I stumbled upon this gem of a coffee shop and discovered the best matcha I've ever tasted! Even as someone who wasn't a matcha fan, this place has completely won me over. The food is consistently healthy and fresh, and the staff's friendliness and welcoming atmosphere make it a joy to visit. I could see myself being a daily regular here. Highly recommended! nice, cozy coffee shop in the 15th. the black sesame cake was a bit too dry for me though  but still tasty. I want to come back to try the scones and the lunch boxes though!! The atmosphere was so good! Tried signature latte and the coffee was tasty. Ordered scone its a bit dry and a bit hard to eat maybe cuz the tableware is not fit for scone
Would come back and try more cake True hidden gemstone of Paris caf. Very small and cosy place, but there is sth very special about this place. The owner is incredibly kind, polite, and gentle. When you enters in it, you even feel the air is softer. Full of positive vibes and refined drinks and desserts selections. You MUST MUST try their black sesame latte with sponge cakes. The best part is again the kind and gentle owner and staffs !! Better than a yoga class to get a peace vibe.

A busy but nice cafe. Plenty of seating and the staff are great and bring your order quickly. The coffee is pretty good, a little bitter but great milk work. The Cortado was 7.8 bit too thick milk and the flat white was a better 8.0. If you are a coffee lover this is your place. Super nice atmosphere. In a cute little square. I had the batch brew it was from Colombia. Really tasty. They also have good food. Really nice coffeeshop in the middle of Pigalle. The terrace is well exposed to the sun, great for summer and sunny days! The service is fast and efficient, plenty of seats and laptops are accepted. I really enjoyed my time there! Their chai latte and hibiscus tea are really tasty.
Definitely will try their other cooffeeshop Back in Black. This place felt like a real spot to hang out. Very busy, people seat hoping to get the best position for people watching. Oat flat white  was smooth Oatly and quite well pulled although not perfect, but I'm being nitpicky.  I would definitely go again. Only one toilet though. Best coffee shop in Paris!!

They actually really care about the blend, the roast, every beans blend is different for almost all the drinks espressomilkice I usually only find these type of dedication to coffee in London or Copenhagen in Europe, so that is amazing!

The pastries are really nice too! Fresh French pastries  The bun is really nice!

You should definitely check it out, the staff is so nice and helpful and if you dont speak a good French, they all speak English which is so nice!

Thanks a lot!!

주소: 14 Rue de la Huchette, 75005 Paris, France
리뷰:
Super fun night in Paris at this nice little bar.  Good piano and singer.  Drinks were very reasonable, 10 Euros for a nice red and no entry fee.  I paid 42 for 2 mixed drinks and 2 very good glasses of wine.  Don't forget to tip the lovely servers.  Great service from the lovely ladies serving me and my friends.  I will go back again in a few days for my last night in Paris.  You really get the feeling of being in Paris singing along with people you don't know.  Everyone was having a great time. If you're looking for a few drinks with good live music, close to Notre Dame, this is your place. Fantastic attention from the staff, nice wine and good location. Totally recommendable What a fantastic venue. I thought everywhere in this part of town would be a tourist trap. But... Excellent drinks, wonderful music and a great vibe. I chilled out after a day on my feet with some good wine and excellent service.
I do have to especially call it the amazing Zaira... I wish all bars had a worker like her. She watched the floor like a hawk, making sure everyone drinks were filled and everyone was happy. If I EVER opened a bar in Paris I would want her working there.
Make sure you drop by for some great music and even better service. Prices are fantastic too. was wandering the streets of Paris when it started to rain on us when we stumbled upon this hidden gem! the live pianist was amazing, playing a range of different songs and the drinks were fantastic! we will definitely be back  Hidden gem!

This place was such a hit and I will be returning for more live music. The inside looks dark and moody and fits the vibes of the music. Drinks are a good price, however the only food I saw was a meat and cheese board so thats something to consider.

I highly recommend checking this place out even if its just for an hour.

주소: 36 Rue des Blancs Manteaux, 75004 Paris, France
리뷰:
The American customer is always right BS is just that, BS.

I walked in asking for an Americano with a side of milk and he said non.  The milk would spoil the flavour and if I wanted milk he suggested a cappuccino.

He was right.

Sometimes it is nice to surrender to the experts!   And that they are in here!

Great atmosphere, with hanging chairs and bright yellow seats and soft French music!

 You walk in and can tell they mean business with their coffee! Quality is great  my macchiato was nutty with hints of chocolate. The staff are very friendly, but the interior although a decent size seemed cramped. Hanging chairs, bar seats and small tables  theres a variety of seating. Worth the visit. Great cafe for a midafternoon break from exploring Paris, with one of the most delicious espressos in the city. Highly recommend the relaxed vibe and chairs suspended from the ceiling, if thats your thing! Excellent coffee. freshly roasted beans. the grand cru in particular was terrific. Pretty small selection of foodbites. The interior feels a lil crammed but nice vibes nonetheless. friendly staff! Okay atmosphere.
Service depends on the person.
Tight spacing. Coffee is very expensive.
Menu is fixed with a we cant change anything attitude. Not even adding a drop of milk in the coffee  come on
Overall, the experience was better at the original small Terre de Caf on rue Rambuteau, which was still expensive back then.
But now, it is a 5 charge for a double expresso and mediocre overall experience.
I wont be preferring this place again, cest dommage.

edit 1 general star for the corpspeak reply.

An iconic spot. We stopped in for a mid afternoon treat. Took an about an hour to get a seat inside but it was worth it. The service was prompt but not the friendliest. We shared a pastry and had some beverages. Definitely worth a visit if youre in the area. Absolutely wonderful! I enjoyed every second, one of the best meals I have had. Such a beautiful building, every where you look. The staff were very fast and attentive. I had the tasting menu with the wine pairings and every bite was just fantastic! I would recommend to anybody visiting Paris! We wanted to visit this place regardless of the thought that it could be too touristy. We were really delighted that the place lives up to its reputation. The scallops were really well prepared and delicious. The escargots with parsley butter were very tasty and very well cooked. Pleasant and helpful personnel guide you through the many menu service options. Lovely and vibrant setting provides a superb backdrop for an excellent Parisian lunch. I started with a half dozen oysters and turned to the seared tuna for a main course. Most enjoyable way to kick off my holiday in France! Style over substance. Stopped by for lunch and had a croque Madame which looked great though I found it to be both cold and lacked taste. I sent the food back after a bite to which they reheated the food and gave it back. On a positive note the French onion soup was good and hot.

The service was quite cold and although inside its very picturesque it lacks atmosphere.

리뷰:
My experience was very special, even though there was a long wait, but it only took 15 minutes before I got seated. I didnt order food, just dessert and coffee, which were both very delicious and of good quality.
Despite it being extremely crowded, the service was very fast. I enjoyed a pleasant time with my family.
I highly recommend the hot chocolate Its a bit pricy but the food is quite delicious. I love the hot chocolate very creamy and thick, and the bakery is great. Service was also good here in my experience It was our first time there, the breakfast was good. Overall a pleasant time spent there!

We wasn't too familiar with the culture, but they wasn't very patient. But still acceptable I guess. Food a little overpriced too compared to some of the other breakfast places I tried in Paris.

Environment was beautiful. 

Breakfast was good too!

Worth trying once! If you enjoy pastries, cappuccino, crepes, macaroons, a classic Paris cafe feelvibe then run don't walk to Carette!!! During our trip to Paris we ate at two different locations and they were both delicious. We ordered a variety of items and everyone in our family was extremely happy with their meals both times. Not only was the food good, the service was delightful. We didn't feel rushed or neglected, just the right amount of time to order and eat. The atmosphere of the cafe was very classic Paris and had great charm, this for sure was one of our favorite spots in Paris! Visited July 2024 with my teen daughter and nieces who had seen this place all over social media. Hot chocolate and croissants were delicious but a bit overpriced for what they are. Brother in law had the eggs with mushrooms and he loved it. Hubby had a Cappuccino and a side of bacon that was really tasty too. Overall we enjoyed it, service was ok. Guy behind the counter at the bakery could be nicer. Our waitress was nice and efficient. Got vanilla macaroons to go and they were delicious!!

La Rotonde is a true gem for anyone who loves classic French cuisine! The tartar beef was wonderfully seasoned, and the steak was cooked to perfection, full of rich flavor. The oysters were fresh and delicious, but the real star of the meal was the snailsthe best Ive ever had, hands down! Each dish was prepared with care and authenticity, making for a memorable dining experience. What truly sets La Rotonde apart, though, is the exceptional service. The staff Morgan was the warmest, treating us with genuine hospitality and making sure we felt welcome and taken care of from start to finish. Their passion for great food and topnotch service truly shines through. I highly recommend La Rotonde for a fantastic meal and unforgettable experience! Very lively, beautiful view of Eiffel Tower, lots of seating inside and out. Food was very good and prices were reasonable.

Service was great.

Lovely experience!

I was a bit tired of French cuisine and they had delicious Pad Thai! We were recommended to this place for dinner and had a lovely time . We went at a time when it was very busy 8p so be prepared to wait a little in between orders if you go there between 730p to 830p. However, the staff is very nice and will work with any dietary restrictions you may have. Overall, it's a great place for dinner and whenever we're in Paris, we will dine here again . What a beautiful restaurant. Loved it !
The food, the service and the environment, everything was perfect. The manager gave us an amazing table next to the window, even though we didnt book one. Bathroom was clean too.
I would definitely be coming back one day. Great dinner spot. Cozy and romantic. Excellent French traditional food. Service was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
