Nice small Korean coffee where you can sit  and grab some food or have a hot drink. The sesame latte was good but not exceptional. Personnel is really nice! Come by if you are nearby, I recommend Amazing fruity food options with great service and atmosphere. Way better and way cheaper than nearby mainstream options. A must go if you stay nearby. It is a very cosy place. The cakes and cookies are homemade. I ordered the carrot bento cake which was delicious I believe it cost 5 as well as a cinnamon cookie Id recommend anyone try it and a sweet potato latte. It cost me 16,40 and I will definitely go  there again ! Cozy little tea  salon in the 15th arrondissement of paris.

Ordered
10  Bingsu Th Vert sweet shaved ice and matcha powder sprinkled over it topped with sweet red beans, whipped cream and a cut in two mochi placed ok each sides.

Wifi, not for  work space  on weekends, fun upside down decorations look up, gives it a little Alice in wonderland vibe. The injeolmi bingsu is the perfect eat for a hot summer day.

Finely shaved ice, topped with soybean powder, sweet condensed milk, red bean, icecream, mochi and usually bungeoppangtaiyaki which was outofstock when I went.

Its a big serving, like a meal for one, but really made to be shared by two.

The cafe is small, and cozy. Theres WiFi available, so its a great spot to work from as well.

So many people lined up, waited for around 10 mins. Great choice for a casual dinner in Montpasse. Generous cocktail pours and classic French bistro food. Solid preparation. Attentive service. Good atmosphere with lots of terrace dining. Cute caf in the 6th with a nice terrace. Sunday brunch is pretty good, offering several combos or  la carte options.

Big downside is the quality of service. Staff are overwhelmed and very inefficient. Enjoyed some very tasty French onion soup, Poke bowls, and seafood pasta. The restaurant is very cosy with an open air garden which is very enjoyable in summer. Very good french onion soup, cheese and meat plater were also delicious. It's a lovely atmosphere to relax and eat. Our waiter Clement was very helpful as well, especially since our French isn't that great.

Very expensive, but at the same time extremely delicious coffee! There was a large selection of coffee beans with their detailed descriptions. The most expensive one went up to 20 for an espresso, which seems a little crazy to me. But we settled for coffee at a quarter of the price and were very satisfied. Actually, I have to say, I don't think I've had better coffee in Paris. The attention in the form of a small cinnamon cookie will also please. So this place is for real coffee lovers, but definitely worth it! Great place  and great coffee with lots of variations and blends. Lovely place to sit aswell and the staff were lovely. The only downfall is the prices like very expensive and even the basic ones weren't cheap. Cafe d'Auteur specialises in all sorts of specialty coffee and is a mustgo for coffee lovers in Paris! The variety of coffee types is endless, from espresso, Americano, syphon, cappucino, viennois, Cafe du'Auteur provides you also with a wide range of roasting and beans.

You basically pay based on the origin of the coffee and the type. Even very rare coffee from Ethopia, Jamaica, and Indonesia kopi luwak is being served, which makes this coffee shop quite unique.

We loved the coffee of the day and Colombian cappucino! The flavours were extraordinary and of very good quality. Highly recommended specialty coffee shop in Paris! The coffee origin selection is outstanding and you can have it made by your method of choice. Service was impeccable very friendly and welcoming. A nice conversation to go with your Parisian breakfast is always a plus Very good place. Top beans but some of them just rare and thus pricy but not necessarily tasty. Good machinery. They roast the beans by themselves. The barrister quality was ok and not overwhelming... But still all top for a good coffee.

Finally, great specialty coffee in Paris. The prices are higher, but the coffee is truly great.
They also have some interesting chocolate bars for sale. I bought the praline one and it tastes like good chocolate.
The staff was kind and spoke English rather well.
They have an area for anyone who wants to work on a computer. Super fast wifi and a few sockets makes for a great place to have a quick meeting or do some work. The host is very friendly and helpful. No ambient music when I was there which I prefer, but if it's full I think it can get pretty loud. Again, the wifi was the highlight. I got a very stable connection of 70mbps updown with 4 people in the cafe. What an amazing gem for coffee and cake lovers! Such warm treatment and excellent coffee. The iced latte is a must in this Paris summer and there's a choice of milks almond, oat etc. Really friendly people and great expertise on coffee. We will be back as soon as we can! We were looking for a place to sit and have coffee in the afternoon and stumbled across this cozy intimate place. We had a decaf cappuccino and a 2shot Americano along with a slice of pistachioapricot pie. It was delicious. The service was attentive and welcoming. Definitely a come back to place. Delicious coffee and delicious, rich, hot chocolate . This little spot is perfect if you want to get some work done there's a counter which often has people sitting at it with their laptops or if you want to grab a takeaway coffee and walk through Luxembourg gardens.  But I travel here just for their coffee. I usually order a latte or cappuccino

Coffee was great, staff super friendly. Would just say that the V60 filter was a bit small compared to other coffee shops.

Highly recommended. omg, very kind and nice stuff and the most delicious coffee in the city, 1010 Very good coffee. And iced latte. You can tell they are passionate about their coffee.

They have some tables outside in the shade  perfect for a hot summer day.

Unfortunately they don't have decaf coffee. The cookie has a nice texture but was a bit too sweet for me. This is beautiful cozy coffee. The coffee was great and the atmosphere makes magic. The only downside is that there were none food options when weve been there.

리뷰:
Go for the decor, bar stools and experience. Stay to have a Madeleine and smell their scents. I have to agree with another reviewer, I've had better tasting coffee elsewhere.

The bar stools are super comfortable, even for a bigger hipped lady like myself. There are purse hooks too.

After my snack, I took in the scents and purchased a wonderful body oil and the orange toothpaste  most I've spent on toothpaste thus far. It's a delightful experience to sit down and enjoy a coffee and some pastries. The place is beautiful, and the staff is super friendly. On the other hand, the coffee is not the best, but not everything has to be specialty coffee. Additionally, you can purchase highquality combs, perfumes, and other items that are perfect for yourself or as a gift. One thing that you definitely must have in Paris. Scents  sensations, this cafe romances you from the moment you walk through the doors.
Old world charms and corners filled with stories, you feel transported and all of a sudden very in the moment at the same time.
It may just be one of my most favourite cafes in the world.
The coffee is sensational, the presentation is flawless and to have Buly scents be a part of the experience provides the perfect compliment.
Just go already!!!! This place is a true gem! Vintage classic atmosphere and so unique. The moment youll enter the space youll be blown away by all the amazing scents.

Unfortunately we didnt have the opportunity to have a coffee. Keep in mind barista goes out for lunch brake between 12301330. However we bought a couple of things!

All items are exceptional. The scents divine and the quality seems to be high as well.

I sprayed myself with the perfumes around 1230 its 2115 now and I still smell them. Especially the oud one.

Keep in mind that perfumes scent keeps transforming as time goes by. I am thinking of going back to get one more perfume the Oud one.
At the beginning was very intense even for me who I love Oud, but now it has transformed into this irresistible sweet mystical Oud saffron  woody scent. My favorite hot chocolate in Paris.
Yes, its a bit expensive but here you are getting very high quality and the experience and ambiance is worth it.
Great style.
The place is very dog friendly as well.

리뷰:
Le Cafe Marly, located right in front of the Louvre Museum, offers an iconic and breathtaking view of the Louvre pyramids. The setting is simply amazing and adds a unique charm to the dining experience.
We visited for breakfast and were delighted with our choices. The pastries and toast with butter and jam were delicious, and the coffee latte was perfectly brewed. The quality of the food, combined with the stunning view, made for a memorable morning in Paris. Highly recommend to book in advance! Nice food well presented and the service is definitely five stars for Paris. Very friendly staff that brought me new breads because mine was not warm enough. I found very nice from them. I found a bit overpriced the menu but you just pay because of the view the Louvre so is understandable why is a bit overpriced. Highly recommend this place if you are in this area. Really lovely views and great hospitality. The door staff was lovely and really beautiful and although I wished the champagne was colder it was still good.  we had the steak and the Tom yum Cod.

Gerard was lovely. Spectacular atmosphere. Magical views of the Louvre inside and out as always! Food has really declined since the many times Ive dined here in the past and the staff were tremendously unprofessional. Suggestions were awful. Bottle of Wine was brought to the table after the mains have already arrived. And when we inquired  it was as if it was a surprise. I would have much preferred to enjoy a glass before starting our meals like a proper French restaurant. The only real reason to eat here is because of the views after all. To top things off  they demanded a tip.  If youre going to demand American style tipping  you should as such be prepared for American style expectations of service and smile a bit more. Beggars cant be choosers as they say.

Also suggest to have a look at the wine list in my photos. I had breakfast at Le Caf Marly before visiting the Louvre Museum. I ordered a caf latte with a croissant. To be honest, the food and drinks were pretty averagenothing particularly special.

What really makes this place stand out is the view. While eating or drinking, you get an amazing view of the Louvre, which adds to the experience.

However, the prices are quite high compared to other spots in the area. For the photos I took, it was worth it, but overall, its more about the location than the food.

리뷰:
We came here for afternoon snack. We had no idea about the fame of this brand but ended up trying out their famous hot chocolate. I have to admit that if you have sweet tooth then you will love this place. But for me the hot chocolate was way too sweet and I could not finish it. Other items we ordered were also too sweet and the onion soup was too salty. It seemed their menu items were all on the extreme ends of the spectrum.

Overall it is not a place I would order sweet or savory items again. BUT, their terrace seats had a fantastic view of the plaza in front of the museum and that photo opportunity alone is enough for me to revisit. The best cafe in the museum . Do visit and try to catch a table in the front view. Its amazing. Egg avocado was awesome and the millefeuille was delicious. Take photos of plates with the pyramid  We got to Angelinas around 930 and there was no queue.  Service was really slow today.  It took nearly two hours for Le Brunch.  After clearing table from Eggs Benedict it took twenty to thirty minutes for French Toast to come.  It took a similar amount of time for paying the bill.  Food was good though a bit too sweat by the end.  We asked for water with the French Toast to help with the sugar, but we never received it.  We left half asleep.

It was our second time here in as many years, but probably will not return due to the slow service. My experience at restaurant Angelina Louvre in Paris was thoroughly disappointing. After visiting the exhibition, my party and I decided to have lunch there. I ordered a homemade lemonade, but to my surprise, it turned out to be just lemon squeezed into water, without any added flavor.

For food, I opted for the quiche and ravioli, but both dishes lacked any taste whatsoever. The quiche was bland, and the ravioli was flavorless and devoid of any seasoning.

Although the view of the Louvre Pyramid was stunning, I can't say the same about the food. In summary, you shouldn't come here for the food experience. Nice location and the chocolate cake that I ate was delicious. I never write bad reviews but the iced chocolate was so disgusting. It was warm, had no ice or ice cream in it and just had a really foul taste? I really dont know how someone could stuff up an iced chocolate, but they did. Perhaps the milk was off? I read reviews about their hot chocolate being delicious, so was thinking the iced one would be too!  I went later in the afternoon when the massive line was gone. Was asked if I wanted to leave a tip, but I did not as the expensive iced chocolate was undrinkable and I had to wait for a long time sitting there holding my credit card to be noticed to pay and leave. They did not ask why I had not consumed the drink and I just wanted to get out of there.

Nice experience to explore this coffee shop, roastery.
Good coffee and the staff were really helpful and friendly.  My favorite cafe in all of Paris! Everything from their self made coffee and chocolate to the beautiful atmosphere! Love love love Coffee was good, as it should be at this price. Had a very mediocre cookie, no madeleines were available. Only one staff member was on, who was really friendly, but had an impossible job to do taking all the orders, making coffee and apparently also responsible for baking the madeleines, so it took ages to get our coffee. Is a roasting coffee shop, where smells like coffee, has various types of beans for your espresso, very good taste. Interior is inviting and seems bigger, but has only 3 tables inside, but is enough, chairs from lether and comfortable. Good coffee machine, personalized, and various grinders. Very professional. Why is so hard in Paris to get a good coffee? This place is ideal. Thank you for nice service and suggestions. Also you may buy coffee and various products. Coffee is probably too bitter for American taste buds but the barista is super nice and spoke English well with customers who cant speak French. Service is fantastic.

리뷰:
Renew
Fringe contact me to solve my misunderstanding, they attach great importance to the problem of the guests, try to clarify and deal with it, very thankful.

I order a cappuccino, americano and a cinnamon roll there. The coffee is okay and the vibes is good. With some problem there cinnamon roll is sold out so i didn't get it. Also the toilet can't use. When i leave the shop and check with my consumption record, they charge the price not the menu's price. I was confused. Overall, my experience was not good. Best coffee I've had in Paris. Service was kind and gentle. Highly recommend.  Oh, and the pastries were still warm mmmmm delicious. Really cosy spot to meet up with friends or to chill alone reading your book as I did! Strong competitor for the best cinnamon bun Ive tasted in Paris so far! Really delicious and excellent comforting chai latte. The girl who served me was super sweet as well! I found the "spoons" very amusing. A nice place to enjoy coffeepastries  with friends . The taste of the coffee has its own identity something special. It was also the first time I tried a cardamom roll, and I loved it! The service was great. On the downside, one of the coffees we ordered was too expensive and not that special! I recommend  Very good cappuccino and great pour over.
6 years since my first visit and the place is still the first one I head to when in the marais.
Friendly atmosphere, great coffee which is always evolving.

리뷰:
We had a great time. We were running late, but they held our table. The veal was amazing. Try the fresh seafood platter with raw oysters. This is one of Paris most authentic restaurants of course a little touristy but perfect to get the full on experience. The escargots were amazing, same as the steak and frites. Good atmosphere, beautiful decor and very relaxed setting!
Thumbs up! Our service was perfect and the meal was absolutely delicious. I had sea bass and my daughter had salmon tartar. The Parisian Onion Soup was likely the best Ive ever had. My daughter experienced her first ever escargot here and she admitted she loved the flavor it had an earthiness that was brought out by the herbs, garlic, and butter. For dessert my daughter ordered crepes flamb and she was able to watch as our server prepared it which delighted her. Thank you so much for the experience and we look forward to dining with you again in October. The food is excellent especially the seafood. The service is great and friendly! Appreciate the hospitality and if there is a bathroom at downstairs that would be perfect! We went as a group of 15 people and we took the menu. Everything was very tasty and the waiters were very friendly. They even had a menu in English and Japanese.

The best thing Music and Croissants are fine. But the coffee seriously the worst! It is such a pity to produce so bad coffee with a decent machine. Far too hot, bad foam and on top served in a plastic cup. We left without drinking it. Please get a barista training or watch some YouTube videos at least. Cannot recommend enough. If you are within a 40,000 minute metro ride, consider stopping by. You wont be disappointed, but you will have a reoccurring metro bill problem. The Gent knew our order by the second day 

so kind This is the second time I stopped by this caf and I'd recommend it highly. Very friendly staff and excellent coffee and lattes. Very welcoming and I was able to sit and read a bit while waiting for my partner. Came here for an afternoon drink and snack with my family. The cinnamon croissant was good and had a nice texture. However, the drink was not great and the atmosphere was cramped with bad music playing, unfortunately. Idk where this high rating came from. The cappuccino had way too much milk, and the milk tasted bitter. The presentation could be better, Also clean up the place a bit.

We ordered a profiterole. It was absolutely delicious. The desserts here taste amazing. The staff, especially the old guy that served us seemed very kind. We tipped him 2. Lovely place and lovely desserts. Went to this restaurant while visiting Paris. Both food and service were good. Loved sitting outside people watching. Cafe de Paris has good vibes and nice service. I love the food thereits flavorful and delicious. Best place for a simple breakfast or evening home made fries with a bottle of chardonney. Great service despite lots of people. Feels good when you're there. Great dinner, didnt take enough photos of this place. Service was awesome, snails and duck were very tasty. Beer was good too.
Would recommend eating here to experience local Parisienne food on a street that has an amazing vibe at night, weekends are much busier but during the week is still a great experience.

리뷰:
Travelled from USA  first stop after dropping luggage
We taste coffee all over the world
We had 1 flat white and 1 cappuccino
Good balance between espresso. I would have preferred a bit stronger espresso but this is a VERY good cappuccino Great cafe that was opened from 8am. And it's right across from Amelie's apartment which is very cool. Also they offered milk alternatives and that is not that usual in Paris. Excellent cappuccino, and fresh pastries toasted on the spot, as if they were freshly baked

Super friendly baristas

Adorable little quite quaint sitting room, natural light, mellow ambient music at a very low volume

Clean bathroom

..and most important AIR CONDITIONING!! 5stars

Must visit on your way to Montmartre. More like a 4.5 out of 5.
Espresso is very strong, not watered down like most other places. The deco and atmosphere is great. The only drawback is the coffee has a bit sour taste and I wish they have a dark roast choice. For the price this is great! We had cookies and they are amazing dipped but the drinks were a bit weak for my liking anyways. The store is amazing vibes and I could see myself coming here regularly. Lovely staff and beautiful place

Food was delicious and coffee very nice.

One downside is no laptops weekends all day and weekdays after 1300, if you are looking for a place to sit and work for a while then. I went there with my girlfriend for brunch on a Sunday a few weeks ago and we spontaneously got a seat. The service was very good and the atmosphere was great. We enjoyed the dishes and the price was worth it. Very good coffee. We will be back definitely! Very pleasant and nice place to stay for a good cup of coffee and delicious meal. 리뷰: What a cute, beautiful cafe in heart of Paris, with exceptional service and kind staff. The cafe is airy, clean and welcoming. So many non dairy options and coffees I have ordered were perfect. Staff was welcoming and kind from beginning to the end. Their matcha was lovely, but nothing special. The smell of the coffee intrigued me and I'm hitting myself on the head for not getting one of their coffee drinks instead! I will definitely go try one at their NYC location. I could have given a better review if staff was a bit more attentive. Our order was ready on the counter for unknown period of time and we were not notified. Coffee I ordered was not as good as I expected and on top of that it had cooled down to the time I decided to go and check if my order is ready. Ive tried sandwich with poached egg which in my case was cooked fully and not poached. Good coffee served with a smile. The flat white coffee could have been a bit stronger in our opinion. It tasted like a latte macchiato. It's still good, but there is room for improvement. I do not understand the hype of this place. The coffee is good but not amazing. Also would be nice if they had something on their page about the coffee shop not being laptop friendly. Didn't know until I arrived and was looking for somewhere to work remote for a couple of hours.

리뷰:
Portions were absolutely massive but food was weirdly underseasoned  still enjoyable however. Staff were friendly albeit sometimes a bit difficult to get a hold of or would take a bit long to come back with what you had asked for.

Super close to the Louvre and is a good option if you dont want to have fast food or anything chainlike in the area. The staff couldnt have been better! They were attentive and lively! The food was good, I had the steak with an egg on it and fries with a side salad, everything was very delicious.

The location is ideal if you are visiting the Louvre museum!! amazing place! delicious, guys are very attentive, friendly, courteous. food is amazing! cappuccino at the end, mind blowing highly recommend, the owner is just great! The fries were good but thats about it. Good to stop for a drink after the Louvre but really better to save your calories for elsewhere. I'm pretty sure this is a tourist trap. This place reminded me to always read the reviews before going to a restaurant. It took 30 minutes for them to take our order, and another 2030 minutes to actually receive our food, which was actually not as bad as I thought it'd be. There are a lot of better options here, so just don't come here.

리뷰:
We've found this small Cafe not far from where we were staying in Paris in the Latin quarter. We've been there twice and both occasions the food was delicious and the coffee was arguably one of the best we had in Paris. Service on the other hand is on the slow side may be due to the number of staff servicing the tables, once the order was taken food and drinks were served pretty quickly. I'd definitely recommend it and go there myself again. Had a lovely meal and all in our group were happy with their food. The avocado toast with egg was great.

Charming spot, and very friendly staff. I did my best to try and order in French, and they were very patient with me and helpful.

Keep up the great work! I loved loved loved this place.  They had excellent high quality coffee, as good as a good Melbourne cafe, and prices were fair and every single staff member was friendly and positive.  They even laughed in a good way at my attempts to joke in French.  I tried lots of places but went back here multiple times as my goto when i was staying in the area.  Thankyou Jozi for making such a lovely welcoming place. We had the Brunch and it was simply amazing. Everything fresh and tasty, great coffee.  Recommend 100 Great place by Panthen to grab brunch. We had the brunch menu and the ham and cheese croissant. Everything tasted awesome and the staff were very pleasant. Not much space to sit and the place seems popular so get in early so you snag a space. One correction needs to be said that even though they open at 8am they start serving the brunch service at 9am. Before 9am you can only order to go coffee and pastries.
Other than that recommend this place to get food before coming on Panthen visit.

리뷰:
As you can imagine its very touristy, everyone goes there for the
Picture if you have watched Amelie !

Waiters are very nice but I didnt really enjoy my meal

However the place is very fun and the service
Is excellent

Didnt like they staff asked for a tip Without giving me the change of adding this myself which probably would have been a
Bigger amount as
I was about to leave cash as a tip  but  when they come with the ticket and grab the machine and say how much with the tip it kind of
Broke the magic of the moment and left me thinking that was a bit cheeky  however they make you feel very welcome and are very nice people I read a bunch of the previous reviews, and still had to come to Caf des Deux Moulins to honor the teenage version of myself who adored "Amelie." Maybe the reviewers we're having a bad day or maybe the staff was having a bad day... But I had a wonderful experience. The staff and I interacted with several staff members were all lovely. Our server in particular was very kind, charming and also very stylish. She was attentive and did her best to accommodate a couple of Americans. I ordered the onion soup and the small Parisian salad. I thought they were both great. The baguette that came with the soup was good. I think baguettes have to be good if they are madesold in Paris. Anyway, I was very pleased with what I ordered. My husband ordered the cheeseburger. He said the burger was decent but nothing to write home about and he was very pleased with the fries. We shared Amelie's Crme Brle  and I thought it was fabulous. If it wasn't socially unacceptable, I would have licked the ramekin clean. It was trs bon! I loved the cute aesthetic of the cafe and how they feature Amelie all over the cafe from photos to the menu. I loved it! If you're a fan of the film, it's definitely worth checking out! Heres a touristic stop. If you are into the Amelie movie, you should stop by.
We ordered her menu and unfortunately the dishes came in a little bit cold. Not the best choice for having lunch, the hamburguers ordered beside my table looked good though Toilet was dirty.

No olive o served in the table. We only took a 5 euro coffee to check the interior since we wanted to see how similar the place looks compared to the movie Amelie. It looks a bit different than in the movie but a lot of what was in the movie is still there. The service was surprisingly pleasant. There were just 2 guys working plus kitchen staff, and they seemed a bit overwhelmed but in very high and positive spirits. I had read some bad reviews about the service here so I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't the case when we visited. If you love the movie Amelie, you must stop here for a coffee and soak in the atmosphere of Montmartre. The staff are so lovely, and the service was prompt. We recommend the croque madame and croque monsieur! As Amlie says, "We pass the time of day to forget how time passes." This is the perfect place to do just that.

리뷰:
The coolest coffee place!! 
The cafe has great outdoor seating! 
Staff was very kind, they offer some cute merch at the cafe too! The cafe has selfservice  Cappuccino was very delicious! 1010! Loved the foam! Many cool people here! 
I would definitely recommend this place!! Very cool coffee place, great for a quick meeting, lovely deserts and amazing blends and roasts. Dont expect to shelter yourself from the cold in the winter . The sitting inside is almost non exhistant.
The terasse must be amazing in the summer .

I just went there because of a colleague this lunch, the staff is prompt and quick. The quality of the product is great. My coffee was perfectly balanced. I took a cappuccino  and a carrot cake today.

Ill definitely go back to try their other desert one day.

Anyone passing by les Halles that is a great coffee shop.

I loved the ambiance and the sticker they sell for 1 euro. This is the BEST cafe I have ever been to in my life, and I have been to a lot. I reside in NYC but when I find myself in Paris, Motors is a must. The staff are some of the nicest people I have met. They take time out of their duties I know they are very busy to come check on you and see if you are liking your coffee. No other cafe I have been to does that. The coffee options are some of the best you can find, from friedhats, to special guests and beyond, you can be sure that each bean is dialed into perfection. The prices are perfect! Remember you are paying for the coffee bean, which a lot of work goes into, NOT just the drink. The aesthetic is truly something else. I wear their tshirt every day!  One of the best coffee shops I have been to in Paris. Try each and every coffee especially the handmaid ones. And the cinnamon roll is awesome! You have an area at the front to enjoy your coffee outside. Amazing and pretty unique specialty coffee, with several sweet bites that are absolutely delicious.

The coffee in this place actually made me feel different tastes than usual, worth stopping by!

리뷰: We were there for breakfast and happy about the portion and quality of the food served. We did buy a small box of fruit from the nearby market. We asked for the permission to wash and consume in the restaurant. The wonderful lady that served us washed thoroughly for us. We appreciate a lot for her kind gesture. We had a great experience here. Super friendly and inviting from the start. This appears to be a local spot, as we seemed to be the only tourist at lunch, which is a great sign. We had the Parisienne burger, the croque monsieur, and a bottle of white wine. The burger was the best Ive eaten in a long time. Somehow the delicious sauted onions stole the show, but the cheese and bacon were great as well. If you are in the Latin Quarter you need to definitely visit here. Food is good but service is really slow. Prices are average. They have wifi Love this spot! My family and I stopped in for breakfast and the food and coffee was amazing. The owner and employee working were so kind and caring. 1010! What a great surprise .. really delicious  tasty  burgers,  that are as good as anywhere .   after traveling for a while we really were looking forward to a good burger and this place hit the mark 100 percent   ,  and service was excellent too .

리뷰: Perfect low key coffee spot. The iced mocha is incredible with sweet cream foam and not too sweet. Hot oatmilk latte was excellent as well. Highly recommended! Really lovely little spot! We popped in for coffee and loved the atmosphere. The staff were extremely kind and didnt seem to mind when I fumbled my French speaking and immediately switched to English. We didnt try any of the bakery items, but they looked fantastic! It was my first time at Kafeibaie and I was very happy with the experience ! I took ice latte, avocado toast and the pistache cake  very fresh and delicious ingredients ! Sure will come back soon ! Thank you ! Wonderful team. Especially loved the chocolate nut cake made by Alix, who is an absolute doll. Great place to hang out, work, meet people. Airy and delightful. Not luxe, but comfy. Lovely quiet little caf down a side street. The staff were just so friendly and lovely, and happy to put together a simpler meal for our 8yearold travelling companion. A great spot for brunch and very reasonably priced for Paris.

I feel the need to leave a review given all of the recent, poor reviews. Not only was the food delicious but the service was friendly and very good! We are so glad we came! We got the Brioche French Toast, two fried eggs, bacon, black coffee, and a flat white. Everything was wonderful. Dont let the other reviews stop you from visiting this spot!

Also, if you are visiting with children, its worth noting that their bathroom has both a changing table and a training toilet seat making this spot unusually welcoming to kids! I want to write to sincerely show my gratitude of my experience at Coutume. I had a really exhausted morning but the food and hospitality here really cured me. The staff was really kind. My dinning experience was amazing. And thx again for making my day  had one of my best coffee here A little cafe gem in Paris, particularly if you're after an Aussie brunchlatte style vibe. Coffee hits the spot go double shot if you want a stronger coffee flavour and the menu is broad enough to cater to your preferences.

Unfortunately I experienced a minor letdown in the service for a simple order and those next to me didn't receive 1 of their 3 items, but I suspect this was a oneoff circumstance that occurred during the Paralympic Games and not reflective of the everyday experience. Nice place to have lunchbrunch. Prices are a bit high for my taste. I ordered a Caesar salad which was a bit dry but overall very nice. Service was great and I had an enjoyable visit.  It did look like other dishes people around me ordered were amazing, so I'm hoping to come  back and enjoy more! Thank you! I checked it out on Google before going to the market and visited it.
The French toast and pancakes were delicious.
The interior of the store was also stylish.

My wife and I were in the neighborhood and were looking for something light and good to eat. We found beige Caf and it looked like it had a great menu and a high enough rating. I quickly looked over the one star reviews and saw the passionate and caring response of the owners and decided I must visit this place. They did not disappoint. The price to quality ratio was great. The options were lovely and quite tasty. Super cute place to stop by for a quick coffee and a pastry. They were very friendly, and also fast service. I had taken an iced chai latte with a cookie and it was delicious, very nicely made! I'd definitely recommend going here.  AMAZING!!
The best bagel I've ever had in my life. The ingredients were the freshest I've had and they all combined into the perfect bite every time. They also had a lot of variety on the menu with something for everyone. The coffee was great and the place had a great atmosphere with seating inside or outside. The nicest staff that are super friendly and give the place a great relaxed and fun vibe. A must go to while in Paris. Amazing cafe with delicious coffee. We really liked the atmosphere and the tranquility of this place. The barista is super nice and friendly. Made the most scrumptious filter coffee weve ever tasted. It was a really good experience
The staff are really friendly and i loved their carrot cake since its not so sweet
Its a cosy place if you want to have date with urslf

리뷰: Great shop specializing in Lisbon style egg tarts. I did not have them until I arrived home many hours later, but they were very good. Almost as good as the originals you get in Lisbon. My new favourite place in Paris!!! Literally in love with it, the place reminds so so much of home, and the pastis are simply amazing, so close to the originals ones and I couldnt be happier!!!  I recommend this to all my Portuguese fellows that are missing home or anyone that wants to try the best of Portugal. The staff was so so nice and they spoke Portuguese which made me even more happy! Really high quality Natas, as good as you find in best pastry ships in Lisbon. Also service and coffee deserve 5 stars. Congratulations to the team and hope you open more branches around France. Discover the best pastis de nata in Paris at this charming pastry shop, located at 37 Rue du Roi de Sicile. Indulge in these delightful Portuguese custard tarts, freshly baked daily to perfection. Don't miss out on this sweet treat! Find on Google Maps and satisfy your cravings today! Best pasteis de nata in France! Had many in Portugal and this took me right back there

리뷰:
This place is pretty famous. Known them since they were just having 1 restaurant and now there are 2 more branches! Meaning they did a good job! Durian crepes were the best for those who love it, matcha is a bit bitter than the Japanese tea salon. Well, others have different preferences. The ambiance was great but crowded, which is normal theyre famous!. Definitely a good one. Today went to opera branch, less crowded than this one Get the Mango thousand layer cake !!!!
It was SO GOOD. Prices are about 8 per dessert and about 7 per drink. It's a very cute and cozy place, definitely check it out if you like great bubble tea and matcha desserts. This is a really cute place with a lot of Matcha based options. We tried the popular Matcha cake with nuts on top, but we ended up removing the nuts because it was better without it. The tea with taro was okay. I would say overall, it is quite pricey for what it offers but could be a good experience Very delicious place to eat at but it is TOO CROWDED.

 The wait line was the most atrocious I had for a dinein place  it was a Sunday afternoon and we waited over an hour ! I understand the hype and it does taste delicious but I probably will only go there for takeout from now on. We were tired and miserable by the time we entered and it really impacted our overall experience.

Food wise  delicious. The ingredients taste raw and fresh, we took a sesame rolls and it tasted just like the one I had in Japan. The matcha was very good too. However they didn't have any of the new menu items advertised on the storefront.

 I observed a bad management of the table service inside. We were told that some tables were available but a lot of people inside refused to go, not ordering anything for hours. I went to other dessert places that were in high demand but I never waited that long. I believe you should be more strict as a waiter and make sure everyone in line gets to enjoy your desserts. I had the Yuzu miel smoothie float, and the taste was pretty good and refreshing. I was caught off guard though when they didn't accept card for under 10 euros. The staff also told me I could only sit in the store and drink if there is not so many people. Not sure if there is a policy for that? I also paid for my drink, so I think I should be allowed to sit in the store to enjoy it?

리뷰:
Did get to visit on my last trip, so I made it a point to visit on this trip. So happy I did. The entire vibe of the restaurant was wonderful. We had a leisure breakfast before we went shopping and it was so relaxing. Everything was delicious and I enjoyed my macaroons purchased here throughout my entire trip. The  service was great and not once did we feel rushed. Everything was clean and our server was attentive and kind. Will definitely be back! So this is how I think of this place Its a museum filled with fun colorful things. And you paying for the museum fee by paying for an extremely high price for the menu. The prices for food and drinks are extremely expensive, but what you get in exchange is to appreciate the ridiculously cute decor, and a chance to taste the original Paris macrons. In other words, it is a tourist trap. However, if you can afford it, it is still fun. There are some exceptionally delicious tea and the macrons are indeed out of this world. Theres also a shop area where you can purchase additional gifts and takeaway menu. It is worth trying once as a tourist, but I wouldnt go back again. We went during the Grand brunch on Sunday and everything was delicious! The options were endless and I had the best French toast Ive ever had. The service was also topnotch. Highly recommend brunch at Laduree! Beautifully decorated restaurant at one of the most expensive streets in the world to be. They offer everything from coffee, pastry, dinning and of course colorful macaroons. The burst of colors would just make you try everything, but the cost would make budgetconscious travelers think twice.

I am not a macaroon aficionado so I couldn't tell the difference from other macaroons I tried. Not twice as good for twice the price. There are flavors only available at this store and I enjoyed them.

If pictures is all you want you could go around the restaurant and caf without purchase. Although when in Paris?  What a beautiful and perfect place, it looks magical, very cute. We love getting to know the place.

We had already eaten macarrons in other places but never in France. The price is a little expensive, but it was worth it, its very good, we got the box with 6 different flavors, and they were all wonderful.

Love this bakery. Their bento boxes taste good if you want something quick. Love their fruit cream cakes. The cream is so airy and not too sweet. The fruit is not the best quality thats why the rating is 4 stars. I love, love, love this place! It's a big mustvisit for all matchafans. The staff was very friendly and the food was tasty as hell.  The sesame cookie is really amazing! The best matcha eclairs Ive ever had. Ever. And I try matcha things all day erry day errywhere. This is a must visit spot whenever Im back in Paris. Delicious JapaneseFrench ptisseries at affordable prices. Buns were to die for!! We got the melon pain could eat this everyday, red bean beignet the dough was heavenly and red bean paste was not too sweet, red bean mochi bun super yum!!

Also tried the salmon and okaka bonito flakes onigiris which were good!

Wanted to go back for the strawberry cake but didnt have time. Will definitely visit every time Im back in Paris! Great bakery. Best mochi in Paris! Loved it! Nice service. Average interiors.

I went there late afternoon and even though the pastry selection was limited I picked up a pain aux raisin which was beyond delicious. Crunchy exterior and soft, fluffy inside. The chocolates were also great recommend the caramel. Lovely service, cheap and affordable and lovely area to walk around. Perfect Insta spot! All of the baked goods would not have looked out of place in a food magazine. The flavours though were not as stimulating as the aesthetics. Don't get me wrong, the pastries taste perfectly fine but they don't thrill your taste buds as much as they exhilarate your eyes. Except the chocolate eclair, that was way too bitter! I was recommended to visit this Patisserie, it was my first stop when I arrived in Paris and I was not disappointed! It's visually Beautiful and the Macaroons and Pastries are amazing, if you visit Paris you must visit Stohrer! This is a well known spot that I'm not sure deserves its popularity or maybe that was its downfall. It was OK but in Paris I'd recommend just grabbing a croissant from anywhere, it's probably better than back home. The one here was either on par or lesser than any other I had. Their vanilla flan is one of the best Ive had and it is a very generous slice for 4.20! Baba au rhum also was excellent, very strong on the rum so even the individual portion is definitely good for sharing.
Also bought a coffee macaron and it was simple but delicious. Definitely an institution worth visiting and if youre lucky, they have some free samples of chocolate by the cashier which are sooo delicious!

리뷰:
I dont want to tell anyone about this bakery and would prefer to keep it my hidden gem. I came in to purchase one dessert for myself and after devouring it, I went back to pick up other treats for my family! Half of their stock was already gone within that time.

If you arent a fan of something too sugary, the chantilly nougatine is a must try. Its very light but the flavours are so well balanced. The cream on top is refreshing and its my new favourite dessert.

They packaged the desserts very well and they came out of the box without a scratch after being in subways and a busy bus. The associates were very kind and even packaged one of my desserts separately so it wouldnt tumble on the others. Cant wait to return!

The only con I can see for others is the price point. For the box I purchased 5 items was around 44 euros. On the last day in Paris, I found a shop coincidentally which offers macarons. It tastes quite good! And feel warm to see owners smile  Incredibly delicious and beautiful pastries. And staff handles them as if they are jewels. At about 8 euros each, they are expensive, but all that deliciousness and beauty is worth it. I liked the chocolate eclair and the cake with purple glass on top. The chocolate cake was not special, I wanted the milfeuille but was not available. We were experiencing serendipity to get to this place being pastry lover. We were in the area and attracted to buy pastries from Carl Marletti  because of the long queue. My favourite is the BelleHelene tart. OMG! It might be the best pastry I have tried in my life. Such a complexity of flavours the chocolate almond cream and poached pear create amazingly tasty contrast in fruity and sweet tastes. We tried the Feather that was also great and the caramel eclair. They didn't had everything because it was December 31st. But it worth going back to Paris to enjoy these amazing original pastries. I will get huge box of pastries next time! If you are visiting Paris definitely worth going here. Thank you for providing such a great pleasure!

A place with lovely eclairs and chocolates. Each eclair is so beautiful, although the prices are more expensive than other patisseries.

The staff are very friendly and helped with ensuring the products I bought suited my allergies.

It's a lovely indoor space, but I wish we could have eaten at the shop rather than only have take out options. The store is like a dessert boutique with all the clairs beautifully presented.

Both the clair de pistache pistachio and the clair de vanille vanilla were delicious.

The choux pastry was light and airy filled with a beautifully flavoured and balanced cream.

The pistachio and vanilla fillings were authentic. The glaze and nutty garnishes enhanced the flavour and provided a needed crunchy texture elevating the desserts.

There isn't indoor seating so I'd recommend either carefully taking the clairs home or having it in a nearby garden Jardin des Rosiers Joseph Migneret. the Eclairs were not what they used to be. A Years back they used to be exquisite  a pity.

They looked boring and tasted very average. Will not come back. The macaroons tasted surprisingly good. Delicious cakes we got red berries and passion fruit ones they were goey inside as well so nice! Very good clairs and nice service, I also liked chocolate Easter eggs. It is a pity though that there is no place to sit down and eat clairs like in this other venue

리뷰:
One of the best madeleines in the Paris city are at this bakery. There is almost always a line outside and rightfully so.

By the evening they are usually sold out with few pastries. The staff is nice and helpful.
There is an option of takeaway which most people prefer considering there is limited seating.

Very centrally located and falls way on great strolls. Highly recommend this bakery. Beautiful shop, wonderful service, flawless presentation, but sadly super underwhelming pastries. I had a raspberry Madeline and a strawberry tart. The Madeline was tasty, with a tart jelly in the center and a sweet coating, but not something I would go out of my way to eat again for 8. The strawberry tart was 90 whipped cream with a good cookie base, but no other real flavor outside of the strawberries on top. I am very whelmed in my experience, versus how hyped up this place was for how it performed taste wise. Honestly, save your money and get like 23 pastries somewhere else unless you want to take pictures of the gorgeous interior. We visited this boutique yesterday and were confronted with unacceptable behavior from the staff. I wanted to sit at a table that had not been cleared while my husband placed the order. The lady raised her voice at me, almost shouting, intimidating all the customers in the boutique and creating total silence. I understand that her job is not easy, but in no case is it acceptable to behave like that with customers, especially in one of the best pastry shop in the world. It is neither professional nor humane.

Otherwise, the boutique is great in terms of taste we loved the cookie and the hot chocolate. Got the riz au lait pate a tartiner, really underwhelming. The whole chocolatecookie layer is way too sweet couldnt eat more than two bites and the ritz au lait sadly has not flavour whatsoever. Definitely not worth 16, had to take to go as there is very limited seating My favorite pastry shop in Paris and a must visit every time Im there. The hot chocolate is simply divine and delicious the sandwiches are top notch

리뷰:
We bought a box of Odettes delicious cream puffs as they were recommended by our Paris guide. She declared that they were the very best and she certainly was right! We tried a variety and they were all delicious! My wife and I had eaten cream puffs before, but these were on another level! We still talk about them! The cream puffs are so good! A little pricey individually but worth trying. Great selection of flavours to choose from. The most iconic Choux in Paris 
A very Parisian cafe located behind  Shakespeare and Company and looking directly at Notre Dame de Paris this little cafe offers not only a great ambience and delicious Choux but a very Parisian spirit.

To begin with the service is great  The girl was very helpful, friendly and welcoming. She was also very fast to serve us.
We spent a lovely time in the caf and enjoyed our stay there. Needless to say that the Choux are delicious and out of this world.
They are of different flavours and rich in texture and taste.
I opted for the Pistachio one and my daughter chose the one with raspberry 
Even though the Choux is quite small, it is absolutely fulfilling. The coffee was also great and the hot chocolate that my daughter had.
The prices are super affordable and reasonable taking into account the location and the view on Notre Dame that it has.
Thus, if you want to spend a lazy and quiet evening in the very heart of Paris, France, definitely go to Odette.

I myself will definitely be returning there the next time I am in Paris 

Highly Recommend  Best cream Puff near Notre dame, amazing terrasse ! So much worth it!
A cream puff is 2,5 goes lower as you buy more, 1 bite of divine pleasure.

The cream puffs are very good, amazingly good in fact, you have about 89 variety that dont seem to change and always a different Chou  cream puff of the month.
You can order as few as just one and sit on their terrasse, what a treat. One can also order different sizes of boxes and tower made out of it.
This is one of my favorite terrasse of Paris, it overlooks Notre dame, its on a piece of sidewalk that is very quiet and for most of sheltered from the rain.
There are toilets on the second floor, on and the first floor you can also enjoy the view of Notre dame from your chair.
Definitely a must go to places while on the Latin quarter or at Notre dame. If youre in the vicinity, stop by for a caf and cream puff filled with the most delicious pastry cream flavored with the likes of praline  raspberry chocolate or passion fruit. Sitting upstairs in one of their tiny rooms overlooking the park below, youll catch sight of Notre Dane directly across the way. Theres nothing more Parisian than sipping your afternoon pick me up and admiring our grand lady in the midst of her post fire renovation, with a rainbow overhead no less.

We had the matcha cheesecake and it was lovely but also the staff was so friendly!! They were so nice, I can't give less than 5 stars. I would love to see smaller cheesecakes as we were doubtful of getting one as it was only 2 of us will def get it morr often if they had smaller sizes!! I have come across many positive recommendations for cheesecake, but I am not impressed with their quality today. Despite my love for matcha, this flavor does not meet my expectations, and the original cheesecake is just average.
Could you consider saying 'Hello' to clients when they enter the shop as part of your service? There were only us at that time. Gorgeous and delicious pastries!! We stumbled upon this while shopping and went back just for more two days later! We had the black sesame and yuzu tarts and some rice balls. All so good!! I tried Matcha cheese tart, it's amazing!
I like that it's not too sweet, and intense matcha.
It's hard to find good quality Matcha in Europe, but here it is!

The first bite I tried, I felt it's authentic japanese matcha. I wish they sell Matcha latte drink too.

The onigiri is average, not much filling. Next time sandro and the bento set looks all good. You can find tasty japanese cheesecakes here. We tried the original one and it was more than enough for four people. You can get cutlery from them. There is open kitchen and you can see everything. Highly recommended!

Lovely macarons  desserts. We have fond memories of feuillete from 2019  we again took the same pastry  plaisir sucre.
In macarons we took assorted 2 tins of 4 macarons  metallic ones which will be like cool souvenir   in taste really like passion fruit  chocolate one, hazelnut one.

Great place to go to if you are strolling around champs elysees
Its a lovely place to enjoy your dessert. Very good dessert. The cakes were probably some of the best I have had. Macaroons were ok. Service of good. Its a good place for people watching and enjoying some afternoon tea. The Isfahan croissant was amazing!!
It's got a rose, lychee and raspberry sorbet filling on the inside and is just amazing!
It was so good that after finishing one among four of us, we went and brought another!

We heard that this place was known for a little more unique flavors of macarons, so came for that.

ISPAHAN Rose, Letchi  Raspberry  really creative and unique. It even had some jam filling on the inside which was probably raspberry jam or something? But whatever it was, it was really nice!

INFINIMENT PRALIN PISTACHE Pistachio  praline  lovely flavor here! Very soft and smooth and just delicious.

INFINIMENT CHOCOLAT PAINEIRA Pure Origin Dark Chocolate Brazil   If you are a fan of dark chocolate, you will like this one. It actually is really rich!

PLAISIR SUCR Milk Chocolate  Flaky Praline  Actual milk chocolate flavor here. Not too rich or anything. Like eating milk chocolate.

MOGADOR Milk Chocolate  Passion Fruit  Another one of their classics It was fairly sweet for me, but dad loved it.

INFINIMENT VANILLE DE MADAGASCAR Vanilla from Madagascar  actually very simple, but nice in its own way.

INFINIMENT PRALIN NOISETTE Hazelnut Praline  Crunchy Praline  Real good!! I'm not usually a hazelnut fan but this was wow! Macrons awesome  very fresh. Very authentic French taste. And the Stawberries pistachio pastry was yummy. Came here for ice cream, as his ice cream in London is fantastic. We got the vanilla macaron one. It was bad. It wasn't a smooth texture, it was bitsy and disappointing. 8 for a tub of ice cream is steep.

주소: 31 Rue Saint-Louis en l'Île, 75004 Paris, France
리뷰:
I ordered a triple scoops of icecream and chose cherry, chocolate, and strawberry. However, it was served incorrectly as coffee, chocolate, and strawberry. I informed the staff that the wrong item was served. A new icecream was served again, but they just scooped out the coffee flavor from the originallyserved ice cream and put the cherry in it. It seemed, during this process, the chocolate ice cream underneath had melted a lot. Even the coffee ice cream was left inside, ruining the taste. It was annoying when the coffee flavor entered my mouth unexpectedly. It is possible for the staff to get the order wrong, but the process for correcting it is unprofessional. The staff said it was to keep the ice cream that was originally served from being thrown away, but why should costumers pay full price for a substandard product? I strongly request that they make it again from the beginning if it is served incorrectly next time. The cues are long but so so worth it when take the first lick! Fabulous ice cream. I tried the blood orange,the wild peach, the chocolate with nuts and raisins and the cacao whisky. The blood orange was my favorite! But the rest was great too. one of my most favourite icecream parlours of all time  a must try in Paris. The icecream itself is very popular and well known among the Parisians. The vibe and how you can eat it out of the metal sunday bowl was just fun  and after all, the coffee and wild strawberry icecreams were just fantastic!
the service was a plus too! The BEST ice cream shop! Highly recommend coming to enjoy a nice break from the heat and to order some delicious sorbet and other ice cream.

They offer a three scoop combo with whipped cream and coulis, which is quite lovely.

My favorite dish here is the Coupe Belle Hlne, which has both pear sorbet and vanilla. Their praline crackers that come with each scoop is also delicious!

The servers speak both English and French, and like most French restaurants, they have impeccable service. The ice cream here is worth the hype  possibly a top spot in all of Europe and it would for sure make a worlds best ice cream list. .  Two things to take note of 1. The staff is super busy and, being Parisian, werent fond of my son asking for samples and they expected us to know what flavors we wanted to order. This is status quo in Paris establishments  the people often just suck and come across as rude. 2. Try a flavor you normally wouldnt try. Some of their best flavors arent your typical chocolate, vanillas, berry, etc.  impatient service aside this place rocks.

sophie gave great customer service and helped us pick out the best pastries based on our tastes. They have one of the best croissants in Paris! The croissant is crunchy yet very buttery. Its everything I was hoping it will be. Putting aside the hype and the queue, its a great Boulangerie and we enjoyed everything we had. Sadly, it was our last day, but we would definitely return and we will in the future. Would Return.

A very popular bakery often with lines out the door, standing room only and a decent range of pastries and breads.

Croissant  buttery, flakey and reasonably priced. Light and airy with some structure.

Eclair  delicious, light, chocolatey. Sweeter side.

Worth a visit and worth the short wait. REVISED
The best boulangerie of the year.
And the master of briochs I tried all kinds they make.

Despite their flawless products, the staff knows how to remain friendly, helpful and efficient in a hectic working environment where people are desperately queuing for freshly baked bread and pastries that are undoubtedly worth queuing for. aot 2024

Oh, their croissant beats many other trendy boulangeries around the area, and the overall price is fair!

I usually avoid visiting popular or touristic bakeries in Paris, but this is an exception. I tried their brioch au sucre, brioch feuillete aux pommes and cookies. All of them are SUPERB! The cookies are crunchy, embellished with naturally scented nuts and the bittersweetness of dark chocolate. The brioch au sucre has a thin crust and a soft, buttery interior. I ate it one day after, and it didnt turn dry like many other mediocre ones given its ingredients and texture, brioch generally has a longer freshness span than leaner bread. The brioch feuillete is the most surprising one among the three. The flavour is a perfect blend of rich butter and a delicate sweetness from a bit of apple pure in the centre. Fortunately, its not so close to our place my belly and wallet must suffer otherwise. juin 2024 Not into cake, but thought I'd pay a visit here. A queue when I arrived, usually a good sign.

The cake pictured was lovely. Very tasty and beautifully presented. I can see why it's popular. Well worth a visit. Lovely staff too. This is traditional local baker. There are lines, and sometimes they set up tables to eat on the deck and sometimes they dont. But I have gone here almost everyday. It is really decently priced. I get a chocolate croissant and sometimes a baguette or sandwich and sometimes both. Lunch and a treat under 10 is always great when travelling. Wish I took photos but I almost always eat everything too quickly.

리뷰:
Wanted to try this for a while but wasnt sure if this was just a gimmick. I am happy to say that it is not! The gelato was DELICIOUS  get the basic chocolate you wont regret it. The staff are so nice, the lady behind the counter told me I can choose as many flavours as I wanted. I recommend this! Delightful presentation of the real thing gelato in Paris!

Loved my hazelnut and vanilla rose and the sweet service with which it was delivered! Please try pistachio and Coffee here!  Very good I took a detour from rue de Rivoli just to grab some gelato, and let me tell you, the gelato was fantasticbut the speed? Unbelievable! I barely had time to blink. One guy asked what I wanted, I tapped my phone to pay, and before I knew it, a girl handed me my 'medium cup, half vanilla, half pistachio.' In and out with my treat in hand in under 30 seconds! Fastest gelato run of my life! They have so many unique flavors, such as blood orange ginger, citron basil, passion fruit etc. the fruit flavors all taste natural and fresh, unlike some places they use artificial sweetener or syrup. The waffle cone was very crunchy, thick and tasty. No wonder they open so many branches

주소: 6 Rue du Pas de la Mule, 75003 Paris, France
리뷰:
During my visit to Paris, I discovered this place. One word AMAZING.

The staff is extremely helpful and caring. The pastries are to die for, and the sweets are the best in town for me. I've visited many places, from highend to lowkey, and this one stands out. Before I leave, I will definitely go back.

The coffee is great, and we took away one of the fruit breads, which was also amazing. Honestly, well done. This place is full of passion and care. Thank you for such a wonderful experience! The things  that we didnt like
1  , the coffee is absolutely horrible. Dont go there for the coffee. Its from this automatic machines and the taste is really bad.
2 the space is really small, barely 3 tables to seat
3 if you order for at there you pay a small extra surcharge
4 they handle cash and at the same time they cut the bread.. I would suggest to keep and eye on the hygiene

What we liked
1The pastries, everything was super tasty. The croissant was super crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.

2The team was super nice and extremely helpful !  

3 We bought different types of bread to take away. Amazing taste and flavor. Chausson de pomme was really good. The croissants are fresh when you come early. No line ups for me. Can't go wrong here for some great parisan bakery The best pastry that we tried in Paris. Staff were friendly and the service was quick. There are spaces to eat inside too. Amazing little patisserie. The staff were so friendly and spoke English very well. The man we spoke to took the time to explain all the pastries to us and how they were made. Not only were they beautifully made but they tasted as good as they looked. I would definitely come back.

Absolutely adorable ice cream spot! The flavors are not just delicioustheyre like a little scoop of happiness in every bite. And the best part? You get to pick from so many fun and unique flavors! Amazing gelato and good portions served. You can choose as many flavors as you want in any size order.
Staff is friendly and welcoming.
Would definitely come back for dessert here  You must try this place when you're in Montmartre! It's my second time visiting Paris and my second time having Amorino ice cream here. Despite reading many comments about unfriendly staff, I had great service. The girl who made my ice cream was so focused and turned it into a work of art. There are so many options that it's hard to choose from. I paid 5.50 for three different flavors of Amorino ice cream. Don't miss this spot and enjoy some delicious ice cream!  Amorino Gelato in Paris offers the best ice creams with natural flavors, each delicately shaped into a beautiful flower, making for a perfect presentation. It's definitely a mustvisit for gelato lovers in the city of lights! Best ice cream! A must try. The staff were very nice and there is outdoor seating.

리뷰:
Would you pay 70 for this? The cake looks nothing like the one I ordered. It looks like they threw together leftover cake trimmings, slapped some dead flowers on top, and called it a day. The photo shows a comparison of the cake I received vs the one shown on their website. Classic case of false advertising. My favorite bakery! as a big fan of red velvet, this place makes the best one so far, you can taste the cheese cream frosting and all the right ingredients, what an amazing job! whenever I come to Paris I always have to stop there and get me some, it is a pure delight!!! I Berko is my secret haven in Paris as an American living in France. I must say, they have the best Red Velvet in Paris, and I'm not exaggerating. The cake is dense yet fluffy, and the Cream Cheese flavor is authentic, comparable to the Red Velvet at the Waldorf Astoria in the U.S.  truly outstanding.

Furthermore, Berko is the pioneer of Cupcakes in Paris, with a 23year history, making them the founding figure of Parisian Cupcakes. My personal favorite is the Raspberry Velvet, and despite their small size, you can easily indulge in several at once. The Cupcake toppings are spot on, each with its own layers, combining French finesse with the relaxed texture of American desserts.

In conclusion, I personally love Berko and highly recommend it. Ive placed orders a few times for a preordered and customized cake, for several occasions which have been delicious and pretty! Their small cupcakes are an absolute delight! I tried a red velvet cupcake and a raspberry red velvet one. The cream cheese was nice but the cake was too dry to my taste. For the red coloring, I could tell from the look that it was natural, maybe beetroot, because it was more on the brickbrownish shade. But overall, it was nice. Their other cakes looked so inviting. If I pass the shop again, Ill try more.

리뷰:
This place is worth getting up early for and you should go early because the pastries go quickly. Ill definitely be back again on my next trip to Paris. The pastries are just delightful. and still tasted great after an 8 hour flight. So yum. If you are staying near the Arc de Triomphe, it is worth to visit this boulangerie. I had the jambon beurre, brioche, and rhubarb tart, and those were so delicious! I also got a free drink which is a event for buying both sandwich and dessert. Moreover, this boulangerie opens earlier and closes later than other stores. If I had known about this place earlier, I would have come to buy some bread every morning, and I wouldn't have spent my money for breakfast at the cafe near my hotel. I am grateful to staffs with beautiful smiles and hope to see U again  There are many pastry shops around Paris and so to stand out from them all, you need to be special. This place bakes baguette multiple times through out the day until they close at 8pm so you can have freshest baguette all throughout the day. We first visited at 4pm, and the baguette was warm! Softly crispy on the outside and soft and tender inside  WOW.

We were lucky to have tried the seasonal fog danish amongst countless pastores. The pastry was crispy and beautifully layered.

Don't bother with the chain pastry across the street with flashy interior. If you want baguette and pastries made traditional way without the fanfare, this is the place to go.

We visited this place Every day while we were in Paris. It is the most delicious baguette bakery in Paris!
I stayed for 2weeks in Paris and tried to have  baaguettes in many places.but BOM is the best. A nice little bakery. I came during lunchtime and it was quite busy, but they were handling it perfectly. I was served fast but with a smile and all the necessary attention. The sandwich and the croissant were tasty.

Incredibly tasty desserts, they really stand out out. Crumbly base and a sweet top, very tender and leave a very nice aftertaste.

Definitely will come again.

P.S. the place is super tiny, with just a small table by the window, so more of a togo or quick soloduo biteandrun. Fantastic approach! Their pastry creations are made with up to 65 less sugar that traditional pastries and still taste so good! A perfect destination for those with sugar related illnesses or just if you want a guilt free treat. The cheesecake is my absolute favorite, so airy and creamy pure pleasure! We tried the chocolate tart and the lemon pistachio cake. It was okay but not less sweet than a regular bakery, we were expecting something with much less sweetness considering these are low glycemic index deserts. Delicious sugarreduced pastry. Lemon was ok, berries one was underwhelming by using only plain sweetened whip cream. At the prices they charge It's hard to recommend.

I will never recommend this bakery. This is the worst bakery I have ever been to! I ordered a birthday cake. They didnt make any requirements I had offered. It looks disgusting and tastes really bad, we almost puked after eating the cake. And they asked for 100 euros for a 6 inch cake. Very conveniently located near the metro Arts et Mtiers and among the other Asian cantines and supermarkets, this patisserie is the place to be to have a quick dessert break without breaking the bank.
I took the taro bread and bubble tea, both were delicious, good quality for the price. Unfortunately they didnt have green bubble tea and did not offer bigger sized cup so I had to go for black tea based and standard sized cup, I guess to be able to have more choice of drinks it is better to arrive early. In any case I think their specialityfocus is the patisserie not so much the bubble tea business.
They also offer custom made cakes I would try that next time.
Service was good and staff were friendly. All cream pastries are always delicious. The cream is fluffy, just right not too sweet. The bread is always perfectly soft and springs back. The pork floss desserts are done with mastery, we were expecting thick layers of Mayo inside but it was sweet cream. Still delicious.

Previously tried their sausage rolls, brings back to childhood in Asia! All the cakes are made at the day! 
strawberry cake is so GOOD Best bread and pastry store with original Chinese taste in Paris! High recommended no matter where you are from. For the sweet bread, my favorite one is the pain au fromage. Super good! And for the salty ones, you must try the Roul avec porc sch. The staffs are really friendly and efficient to explain all my questions, which I appreciate a lot. Cant help going there everyday!

I would recommend getting takeaway if you can as it is about 20 percent more to eat in. You would like to try all cakes they are so tasty cant resist.
I always take a Flan and a coffee.
Make a brake after a long walk. Everything we ate here was delicious. It was our goto for breakfast and we had sandwiches for lunch several days. The only complaint is our order was missing at item a few times not surprising since we were speaking broken french and ordering a lot. The only thing that wasn't amazing was the coffee which was just soso. Staff was very friendly. Amazing service from the team. Beautiful place and very kind. The best in Chatelet and in Paris. Five start rating...l would give 6 if l could.

Highly recommended
Friendly staff , super clean
Make sure you get the pistachio and the flan I visited this place several times when I came to Paris. They have great selections of delicious Ptisserie.
The shop is very small with only two table outside to eatin. Otherwise its great for takeaway. Desserts are very special, interesting combinations of tastes, fruits, and textures. The decoration is attentively made. We tried the rhubarb rose and flan. So this is very unique place!
They take from something like 12 patisserie chef every month one dessertchocolatecake etc and sell only that so the costumer can taste from all around the best of Paris.
Great idea!
And the pistachio tart is just unbelievable, wow!!! Just go and take it!
The service is also a key when they let you know everything about the choices and help you choose The most delicious pastries we tried in Paris! Exquisite and pleasing your taste buds. We tried raspberry tart and pistachio one, raspberry is our new favorite now. Perfect sweet balance, bouquet of flavors, nice look. On the pricey side but well worth it.

리뷰: We tried several pastries this morning, their pastries and cakes are soooo delicious! Must try lemon meringue tart which has the right amount of tartness and no over powering sweet, highly recommended! The raspberry croissant is so flaky yet so moist in the inside! Simply scrumptious! A bit of a touristic version of the classic French bakery by a Korean group totally undercover and posing as an old French brand. Not bad but nothing extraordinary. Very annoying to be systematically asked he you want a coffee when you say you just want this or that.They always try to push you to buy something else which doesn't make you want to come back. In terms of french tradition, I prefer the original this asian copy... Everything was delicious!! The stuff is very kind. I tried to order in French, but they realised Im a tourist and they started to talk in English. I really appreciate that  bonus tip you have to try the almond croissant  Chain from South Korea. Good but nothing wow. Coffee fell flat. Had better baguette sandwiches from other places nearby. It is my favorite boulangerie ptisserie in Paris and has many branches all over the city. This particular branch is located behind the Thtre du Chtelet and has tables inside as well as on the sidewalk. It is worth trying the croque monsieur, the quiche lorraine and from the desserts the raspberry croissant and the Madagascar vanilla flan. We also tried macarons but they were not fresh.
