리뷰:
I went here on the 26th of July, opening Ceremony night. It was raining. My 5 year old son and I were in the area and I really wanted a coffee, so i see this place as I'm walking to my destination and I'm like let's get a coffee and a dessert while we also escape the rain. It was 525pm when I got in. I saw 3 people sitting on the table eating. I got excited seeing this place , took out my camera and even recorded it, thinking it will be a great mom son date.

I go in and we're looking what's there, my son gets excited and starts calling the lady out madame madame.  I told him not to call out like that, we will try and get a place to sit and the lady was like oh we are closed for sit in. It is 530pm now. I'm like oh are you. She said yes but you can do take out. I was like hmm I don't know I really wanted to sit and enjoy but my son was eyeing the clair and was like I want one. I was like we can go else where. I asked the lady hey do you do drinks for take away too. She goes what are you after?I was like tea or coffee. Then she proceeded to tell me ' no that's closed too now but franprix is next door' . I told her, I'm not interested in that.

I came out of the door, as I was leaving I saw the back of the sign for the shop hours, I then looked at the opening hours and it is open until 630pm. I checked on Google, I checked on their website, sure enough that's the hours. I was first of all left very shocked,  but also you kind of gaslight yourself into thinking it is not what you think it is, aka rcism or some kind of discrimination.

Imagine this, on the night of the opening night of Olympics when paris is flooded with tourists and this employee was  essentially saying no by simply looking at me.

We are big desserts and chocolate fans, and try such places wherever we travel. This being in the 17th so close to where we live, could have Been a place I'd frequent with my family and my friends. But sure enough, this is the end of it and I'll be sure to spread the word to everyone to avoid this place at all cost. If it isn't good enough for us to sit in, it isn't good enough for our money to be spent here!!!!

I'm actually upset that I bothered to spend a penny here after this really leave a horrible taste in your mouth experience.

Thank you Kevin for responding, but an apology doesn't rectify the root cause issue. I'm really curious what will be done on your part to address that this sort of thing doesn't happen again? I'm still not sure why I was discriminated because your response below proves I was indeed discriminated as you are admitting that the shop doesn't close at 530. Was I discriminated because I'm not white, or wax it that the lady thought I cannot afford the place or was it because i came in with a child? Or any other form of discrimination?

It is important for you as a business to train your employees properly in customer service and also in diversity and inclusion training especially because this happened on the opening night of the Olympics, thousands of tourists will be flocking to Paris. Your location is in a very heavy expat area plus tourists will drop by. If you'd sort of behaviour continues by your employees, it will yield significant loss to your business, which I assume you have put your heart and soul into.

Also, it was not both the ladies I talked with but just the one manning the till, dark hair, big glasses.

Thanks, I look forward to hearing from you.

I arrived at 525pm,not 550pm. As I've stated earlier. So I got lucky to visit this amazing patisserie  and more lucky to meet the ownerchef patisserie of the place.
When you enter you feel like you just got in a michelin star restaurant, every detail is on spot, clean and I love the window to the prep area.
We took salted caramel and macadamia tart that was sublime and chocolate eclair and canele that eas the best I got to taste in Paris.
Wow Don't go there! I recently visited this patisserie in Paris 17th, lured by their claim of having the best SaintHonor. Unfortunately, my experience was far from what I expected.It was for my GrandMother 94 Birthday 11th of July

The SaintHonor was terrible. The taste was off, and the cream had probably turned. Additionally, the service was equally disappointing. The staff was inattentive and unhelpful, making the overall experience unpleasant.
We reported our experience to the store , and the answer was even worse. At Patisserie KL, I found that they dismiss any form of criticism and their client service leaves much to be desired.

I do not recommend visiting this patisserie. Save your time and money by choosing a different spot for your pastry cravings. Tried their flan. Lots of puff pastry and an extremely tasty one, beautifully puffy and delicious. Sadly they dont sell a slice so you have to buy a full one 4 pers.
Tried 10 flans Bristol, Jardin sucr, tapisserie, KL, Couvreur, Mam, Jojo, Brigat, conticini, Meunier, to my taste, its the number 4 after Bristol, jardin sucre and tapisserie. For sure worth a visit Big fan of patisserie. I tried all the galette des rois this year Grolet, Herme, lignac, lenotre, michalak, Ducasse etc and I have to say the best one comes from Kevin Lacote by far. So while I was there, I tried a few goodies. The pink praline brioche is out of this world, the hazelnut cake is deliciously moist and tasty, the vanilla flan is perfectly balanced, the cannelets are probably the best in Paris, the saint honor is unbelievable. All very well structured, with an amazing crust base and the sugar on the low side which is good.
Definitely one of the top patisserie in Paris

Glad we didn't check reviews before coming here. I am surprised with low rating. I have no photos of food, had no patience to take it, it was delicious! Quiche was very good, eclair had too much cream. Apple Tartallete is perfect!! Desserts were quite delightful and the prices were okay. 리뷰:
This spot on the left bank is definitely one of the best places to indulge in Mochi, although it comes with a price tag! They serve freshly made Mochi that's wonderfully chewy, unlike the frozen ones you might find elsewhere.
I sampled four different flavors, from matcha to lemon yuzu, but the almond with orange blossom stole the show for me. The unique combination, especially during the spring season, made it the perfect treat for the moment.
While it might not become my regular haunt, it's still a great spot to pamper yourself with some delightful Japanese delicacies. Lovely mochis. The seller is so nice, very friendly, very welcoming, very passionate about the products. She explains all the flavors of mochi really well. And we really enjoy the desserts. I give 45 because its a bit expensive. Price range high per mochi, however they are fresh, gooey inside, with a large filling and delicious flavours. We got yuzu, matcha and black sesame kindly recommended by the waitress and cut them in half to share for two! The best thing is that the mochi are vegan Freshest lightest most delicious mochi. I enjoyed a black sesame one. Definitely coming back for more. Yuzu is the best! Highly recommended.

Note theres only one little seat there so its lucky to get to sit down.

But it tastes good after taking away as well

Super cute hidden gem!! Seems to be loved my locals as there was a long line but it moves quick! All the pastries and breadbased treats looked and smelled amazing!! Got a croissant and it was super buttery and flaky. Ive had better croissants but this one is deff worth the trip up and can visit while coming to MontMartre.

I wish I had a chance to try more of their goodies but highly recommend!! Every time we come to Paris, we can't resist stopping by Ptisserie Alexine. It's a must for us! Their chocolate clairs are simply delicious, and everything from the crpes to the baguettes is amazing. Each visit feels like a treat, with fresh, flavorful pastries that never disappoint. The pain au chocolate was good, but the croissants with almond and chocolate wasn't really tasty. No table just for takeaway  Love their baguette and tarte citron. Yummy! Best quiche of our lives!! Best pain au chocolat I had in Paris so far.

After a meal in the noon. We walked a lot exploring the Parisian streets.
Came across this place. It was indeed small but there was a queue.
So wanted to kill our hunger pangs and try the food there.
We ordered Churros only. Was really nice. It was made in front of us fresh. With Nutella, it was really ticking all the boxes.
We saw the crpes being prepared, but didn't go for it as had to meet someone.

5 X, all the way in all ways.

People were very friendly. Not sure if they were owners or workers. Either way, they were too good.

Overall atmosphere was too good in and around the place.
Given an opportunity, yes will definitely go there again. Good, hot, fresh crepes to go. Would have again if I'm in the area! Cheaters. Average waffles and they overcharged for a supplement speculoos. Better buy a waffle at Cafe de Beaubourg at the same price for better quality Nice churros prepared to order in fresh oil. Also good crepes. Very good churros, fried in clean oil and they used original Nutella

리뷰:
Amazing cake shop with beautifully crafted creations. We tried two of them and they were tasty but i expected a bit more flavour and character. I think next time we need to try the others. The large chocolate croissant was amazing and was more than enough to feed a family of 6! It was such a fun experience! Well located in the heart of the 7th district, this French pastry shop from the renowned Chef Philippe Conticini serve some of the best pastries in the city! The Paris Brest has won some awards as best Paris Brest in Paris and it was really good! The price is a bit high as you could expect but once in a while, it's a nice treat  Rather small shop, famous for the huge croissants. You can get it now without having to preorder. Fun idea with friends. We xame here to try the stunning croissant XXL and you can see my reel in my IG profile merceonearth
It was delicious and we kept ot 2 mote days and was nice and tasty anyway.
Price is 32 which is worth it and we did also try a praline one and it was so delicious too, definately worth it

리뷰:
Got a gift box from this place back in 2019. Have been an avid fan since then, chocolates are very fresh and very delicious.

The lady was very attentive and welcoming. Helped us find the specific type that we were looking for and added a small box as a gift in our bag. I wish we could buy their chocolate in the US too! Pretty packaging. Candies are not the best. But I still buy them as souvenirs. The Japanese staff there spoke French whole time when I asked a very simple question in English. It would have been nice if at least a little effort had been made to use basic English so that foreign visitors like me could understand what she said because she seemed she fully understood English. There arent enough good things to say about this shop. The products are top quality, of course, and they are the perfect gift as they represent so well the history of confectionery in Paris. The most impressive however is the quality of the service. Every time I have gone in to this store in the last two years, I am greeted with a smile and helpful advice. I recently requested a large order, and the Boissier representative had a bag prepared and waiting for me upon my return. Incredibly thoughtful! Thank you. I saw it online and the candy and cans were cute, so I decided to visit.

I bought chocolate coated with sugar and candies with syrup inside.
Both the container and the paper bag are very cute and I am satisfied!
At the end, I got a piece of candy to taste.
It was delicious and I can't wait to give it to a friend.

When I told them about the trouble I had on my trip, the Japanese staff were very kind and helpful. thank you very much. This is a store with really friendly clerks. The staff explains the products in detail and helps you taste them. The store was pretty, and the candy I bought here was delicious. I want to visit again next time.

리뷰:
Delicious aromas greet you when you walk in. Lots of variety from breads to pasteries to desserts, all very affordable. Definitely worth a visit if you're looking for a great bakery near the Eiffel Tower. BEAUTIFUL CAFE IN THE HEART OF PARIS

 If you are in the area, this is a beautiful bakery to visit. The staff are friendly, the pasties and delicious and it is seriously affordable!

We ordered a baguette and a croissant as tourists and they were so tasty and absolutely to die for It is one of the most beautiful cafes near the street heading to the Eiffel Tower. It includes a variety of delicious French baked goods. I very much enjoyed this beautiful and distinguished cafe by sitting in it for breakfast. I picked up assorted baked goods for breakfast for myself and my spouse and we both agreed that the quality was simply lacking. Beautiful presentation at the boulangerie, but the food tasted like it was leftover from the day prior. Not fresh tasting, and a sad reminder that I should have returned to La Parisienne across the street. Comparatively, more expensive than La Parisienne as well. The orange juice was good, but didn't make up for the lackluster food. While there are many superior options for breakfast and baked goods on Rue St Dominique, if you have to come here, I do recommend the moelleux chocolate with salted caramel and the orange juice. Otherwise, skip this place and head over to the far superior La Parisienne, a better treat for your bouche and pocketbook. Stopped by Liberte while walking to other activities and picked up snacks, coffee, and a ham sandwich. Everything was absolutely delicious and well priced. Service was fast as well. Tasty spot!

리뷰: So happy with my chocolate and vanilla birthday cake! I got exactly what I hoped for. The cake was delicious and spongy and just the right amount of chocolate, the buttercream was great and the presentation too. Highly recommend as I know no other place like it in Paris! Clove Bakery made us an amazing three tier wedding cake  vanilla, carrot and chocolate. Not only was it gorgeous, elegant and refined to look at  but absolutely delicious. They were super easy to deal with and communication was smooth and efficient. Id 100 recommend if you want a more Anglosaxon cake for your big day  grand merci ! This is a fantastic American bakery. Everything we ordered was fresh, moist and baked to perfection. The frosting very important was legit. Being an expat I appreciate this bakery so much. Don't get me wrong, I love the boulangerie and patisseries here in Paris but I do miss these types of treats and desserts. Highly recommend! So happy that I found this bakery.  I needed an American cake and not being a baker and far from achieving anything in baking , I was so relieved that Stoney Clove had one cake left.  Red Velvet!  Exactly what I needed. I also purchased oatmeal raisin cookies as well.  Everything was delicious.  It's a tiny place and the ladies hustle to get their goodies out. Love this place, I'll definitely be going back and will also order in advance. In a city where classic ptisserie is what people are mainly seeking, I often find myself yearning for classic American treats like cupcakes, pies and cakes. You would think that the French bakers could easily make something as simple as a cupcake. They have tried many times but they get it totally wrong and dont even come close. They also dont understand the simplicity and beauty of  the fruit pie. I felt hopeless for a really long time that I could enjoy these American ptisserie classics that are overshadowed by the French ones. Then I happened to stumble upon Stoney Clove Bakery. Not only did they have the cakes, pies, brownies, and all the indulgences I missed so much, but they are next level amazing in what they make. When I have surprised French people with something like a red velvet cupcake, you see that look in their eye when they take their first bite. Its their realization that they have never really had a cupcake before and this is what we Americans were trying to tell them about. Stoney Clove Bakery is the legit real deal and they may be small but what they make is truly magic. Red Velvet cake is my favorite, but in the summertime the pies are heavenly and a great addition to a picnic.

리뷰: I recently visited Tout Autour Du Pain, a bakery in Paris that I found online, and it truly lived up to its high rating. The croissant was one of the best I've ever hadextremely buttery and perfectly flaky. Each bite was a delightful experience. If you're in Paris and looking for an exceptional croissant, I highly recommend Tout Autour Du Pain. Family owned boulangerie. Very good flavor baguettes with simple ingredients. Baguettes a bit chewy.  Other petite pain are really good and flavorful too, like fig and nuts pain. Agreed with other comments that bees fly around the pastries. The absolute BEST croissant  and pastry. It was fresh, delicious, warm n perfect!!!  Wonder why the ratings are not better here. Our absolute favorite bakery in France! Favorites are fruit tarts and baguettes. This are the best croissants I ever ate in my life. They are crispy on the outside, slightly caramelized at the bottom and fluffy on the inside. When they come straight out of the oven and still warm it is even better. The staff is also very friendly and tries it's best with non French speaking customers. The Eclair I had was also very good.

The raspberry  fig tart is fantastic. Highly recommend! The workers here were very kind and patient with me while I chose. There were a ton of selections and difficult to choose, and the ladies here were very sweet while I made my selection. I would return again and highly recommend this bakery. The croissants are very good with crispy bites. Different drinks are available which is nice. However the staff who served me was a bit rude to me maybe because I dont speak good French? But the place is super touristy though. Other staffs seem nice though there is a bit of waiting  line but the line goes fast. Top rated, but very touristy. The line goes quickly and they have many options from sweet pastries to savory. The bacon and cheese croissant was good after they warm it in the oven. My friend ordered a passion fruit dessert that was phenomenal. The place can get crowded and the staff overwhelmed. There were many tourists inside when we went on a Tuesday morning in August. YUM!. my god  the size of the croissants.  Amazingly good. And the girls were so nice here. Pain au chocolate was also very good. The only thing is the coffe comes out of a machine and not made with an espresso machine. A few tables to sit .but one of the best and freshest pastries here. Great spot to grab a quick sandwich or pastry! Had the vegetarian sandwich and pain praline and both we delicious. Many pastry choices to choose from.

Slight edit they offer a free croissant and espresso upon a return visit if you leave a review but getting them to honor it is a bit tough and staff was a bit rude. Hesitant to let me sit there even though I ordered something additional which I paid for. Everything was good but wouldnt go back because of this

주소: 16 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75007 Paris, France
리뷰:
We tried two of the most hyped things on the menu, the tart syrop and the choux with vanilla cream. To be honest, both were quite overpriced and pretty underwhelming. The croissant, on the other hand, was really good. The right amount of juiciness, crunchiness, flakiness, and an intense buttery flavor. It almost seemed like the flour was a mix of wholemeal and regular, not only white flour, which gave it a nice touch.

The service could also be improved with just a smile on the cashier's face. The coffee was good for Parisian standards, but again, quite pricey. I guess the prices reflect the neighborhood, but overall expected more from the high price and the very good reviews. There are many better patisseries and boulangeries in Paris for a much lower price. A cozy and minimalist place serving sublime pastries and good coffee. simplicity refined with details and atmosphere. I tried the croissant and the fames tartlet with maple syrup and cream. Both cakes were delicious  although the tartlet required alternating black coffee and water due to its sweetness. I recommend this place near the Eiffel Tower, worth visiting and stopping for a second and take a breath Delicious coffee and fresh food. Service is really friendly. Definitely I will come back in my next trip. Delicious and quaint. Extremely happy to have chosen this location, with a much bigger sitting area to have our morning breakfast. The chocolate tart is divine and extremely well balanced. Would visit again! Went twice to Tapisserie 7eme, the viennoiseries never disappoints if you like it not super buttery. The croissant, pain au chocolat and the danish are delicious and you can see the layers crumble with each bite. Eggs are super bio and for my surprise I found herbs inside of one of them, I guess maybe some people may be bothered with this but for me it was ok. The chouquette  la flouve was a DREAM, definitely not an ordinary chou. Bad point is not petfriendly. I was with my dog and even water was denied for her. So I had a quick brunch cause I felt my dog wasnt welcome.

리뷰: This is a really sweet nook on a very green street with a florist next door and a park across the narrow street so you are immersed in greenery and then the cafe is brightly painted in white and green with a white and green awning. Very good coffees and tasty apple care and kind service. Looks like they get very busy so be patient. Only had a hot chocolate. Good, mellow taste. Fits in well with outdoor setting. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Great little place, seemed very busy at lunchtime so I came back in the afternoon, there was still a good atmosphere but it was less hectic. The coffee was very good, the tarte aux fruits even better. Lovely setting, opposite a park So fresh  delicious! Best salads in the city. We ate lunch here twice on our recent visit to Paris, we loved it so much. Very nice, quaint  lovely location as well. Cant wait to return on my next trip. My husband and I shared breakfast at Grace Cafe on our 20th Anniversary. The food was delicious and we enjoyed sitting outside along the park. We took the waiters suggestion on ordering and we were very satisfied.

Lovely choice of savoury and sweet options. The sweets are very well curated, plated well and are delicately sweet , not overpowering or heavy which is something i really loved about their desserts . Servers are friendly n can speak good English.  I wish had more days to come back n keep eating here, definitely enjoyed every bite of it!  A paradise for vegans ! Absolutely amazing food! This is by far the best bakery I have ever been to and it is all completely vegan! We had both breakfast and lunch here. I thought the pistachio cookie was delicious and my sandwich was insane! You have to try this bakery. A must try!! The Monkey cookie 4 and Chimp cookie 4 are delicious and unique. The Bostock 3 tastes good but dry inside. The cinnamon roll 3 and babka 12 are disastrous and absolutely dont match the price. Nonetheless, the worst is the male staffs attitude. He looked at us without uttering a word when we said bonjour to him. He even seemed reluctant to pick the bread for us. We wish him the best and a job he could be passionate about. Best vegan cafe Ive seen so far in Paris. The croissant was really really good, and the prices along all products seemed lower than average! Ill have a couple sandwiches for takeaway before leaving for lunch later, they looked really good. Amazing patisserie, all 100 vegan. We had a baguette,just a plain ham a pickle, nothing to amazing filling wise but the bread was lush.
The plain croissant was perfect too.
We also had an Almond croissant and pain aux raisins which were both delicious, and we also had chimp cookies, once again  these also tasted amazing.

리뷰:
Galleries Lafayette is a shopper's paradise! From wine and  champagne to gourmet food.Delightful pastries, and a variety of restaurants. The upscale stores offer luxury experience the most exclusive latest fashion.  Also beautiful place for photos. You make reservations to have private sessions and the breathtaking views from the terrace. Such a cute atmosphere.
Yummy desserts that I wish I had the stomach capacity to eat all.
Also had some food options for those who aren't there for sweets.
Would like to come back again! Last time we were in Paris, my then partner proposed marriage with a wonderful bottle of Champagne, under the Eiffel Tower. This time we returned as wife and husband, so only appropriate that we shopped at Galleries Lafayette Le Gourmet!
It was a paradise for fine wine, Champagne and food lovers.. undoubtedly the premier location in the world. We spent well over an hour wandering from section to section on each level discovering new brands and old of many wines and foods. Le Cave of older wines and the Champagne section stood out as unbelievable!
Thank you Galeries Layayette Le Gourmet! My word!  what a place!! I was lucky enough to stay next door and believe me, I visited everyday!  There is so much to see and sample it was truly an unbelievable experience. I brought home macarons, chocolate and cheese and enjoyed the baked goods every morning.  A place to visit for sure!  Be sure to visit Mosogo for a great dining experience  sweet potato fries are to die for! Definitely a Parisian staple that one should check out and enjoy the gourmet food, deserts and drinks. Quite a few options, prices are reasonable for Paris, quality is good and ambience is 
Galeries Lafayette Le Gourmet didnt disappoint! Macarons, puff pastries  and eclairs are musttry

주소: 2 Seorae-ro 5-gil, Seocho District, Seoul, South Korea
리뷰:
Had brunch and coffee here. The soup bread was delicious, the mushroom pasta smelt delicious. Pastries also very good. Upstairs lots of seating, felt more like a restaurant than a cafe. Ground floor is the main pastry shop. The basement level specialises in cake and chocolate. Would give it a 4.5 overall if that was an option. Lots to choose from and good options for eating in or out. Great place for brunch  Another reviewer said the food is 5 stars and service is 0 stars, and I completely agree!

The mushroom crepe brunch and mushroom soup bread bowl brunch taste phenomenal. Other bakery items are yummy and the visuals all around are great.

But both times Ive been here, the staff have been unfriendly. When I asked which brunch item was most popular, the cashier said its up to you and provided no help at all. When I asked about the difference between two similar looking pastries, the staff member answered with immense attitude as if I was already supposed to know. Sorry Im not a French baker and sorry for burdening you with the horrific task of a simple explanation! All staff interact with you with a deadpan face, or barely any eye contact at all.

Overall, youll enjoy this place if you only eat and avoid any staff interaction. I visited this place to eat Korean style bingsu with my kids.
Valet parking is available here, and there are several tables where you can eat purchased bread, desserts, and brunch dish and the facilities are good!
We ordered Mango Bingsu and it was delicious!
Also, this place is very delicious like local French bread!!!
If you are staying or visiting Seoul, I highly recommend this place! Incredible quality considering this is a chain bakery. This location is undoubtedly the best in everythingbaked goods, pastries, sandwiches, salads, and atmosphere. They offer a variety of menu items as well available only until 6pm, so suitable for anyone. Great bakery and nice brunch place.

Delicious fusion French pastries and cafe offerings.

This place has very well crafted delicate foods. Everything I tried was delicious, had an excellent texture and was beautiful.

Likely the very best place for French Pastries for over 1,000 miles.

Great decor for a small cafepatisserie. Amazing croissants! They are very expensive 67 each, but are very good. I tried their Cookie Croissant and Spinach and Feta Croissant, and both were amazing especially the latter, which came out fresh and very creamy. They also have chairs and tables and WiFi in case you want to hang around and work. I came here for the first time today because I heard they sold macarons here and had to try them and grabbed a few other things.

The Strawberry tart was amazing  I literally ate it in the parking lot like a savage because I just couldn't wait.

The marshmallow cookie my husband got was good.

The macarons on the other hand  were extremely disappointing and concerning. Out of the 12, about 9 tasted like floor cleaner. I'm not sure if the oven they were baked in or the showcase were recently cleaned with something strong but that absolutely should not stick to the outer layer of the product. 24 down the drain  besides tasting like fabuloso I honestly couldn't tell them apart due to a lack of individual flavor. The place is realllllllly cute and they have great service. I bought Macaroons and a Sandwich. I think the only issue is that the Tuna sandwich was 10.50, pretty pricey and kind of a bummer. It was super soggy, squished down, and hard to hold without it falling apart... I also spent 24 bucks on 12 Macaroons. Hands down one of the best bakeries in the island.

Yes, it was delicious and it gets paaacked at times! I was there for a while and at least three times, one around lunch then maybe 2 pm and again around 4 it was extremely packed! Which I think its good right? Good places have lots of people coming to buy. But be aware they might not have tables available and you might have to wait 1520 min.

Lox bagel was 11.75 its small
Strawberry Machiato 67

I believe if you  are traveling in a budget this might not be the place you frequent the most bc of the prices but it worth to come at least once! Plus they have WiFi and omg its so hard to find a coffee shop with WiFi in Guam.

The bakery is a family owned business 
The owner is actually French! Probably thats why the pastries are so good!

It was amazing and the lady who made it for me did a great job, a creamy and tasty Capuccino. Ill come back on my next trips. Super nice attention too. Sweet and savoury small bites to get with your specialty coffee a Marzocco, your usual flat white, espresso a safe bet for good coffee! honestly, it's kind of hard to find a good coffee in Paris, but their filter was the best from all that i've had here.
also, baristas are really nice and this place is such a vibe! Cute little cafe in Paris for coffee and matcha latte, they have a limited space to sit inside but reasonably enough seating space outside to sit and enjoy your drink and work on your laptop, its also on a quiet street. They also have some sweets with a selection of non dairy products which are really tasty. Dont miss trying it. The stuff were sweet and kind. Definitely going back whenever Im in Paris. Best coffee in France!
Australians looking for a good coffee, found Noir and the lovely gentleman saw us and said "flat white!?" And then made it happen.

The decor is on point, the service is second to none and the coffee is outstanding.  Absolutely 5 star!

리뷰: I came with my grandmother 15 years ago. The same flavours prevail. The strudel was amazing and the bureka too. Wonderful place! Brilliant service! Staff were helpful and dedicated. A must vist! One of the few kosher Paris restaurants actually only one we found to offer a sit down Americanlike breakfast with a French spin. Hot eggs made as a French omelette, gratin, breads, etc. Next time Im going to get the eggs on croissant which looked great. Very nice service. I come here often as its one of my favorite bakeries ever. Im in love with their strudels, but especially their poppy seed one! I also love their baklava and basically everything they sell. Ive never been disappointed. I cant wait until everything opens up back up so my friends and family and I can hang out here again. Not the best bakery experience in Paris. If you want a great croissant, avoid this place. We didnt even bother finishing it. Theres a variety of other pastriesdishes to try, but I found it to be overpriced and the other pastry we had chocolate babka was way too sweet. Ill give them two stars for a good cappuccino and the baked pastries with potatocheese and spinachcheese were okay.

리뷰:
The only place I will ever go for milk tea in Paris. This place is so good, the ratio of tea and milk is just perfect. Tea is very fragrant and the boba is good. The interior of the place gives you of Japanese vibe. The staffs are always nice and friendly to me, very helpful. There a few options of Olong tea and she explained to me very clearly about what to pick. Can be on the expensive side for a boba but so worth it. Definitely recommend this place. Best milk tea in Paris Honestly couldnt tell you exactly what about this place made us want to go back four times while we were in Paris for a week. We randomly waltzed in here and the aesthetics inside and the drinks were perfect. Highly recommend the lavender milk tea and the rose or honey latte!! Their lavender bubble tea is amazing as always. I like its taste soo much even though its a bit pricey 8.3. But I prefer the Palais Royal location, here the interior is smaller and there are just stools. Cellular internet was not working inside, but its good that they had wifi. Was here a few times with a friend, the place is not crowded and has a great and friendly atmosphere, the employees are always nice and friendly and charged our phones when we asked them. As for food, 7 eur can be a bit of a high price for a drink, but the place provides a great variety of different teas and different types of boba, while you are also able to choose the sweetness and the amount of ice in your drink, which is a great addition. Would recommend Overrated bubble tea place, I ordered the Taro Milk Tea with slight sugar.

Very disappointed of the drink, the drink doesn't have any taste of Taro and it seems like it is 120 sugar added in it. Also, the tea flavour is super blend.

리뷰: Got the recommendation from a local friend living nearby. Personally, I would say the almond croissant and red bean butter bread are my top choices. Theyre very rich in flavor but not sugary like the some other ones. If you like the mild sweetness, this place suits you. However, coffee is on the okey side. Regardless, still worth a visit  Food is so very delicious and the staff was so friendly, but if you eat in there are only about six seats. Delicious!  There were only 3 chairs to sit. I liked the galette and the apple pie best! The almond croissant which is the best menu was less tasty than I expected ! The sliced milk bread was also tasty and soft!! This place would be the musttovisit place to me if I visit around there. Superb! Some of the best baked goods ive had in seoul. I think it would be nice if they had a trash can  water available. THe croissants are amazingly baked, crispy and soft inside. chocolate, almonds, plain ones and other kinds of pastries are quite exceptional here. I like to visit them whenever I visit Seoul. My mustvisit place for a bite of croissants. Why don't you join me? heard the owners have learned how to make pastries when they were in Australia. Aussie pastries you encounter in Seoul.

리뷰: My experience at Samsun, a traditional Korean restaurant, was quite satisfying. We opted for the lunch set, which proved to be worth the price. While the flavors leaned slightly towards the sweet side, the overall dining experience was enjoyable. The dishes were wellprepared and provided a glimpse into authentic Korean cuisine. If you're looking for a taste of Korea in a cozy setting, Samsun is definitely worth a visit. I really like Korean cuisine, I tasted it for the first time, it was amazing! I like your restaurant. The food is very tasty, that's why I give it 5 stars!! Thank you Our family was determined to visit the restaurant during our stay in Paris because of its high ratings.  It did not disappoint!  Everything we ordered was delicious and satiated our craving for authentic Korean food.  We also loved the modern atmosphere. If in Paris this Korean place is a must. Beautifully and simply designed, great helpful staff that can leave you having a great experience dining. The food is mouthwatering with a great selection of main meals, and barbecue. Highly recommended I am very impressed with the interior and the plating. I could tell the owner made a sincere investment on the experience for customers at a traditional Korean restaurant. I could see minor tweaks on the taste but the overall quality and the taste was still above my expectations. I would visit here multiple times during my 1 week visit in Paris. I personally dont recommend desserts in the picture though.

Place is welldecorated and staff is polite, but takes a while to get your food. Some dishes were tasty, but they are not made fresh, rather than reheated in the ovenmicrowave, which doesnt seem right. If you come, order bibimbap to ensure food is hot, as our bulgogi was quite cold even after the reheat. Spicy squid was very tasty. Unbelievably good! Staff is wonderful, food is delicious, full in flavor, looks and sounds yeah amazing. If you order Seafood BIBIMBAP, you will not be dissapointed. It's not pricey as well. And food came really quickly! Good Korean, served in stylish dishes and a modern and cozy setting. The food is nothing exceptional, but quality is good and price is very reasonable. A great place for a quick lunch around the Opera area More of a traiteur than a restaurant. Most of the food are preprepared and either served cold or heated by microwaveoven. Lunch menu from 1319 euro. Ravioli is ridiculously small. Good for a quite bite if shopping or visiting in the neighborhood. Not a place for a gourmet experience. The place is clean and look appetizing from outside. But once we have ordered our meal, just discovered that its not done freshly, most are microwave food! I wont recommend this place if you are expecting a freshly cook meal. the bibimbap was ok because it was done freshly and not microwave. Everything else was, you can see them putting it in the microwave.

Amazing place with amazing food with good prices. Def recommend! We ordered vegan soup and chicken noodles and both were amazing! Big portions and good taste.
There were also vegan noodles!

Also food came out super fast! With those prices and taste I wish I could visit this place every day. I came to Paris to try French food. However, I didnt realize I stay in a Airbnb that are surrounded by Chinese food. As somebody who was 100 made in China, I cannot believe how delicious the beef noodle soup is. A brought me back to the college days back in Shanghai. We did not have this delicious beef noodles. Soup backing Seattle United States. Love. Large portions and quick service. We got the spicy beef and vegan soups...both great! We also had edamame to start and vanilla mochi for dessert. Recommend if you're looking for a quick and easy dinner option. Fresh handmade noodles and dumplings in large portions, and most importantly, delicious. What more could you ask for Fav asian restaurant. The dumplings are to die for. Also love the fried chicken curry and noodles with fried chicken as well. Been there 4 times. Very quick turnaround and good prices.

리뷰:
One of the best restaurants in Paris! The onion soup was so delicious, Im usually not into onions but their onion soup was SO GOOD! and the fish and crme brle were super tasty. The owner is friendly, funny, and knows his wine well. Highly recommend this place for great food and awesome service! Stumbled on this gem. This place is what makes Paris so special.  Small restaurant with attentive owner and staff.  Nice atmosphere. I had wonderful onion soup and lamb with a reduction sauce. Very well executed.  So good I'm coming back tomorrow. They are very helpful to make the reservation on the day. We had snails and onion soup for starter, duck confit and lamp for main, poached pear with salted caramel ice cream for dessert. All are delicious and the poached pear is absolutely a star!! One of the best meals that we had in Paris. We had an Aperol spritz with onion soup and escargot. For mains, we had the salmon and duck breast accompanied by cremant from the Loire. For dessert, we shared the profiteroles. Everything was delicious and the service was attentive. My one of favorite French restaurants!

I brought many of my friends and all of them loved here whenever I brought them.

Most of their dishes are good including starters, main dishes and desserts.

Highly recommended!

We found this great Korean place near Montparnasse, and we were happy we stopped by. With plates going for 11 or even 9 on take away, we ended up going for the starters  main dish menu for 13,50 . It was a great choice. Not only it was a great deal, but the food was delicious be really filling. Tried this place through Uber Eats and selected the menu that included chicken wings and kimchi Jjigae soup. The flavors were good, though I had higher expectations for the amount of meat in the soup. On the positive side, the service was quick. Ive been there twice and will come back for sure. Its a nice place for a group of friends. You can have tasty Korean dishes at a reasonable prices. The staff is friendly. The place is nice and clean. Dont miss their sweets. Theyre really really good! Clean no nonsense Korean restaurant. Had lunch there quite copious and amazingly economical. Found this Korean Restaurant while walking around, quite nice Korean Fusion Food.
I tried the bimbimbap with soy sauce, not the red sauce as usual.
Also very nice hospitality from the Nepal guy. Thanks

Very tasty korean cuisine with a lot of options. Only issue is the outdoor kitchen ventilator that leads the air to the terrace area inside the tent, so our clothes smelled like fried chicken for a couple of days  Worst japchae ever! The place is super tiny, service was quick on the beginning, and then weve been quite ignored. My drink was like a still water with alcohol. Completely not enjoyable, high hopes, zero satisfaction. We came to have dessert in this cute korean shop but we were not able to have dessert if we dont order a savoury dish which we did but we were full from our other meal. I think they could leave us just have dessert as there where space in the restaurant to sit.

Food is great though! Bonpot is a great AsianKorean option in the middle of Paris, in the Opera area. They don't have an extensive menu but the items they have are really good. And they may serve the cutest Bingsu with pink ice cream teddy bear on top.
The space is really tiny so be prepared to wait when it's busy. My favorite at lunch time especially the guy with mix yellow and black hair who served at lunch time, i come back everytime because of him Everything is on the top.

주소: 47 Quai des Grands Augustins, 75006 Paris, France
리뷰:
Authentic Vietnamese Comfort Food in Paris  I had a delightful dinner at ChiHai Restaurant in Paris, a Vietnamese gem. I tried the beef pho and iced milk tea, along with the grilled chicken. The beef pho was incredibly comforting, with a simple yet flavourful broth that reminded me of authentic Vietnamese pho. The fact that the owner is Vietnamese added to the authenticity.

My friend had the chicken pho, which looked just as delicious, and I am eager to try it next time. The milk tea, with its popping boba, was a refreshing and fun treat. I will definitely be back for more! Highly recommended for anyone craving genuine Vietnamese flavours in Paris. The pho at this restaurant features a light, clear broth thats low in oil, making it ideal for healthconscious diners. The grilled pork with vermicelli is not only visually appealing but also perfectly seasoned. The milk tea is pleasantly mild in sweetness. As for the mango sticky rice, the rice is soft, warm, and chewy, with perfectly ripe mango slices covered in a layer of mango jam. Stumbled across this place after the Lourve. The food was amazing. Customer service was amazing. I tried my best to speak French and they were very helpful If you're craving a comforting bowl of Pho and a taste of Vietnamese hospitality, this newly opened restaurant is just the spot. The ambiance is welcoming, underscored by the warmth and friendliness of the owner who makes every guest feel like family. Ideal for a quick, satisfying meal, the restaurant offers a cozy setting to enjoy authentic Vietnamese flavors. I love this spot and its lovely owner! As a Vietnamese, I can say the food is authentic and delicious. I had bo bun and it was so good I easily finished the whole plate.
Also, I was traveling solo but the sweet and beautiful owner was really warm to me and it felt like I was hanging with my sweet auntie
Highly recommended!

리뷰:
I was checking to have a meal at Paris, then find here.
I was with some of my guests of tour to have dinner, it was quite big party but we were lucky to take seats soon.
Foods were very tasty and not expensive compared to other restaurants around this area.Menus are simple so easy to translate to them.
Staffs were very friendly and helpful.
I definitely suggest to my guests and go back again.
Thank you very much Hidden gem near Opera! They only have lunch combos, but the food is amazing! We tried onion soup and snails for appetizers, both were very good. For main we ordered beef burginon and duck. Duck breast was out of this world, best I have tried so far. Service was efficient and proactive. Overall 910 Cute looking from the outside, but inside quite small, the food was average, nothing special and lacked flavor. The portions were quite small and we were hungry at the end. While waiting for the toilet, I saw a mouse Had a delightful evening at Lou Cantou! The ambiance was cozy and inviting, perfect for a romantic dinner. The food was exquisite, with fresh, flavorful ingredients and beautifully presented dishes. The service was impeccable  our waiter was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. Highly recommend Lou Cantou for an unforgettable dining experience in Paris. Authentic french food in a simple, cozy restaurant with amazing staff. The ambience is very old world with tables crammed against each other that you almost feel like youre dining with the neighbours. Foodwise you wont be blown away by the quality, dont expect a wow factor here but then again the prices make up for it! Highly recommended especially for lunch if youre shopping in the area as its really close to Galeries Lafayette.

리뷰:
1010 would go everyday if I lived here ! We already know what we wanted and got served in 2 minutes. The people here are friendly and helpful. The shop seems small but isn't ! It's so cosy everything about it is great. Feels like home. Let me put you all on my FAVOURITE korean restaurant. Little seoul is a small cozy restaurant which serves the best kimchi jjigae in town! I tried it for the first time last summer and after that i always find myself coming back to it. Yall can see in the photo took on different days, my order always includes kimchi jjigae which is a traditional korean kimchi soupe with porc slices served boiling hot with rice and accompanied with 3 different side dishes.
For my vegetarian friends, you can ask them to not put porc in your soup and dont worry it tastes exactly the samewith and without meat
I have came to this restaurant for around 89 times now i think , during several different occasions, sometimes with my friends,sometimes with my relatives and mostly alone. I always recommend them this restaurant and this dish specifically when it rains, you know you are going to have the best hot meal of your life there!

If i have to choose only one restaurant for the rest of my life, it would be this one!I feel like this review might have sound to you like a paid promotion but trust me its all my honest opinion. At this point they should ring me up to for being a loyal customer 

P.s   dont hesitate to go alone if your friends cant go with youas an introvert, i assure you that the owner and the workers are super friendly and nice and the place is very comfy. Bonne apptit  Most delicious Korean food I've ever had. Portions were a nice size, staff was friendly. Food is definitely spicy, so be warned. They had a good variety of dishes, and I'm definitely coming back to try some others. I recommend the ros tteokbokki and the kimchi ramen, though you really can't go wrong! A small Korean restaurant but always full of customers.  The owner and staff are all very friendly.  I ate kimbap and I love it!!  The chicken dish was a bit too sweet for my taste.  Anyway, this is a good place to share with friends!!  I will definitely be back  This is the worst spicy pork I ever had in my life.. the rice covered by the oil its not possible to eat!

리뷰:
TLDR A perfect Parisian dining experience  great staff, cozy atmosphere, excellent French food.

The long version  The staff here are exceptionally friendly, and although they speak perfect English, they were very patient speaking in French with me. Food is traditional French done to perfection  surprisingly, a standout bulgur salad with artichokes starter followed by the duck and finished with a todiefor chocolate mousse. We went here for dinner. The restaurant is small, and it has a warm atmosphere. It is preferable to make a reservation in order to assure you have a place. The service was great and fast and the food was really good. Recommend if you want to eat some french cuisine. Just left this place. Wow what an incredible experience. The food is beyond amazing, the service is incredible and the ambiance is beautiful. The two guys working today in the front work so hard to make everyone have an amazing experience. The next time we visit Paris, this place will be one of our retuning places for sure. Merci!! I always love going to Mademoiselle, for tasty French cuisine in a quiet terrasse. Everything was good, with good portions and very good service.with maybe a couple caveat the potatoes coming with the beef tartare were kind of cold, and the chimichurri  coming with the other dish was basic. Special mention for the large decadent mascarpone cream that came with the dessert. I accidentally booked the wrong restaurant and Im so happy I did!!! The food here was exceptionally good. Our party had the duck, fillet steak and risotto  each dish was absolutely delicious. The waiter was also very friendly, and spoke to us in perfect English when he saw we were struggling in French. We were also the only group with kids definitely more a restaurant for adults  a date but the staff treated us very kindly. Thank you Chez Mademoiselle team  you were all lovely and the meal was a highlight of our 3 days in Paris. I will be back!

They have many sets to choose or you can order what you want separately. Food tastes delicious but if you're not a big eater I recommend to order separately because the food is a lot. I order mango juice and it comes with a bottle like that. So it tastes really nice Just saw them on google maps and wanted to try bingsu. They do have interesting menus. We were greeted with "I don't speak English" which was the lamest joke I've ever heard. Obviously he can. We just wanted to try some food here and there because we were not big eaters and don't wanna waste leftovers. The set menu looks interesting, but it's just strictly for 1 person only No sharing! Okay If that's the policy. We were told to order 1 meal per person. He's quite too pushy and seems annoyed too. Which annoyed me as well.  I think they're not fond of tourists.
The chicken is okay some were hard. Tteokbokki serving is 14? Wow I think that's quite a lot for something like streetfood. It was good but 10 would be reasonable. That's just prolly 23 in korea  7 in Germany, but 14 in Paris!? But when I saw all the staff I understood why. Other food we ordered is price reasonable. I would give 5stars for the bingsu  Even the one I tried in Korea was not as good. Came here for dinner a little earlier than what the French normally do and was decently busy. Ordered a set and it was really good and also good value. I liked everything that I got. It started to get busy once I was leaving though Absolutely great Korean cuisine! Great place to enjoy in Paris, authentic kimbap and fried chicken served with a lunch set. Definitely worth the wait. The best Korean food compared to the ones in London. But their chocolate fondant was meh tho.

Came here a few times, the decor is very cute and feels like being in a kdrama. The stools are actually comfortable. The food is very good and staff is friendly. Its good for people that want to eat alone since they have counter seating. Gets really crowded shortly after opening. We ordered two portions of chicken The Korean Fried and the spicy one. The classical one was pretty bland and slightly underwhelming, although the crisp was very nice. For the spicy one it just did not our taste, while it was not bad. The sides were pretty good and delicious. We got 2 portions of fried chicken with 2 portions of rice and not hungry afterwards. Solid fried Korean chicken. The spicy is extremely not spicy at all, so Id recommend getting the extra spicy sauce. Im a Caucasian from New York whom loves fried chicken and enjoys medium level spiciness and the mild was literally nothing. But staff was friendly and Id def come back next time Im in the mood for some Korean in Paris. The food was good, the staff were nice, and the atmosphere was amazing.
As many people were talking, it was noisy but yk in a good way, it's perfect to go with your friends.
But it's quite expensive. food came pretty fast and it was very very good. chicken was tender and crispy and the sauce was really good. would def come again! we just ordered 3 menus and it was enough for the three of us.

I think it's more appropriate to buy takeaway because the space is very small, so the smell of fried oil will make you feel sick if you sit back and eat. The shop owner is friendly and the corndog is pretty good! Sweet lady in my short trip in Paris definitely recommend everyone to go and try her food!!!!!!! The owner is very kind and beautiful...hahaha   and the food is delicious. The hot dogs and chicken were especially tasty. Absolute perfection. Little small place, enough for 4 people, the corndogs are amazing for 6 tho I'd rather not eat half cheese half sausage, it would be better if i can eat both at the same time.
The lady was very nice and fast
The sauces are pretty tasty
The place itself can be better by redecorating a bit but its good for the price An amazing spot for a quick snack. Very delicious ! The corndog is made right in front of you and the atmosphere is calm.

One of the oldest Korean restaurants in central Paris. Their signature fried chicken is tasty, and does it's fried dumplings. nice decor with traditional calligraphy and wooden masks. My friend and I had a really good experience. The prices are more than reasonable, the food is delicious and the staff super nice. Will gladly come back to try the other dishes. Came here for jjajangmyeon especially, but had the barbecue too which was quite delicious. Recommended for authentic korean flavors! No to go though... unfortunately  i could not bring home to share with my friend Perfect Korean food
Traditional, great taste. Delightful Korean restaurant with very friendly staff, great food and tasty desserts

Cute little place. Was really craving Asian food and found this little place. Can be for takeaway or dine in! They had a lot of bay marine stuff that was reheated if you wanted but we decided on the pho and have to say the pho was pretty good. Broth was light and noodles and beef were good. Didnt try anything on the bay marine just the pho Very good and affordable. Quick service and generous portions! Worst experience in Paris. Were huge Ph fans and this one was the worst we ever eat. Plus staff really loudly moving chairs around as if we were not present. Really rude and disgusting food. This is an amazing place for the price. Ive been eating here at least once a week for a year, and always having their signature Pho soup. Its a great value for money, consistent and comfort food for my soul.
The stuff is also great friendly, fast and efficient.
Highly recommended to try. Amazing food great atmosphere and the service was very good and the people working there where very nice 1010. Also it was very cheap for the quality.I

Is it difficult to understand? Alors, en tant que Corenne, je vous recommend ce restaurant.Surtout Bulgogibuf.
Une cuisine dlicieuse et un patron sympathique et agrable vous accueilleront.
Un repas vraiment satisfaisant. Le dessert Tiramisu au th vert est galement trs trs bon!! Je voudrais que tout le monde essaie ce dessert!!!!
Le dner est galement disponible!

I really like Petit Yevan's first branch, and I heard that the second branch was open in the evening, so I went there As expected, the taste did not disappoint! The advantage of being able to eat food that could only be ordered and eaten at 'The Kimchi Shop'  Thanks to the friendly and cheerful owner, I had a delicious and comfortable meal! And, for those who go, dessert is mandatory and required... It's so delicious... If you want to eat delicious, cheap, and plentiful Korean food, be sure to visit Si vous voulez manger les cuisines corennes  Paris, venez devez absolument venir ici! Comme je suis coren, je vous recommande fortement.
De plus, les serveurs sont trs gentils!

Yes manquez pas votre chance.

Travelers, exchange students, and international students! If you want to eat Korean food, I recommend coming here! It's really, really delicious! Haha The bibimbap is so delicious, the quantity is plentiful, and the price is better than other places!  It's the best bibimbap I've had in Paris haha. I'm going to come again with my friends. I'll have to spread the word haha. I highly recommend it. Steamed dumplings are delicious! I also had a bibimbap with sauted pork seasoned just right. The portions are generous. A very pleasant manager. I live in the neighborhood and I plan to return there! Very very good bibimbap address! Good portions of meat and vegetables, recipes that vary. Authentic taste, attentive cuisine. For me the best bibimbap in the neighborhood!

Food is very authentic, fresh and tasty. Staff and even the restaurant's owner are super nice and kind. I love the Sundubujjigae here and always went here whenever I was craving Korean food.
I would love to have a highchair for kids too but they may not have kids guests a lot, we always had a good place for our stroller anyway. But I hope they will equip highchair in the future. Dokkebbi is one of the best Korean restaurants in Paris I have been to.
The owner are super nice, the menu changes regularly and there are options for vegetarians and other dietary options. Small place, super sweet and attentive staff all trying to speak Korean or even speaking it well. The banchan are served in individual ramekins and are okay, the kimchi is lacking in the true pungent flavor, but everything tastes fresh.

We are Koreans visiting from the states and the feel in the place is like a little boonshik place, but the prices are def on the pricier restaurant side 1425euros per plate. We had a few solid staples which were all pretty good.

Nothing amazing, just a solid representation and a sampling of korean food they even have gujulpan which is rare to find. See pics of the individual banchan, kimchi fried rice and the mandoo. My youngest wanted jajangmyun  the pork served in it is pork belly which is not authentic, but super tasty. The sauce could be more watery and less pasty, but all in all, we were satisfied. The owner is super friendly and makes sure you feel comfortable  food is really yummy too, authentic Korean food! Some of the most authentic Korean Ive had in Paris. Has a killer kimchi soup and the sides taste great and not just an after thought

I am a vegetarian which basically means I could only have a salad. I asked the waiter if the chef could make me something, and he suggested a veggie dish. I was pleasantly surprised by what he had prepared. It was delicious! My husband tried the mashed potatoes that were on my plate and went ga ga for them. He told the waiter they were excellent and about 5 mins later, the chef had sent out a bowl of them for my husband! The apple tart was amazing! Great experience! We were a bit intimidated at first since this was the first restaurant we came to in Paris. A small restaurant with a lot of character. We soon felt right at ease and like we found a neighborhood gem. We started with the morel mushrooms and wow they were tasty. Wine was also good. I ordered the beef burignon with pasta and my husband got the confit duck. Both dishes were super delicious and filling. We had to end our meal with their famous grand marnier souffl, it is massive and delicious. They ended it all off with a fabulous tray of treats with an almond twill that was wonderful. Espresso was also great. Very authentic French taste. Foie gras pate very rich and smooth. Tomato salad fresh and sauce well mixed. Beef tartar portion big and tasty, restaurant manager prepared it nicely on table, everything perfect! The menu price looks expensive vs environment but it is very high quality food. Highly recommend and will visit and do dinner with a bottle of wine next time! A traditional place. Delicious food and fast, kind service. Feels like half locals and half tourists because of its mention on Eater. Had incredible langoustines and duck leg confit. This restaurant is one of those quintessential institutions in Paris, famous for its Boeuf Bourguignon. We chose to go for lunch to take advantage of the broader menu and ordered a variety of dishes.
We started with the steak tartare, which was simply divine. It was freshly prepared right in front of us, allowing us to customize the seasoning to our preference, whether mild or spicy. Next, we tried the fried foie de canard, which was incredibly juicy and rich, perfectly complemented by their sweet dipping sauce.
For the main course, we naturally opted for the Boeuf Bourguignon. The flavor and cooking were impeccable, but I found the tagliatelle side dish a bit disappointing. It was slightly overcooked and cut into smaller pieces, which detracted from the overall experience.
We made sure to save room for the renowned desserts the oversized millefeuille and the superpuffed souffl. The millefeuille was exceptionally crispy, with a luscious vanilla cream that was absolutely addictive. Unfortunately, the souffl fell short of expectations it was runny inside and had an overpowering egg aftertaste, which I tried to mask with the Grand Marnier provided.
Overall, the food was very good, especially when paired with the excellent wine selection. Despite a few minor disappointments, this restaurant remains a noteworthy addition to the list of mustvisit places in Paris.

Great French bistro! We had a lovely lunch, with a friendly quirky and fun waitress. We chose to sit inside as the patio was full and we love the interiors! Full of art and quirky bits and bobs. The duck was great, the melon salad SOO GOOD, with affordable wines and great olives. You must make a reservation! This place fills up quickly and most everyone has a reservation. We walked up on Saturday to make a reservation for Tuesday. We were seated promptly at our reserved time. Its extremely busy and fast paced. The ratatouille was delicious, my steak was not overcooked, and very tender. The ravioli was too rich, my fianc could barely eat it. Theres no English menu so do your research before showing up. The chocolat mousse is worth the hype  you must get it if you go. The food is really good. The ravioli and the mussels were exceptional, I would visit again just for these. The mousse is not overrated, it really is good. I wouldn't give them a five star because we didn't like the way we were treated by the blonde lady while being in the waiting list. it took us two hours to be seated.
Tip they don't have online reservation. You can call them in advance to reserve. Super cool place!! I guess we were a bit late for the lunchtime and couldnt get the dish of the day. The chocolate mousse was so good! I had La Flottante and ratatouille. Both were very delicious, but I think ratatouille was my favorite, probably because I love eggplant. The olives served at the table before the meal were amazing. Despite the crowd and how busy it was, the waiter did their best to be attentive and even made some recommendations.

Thank you for the lovely meal.

The only thing that bothered me was being seated at the table near the entrance, as it was quite cold and I felt a bit chilly. However, since I was dining alone and didnt have a reservation, its not something I can really complain about

A Wonderful Family Restaurant!
We were absolutely pleased with both the service and the food at this charming family restaurant. The atmosphere was welcoming, and the staff made sure everything was perfect. The food was delicious, fresh, and served with care. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a great dining experience!

However, we were quite shocked to witness a group of six Americans asking for a discount in exchange for a recommendation. Such behavior was surprising and out of place, but it didnt take away from the restaurants wonderful quality.

Well definitely be back! Wonderful evening and dining experience. Three of us reserved for dinner and were not disappointed. All chose the 55 euro prix fixe, only 3 or 4 options for each course but a nice range of choices. All our courses were delicious, pictures are of escargot, fish entree, and two dessertscream brle and chocolate cake.
Feels like a family run spot with the two brothers taking care of us and very accommodating with our questions and requests. Nice selection of reasonably priced wine bottles as well. Best to make reservations as its a smallish spot.
Definitely recommend!! Amazing French onion soup! The duck was cooked and flavored very well! Our server was super nice, let us try the wines before ordering a glass. Brought us a thing of olive oil  butter for our bread upon request. Olive oil was so good! A nice little bistro just outside of the hustle and bustle focused on duck recipes, and also traditional favourites like escargot, onion soup, and beef.
Quaint, cozy bistro serving traditional French food  and wine. Very enjoyable. One of my best experiences in Paris hands down. Onion soup was so tasty and delicious then moving onto tournedos rossini which I think is top 3 steaks Ive ever had in my life. Not only the food but also the service was amazing I love how respectful and polite they are with all of their costumers. Love the whole family restaurant vibe and highly recommend it if youre going to Paris and willing to try onion soup.

리뷰:
Looks marvelous. We did not get the time to visit inside and in more detail. Aesthetic and nice. Built in 1900 and still going strong, this glass domed structure clearly catches the eye, as it is a stand out feature. Seen from across the river at the Northern end of Alexander III bridge it proivides a huge photo opportunity. Stunning building with glass rooftop. Venue for Fencing competition at Paris Olympics 2024. This place is accessible from inside only during events. The Grand Palais in Paris is a historic and iconic exhibition hall and museum complex located near the Champslyses and Place de la Concorde.

Built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle World's Fair, it is renowned for its impressive glassdomed roof, which is a prime example of BeauxArts architecture.

The Grand Palais hosts a wide array of events, including art exhibitions, fashion shows, and cultural events. Its grandeur and architectural beauty make it a significant landmark in Paris, attracting visitors from around the world.

The complex also houses the Galeries nationales du Grand Palais, which display major art exhibitions. The building has undergone various restorations to preserve its structural integrity and aesthetic appeal. The Grand Palais boasts stunning architecture. Its grand BeauxArts style, with its impressive glassdomed roof and ornate facade, is truly a sight to behold. Walking around the building, I was struck by its majestic presence and intricate details. The blend of stone, steel, and glass creates a beautiful harmony that reflects both classical and modern design elements. Even without entering, the exterior of the Grand Palais is a testament to Paris's architectural brilliance.
영업시간: no operation time

리뷰:
We had an amazing trip up the Eiffel Tower!  Unfortunately, the top tier was fully booked, but we still made it to the second level. The views were breathtaking. We took the stairs, and it wasn't as bad as you'd think, as you're distracted by many hidden glimpses of the view you'll embrace at the top.

There were also food and restaurant facilities available. We were especially impressed by an incredible machine that gave you 2 when you recycled your cups. It's a testament to how environmentally driven France is  they really do encourage being environmentally friendly!

And rightly so! The views were breathtaking, and you really get to appreciate Paris from a whole new perspective.

If you're a photographer, you have some real opportunities with the right eye!

I love Paris, and this was a highlight of our trip! This was a amazing experience. The structure itself is impressive in size and the design of the ironwork. The Eiffel Tower must be on the list of places to visit in Paris.
The views are 360 degrees and  stunning. The elevators hold 45 people  per car, but it is not overcrowded and the cars have large windows. The cafe on the second level makes a pretty good hot chocolate. The ham and cheese on a baguette was also tasty. I was blown away by my visit to the Eiffel Tower. I had seen pictures of it my entire life, but nothing could prepare me for the experience of actually being there! It was SO much cooler than I ever imagined beforehand. Just seeing it, a marvel of architecture and history, gave a feeling of deep appreciation and awe I can't fully describe. I climbed up the stairs to the observation platform midway up the tower. There were a LOT of stairs it was a semidifficult climb. But the views were so worth it. I spent over an hour looking out over Paris in all directions. There were countless things to see in 360 degrees! If you're visiting Paris, I highly recommend taking the stairs or elevator to the observation deck you will absolutely not regret it! My experience at the Eiffel Tower was overall amazing. I felt safe while there, and the area was kept very clean. It's a wonderful and magnificent landmark! Visiting the Eiffel Tower can be both an aweinspiring and challenging experience. As you approach, youre greeted by the stunning view of this iconic structure rising above the Paris skyline. However, the area around the tower is often crowded with tourists, street vendors, and performers, creating a busy, lively atmosphere.

The line to enter the tower can be quite long, especially during the weekend. Waiting to get through security and up to the elevators requires patience. Once inside, youre rewarded with breathtaking panoramic views of Paris, which make the wait worthwhile. Despite the crowds and the wait, standing beneath and atop the Eiffel Tower is a mustdo experience, offering an unforgettable perspective of the City of Light. 

We visited the Eiffel Tower on a Sunday and were pleasantly surprised by the lack of queues. It made the experience so much more enjoyable! We took the elevator to the summit, and the view was breathtaking, even with a bit of cloud cover. The iconic landmarks of Paris peeking through the clouds added a unique charm to our visit. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would recommend to anyone visiting the city!

Beautiful architecture and history. Definitely a must see when in Paris. I love how they built a passage under the road to get to the center and other side so that you do not have to cross the very busy roundabout. Makes it very easy to access. A lot of steps  13 euro ticket but it's worth it to go up! The line looks longer than it is, just 20 minutes to get through initial security and then you walk another 510. Great way to appreciate Paris with twelve major roads starring out in each direction, fantastic view of Tower and other attractions. Go just before sunset for cool photos and memorable views. There's an underground bridge, so you dont have to cut through traffic to get to it. If you want to get to the top, there's free entry for 1825 EU residents and longterm EU residents visa 4 months! If that's not you but you still want to see the views from the top, I recommend purchasing tickets in advance. The ticket line moved quickly, but it would've been much faster if we already had our tickets. Great views. Be prepared for some stairs, though!! There is also an elevator for the elderly and disabled. The history demonstrated is more important.

Try get tickets in advance for around sunset for the day you attend, providing the sky is clear you should get a great view. Be prepared to climb a lot of steps! There is a lift but is generally not available for most people. There are toilets available for those wondering. Well worth the visit if you visit Paris.

리뷰:
My visit to the Louvre Museum in Paris was very nice. The museum itself is a masterpiece, both in terms of its architecture and the vast collection of art. The entry might take time due to long line so better book your tickets online.

One of the most memorable moments was finally seeing the Mona Lisa. The paintings aura was next level. Surrounded by crowds, it still managed to stand out as a symbol of artistic brilliance. Watching it up close, I could appreciate the mysterious expression and delicate brushstrokes that have intrigued art lovers for centuries.

Another highlight of my visit was the stunning collection of royal ornaments. The intricate craftsmanship of the crowns, scepters, and jewels was dazzling.

The Louvres collection is vast, and its impossible to see everything in one visit. However, my experience was unforgettable, filled with iconic art, rich history, and a deep appreciation for the masterpieces housed there. For anyone visiting Paris, the Louvre is an absolute mustsee! This is without a doubt the best museum I've ever been to. I can't express how amazing it is. Floor to ceiling, wall to wall, absolutely packed to the brim with the finest art you'll ever have the privilege to see. I was overwhelmed by the size and magnitude of this place.

Do yourself a favor by grabbing a map and don't be in a hurry. You could easily spend all day inside. And definitely wear comfy shoes! There's tons of ground to cover and lots of stairs.

Buy tickets in advance!

We bought tickets for 10am entry and the crowds weren't too bad. By the time we left, around 2pm, the place was packed. O.o A very large and awesome place to visit with unique items from all over the world. I highly recommend advance ticket purchase and guided tour is the perfect choice. It's very busy and I found it unorganized. You'd need one full day, if you don't have a guided tour. This massive museum is almost impossible to take in during one visit. The hours I spent there were overwhelming in the best way, trying to drink in thousands of years of human history, ability,  and creativity. A must see, and an experience of a lifetime! Make sure to buy your tickets in advance and arrive 15 minutes before your entry time. They have strict security measures. It is crowded with tourists. There are food kiosks, restaurants and souvenir shops inside. Wear your most comfortable shoes as you will do a lot of walking to see the whole museum.

Domaine National du PalaisRoyal is an absolutely beautiful place to visit in Paris! The gardens and architecture are stunning, offering a peaceful retreat right in the heart of the city. Best of all, its free to enter, making it a perfect spot for anyone looking to enjoy some of Pariss charm without spending a dime.

The entire area is incredibly photogenic, with elegant columns, manicured gardens, and lovely fountains that create a picturesque setting. Its a great place for a leisurely stroll, taking photos, or just sitting on a bench and soaking in the atmosphere.

For travelers planning a visit, I recommend going early in the morning or late in the afternoon to enjoy the serenity of the gardens before they get too busy. If youre into photography, youll find plenty of opportunities for beautiful shots, especially with the iconic black and white columns in the courtyard. Also, take some time to explore the surrounding area, as there are plenty of charming cafes and boutiques nearby.

Overall, Domaine National du PalaisRoyal is a mustvisit when in Parisits a hidden gem that offers a perfect blend of history, beauty, and tranquility. Dont miss it! What a great place to relax on the middle of a busy Paris. Gardens are stunning and its not too busy. Free to enter and just hang out. The fountains are a tribute to Champagne because thats where it was first made public by the Monk Dom Perignon. Simply spectacular and within easy walking distance of numerous iconic "must see" places in Paris.  The spacious and well kept grounds are a real treat where you can relax or browse and take in the atmosphere at your leisure.  Definitely well worth the visit.  No cost to enter.  Take the obligatory photo as a momento of your visit. This is one of my favourite spots in Paris, without a doubt. The elegant beauty, history and exquisite refinement of this place always recharges me. I love reading the thoughtful quotes written on the benches and chairs and just spending time in contemplation and gratitude. An oasis of enriching tranquility in the heart of the most beautiful city in the world. Pretty location for photos and relaxation. Lots of chairs available in the garden and plants are well managed.
