When youre nearby, your heart stops at the grandeur of the surrounding structures. This area is a mustvisit, even if just to admire from the outside. We didnt manage to go inside the Pantheon as we hadnt planned ahead, and the line of tourists waiting to buy tickets was very long. So its best to purchase tickets in advance. I guess I went in with lower expectations because this surprisingly ended up being one of the coolest landmarks we went to in Paris. Definitely get the panoramic ticket, even if the weather isn't nice. We should've bought tickets in advance but the wait and cost was worth it. Such a spectacular monument. Photos do not prepare nor do justice for this amazing piece of architecture and history.
If youre in Paris, you MUST come inside and take a walk through this Pantheon, its honestly one of the best in Europe. There are multiple lines for entry, we did not have tickets but did not want to wait in the line for people who have not booked but managed to book online within 5 minutes so managed to skip that larger queue. Once in its quite a stunning building, amazingly detailed sculptures in a space that reminds me a little of something from Rome. The lower crypt is added bonus even if on the more eery side. For me its a great place but possibly a little too highly priced compared to museums which have a bit more to look at. You might spend up to an hour hear depending on your pace. This whole area is absolutely stunning. I've never seen this much stone in my life. We did not opt to go inside due to a limited amount of time in Paris and wanted to see as much as we could. U can go inside for a small fee. I imagine the view is spectacular from inside. There is a view of the Eiffel tower from the street in front.

Absolutely beautiful interior architecture!  My favorite are was the place where Marie Antoinette was jailed.  I loved seeing the personal items that belonged to her.  Her little shoe was precious! A palace that turned into a prison for the French royalty, and now its a must visit monument. You get a tablet that gives you a virtual tour inside, and you can see how things were during the 18th century. Great for kids too. Not really worth visiting. Just bare walls throughout, nothing of interest. You must have great imagination to take it in, otherwise you will see nothing but dull chambers, and even the AR tablet you receive at the entrance wont help much.

During my visit the tablets were limited to one per couple, even though the day was rainy and far from busy, and there were tons of spare tablets available. The lady at the ticket desk refused outright to give one more tablet regardless. Shameful. It was a short visit. For me, the cell of Marie Antonette was the only thing here that warranted my attention. They had some art display or exhibition going on in the main hall that I breezed right through. It seemed like an afterthought to help sell tickets as the rest of the grounds seem underwhelming. Conciergerie is very less crowded place and the complimentary tablet provided at entrance helps you understand and navigate the history behind this place. Very nice and interactive tablet explained the original place in a time travel format I really liked this innovation. Do visit this place to learn about an important historic place of Paris. Don't forget to check out the prison guard's office and cells. Visit this place only if you have Paris Museum Pass or a combined ticket with Saint Chappel otherwise there is nothing much to spend extra.

The large, open green space offers a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower, making it a great place for picnics or a peaceful walk. Whether you're a solo traveler, with family, or a couple, you'll love the atmosphere here. There are plenty of benches, and it's easy to find a nice spot to sit and watch the world go by. The area is clean, wellmaintained, and offers fantastic photo opportunities. Highly recommend visiting in the early morning or at sunset for the best experience. A mustsee when in Paris!" A beautiful park, well worth visiting and exploring if you're there to see the Eiffel Tower! There is so much space, so it did not feel overcrowded while I was there. There are lots of benches to sit down on, and places on the ground to sit. There is a playground for children, a basketball court, and other recreational sites. When I was there, there weren't a lot of bathrooms available, so keep that in mind before you go. The park is incredible with lots of big trees and cool nature sights to see. You won't regret a visit! Beautiful park with a nice view of the Effile Tower. Although during the Olympics it was extra crowded with some areas closed, it was still a wonderful sight to see. If you're ever in Europe or France it's a must see! It is a wonderful place to visit. Lovely garden to sit and have picnic . Very busy around the Eiffel tower . Be careful with pickpocketers. Some vendors in the parking selling snacks and drinks. The Luxembourg Palace is located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, north of the famous Luxembourg Gardens and is the location of the French Senate.
From a historical perspective, the palace was built for the mother of King Louis XIII of France and Gaston, Duke of Orlans, Marie de Mdicis, quite close to an old palace belonging to Franois Henri de Montmorency, Duke of Luxembourg. This small palace later acquired the title it retains until today, Petit Luxembourg and is the location of the president of the French Senate. Beautifully layed out and divided into a very classic tiered garden,  with the Palace in the background.
Classical statues and famous people line the walkways shadowed by nicely trimmed square trees.
And two lions protecting the gardens and fountain.
Awesome place here!!! Located at the northern end of some very pretty parklands, the Luxembourg Palace stands out as quite the impressive building.

Dont go too close though as they armed guards get a bit antsy and they carry automatic rifles.

The surrounding parklands are spacious with plenty of seating available where the locals love to sit and relax

리뷰:
A nice botanical  ornamental garden with several lakes, a kids playground, and many wonderful picnic spots.  I particularly liked how they made a number of bee hives and bird houses into works of art.  The "purple" flower section was spectacular while we were there early July. Lovely place with impressive thematic areas, like big bonsai exposition, art exposition, special gardens for different family of flowersplants, and even some birds, ducks and peacocks around. Very relaxing, well organized and beautiful place to visit and spend some time for photos, contemplation and learning about different plantsflowers. When you enter the park you won't feel that there's so much more inside. A big park with lots of flowering and non flowering plants and trees. You can easily spend half a day to full day here. Different kinds of flowers, shrubs, creepers, trees etc. which are a treat for nature lovers. Even though we visited in spring about 75 have bloomed the rest are yet to make a peek.

There are couple of restaurants and toilet facility inside the park. There are lots of benches everywhere inside the park which is a boon. The entrance fee is just 3.5 euros which you can take online through app or buy from the counter. Easily accessible by bus number 112 and 207 or by metro 1 chateau de vincennes There's some work goin on in the chateau else that's also a good option to visit. All in all you will definitely enjoy the park. Truly the most spectacular place on the edge of Paris, blooming from late February to November  seas of daffodils, cascades of Hortensia, clouds of azalea, magnificent camellia trees, and much more. The best time to visit is April and May, as featured on my photos. It's a secret place not known to tourists, offering simply enormous space integrated with nature, including ponds and sculptures. There are a few places to eat, a selection of bonsai trees in the pavilion, and peacocks roaming outdoors. Plenty of cute spots for a romantic picnic can be found throughout. There's a large playground space for kids on the further edge of the park, and in autumn, a section of large flower beds features hundreds of dahlia blooms. Easy access by metro, with a 2.5 eur ticket and free entrance offseason. Amazing park with a lot of playgrounds and bicycles for rent. Looks more like a forest than a French garden.

주소: 1 Av. du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris, France
리뷰:
You definitely need to get the tickets in advanceonly sold one week prior to the day you require entry. And be sure to buy from the official website...I have heard there are fakes out there.
Our entry time was 1045am. We walked up at about 1040, went through the security line quickly, declined the audio tour, and started walking down the spiral staircase. They only let 200 people down at a time, and there is a digital display on the wall right before you descend, keeping track.
DO NOT underestimate the physical part of this. The stairs going up and down are not for the faint of heart. It can easily make you dizzy, and obviously, it is just a plain physical strain going up and down. Plus, the path down below is uneven, slick, and cramped. Do not go down if you're claustrophobic or over 6 foot 2 inches. My husband is that tall, and he almost hit his head in several spots and even had to tilt his head sideways while walking at times. It was a gruesome yet fascinating part of Paris to see. All in all, we spent about 30 minutes below ground. Wow what a historical part of Paris. We got the audio while walking through and it was so informative and told you so much history and information. It is just amazing how many bones and bodies make up the designs that you see. The history and the stories that you will hear and read is so interesting. We went during the Olympics and they were busy, but not too bad since we went in the morning. Would recommend during your visit to Paris. There are a lot of steps both and down and up, but they are easy to manage. First off, please buy the tickets only from the official site, no need for you to get scammed on the 3rd party websites. On there, the adult ticket can cost upwards of 90 euros, while on the official site you can get it for much, much less. Also, buying the tickets is somewhat of a must, as they sell out really quickly a lot of the time. The slots open 1 week in advance, good luck!

Second, please do not use flash from your camera, if your phone has it, use the night mode where you stand still from 1 to 10s to allow more light to enter the sensor and get some quite good results.

The audo guide is completely worth it, both me and the Miss think so. She had hers in French, and I took mine in English as I was more at ease with it. You also have a Spanish and a Germanif my memory serves me correctly version of it.

The steps up and now are not that exhausting, average physical form is enough. You have something like 120 steps both ways, though the staircase is your classical circle one, so you might get dizzy along the way if you're descending fast.

We took around 1h, but we stopped to read all the plaques, and did discuss them along the way, you would usually take around 45 to 50 minutes. Enjoy the experience, there's no need to rush it. On the walls you can see signs from time to time with a human ear and a number alongside it, that means you should listen to the section X of your audio guide if you have one.

At least in the summer 32C on the surface, the temperature was bearable and we'd classify it as "tshirt weather".

Overall the history behind this place is incredible, and they really cater to tourists with the multilingual signs, you won't feel left out, that's for sure! A must visit place to explore the history of Paris city. It allows a limited number of people everyday, so you have to book tickets in advance. You need to climb lots of stairs to go down. Plus this place is claustrophobic. So make sure that you are aware of these points before visiting. You can skip the audio guides as information is present on board in French and English at all the important points inside. It will take you around 40 mins to cover this place. What a memorable experience! We had the audio tour and to learn about where these bones came from and how they were moved  it is a sacred site.  131 stairs down and up which you should keep in mind but definitely worth seeing.

Wonderful open area full of historical significance. Has public seating. Many police and military on patrol for Olympics. Dont miss the picture with the Olympic rings. Place de la Bastille is rich in history and has a unique atmosphere, but my experience was somewhat dampenedperhaps due to the bad weather. Despite the clouds, its clear this square has a lot to offer with its lively surroundings and historical significance. On a sunnier day, Im sure it would be even more impressive. A solid fourstar spot to explore in Paris. Place de La Bastille is a mustvisit location in Paris, rich in history and vibrant with life. The square is not only a symbol of the French Revolution but also a hub of activity where past and present seamlessly blend. The iconic July Column stands tall in the center, offering a perfect spot for photos.

Whether you're strolling through the area or enjoying a coffee at a nearby caf, the energy of the place is contagious. The surrounding streets are full of charming shops and restaurants, making it a great spot to explore. Plus, the proximity to the beautiful Bastille Opera House adds a cultural touch to the visit.

Overall, Place de La Bastille is a perfect mix of history, culture, and modern Parisian life. I highly recommend adding it to your itinerary when visiting Paris! Still a great place to have a good time the weekend until 6am... You can even eat in multiples restaurants until 4am after partying or just visiting paris by night. Nice place de la Bastille. Some police cars n security nearby. Paris public tourist places always high security police personnel

I liked a lot the site and especially its benches, yes the benches.
When you walk Paris, you eventually get tired and you not always wish to sit at a cafe but you just want to rest and enjoy a nice view or look at a park.
This is exactly the case here and the pause facing this beautiful tower and its flowers around was more than welcome. 300 steps to climb is not for everyone but the view at the top of all Paris is amazing.  Tour guide explanation of the history is very interesting. Booking is required as limited numbers in each visit. Amazing attraction in Paris that is not known...a hidden gem!!! You can buy the ticket at the kiosk which is located inside the small square. The visit is within a nice guided tour that starts every hour having some slots in french and in english. To climb the tower you'll face 300 steps stairs, however, as it's a guided tour, the group stops 2 times on the way up to visit internal parts with nice explanations, which makes the climb softer. From the top, you have 360 degrees of breathtaking views! It more than worths the 300 steps! People were chilling there near by. It was really crowded. Some people were sun bathing there. Be careful and always look at your purse and pocket. You can chill here but this place must be crowded all the time. You can not really see much here but i bet this place is on your bucket list in Paris. A historical tower in the middle of a public park. I havent been inside but i was told it is a nice climb, and will be doing so soon. It has a lot of history and gives its surrounding neighborhood a sense of uniqueness. You can also see the gargoyles and statues just passing by it.

리뷰:
While the church is beautiful, they could do a much better job with crowd management. As you can see when we showed up it was impossible to tell which line was for which type of entrance. For a weekday during shoulder season, the line moved much slower than expected too. Id recommend getting tickets in advance. Wow, it was an amazing experience! I loved it. When you go inside, it's a different feeling altogether. You have to look at each line from the bottom up, as each line has a separate story to tell. You also have to go to the upper level to see the stunning glass walls. And the best part? Entry is free with the Paris Museum Pass. Be sure to keep it with you wherever you go in Paris, it comes in handy! Make sure you get timed tickets and find the right line. Not very organized.  There are seperate lines for tickets on the hor and half hour. Full airport security with the 360 scanner.

Once inside the chapel is incredible. Try to go on a sunny day to get the full effect of the stained glass. It's hard to decide where to look. The rose window was so intricate and beautiful. Well worth the small confusion to get inside I don't remember hearing about this chapel before my visit but was very glad I went. It is stunning inside. My only complaint would be I did not see an elevator. The stairs are very old stone stairs. They go around up the tower. They are not even so it's easy to trip and there are a lot. If you are unable to do stairs you would not be able to see the upstairs stained glass. I would also use the bathroom before you go.  Watch where you walk as the stones in the grounds are uneven, but it is worth it. We bought tickets in advance and still waited for an hour plus just to get in. Our reservation time was 130, we didn't get in till after 230. There are 3 lines for the queue in place. The markers are 20 feet from the checkin, and security is another 1020 feet from there, so you need to be in the middle aisle if you're at the half pass reservation. Queue on the right aisle is for the 0 hour reservation. Queue on the left is if you don't have tickets.  So getting in took a while, and once you're in, there is a bag and body check, like the airport   they check everything, including bags, camera, and phone. After you enter,  you can buy your tickets or scan your prepurchased tickets. As you go into the 1st floor of the chapel, which is also the souvenir shop, you can spend about 510 minutes there. Go up the spiral staircase on the right when you face the entrance. Cautiously go up the tight and narrow spiral stairs to the 2nd floor, and that's where the stained glass and the beautiful ceiling are located. There's a walk out to the balcony, which oversees the grounds. You exit on the left side of the balcony, looking out at the balcony. Again,  caution going down the spiral staircase.  Waiting for an hour to have a 30minute visit is not a great costbenefit tradeoff, but it's our first time to visit, and you need to bring your patience and manage your expectations. If you get the audio, you may be longer. For me,  it was worth the wait. 3 star because of the lack of logistics managing ticket  sales I believe they oversell and is probably the cause of the delay.

리뷰:
Trocadro Gardens in Paris is a picturesque and iconic spot, offering breathtaking views of the Eiffel Tower. With its elegant fountains, expansive lawns, and classic architecture, its an ideal place for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing picnic. The gardens are wellmaintained, with plenty of benches and shady areas to sit and take in the beautiful surroundings. The combination of greenery and water features, particularly the stunning Fountains of Warsaw, adds to the serene ambiance. It's especially magical at sunset or in the evening when the Eiffel Tower lights up, making it a favorite among photographers and tourists alike. It was a great experience after 15 years that Ive been to venue for the first time.
The gardens are as stunning as I remember, the perfectly manicured lawns and fountains setting the stage for my longawaited reunion. But this time, it wasnt just the breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower that captivated me it was the feeling of coming back to a Paris that I had never truly left in my heart. A lot of crowds but worth it! Best time is sunset time and around nightime every hour the lights of the eiffel tower flash for 5 minutes. In the winter period it starts at 20h00 and the last one is at 23h00 I think. If you catch the metro 6 from Trocadero towards Nation, you have nice views of the Eiffel tower when crossing the bridge so I recommend taking a video. This place is just breathtaking. The atmosphere is outta this world where romance is in there. I could see couples taking photos, bridal photoshoots and just happy people all around. The view of the tower was the best. Took my dogs here from the UK and was lovely. People stopped to take photos and chat and everyone was really nice. Always bits going on here too, making it a nice atmosphere.

Downside is the amount of conshussles going on, which can be avoided with more police presence.

Passage Vendme is a beautiful covered shopping arcade located in the heart of Paris. It was built in the 18th century and is home to some of the most luxurious stores in the world. The arcade is named after the Place Vendme, which is the square that it is located on. The Place Vendme is home to the Ritz Hotel, the Vendme Column, and the French Ministry of Finance.
Passage Vendme is a popular tourist destination and is a great place to shop for souvenirs or just to window shop. The arcade is also home to a number of restaurants and cafes, making it a great place to take a break from shopping.
I visited Passage Vendme in the summer of 2019 and was very impressed. The arcade is beautiful and wellmaintained. The stores are all very highend and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I didn't buy anything, but I enjoyed just window shopping. I also had a coffee at one of the cafes and it was very good.
Overall, I highly recommend Passage Vendme to anyone visiting Paris. It is a beautiful and unique shopping experience that you won't find anywhere else.
Here are some additional details about Passage Vendme
The arcade is open from 10am to 7pm, Monday through Saturday. It is closed on Sunday.
There are over 80 stores in Passage Vendme, including Cartier, Chanel, Dior, and Louis Vuitton.
The arcade is located at 1 Rue de la Paix, 75001 Paris, France.

I stayed at Healing Minbak for 5 days and 4 nights starting February 3rd! It was my first time traveling to Europe, and before Paris, I stayed at a Korean bed and breakfast in London, so I don't have much experience with Korean bed and breakfasts, but I will try to explain as much as I can to help firsttimers like me make a choice.
First of all, the location of the accommodation is very good. Both North Station and East Station can be reached in about 15 minutes on foot, so it is very convenient for coming from other countries or going out to nearby areas. Also, a large subway station called Relublic is less than 10 minutes away, and if you take Line 8 from here, you can go to most tourist attractions. It's great to be able to! Thanks to this, I never had to worry about transportation when planning my day's travel and was always able to travel smoothly. And since the Marais district is within walking distance 1520 minutes on foot?, it was convenient for shopping and walking around.
Second, the food is delicious. Basically, they provide side dishes such as kimchi and scrambled eggs, as well as different main side dishes for breakfast and dinner every day. Bibimbap, spaghetti, seaweed soup, fried rice, Vienna stirfry, etc. are all very delicious. Since eating out is expensive in Paris, it's really great to be able to eat breakfast and dinner at your accommodation. Moreover, the owners do all the washing up...  And the owners wait for you even if you oversleep in the morning, survey demand for dinner every day, and even if you come in a little later than the designated time, they prepare the same meal for you if you want to eat... It's the best!
Third is security! It was really safe to walk around at night, and the accommodation itself is tripleequipped, and the owners don't leave often and watch over the house, so you don't have to worry! I also brought a bicycle lock because I heard there might be thieves in the accommodation sometimes, but it was of no use.
Lastly, the bosses are very nice. When you travel, many things like this will happen, and whenever that happens, you will stop by and complain to the boss who is taking a break, but he will listen and take good care of you. But don't ever overdo it! These are the people who literally provide an environment for healing. They were so kind that we laughed the entire time we stayed at the accommodation.
In addition, towels are provided every day, hot water works well, and the water pressure is strong... there are many advantages! There were some reviews that were not satisfied with the facilities, but I think this is the best in Paris and among Korean guesthouses. I rested well and enjoyed myself for 5 days. I often go to London, Milan, and Paris, so I often stay at Airbnb or Korean BBs, and this was by far the best place I stayed in Paris!
I tend to read reviews carefully and search blogs and other places to compare trustworthy reviews before making a decision. After the owner of this place changed, the reviews were surprisingly good, so I trusted them and decided to trust them. Thanks to the reviews, I was able to stay in such a great place, so I'd like to ask for my review. I'm leaving a review in case it helps others!

First of all, the most important things I consider when staying at an accommodation are 1. Are the toilets and bathrooms clean, and is it inconvenient to use hot water?
2. Isn't it difficult to communicate with the owner during your stay? Even though I paid my own money to stay there, strangely, there were times when I ended up being criticized if I couldn't meet the owner or staff at a Korean guesthouse with good people.
3. Is the accommodation safe?
I focus on these three things the most, and if you have the same standards as me, I recommend them.
1. Not only the toilet and bathroom, but also the sink and dining table in the room, daily water cups and dishes, water purifier, slipper bed, and towels were always kept clean, so it was very comfortable to use! The accommodation was almost full during my stay, but I had no trouble using the bathroom and toilet at all! The buildings themselves are very old in Paris, so there were some things that bothered me when I stayed at other Korean bed and breakfasts, but this one didn't bother me at all. The bathroom and shower area were always neat and clean, with no scale, mold, or rust! And even if someone washed it right after using it, I didn't have to worry about the hot water and water pressure. It was convenient because there was a hair dryer!
2. The response to KakaoTalk messages was very quick from the time I confirmed my reservation, and even when I had to change my checkin time and when I got off at the North Station late and was a little scared and wanted to ask how to get there because of the strike, they always responded quickly! During my stay, they always communicated with me about how the day was, information about the strike, information about transportation, and restaurants and cafes. I felt unwell due to a cold, so I asked what kind of medicine I could buy, and I was wondering if any of the guests were sick. They said they would prepare Korean cold medicine and provided it to me whenever I needed it. One day, I suddenly came home a little late, so they asked me about dinner and prepared it for me. I told them that I was a sensitive sleeper and had trouble sleeping due to the sound of snoring when the dormitory was full, and they continued that day. They brought us a plug and prepared it for us they gave us a good one so we had a good night's sleep that day haha, and we were happy to check out and store our luggage...! I was always able to stay at ease thanks to the attentive consideration of really warm people.
3. The entrance to the building had double security, there was a supermarket downstairs, and there was a major road and station nearby, so the way home wasn't scary at all. It was very convenient because it was so close to the Marais district, and the station was right in front, so it was also very convenient! I arrived in Paris late at night during the strike and had to walk, but I was able to walk without any difficulty at all! Of course, now that the strike is over, I think I can take the subway and come directly to the front more conveniently.
I really recommend it! They always prepare a warm meal early in the morning, they always prepare a different menu for dinner, and the two of you take great care in meal preparation, so we always eat with satisfaction and rest comfortably! I think I'll be coming to Paris again soon, and I don't think I'll stay here without hesitation even then! I will come again. Thank you, boss! The reason why my first solo trip was successful was because I was able to rest comfortably and eat delicious food at the accommodation! I was able to eat delicious food for breakfast and dinner and walk around comfortably. I was happy while staying here and I was really grateful to the owner and his wife!!! I was worried because I was alone, but the owners made my stay so comfortable that I met some nice people and was grateful. I will stay here again next time I go to Paris! Thank you so much! Seeing is better than hearing, so I think it's better to go and see for yourself rather than judging by reading hundreds of reviews! The cost of eating out in Paris was very expensive. Healing BB provided breakfast and dinner twice, but you didn't have to pay extra, and the quality of the food wasn't poor. It was nice to be able to save money on food and do other things I wanted with that money.

The first atmosphere of the accommodation was quiet, so I thought I wouldn't be able to talk to the people I was staying with, but it started a conversation, and we had a lot of fun talking about each other's stories, travel stories, etc. every day!

The location of the accommodation was very close to the subway station, so I didn't feel there was a problem with security.

Conclusion Good value and good taste Facilities, service, location, and meals were all good.

1. Facilities
I stayed in an 8person dorm for 2 nights and a single room for 2 nights, and both rooms were okay. It was nice that there was a sink in the dormitory so I could easily wash my hands or brush my teeth. The single room was nice because the bed was very big and soft.

2. Service
The owner and his wife were both really friendly! He recommended good restaurants, helped me carry my luggage, talked with me while I ate, and gave me various travel tips.

3. Location
All famous stores such as ofr, merci, and vintage shops were all within walking distance, and it was nice that there were many art museums nearby, including the Pompidou. There were two subway stations nearby, but because of the strike, I couldn't use them as much as I thought, which was disappointing. It has been operating normally since the day before I checked out, so... If you go when there is no strike, you will be able to use the subway station really comfortably.

4. Meal
Breakfast was served at 8 o'clock and dinner was served at 7 o'clock, and everything was delicious! The kimchi that I made myself was really delicious, and all the menu items, including spaghetti, steak, stirfried pork, and bibimbap, were all delicious It was nice to have purified water.

If I had to pick one thing that was disappointing, it would be that the soundproofing wasn't very good... This is a problem that applies to all European apartments, so I thought that would be the case.

It was nice to be able to stay comfortably for 5 days. Recommended!!

It offers a peaceful escape with its wellmanicured lawns, elegant statues, and stunning views of the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel. The open space is perfect for a leisurely stroll or simply relaxing while taking in the iconic surroundings. Whether youre visiting the Louvre or just enjoying a quiet moment in the city, Jardin du Carrousel provides a serene and picturesque setting in the heart of Paris. The Jardin du Carrousel, a tranquil oasis in the center of Paris, is a beloved destination for both tourists and residents. Located in the place of the same name, that was created to honour the Sun God,King Louis XIV, is his Equestrian Monument, The square is surrounded by grand and beautiful buildings, a frame to the picture so to speak. Louis XIV de Bourbon was the eldest son of Louis XIII and Anne of Austria.  He was also called Louis the Great or Sun King.  Louis le grand, louis roi soleil The Statue of Louis XIV refers to various statues depicting King Louis XIV of France, who reigned from 1643 to 1715. Louis XIV is often referred to as the "Sun King" due to his association with the sun as a symbol of his reign and power.

One of the most famous statues of Louis XIV is the equestrian statue located at Place des Victoires in Paris. Created by the sculptor Franois Girardon and erected in 1686, this statue portrays Louis XIV mounted on a horse, showcasing his grandeur and authority.

Another notable statue of Louis XIV can be found at the Palace of Versailles in the Hall of Mirrors. This statue, created by the sculptor JeanBaptiste Tuby, portrays the king in a standing position, wearing regal attire and holding a scepter, symbolizing his royal power.

These statues, along with others found in various locations, serve as reminders of Louis XIV's significant role in French history. They depict his influence and achievements as one of the most powerful monarchs of his time and his contribution to the arts and culture during the period of the French Baroque.

The statues of Louis XIV also reflect the magnificence and opulence associated with his reign, showcasing his desire to project an image of grandeur and authority. They serve as historical and artistic landmarks, allowing us to appreciate and learn from the legacy of this influential monarch. whilst here, Please do not miss the fantastic bakery just around the corner

The large fountain dominates the small square. It seems out of place but none the less is very ornate and cannot be ignored. There are also two restaurants competing for trade in the tiny square. Fountain on Saint Dominique Street with a beautiful relief sculpture. Minutes away from the Eiffel Tower. Many shops and restaurants around. La Fontaine du GrosCaillou is a historic fountain located in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, France. It is situated in the square of the same name, Place du GrosCaillou.

The fountain dates back to the 18th century and is named after the "gros caillou" or "big rock" that used to be located nearby. It was originally built to provide drinking water to the local residents and has since become a charming landmark in the neighborhood.

The design of the fountain is simple yet elegant. It features a circular basin with a central column topped by a decorative urn. Water flows from the urn into the basin, creating a soothing sound and adding to the overall ambiance of the square.

The Fontaine du GrosCaillou has undergone several restorations over the years to preserve its historical significance. It continues to serve as a gathering place for locals and a spot for tourists to relax and take in the surroundings.

The square surrounding the fountain is also a popular meeting point and offers a pleasant area to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. It is surrounded by cafes, shops, and residential buildings, adding to its charm and liveliness.

Visitors to the Fontaine du GrosCaillou can appreciate its architectural beauty, as well as its historical importance as a source of water in the past. It provides a glimpse into the rich history and culture of Paris and is a delightful spot to visit while exploring the city. One of the most beautiful squares in the 7th arrondissement, rich in history and historical memories, with a few restaurants to keep it alive forever. MARS FOUNTAIN or GROS PEBBLE
Located in the center of a square, between 129  131 Rue SaintDominique, at the end of Rue de l'Exposition, Paris 7th.
The Fontaine de Mars was built from 1806 to 1808 to the plans of the engineer FranoisJean Bralle. Its sculpted basreliefs are by PierreNicolas Beauvalet, a student of Augustin Pajou. It was first called Fontaine du Gros Caillou. Originally, the water came from the GrosCaillou fire pump. System for raising the waters of the Seine in order to supply fountains. It was located on the left bank at the Quai d'Orsay and operated from 1788 to 1858. In 1859 the arcaded square which surrounds it was built.
At the foot of the fountain, a flood mark indicates the level reached by the waters of the Seine during its flood of 1910 the river bed is located 570 m away. Listed as a historical monument in 1926.
Neoclassical style building. It takes the form of a large mass with a square base of approximately 2 m on a side, framed by engaged and molded columns, all crowned with a portico roof. The panels on the four sides are carved with basrelief, Mars, god of war, alongside Hygeia, goddess of Health  an unusual illustration for a fountain  on the side facing the street and decorative vases on the other three. The pilasters are Doric.
Three bronze masks, the same as those of the Fontaine des QuatreSaisons on rue de Grenelle, spit water close to the ground. Only one was still in operation in 2012

My Real Trip said they could only give me half, so I still can't get a refund..
I knew this would happen and recorded it all, so please dont say anything else

Note
No shower after 12pm. No shower after 12pm.
Personal shower supplies and towels not provided.
A unisex bathroom for more than 10 people,
A narrow bathroom with a strong foul smell,
broken sink,
A nearby coin laundromat costs 4 euros, but laundry costs 5 euros.
The owner often asks guests to check in,
Even though it is a women's room, they ask that the door be always open except when changing clothes to ensure ventilation.
And even on the day of checkin, the male boss was going in and out of the women's room, nagging her, telling her not to lie upside down in the direction of the bed, and telling her to use the bed next to him instead of that bed, etc.
Use only one glass of water a day,
Carelessly throwing away guest luggage the cleaning lady in the other room said she thought it was trash, but no matter where I looked, it wasn't the case

There is a lot to say, etc.
The good reviews you saw were from before the owner changed, so dont be fooled.

If you're booking for more than 2 people, get a real Airbnb.
For the price of two people, you can get a studio apartment in the city center. That's much better. Transportation costs to and from Paris are also expensive

For your information, if you say something unpleasant, they say they expect the same level as a hotel, but if the hotel does this, you should sue

The owner says they are all tsunderes...

Even though they spoke informally from the first day, I was assigned a different room than in the picture and complained, and they said they gave me a better room because it was under construction, and they said it was because you don't know Paris and that you are just expecting hotel conditions haha and blamed us.

The faucet was broken and it came off when I touched it. I called a repairman two months ago, calmly telling him to put it back in, but he still hasn't come. It was painful to hear this nonsense.

And if you don't have anything, are you proud of having a fan in your room in the 30degree Celsius summer in Paris?
Air conditioners aren't often installed in Paris, so even if you don't have one, it's hard to buy a fan in Paris, so when I heard you bragging that you bought it by opening it in the early morning, I was wondering who knows.

Even if it's your first time in Paris, you shouldn't say anything like that.

It's not a hotel, but it's not even half as good as half of the other guesthouses, so only those who really don't think they can travel without this price should come.
Please note that Korean food is not provided for free and you have to pay 10 euros per meal.

The bathroom has a strong odor and there are a lot of spiders, flies, and moths.
And since it's an illegally operated bed and breakfast in a roadside commercial area, you can clearly hear the sounds of cars and motorcycles passing by at night. Even the glare from motorcycles hurts my eyes.

리뷰:
This is my second time I have visited City Hall for European Heritage days. I think this might be my favorite building in the whole world!

And right now they are even having an exhibition on all sorts of Parisian photos, and a light show in the big ballroom. GORGEOUS!!! Magnificent building.
You have to go there and visit it.
Since it is very close to Notre Dame de Paris, Le Chtelet, Le Centre Pompidou, each of them another must, it would be a pity to miss it. Such a cool city hall filled with Christmas decorations and the Paris 2024 Olympics sign. I went here twice to see both in the day and what night with the lights. They have a small ride for children there and food carts. Great place for photos. We saw an interesting exhibition detailing recent infrastructural change across Paris and the effect it has had on environmental metrics and lived experiences. I was surprised and impressed by the attention devoted to womens efforts in improving the city, as well as the influence of LGBTQIA groups in promoting equality. Very cozy Christmas atmosphere, decorations, lights and the market was good. Advise to people in charge, you shouldn't not have put up those screens!, it doesn't match the intelligent architecture of the building.

주소: Big Bus, 11 Av. de l'Opéra, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰:
We did this a year ago so perhaps my experience is outdated. The pass was overall fantastic although it took more work than just buying the Pass. Once we had the Pass, we still had to go online to reserve times for the Louvre and many  but not all  attractions and museums. We didn't have to reserve a time for the Arc de Triomphe, for example, and just walked right on in. If you buy the Pass it is crucial to check whether places require reservations as soon as possible. This prohibits a lot of spontaneity, since Paris is one of the most visited cities in the world and a lot of people want to do the same things. The food portion of the pass was wonderful. We visited some of the chateaux on the Pass and they were astonishing. We are already planning on returning and the Paris Pass is part of our plan when we go back. The 4 star rating instead of the 5 star rating is simply due to the complications in ensuring reservations above and beyond buying the Pass. It gets you in free as long as you make a completely separate reservation on the museum website for what day and time you will be there. We didn't have a lot of time in Paris, and I didn't research it enough ahead of time however, it was worth the cost to have access to most attractions and even breakfast at different cafes. Note you must pick up your Museum Pass at the designated pick up location before attempting to enter any museums, this includes the Louvre.
The boat ride is best at night in my opinion. You get to see the Eiffel Tower light up if you go past 9 pm. I agree with other reviewers that the pass can be pricey, however for the convenience of having skip the lines and everything included in one day package is worth it. Even if only visiting a couple sights, the pass made our visit very time efficient. Also provided us with the luxury to visit attractions that were not in our itinerary.  Most sights we visited allowed us to skip the long security lines as well. The big bus pass that was included was ultra touristy but convenient for seeing a lot in a short amount of time. All staff very friendly and the reps I dealt with through email for the pass were excellent as well. This pass is great if you only have a few days in Paris or are unsure of what you want to see or do. Lots of flexibility with the pass and includes public transport which we did not need to utilize due to the big bus being included.  Beats the hassle of prepurchasing tickets online, for specific time slots etc.... we were surprised it included the museum pass which we were debating purchasing versus the Paris pass which was a plus for us. Great for those who want to keep a flexible itinerary and small groups. This is an awesome deal, but be conscious that you will not be able to see all attractions in 2 days. The Palace of Versailles entry is included in this package, but you would have to plan a way to get there separately, and once there the passes sold DO NOT provide skip the line as advertised, because most tourists there have the same ticket.

Also, the Big Bus Tour is a great way to see everything meaningful in a 4 hour span, yet, you only get one bus day with this bundle, we paid 40 once there to get an additional day... Bottom line get there early and get a bus upgrade to see everything you'd like with sufficient time.

Tip Ask about downloading the app to schedule a time to enter the Notre Dame tour and use the WIFI provided by the bus while aboard to download maps.

You do get to take some awesome pictures from the bus!

P.S. The Eiffel tower is not included in this package. It was a great value, but some things were  off.  The Eiffel Tower open times flexed unpredictably due to 24 Olympics prep.  We were in Paris 1828 Sep 2021. The Arc de Triomphe was covered with fabric as an art exhibition and Paris Pass did not cover admission.   Also, train, bus, metro fares were not included. But we just bought books of ten MetroBus tickets at 16.94 euros per set and bought train tickets as needed. You need to make timed reservations  no cost with ParisMuseum pass on line for Louvre, Orsay, Versailles and some other attractions. Buy Paris Pass on line, then go to 11 Rue de L'Opera to pick up your museum pass and big bus ticket on day you want to activate.  Our US CDC Covid Vaccination card was accepted everywhere.  We applied for French Pass Sanitaire 2 wks before we left and did not get them until we came home. If you dont have a vaccination record, the other option is getting antigen test at local pharmacy, 25 euros, good for 72 hours.

리뷰:
Nice location and truly educational. Plus you can browse the exhibition with a glass of wine in hand! Audio guides included. We went for lunch here last Friday. What a fantastic experience! The service, is immediately wonderful. We had the lovely Corentine wait on our table. So friendly. The starters of foie gras and the crabavocado were delicious. The lamb and onglet de boeuf... excellent. The truffle dauphinois, sublime. We finished with cheese and the pistachio, raspberry, cream dessert. Delicious.
We will be going back very soon. Highly recommend Amazing menu for reasonable price for Paris! Fantastic service, very cool location and the best lamb Ive ever eaten. Not to be missed! The restaurant in this Wine Museum is a hidden gem. I had the full course lunch with cheese and wine, food was fantastic paired with good wine.  Emmanuel was friendly and introduced us the various wine regions in France and their grapes. Its such an amazing experience to dine in a 14th century wine cellar, a must if you come to Paris. What an amazing experience! Unlike the more touristy wine tasting classes, Emmanuel let us choose the wines we wanted to taste from their extensive wine cellar, and even purchase them. He was so friendly, knowledgeable and patient, and his English was fantastic. Especially when you consider the myriad technical terms and wine making techniques he needed to use to answer our endless questions! Reservations were easy you just have to email they don't have it available online. Marie Elise took extra time to helped us package up our wine securely, so it could travel home in our suitcases. She was so kind, and a delight to talk with, and was able to make further wine recommendations based on our tasting. And you get to tour the museum with an audio guide. It was quirky, we learned a lot, and it winds through the ancient wine caves. Thank you so much, we had an amazing experience!

주소: 2 All. du Bord de l'Eau, 75016 Paris, France
리뷰:
It was 8 years since our last visit to this site. The amenities had all been greatly improved. Toilet blocks were clean and able to deal with a full compliment of guests .The bar, shop, and restaurant was clean welcoming and airy. The food in particular the Pizzas were excellent.The children's play areas were modern and well equipped. There is no swimming pool but this doesnt detract from the site.
Most pitches are of good size with plenty of shade from the hot summer Paris days. The staff were friendly and helpful. Great location for visiting central Paris with much improved transport links including nearby trams buses and cycle paths. If it is Paris you are looking at and camping is your option you cant go far wrong. We stayed at the site for 4 nights while attending the Paralympics. Our pitch was small but perfect for what we needed, it was also quite secluded which was nice. The facilities were excellent, lots of toilets and showers and were always clean and tidy. We hired bikes on the last day which was not as expensive as we thought it was going to be. We found the all of the staff helpful and very friendly, especially the team at reception. I am sure we will be back soon. The front desk staff are great.  The toilets are mixed.  The restaurant looks good . But I'm marking down for the pitch blackness of this place at night . No food waste or dog waste recycling bin at the main recycling point.  The numbers of the pitches are so badly signposted and small you'll struggle to even see them . It's like two worlds . The front desk modern and well looked after , but the pitches an after thought and run down .

Can't argue about the location however it's a long walk to most places and the shuttle is limited time only . Uber is your main friend here . Add it to the cost .

Photos posted  are of the pitch numbers . See them ? No ? Exactly ! And of what you can see walking through at night . Nothing. An excellent campsite to stop for a visit to Paris and its surroundings. Wellmaintained pitches and services of all kinds within easy reach. Clean bathrooms and showers at all times and hot water always available. Furthermore, in addition to the shuttle service to the nearest metro and bus station, the bus stop is very close. If we really want to find a small flaw... the noise from the road which is very busy day and night for those who have a pitch in those places. Overall we had a great stay at the campsite. Staff at the reception is very friendly and helpful, the shuttlebus is very handy and the grounds are well maintained. Only point of feedback would be the level of service provided by Alexandre, one of the bar staff, who was very rude and did not provide the level of hospitality that the other staff members provided.

리뷰:
We went on three different trips with them, a coincidence that we ended up with the same driver all 3 times we were told they have 10 drivers.
Nicolas was amazing, very friendly and very skilled driver, specially in the madhouse streets of Paris. He provided bits of information on some of the locations we would pass by on our way to our destination and we were always picked up on time. And he speaks French, Spanish and English. I think most of their drivers speak all 3 languages.
This is actually my second time taking a trip with them. Last time it was to Mont St Michel, and it was great.
This time we went to Vigerny  Monets house, Loire Valley Castles, Mont St Michel. Totally worth it. I think next time we come over we might do Burges and Champagne.
I dont know why the bad reviews on the trips close to Paris though, all my trips were outside since those are the hardest places to get to on your own.
Just want to say if you want to see some amazing locations outside of Paris, and dont want the hassle of renting a car or trying to get there on your own, this is the place for you.
1010. Cancelled my trip last min when I personally confirmed with them over WhatsApp multiple times. It ruined my day and my plan. I cant believe how unreliable this travel agency is. I should have believed the other comments about their last min high risk cancellation. Had a great time doing the Loire Valley tour with the guide, Roland. Highly recommend  A wonderful tour. A great tour guide and many interesting timelines about French culture. We had many other stops include in the Normandy tour near the coast. A 2hour lunch and city tour and frequent breaks. Very satisfied with France Tourisme. Booked tour before going to France and arranged to be picked up from hotel then driven to coach departure location. Made it far more pleasant getting there, worth the extra cost. Our coach tour, in a luxury coach, was about an hour an half each way. Tour guide was knowledge and provided information enroute. Bilingual France, Spanish, and English. At the venue informed the group the best vantage points. Would use France Tourisme again.

We loved our Montmartre tour with Hugo. He was friendly and provided a thorough yet relaxed tour. He was very attentive to details with historic information, tips and opportunities for photos and a private local wine and cheese tasting. We couldn't have asked for a better day and the best tour guide. Merci beaucoup! What an incredible and unforgettable experience! Our two trips allowed us to savor the beauty of Paris both by day and by night, offering a truly enchanting perspective of the city. The highlight was undoubtedly the exceptional tour in an iconic 2CV, which added an extra layer of charm to our time in this remarkable city. We had a tremendous 2 hour evening tour in a Citroen 2CV with Joey as our guide, driver, and photographer. He went out of his way to give us wonderful views with time to stop and take pictures. His photography skills were awesome! He also played some lovely Parisian music as we road along. It was the perfect way to cap our time in Paris! We booked two separate tours due to our schedule for our one day in Paris  our guides, Leopold and Alice were both INCREDIBLE. We saw more of the city than I had ever hoped to. We were able to see ALL of the big sites, get out and take photos when we wanted to, and view Paris through the eyes of locals. The routes taken between each site and the knowledge of the little areas that are off the beaten path were so delightful to experience.

Would recommend this tour to anybody  both my mother and my 9 year old son were loving every second of the trip  definitely would do this tour again knowing we would see new places and learn so many new things, too! We did the 3h sightseeing tour by car. It was a surprise for my boyfriend, so Quentin from iparistour helped me to decide which tour would be the best, as my boyfriend hadnt been in paris yet and I had been here already. He was also very helpful with other recommandations within Paris. The tour itself was perfectly organized, from pick up till drop off. We got many cool insights on paris in a very short time. Its not a cheap tour, but its a unique opportunity to explore a city and definately worth the money! Thank you!

리뷰: I dont think it will be easy to find this level of accessibility and convenience at this price. In my opinion, I thought the sanitary conditions and management were excellent for the price, the room was comfortable, and the hot water was great! Above all, the owner was so warm and kind that I felt comfortable and happy during my stay. When I come to Paris again, I want to visit again. Bring your toiletries! The price is cheap but the location is great. The owner was also kind and nice. The bathroom is a bit disappointing, but overall I'm satisfied considering the price. If I go to Paris again, I want to visit again. I had a great stay! I don't think I'll ever go back.. The bedding looks bad and the mirror in the room is broken... haha. Maybe it's because I went before the trash from the people who stayed the night before was taken out, but it felt very dirty. It's a bed and breakfast where men and women live together, but the shower room is made of opaque glass, and there are places where sheets are not attached. There are shampoos and body washes lying around on the floor, and even the shower room door doesn't seem to close properly. They don't even provide meals. It's okay The bathroom shower booth was so cramped that even one person could fit in it. When I tried to wash it, it bumped into me. Plus, it smelled a bit too much. A foreigner on the same floor was racist and tried to open our room and come in. The second floor was very difficult to climb. Aside from the location factor, I was so skeptical that I thought I would have to pay for all of this. There was a Chinese restaurant below, so it was inconvenient to have a strong smell coming out when you open the door. As you can see, the location is 5 points. There is a supermarket 20 seconds away and a subway station 1 minute away. Nearby museums are also within walking distance. While walking, you can visit the charming alleyways of the Manet district and famous vintage shops. 10 out of 5 for the meal  The taste of your aunt's cooking is excellent  And a quick meal for dinner? The beer and wine they provide are excellent  I will give 4 points for the facilities. It is a total of 5 floors. I only brought one bag and didn't feel any inconvenience, but it may be a little inconvenient for people bringing suitcases. But it's the same wherever you go Even if you check in and check out twice, it's 5 minutes The bed mattress was great! The shower and toilet facilities are also satisfactory. Lastly, aunt! I give it 100 points  He was so kind and cool, cleaned up the place cleanly, told me to eat even if it was late, and even complimented me and said nice things. It was the best.  It was a place I wanted to go to again! Thank you aunt!

리뷰: Manon helped us with a trip to Provence after the Paris Olympics and everything from the the drivers, guides, hotel and restaurant recommendations were first rate.  She worked with us to create an itinerary based on our interests and travel style and when we had an unexpected change 8 weeks beforehand, no problem  she helped us with revisions.  We did some sightseeing, wine tasting and bike riding and had a wonderful time.  I will be recommending Paris Toujours to everyone traveling in France. Words are inadequate to express our gratitude to Laurence for arranging the 10day honeymoon of our dreams in Paris and Alsace.  She created a unique itinerary for us based on our personalities and interests.  From private walking tours to guided visits to the most important cultural sites in Paris, everything was incredible.  We had a variety of cheese and wine tasting adventures along with a macaron baking class and horseback riding in Versailles which my wife LOVED.  In Alsace we were able to explore picturesque villages and learn about what makes Alsatian wine unique at family estates with generations of experience.  We even had a unique trip to the mountains to hike with a truly authentic lunch at a local farm without another tourist in sight.  We would never have had access to such experiences without Laurence.  We will be grateful for these memories for the rest of our lives. We just returned from an 8 day trip to France and had Laurence with ParisTouJours plan all of our accommodations, transportation and get tickets for what we wanted to see.  I cannot say enough good things about our experience with Laurence!  She met us at our hotel when we got to Paris and she had everything expertly planned out in great detail.  We spent a few days in Paris, then on to Normandy, Amboise, Toulouse and back to Paris.  All of our accommodations were outstanding, our drivers were always on time and courteous and Laurence had every step of the way planned out.  She listened to our interests and what we wanted to see.  It was awesome to have tickets in advance for everything as we avoided long lines and had intimate small tours.  She even made recommendations for restaurants when we asked.  We would recommend Laurence for any trip that you want to plan in France.  She is 5star all the way! A thousand thank yous to Manon and ParisToujours for an unforgettable trip to Paris for our Mother's 80th birthday!  She planned a perfect trip from start to finish.  We loved the Hotel d'Orsay which she chose for us.  All of the tours she arranged were excellent and we enjoyed our guides immensely  Nicolas, Annemarie and Melanie, especially!  All of our drivers were on time and so personable  special thanks to Innocent, Jerome and Joe.  The restaurants she booked were lovely and delicious. The menus suited us perfectly and the service was impeccable.  We have memories for a lifetime! We just returned from a 7night trip to France. We had a group of four that ranged in age from 18 to 74.  The team at ParisToujours created a wonderful seamless plan that worked well for the entire group.  Before and during the trip, communication was very good.  We received a detailed roadmap just before our departure.  Our requests were incorporated in such a nice way.  The entire trip went to plan with no issues. The hotel selection was lovely.  Laurence, our tour guides, drivers, and the hotel staff were welcoming and made the trip magical.  AnneMarie and Marie, our tour guides in Paris, were knowledgeable and fun to spend time with touring the city.  Our guides in Champagne and the Loire Valley were very good as well. All four of us loved the trip and wished we could have stayed longer.  We will return!  Thank you ParisToujours for the fantastic memories of Paris, Champagne, and the Loire Valley.

Took 4 hours Pallace of Versailles trip. It was well organized with minivan ride included. Guide was knowledgeable and presented lots of information about the place. Obviously, you cannot see entire place in such short amount of time. But you will see enough to get the taste of this very unique place. Garden is a marvelous place, especially when weather is nice Went on a trip to Versailles and had a great experience, they guaranteed a skip the line access and that was held up. Tour guide was knowledgeable and was clear with tour directions. Editing  so I recently got an email from this company about this review.  So to be fair, they did refund 39 euros out of the 180 euros and I was not even asking for all of it.  I had told them to keep the entrance fee of 34 euros. 17 for each adult and  my child was free. I also didnt ask for a refund for the second tour at Eiffel Tower because at least the guide was with us till the end.  We messaged from the very beginning of the Versailles tour and we didnt hear back from guide till now, one week later and he was very rude.  Everything I said about being unprofessional is true.  Read other reviews about their attitudes toward customers. If he would have messaged apologizing and asking nicely about the review, I would have changed it because of them trying to be nice and apologizing for their mistake.   Not to a 4 or 5 but more than a one star.  I have proof to everything I have just said if they want to say I lied about anything.


Save your money and dont book with this company.  Unfortunately we booked two tours with them before coming to Paris and both were bad.  The first one in palace of Versailles was the worst.  The guide lost us in the second room and she didnt even notice she lost us.  We never found her. We contacted the tour company right away and they never answered my messages.  We looked from room to room and nothing.  We could hear her through headphones and she would not say what room she was in or noticed we were going. She kept on walking.  She was very short and didnt even have one of those sticks to see her.  We ended up loosing her in the headphones piece too so it made it harder.  When tour ended all they cared about was to get their machines with earpieces back. We explained what happened and even asked if we messaged the tour company which we had said yes and showed them the proof and no response.  They went on to say, oh they barely answer messages.  Then why ask if I messaged then?!
When they thanked us for returning their machines,  they said they had lost 1015 of them that day from people who also got lost and never returned them.  So youre saying you always loose people but dont care?
Second tour was of Eiffel Tower.  Guide was better than Versailles but barely told us history of the tower.  He gave us like 5 minutes of facts while we stood in front of the elevator and then left us when we got to the second floor.  The line to elevator was long and wait was an hour a there is absolutely no advantage to booking with this company because we still had to wait behind the people who just bought elevator tickets for that day for a lot less.
Please just book just tickets in advance straight from the place youre going and dont use this tour company.  There is no skip the line tour Eiffel Tower
We spent a little more but it was worth it our companion was the French Gerard pigtail and goatee he spoke 4 languages and perfect English
Nice and friendly, very professional who denies the stereotype of the pompous Frenchman This was very good, the guide spoke clearly so that we could carefully follow the history of the Eiffel Tower.
I strongly advise it

리뷰:
I was very nervous as it was my first time traveling abroad alone, so I made a reservation at a Korean guesthouse! First of all, there is no restaurant on the first floor, but a mart, so it was easy to buy daily necessities, and it is a clean building! I think I was able to get around easily even late at night because it was in front of a big road! The subway can be reached in 2 minutes, and a place to rent a bicycle is nearby!

The accommodation was clean and had a warm atmosphere, and even though it was October, I slept well without being cold! The owner cooked breakfast every day, so I was able to start my trip after eating a warm meal.

Because it is a Korean guesthouse, you can communicate with Koreans and get travel information I think it was the cornerstone of my happy memories during the 7day trip.
The owner was friendly and the food was delicious. Meals such as chicken porridge, budae stew, boiled pork, etc. were served, and thanks to this, we were able to save on food costs.

The staff were also friendly. I was impressed by the effort they made to provide as many services as possible.

The location was also great. It was within walking distance to the Louvre below and Montmartre Hill above.

I plan to visit again when I visit Paris again. I have been staying at Number Two BB for over 2 weeks since last week!
The breakfast was really delicious, and the composition was plentiful, so I was able to start my day with a hearty meal every day  SaJang's cooking skills are so good that my weight plump up hahaha.

I really liked that the cleaning lady and staff cleaned it every day.
It seemed like they cleaned the bathroom and hair thoroughly, and I was very satisfied that the blankets and towels were washed every day.

I was happy because the owner and employees were so warmhearted 
I hope you prosper! I'm a person who likes France and Europe, so I've been back and forth there a few times.
Before I go, I always look at reviews of accommodations.
I don't often write reviews because I think the good stuff is good, but I'm sharing it for the public interest.

When I looked before, there were a lot of 1star reviews, but all the reviews have disappeared.
Seeing that there were only 3 new reviews on the same day, it looks like the location was registered again. Is this something like place washing?

First of all, this place is located on the second floor, but because Europe has high ceilings, the stairs are almost like climbing stairs.
But there is no help. If your suitcase is heavy, please consider somewhere other than this place.

And I think the cleanliness is a bit lacking.
There were a lot of old reviews saying it was dirty, but I guess they were sensitive guests even though it was cheaper than a hotel.
I didn't think it was a big deal, but now that I think about it, they weren't really sensitive people.
They give you one towel each, but there are different types of towels. Customers say they are leaving it behind. They are probably throwing it away.
It's used by customers again. There's not much to say about the feel or smell.

Among the guesthouse guests, there will be many who are new to Europe and have no experience with other accommodations.
They originally said Paris was dirty, but it seemed like they were wondering if that was the case here too.
I've been to many places, but Europe isn't all dirty like here, so think carefully.

I said it was good because the breakfast was Korean food and it was free, but it was really free so I just ate it.
It's all good, but I mixed leftover rice from yesterday and made soup with yesterday's soup, and it's a different dish! They say it's too much to do.
The CEO's tsundere attitude is also criticized a lot.
Don't expect kindness, the boss is the boss. Does it feel like you should leave if you don't like it?
Ah, if you're pretty, you'll probably be excluded haha

Because it's cheaper than a hotel, they serve Korean food, and because the owner is Korean, I feel secure.
I think people are looking for a Korean bed and breakfast for various reasons.
I couldn't ask the boss directly because I was scared.
No matter how much I thought about it, this place didn't seem like an official lodging company.
As you all know, illegal companies do not take responsibility if problems or accidents occur to travelers just for their own safety.
Of course, you may trust Marit or Minda to make a reservation, but they also have no choice.
The country of Europe is gorgeous and nice to look at, but it is also a dangerous place.
You must take care of your own safety! Please keep this in mind.

The people I stayed with at the time when I didn't know anything about fashion were nice and it was nice to chat with them.
I didn't want to go back because the facilities and service were so bad.
Since then, I've been going to regular companies, hotels, or even Airbnb if possible.

Many people say that the location here is good, and that is of course true.
However, there are also good locations, clean and friendly places.

Once again, we would like to inform you that this review was written for the public interest. I recommend it if you are looking for a decent Korean bed and breakfast. I used a 4person female dormitory, but there were no people there, so I was almost alone, so it was comfortable. Even though I stayed there in a hurry, they accepted me right away. There is a shower in the room, but you have to go out to use the bathroom. I didn't really feel any inconvenience while using it... Oh, there's no air conditioning. It was very hot the day I arrived in Paris. It was a bit hot, perhaps because it was the only accommodation without air conditioning during my trip to Europe. However, since Korean food is served for breakfast, you can save money on food!

Beautiful, elegant,  and what's not less important, a free museum in Paris. Sitting right next to Seine river it's a perfect spot to come for a stroll, or take a break in the beautiful garden cafe.
Nice collection of art work with painting of old and modern masters, sculptures, furniture. You can easily spend  your whole day here. The garden is beautiful, there are lounge chairs to relax and enjoy the view.
Definitely less crowded than the  Louvre.
A gem to not be missed! A very nice and free spot to spend some quality time in Paris, short walk from Concorde and Champs Elysees. Opened on Tuesday when most of other museums are closed, also not as busy as other museums. Stunning ceilings and pieces of art but above all, a serene garden with plenty of chairs to enjoy the outdoors. Access is free, no need to book a ticket, just go through security. Museum plan available in French and English, also a guide application to download. Theres a shop, toilet and consigne left luggage available on site. Beautiful place to visit and free to enter.  I'd advise going early if you want to sit out with a coffee and enjoy the surroundings.  Nice way to spend an hour or so, while out sightseeing. Loved it  my daughter studies art and was keen to go. I was taken aback by the beauty if the building and the inner courtyard garden. Unfortunately the cafe was too busy to sit but it looked great.
The art work was an eclectic mixture of the modern and classic which made for an interesting visit. With free entry this is well worth a look. Best value so far in Paris. Free with no line up. Easy to spend a few hours walking around. Two floors. Mix of contemporary art. Definitely worth the visit. The garden in the center was peaceful with a cafe too

리뷰: Such an inspiring place with such a dark past. Site of the infamous guillotine where most of the gentry met their end. Now a tourist attraction and events venue. Ornate fountains surround the Obelisk that is adorned with Egyptian Hieroglyphics. Ironically the Place can be seen in direct line from the original Palace of the Louvre. I was unable to get closer as the site was being restored after the Olympics. Place de la Concorde was impressively transformed into an urban sports complex for the Olympics. This historic square as a vibrant sports hub was a sight to see, with the skate park standing out. It was fascinating to see such a classic Parisian landmark seamlessly adapted for contemporary sports and activities  a fresh and dynamic experience. Wonderful experience shared with my son. Everyone should share Paris with someone they love. Place de la Concorde is one of Pariss most historic and impressive squares, located between the Champslyses and the Tuileries Garden. Its known for its grandeur, with the iconic Egyptian obelisk standing at its center, surrounded by beautiful fountains and statues. The square offers stunning views of major Paris landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Its rich history and central location make it a mustvisit for anyone exploring the city, offering a perfect blend of French history, architecture, and charm. This is a spectacular plaza in Paris. The water fountains are beautiful even if water is not flowing. It is located at the end of the Tuileries garden and start of the Champs Elysee.

리뷰: Beautiful place, you feel that you are in NYC in the USA,when you see the statues. Its free to visit. Also you can see the Eiffel Tower completely from there, plus they have free sports machines behind the statue if you like to workout . I recommend you to visit it. I recently visited the Statue of Liberty in Paris, and it was a delightful experience! This smaller version of the iconic New York statue that is located on the le aux Cygnes in the Seine River. The setting is beautiful, offering picturesque views of the river and the surrounding cityscape. It's a peaceful spot perfect for a leisurely stroll or a moment of reflection. The statue itself is impressive and a wonderful symbol of the friendship between France and the United States. Overall, it's a mustvisit landmark that adds a unique charm to the Parisian experience. The Statue of Liberty in Paris, located on the le aux Cygnes in the Seine River, is a smaller replica of the iconic American monument. Gifted by the American community in Paris to commemorate the centennial of the French Revolution, this statue stands at about 11.5 meters tall. It faces westward, symbolically looking towards its larger counterpart in New York. The statue's location offers a picturesque view, and its significance highlights the enduring friendship between France and the United States. It's a charming and historically rich landmark that adds a unique touch to the Parisian landscape. This Statue of Liberty Paris is located on what is called swan Island accessible on foot by walking on one of the bridges that crosses the Siene River Pont De Grenelle. When you go under this bridge via the stairs towards the statue, you will also walkthrough an outdoor workout gym that was constructed underneath the bridge. Smaller version of liberty  in USA has a park to strength your body building  and good for relaxing your mind while looking Eiffel tower in panoramic view with breeze air
