주소: Esplanade Valéry Giscard d'Estaing, 75007 Paris, France
리뷰:
Fantastic museum! Incredible collection of impressionist paintings by a variety of masters. Plus many other paintings and statues. It's in an old train station that was converted into the museum. Very well designed. Very nice feel to the museum. Highly recommended. This is an excellent museum and, in my opinion,  a mustsee when in Paris. It's a more manageable size when compared to the Louvre.  It's well laid out and accessible. I think we spent 34 hours here and saw everything else wanted to see. We bought our tickets in advance and had a minimal line.  I really enjoy the Impressionists and was very satisfied when I left. I recommend this museum and I will definitely come back again. I am inclined to prefer this place over the Louvre, its still a very large space but on multiple floors in a single central location so to navigate is not an issue. We had no queue to get in either with our pre paid tickets. So many things to see here, you could spend half a day or more if you took the time to appreciate the setting and the various paintingssculptures that is here. Also a few opportunities to get some pictures of the outside. Oh and there will be a large queue to get a picture by the clock, personally I don't see the appeal a picture Infront of the clock, especially with a phone as its likely the background will be over exposed or the other way around, but a more interesting picture is getting one from the sides or behind people as it gives a better sense of the scale of the various clocks here. We visited the Muse d'Orsay in the last week of August 2024 and had a great experience overall. However, one tip for other visitors avoid purchasing "skip the line" tickets from thirdparty sellers, especially if you're planning to visit on a weekday morning. The crowds were lite during our visit, and the line for onsite tickets was minimal, so the extra cost for those tickets wasn't worth it in our case. The crowds may vary seasonally, but this is something to keep in mind if you're visiting during a quieter time.

As for the museum itself, it's very well organized. Its also quite kidfriendly, with elevators available throughout the building, making it accessible for strollers and wheelchairs alike. There's a large cafeteria inside too which we haven't tried but seemed reasonable priced based on a quick glance on the menu.

While the museum is much smaller compared to the Louvre, you can comfortably explore it in 2 to 3 hours. We started at the top on the 5th floor, where the oldest paintings from the mid to late 1800sparticularly the Impressionist paintings are housed. As you work your way down, you move through postImpressionist works, which often depict older historical events but were painted later.

Overall, it was a lovely couple of hours spent surrounded by incredible art in a more intimate and less overwhelming setting than the other larger museums around there In my opinion, this is the concept of what a perfect museum should strive to be. Everything was very accessible and easy to follow. The museum followed a chronological experience and took you on a voyage of 70 years of the most important works in art history between 1850 and 1920. The museums layout and amenities were perfect and my visit couldnt have gone better. World class museum that every Parisgoer should plan a morning or afternoon visiting. 55

Square de lle de France is a serene oasis nestled between historic landmarks. With views overlooking the Seine and proximity to NotreDame, its an ideal spot for contemplation and taking in the scenic beauty of Paris. Perfect for a brief quiet break in the middle of the chaotic landmarks and tourists. Ah, Square de l'le de France, what a lovely place! Located in the heart of Paris, this square is known for its beautiful gardens and tranquil atmosphere. It's a fantastic spot to take a leisurely stroll, have a picnic, or simply relax and enjoy the surroundings.

The square is adorned with lush greenery, colorful flowers, and charming pathways. You'll find benches scattered throughout, providing the perfect spot to sit and soak up the peaceful ambiance. It's a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and unwind for a while.

If you're a fan of history, you might be interested to know that the square is named after le de France, the historical region surrounding Paris. It's a nod to the rich heritage and cultural significance of the area.

Whether you're a local looking for a serene retreat or a visitor hoping to discover a hidden gem, Square de l'le de France is definitely worth a visit. Enjoy the tranquility and beauty it has to offer! Is there anything else I can assist you with? Beutiful place that looks like a painting..  especially after rain. Lovely.

Large fountain with a bunch of chairs to relax on while you observe the Louvre. It is also possible to see the Place de la Concorde Oblisque de Louxor, with the faded silhouette of the Arc de Triomphe behind it, and even the top of the Eiffel Tower rising up from the hills. Great place to visit in the Tuileries Garden after visiting the Louvre. Huge fountain with plenty of seating around it. Great location to relax on a sunny day and watch the birds. If you need a place to relax in hectic Paris, this is it. There are more than enough chairs to find a place to sit.

Enjoy the ducks, enjoy the Parisians walking by, enjoy the day.

리뷰: Well we loved it! I was able to benefit from a 50 reduction thanks to my CE, so we took our 12 year old daughter there. 45minute visit, fully automated but very interesting, fun, we laughed a lot. We were a small group, no waiting. We came away delighted. Disappointed because it was broken With some English friends passing through Paris, we went to visit the backstage of the great Rex. Everything worked very well for... 5 minutes at the end of which we found ourselves at the exit where an employee asked us if we liked it and if everything had gone well. When we told him we hadn't seen anything, he was surprised, and after explanations, he kindly refunded us. Never mind, we will go back!!! Please note, this place is not to be confused with the cinema. This is a bit of a behindthescenes tour of the Grand Rex retracing its history and a bit of the history of cinema. Nice for a little outing with friends or for a fun date . A very good surprise entry certainly a little expensive 11 eurosperson but acceptable given the originality of the visit. We have a great time there and have a lot of fun. In addition, the reception and boutique staff are very friendly in Paris, this is rare enough to be mentioned. Quite nice to do but you have to go early in the morning so as not to be in the crowd before 10 a.m. Plus we went on Heritage Day so it was a nice half price.

리뷰:
The first time I went to a jazz bar and it was an amazing experience. If you get into the place early, there arent many people, and you can see some other visitors dancing while the jazz band performs. The place is very popular, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. When my friend and I arrived at opening time, we had to wait about 15 minutes. Theres often a long queue, but its definitely worth the wait. Its unfortunately a tiktok place right now. Inside is so much crowded that you can not enjoy any of the music. Its just packed, without air and you wait in line to get in. we went on a thursday evening

Normal entry is 14, for students its 10. Its good that they have two prices cause most of the people are tourists. Im not complaining about it being a touristy place, but they should lower the number of maximum people that can be inside at the same time. Because for now, its like a musical sauna in a basement  Get there early as there will be a line.  Dance floor and band in basement is very crowded, but a blast.  The only time I can remember where people are not doom scrolling phones.  Crazy to be dancing in a room where Templars met..... The atmosphere in this place is crazy. Its filled to the brim with people on the weekends and people dance and yell and go crazy. There was even a proposal she said, yes. Normal entry fee was 16 euros A very fun live jazz bar!!! The band who was playing was wonderful and everyone was so happy! You can sit down and listen or dance with amazing music. 

The only downside was that it can get very hot and humid downstairs  but the fun makes you forget the uncomfortable feeling haha. Id love to go back again!

even inside it was so bad.

I recently had an incredibly disappointing experience at The Bridge in Paris.

My friends and I, a group of six from different ethnic backgrounds and with a good gender ratio 3 men and 3 women, made a reservation online and were excited about our night out.

We even paid for a van to ensure we arrived together and on time.

However, despite our reservation and preparation, we were not allowed entry.

The staff offered no explanation, and their attitude felt dismissive and discriminatory. This experience ruined our night and left us feeling humiliated.

I expected much better from a venue like The Bridge.

Save your time and money and look for a more inclusive and respectful place to enjoy your night out. Despite the crowd and the minor service issue, I had a great time. The club's vibrant atmosphere and unique Parisian charm make it worth a visit.

If you're looking to experience Parisian nightlife, Bridge Club is a solid choice. Just make sure to book ahead and be ready for a lively crowd. This venue is under the northeast side of the bridge, with the line typically starting above the righthand side of the bridge. I arrived at 130am, and was in line until 245am before entering. I attended the Agents of Time  me live  Yet More show put on by Haiku. I was nervous to come here after reading the negative reviews my experience was great, however. I didnt drink, but I purchased the pricy water 8. Bar staff was very friendly, security was reasonable, and I felt very safe. Even the bathroom was well organized by staff so the line kept moving. The vibes were great  a good mixed crowd in terms of age and locals  visitors. Room to dance, or to move to the front. The lights were fantastic. The only thing I didnt like were the aholes who cut the line, and the glass beer bottles on the floor none were broken during my visit fortunately. Solid place to see a show. Would give zero stars if i could. The queue is long and place overcroded. Not to mention there are pickpockets there that have stolen phones out of people's bags on multiple occasions and security does not help at all or do anything about a situation that has been brought to their attention several times. Would not go back, would definitely not recommend. Save your money and go somewhere decent. Horrible experience. Aggressive and extremely disrespectful bouncers that make you feel more like inmates than guests at a venue. The bar is overpriced and the untrained bartenders are overwhelmed with the amount of people, average 20 minutes for a drink, no surprise there, they were also disrespectful. The cherry on top is that theres no toilet cabines for men, they just assume that any man going to a cabin must be doing drugs and treat you as such, if they finally let you go into one, youll have bouncer knock on the door and look over it in the less than a minute. Never again.

리뷰:
You don't need to pay anything to enter here. Near this place is Chateau Vincennes, a really big castle. Unfortunately when i visited this area the place was closed, but i could walk in the woods.

This area is really big, and has a lot to offer, especially on the other side, you will find Lac Daumesnil. You won't regret going there. My fave jardin parc in 20th eme in Paris. Its totally free to enter, you can do almost anything you want, jogging, walking, running whether you alone or in a group. Visit the arboretum the river just sitting down alone to contemplate your life, reading a book, kissing a with your lover.
But please keep it beautiful as it is.
Im just running here circling the park and it turned out to my half marathon run. Optimal for walking, biking, jogging and ... during the day. At night there is another business on  not to recommend ... Bois de Vincennes, located on the eastern edge of Paris, is one of the largest green spaces in the city, offering a stunning retreat from the urban hustle. Often referred to as the lungs of Paris, this expansive park covers nearly 2,500 acres, making it a haven for nature lovers, joggers, cyclists, and families looking to relax outdoors.

The parks diverse landscapes range from sprawling meadows and thick woodlands to picturesque lakes, creating a variety of ecosystems that are home to numerous bird species and wildlife. One of the highlights is the Lac Daumesnil, where visitors can rent boats and float peacefully, surrounded by lush greenery. The Parc Floral is another mustsee, especially in spring and summer when the vibrant flower displays are in full bloom. For those interested in history, the Chteau de Vincennes, a medieval fortress located at the parks edge, adds a touch of cultural charm.

Bois de Vincennes is wellequipped with paths for biking and walking, making it an ideal spot for those looking to stay active. Theres also a small zoo, the Parc Zoologique de Paris, and an equestrian center for horseback riding enthusiasts. The parks peaceful atmosphere and size make it feel like a natural escape, despite being just a short metro ride from central Paris.

The park hosts various events throughout the year, from concerts to festivals, adding a lively cultural element to the natural surroundings. Whether youre after a peaceful walk, a scenic picnic, or just some fresh air, Bois de Vincennes offers something for everyone, blending the tranquility of nature with the charm of Paris. Very big and lively park. Jogging, picnic, doing sports, cycling, zoo park etc you can do everything here. Also if you like to study botanics, there are different kinds of parks.

Completely out of the mainstream mindset  dead animals, guns and paintings of hunters and dead animals. I let you imagine how weird it can look at first in todays world.
Yet it is a brilliant must see place in Paris. Always good surprises to discover. Mix of tradition and fun cutting edge modern arts.
I love it much better than the neighbouring Picasso museum Its quirky, but if youre fine with taxidermy, youll appreciate how this museum mixes modern art with the stuffed animals. Tickets are just over 10 Euros and it took us an hour to go through, enjoying every room. The signs are in French. To be honest, I don't recommend it. Charging 13 for such an exposition is too much. There are more artworks than nature here. I'm also annoyed by the guards who follow your every move, there are more of them than exhibits Taxidermy, black feathered book cave and guns!

Not exactly my jam, but holy cow it totally was!  Not only is it in the heart of the Marias, but it is in the MOST gorgeous mansion, with a gorgeous museum gift shop.  Who knew?!

The current exhibition by Tamara Kistianovsky of cloth sculptures inspired by nature is exquisite! It is so well curated and placed that you feel like you walked into an alternate world where elegance meets whimsy!

Go for a coffee to Sevenly Heaven across the street and luxuriate A very strange museum which isnt for the faint hearted. A mix of old and new, taxidermy animals and contemporary art related to nature. I enjoyed it but didnt feel great about the whole theme. Most of the museum is accessible but there is a small area at the end that is accessed with stairs. Has a gift shop. Free first Sunday of the month, I went on this day and didnt have to queue.

Good also if you are a trail runner and looking for some smaller challenging runs in the city Parc Montsouris is a true oasis in Paris. Tucked away from the bustling city, it's incredibly peaceful and serene. The expansive green lawns, beautiful lake, and winding paths create the perfect setting for a relaxing walk or quiet picnic. Whether you're looking to unwind with a book under a tree or simply enjoy the tranquility of nature, this park is the ideal spot. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a peaceful escape within the city. Beautiful park, super nice landscaping. It gets a bit crowded on hot days, since its the only green spot in this area of town.

Great for kids. They have games, both free and paid. Lots of space to play with balls.

Its a pity they close so early during winter, you cant even take a stroll after work. They also close it with some wind, so check before going. I wanted to take a quiet stroll at the end of long day, so I chose Parc Montsouris because it was a short bus ride from my hotel.  It was the best choice I could have made.  The park has beautiful naturalistic landscaping and wide, winding paths that are ideal for leisurely walks.

There was also an eerie art installation in the large pond that features some ghostly, fairylike beings.  Seeing it at dusk made the experience all the more haunting  memorable.

Parc Montsouris is ideal for picnics, running, bird watching, strolling, sitting on a bench to enjoy a good book or hang out with a friend. Beautiful little  not too park. A lot of grass space to hangout with friends, a lake, a walking path around the park. Not a tourist park. Obviously, with many things to do in Paris, coming out to the 14ieme might not be high on the list but if you've been many times, a great park to run in or hangout with friends.

I visited the Eiffel Tower gardens today and was thoroughly impressed. The meticulously maintained lawns, vibrant flowerbeds, and charming pathways create a serene atmosphere, perfect for a leisurely stroll. The gardens offer stunning views of the Eiffel Tower, providing ample photo opportunities. Benches scattered throughout allow for moments of rest and reflection, making it an ideal spot to unwind. The combination of lush greenery and the iconic backdrop of the Eiffel Tower makes these gardens a mustvisit for anyone in Paris. Gorgeous view, came on a Monday between 2pm3pm just the 3 of us. Got a few shops in the middle of the tower that do pizzas, chips, refreshments. We wanted a slush whilst it was 37 and obviously its a sell out on a day like that, so wasn't able to grab one. No bother, there was still plenty of refreshments to grab.

Nice views of Paris, was definitely worth the experience! I'd recommend extra staff for the Cafe areas as we were lined up for 30 minutes with 2 people serving, but they were polite and friendly and overall the experience is something we all very much enjoyed and recommend  People will moan about about the crowds but its paris!

Once you get past that you will be gobsmacked by the sheer beauty that is the eiffel tower and the lovely ponds and gardens .

We went at night which i would recommend as during the day the tower can look a bit glum . But at night is just impressive by anyone's standards and if you're lucky to be there when the light show is on you will love it.

Quite the wait for the 2 x lifts to reach the top but worth the wait if you only do it once in your life. I was lucky enough to be able to watch the Olympic medal matches for the womens beach volleyball in the Eiffel garden stadium. It created a unique experience I will never forget. every season has a different perception of this tower, that's why I always come to see the Eiffel Tower when I'm in Paris. I really understand the Parisians when they were against this Tower , it really violates the architecture of the city a little, but there is no more famous place in the world entrance to the tower is 25 euros by the way and you can wait from 40 minutes to 4 hours, so choose your time wisely, the best on weekday mornings.

Parc Monceau is a beautiful and peaceful oasis in the heart of Paris. The park is wellmaintained, with lovely walking paths, picturesque bridges, and charming statues. Its the perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, a quiet picnic, or just relaxing in nature. The park also has a playground for kids, making it great for families. I love the blend of nature and art here, with its tranquil ponds and historical architecture. A hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of the city! Really nice park close to all the popular tourist spots. I pass through here each day and also used to live close by. The only problem with this park is that there is no dog space. It's absolutely insane and for the amount of people who have dogs in the dog they really need to cater for these people. Beautiful flowers and green area here. Also great place to run if you are looking for something quick  its just over a kilometre per loop. This such a lovely park. It is nice for a stroll. Many varieties of plants are in the gardens. The park is surrounded by mansions and other large buildings. As a semiprivate park, the mansions have 24 hour access to the park. The park is ornamented with lakes, statues, and architectural features. Entry from Avenue Velazquez will take you through a magnificent gate. Its an exquisite and beautiful garden in Paris 8th arrondissement.
Oh I hope I can lay down on its bench for just enjoying the slow sunset with such a beautiful view of flowers, the pond lake with the swans swimming, the water fountains and so many artsy statuesque.

The perfect weather just to enjoy this in between autumn and winter. An absolutely enchanting place to spend your Saturday or Sunday downtime. Flowers blooming among marbled statues, slow strolls remind you to take your breath while you step. Benches serve you to pause and eat the savory crepe and espresso.

The zoo is very beautiful and wellmaintained. The rare animals, especially the marine ones, are a delight to see. The zoo is wellindicated, and the animals seem happy and wellcared for. However, I noticed that the baboon monkeys seemed to be in need of more vegetation in their enclosure. I hope the zoo administration will consider addressing this issue. The Amazon corner of the zoo is particularly impressive and welldesigned. Best zoo weve ever been. Maybe it was in August and all the Parisians are out for holidays. The zoo was very quiet to visit on a Sunday. Out little one really enjoyed the flat and easy walk in the park. The animals were glassed for better observation for the little ones. Appreciate the design. The feeding sessions of the sea lion was interactive as well. Overall, we had great time!
If you have young child, I would suggest you bring them in a sling rather than push a pram.  It will allow more flexibility! This zoo is wonderful. Excellent layout and the enclosures are large with several animals living together. Interesting animals and birds. The tropical house was really great. Our toddler loved running around here for a few hours. Great place to safely spend a few hours with kids and have access to lots of toiletsbaby change and foodwater outlets. We didnt really encounter any staff aside from the ticket seller who was nice enough. One of the most beautiful zoos I have seen. A huge plus is the single path that makes it hard to get lost. The park looks very wellmaintained. We spent 45 hours there. I would gladly go there again. Absolutely do not recommend you going here if you like animals
Its bizarre the little space and conditions these animals are placed in. They shouldnt be in any zoo, in the first place.
Lets please stop supporting zoos of any sort. Its time we evolve! Let the species be where they belong.
These places are all about making money and zero about animal care  protection although they claim it to be!!!

주소: 3 Av. de la Prte d'Auteuil, 75016 Paris, France
리뷰:
Spent two weeks here for the Olympics,  this was my favorite stop!  Best botanical gardens I've ever been to.  Just wish the signs had also been in English. The google directed entrance was blocked by an event and it will be closed until June 16. But the google directive should be fixed.  According to the instructions, after exiting metro 10 at Porte d'Auteuil, you need to take the bus to go 2 more stops and then walk.  But that is not necessary!  I followed directions and then I found out it was stupid.
After exiting metro 10 exit Bd de Murat and on the ground until, look to your right  cross the street and that's the other entrance to the park, very close and convenient.

I arrived after 5pm and the greenhouses were all closed this doesn't update the system.  You should arrive before 4pm to be able to visit the greenhouse because it is obviously the special thing about this garden.

Other than that I found the park not very special compared to other parks in Paris.  It is like a garden next to the house, not necessarily beautiful and special to the point of becoming a famous tourist destination.  And it's on the edge of Paris, so it takes a while to get around.  If you are nearby, you can stop by and go for a walk or sunbathe. Such a cool place! I loved the ponds and running water. They even have fish and parakeets! So many interesting plants to see, so many greenhouses. After the crowds and noise of the city this felt like such a wonderful escape. Id highly recommend!! Just gorgeous. A bit dilapidated, perhaps, but that only enhances the whimsy. By far one of my favorite green spaces in Paris, helped by the fact that its out of the way enough to be both expansive and peaceful. If youre lucky you might even get misted  Excellent. Vast array of plants from across the world,  some lovely koi carp and huge south american fish. Most of the greenhouses were open, and it was lovely and quiet even at midday in august! A lovely place to escape the tourist bustle. And its all free to enter! Maybe not ideal for young children as youre not supposed to touch the plants a fun family visit for us though with 2 teenagers  Sculpture exhibition on currently so worth a visit.

리뷰: It has always been a dream to visit a football stadium in Europe and this brought out the child in me. From walking the halls, visiting the locker room and getting to go on the pitch, its more than one can ask for. The store made it even better. I would definitely go back and I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris The start of the stadium tour extremely unorganised, with no set signs saying where to go, like a free for all to get in, no matter if you had pre booked.. due to the free for all, the start of the tour is extremely crowded. Once you get past the crowd the tour was good, unaccompanied around and get full access. My nephew loved it! I thought it would be a guided tour, but it ended up being a selfguided tour. Nevertheless, he was plenty impressed, especially with the changing rooms. The little video half way through in the history of the PSG was a nice touch. There were A LOT of stairs so it might not be for people with mobility issues. I don't actually know whether there were elevators. Actually really loved this tour. My daughter and husband are big soccer fans and since Messi played for PSG, of course we had to go while we were in Paris. It was really cool! Coming from the US, I loved seeing what an amazing stadium they had for soccer. The grass!!! Wow!! They were prepping for a game and it was beautiful. The mascot was walking around taking pics, which was really neat. And the store! Huge! You can buy a jersey and for an extra 25Euro put your own name and number on the back. Pretty spendy, but a very unique souvenir. Definitely recommend. Coming from the UK, this was a special treat for my teenage son being a huge fan of Paris Saint Germain fc. He loved every second of it. I loved the freedom of the tour. The stadium was very impressive. Of course we had to visit the stadium shop.

주소: 4 Rue des Petits Champs, 75002 Paris, France
리뷰:
While you could describe Galerie Vivienne as a mall, the term would falsely evoke for Americans those structures which housed the Nordstroms, Sees and Barnes  Nobles of our bygone childhoods.

On the other hand a 200 year old covered passageway like Galerie Vivienne adorned with ornate iron roof and decor is something different.

It is an opportunity to stroll through shops, while imagining what old Paris was like when wealthy ladies would stroll through the passageways with their enormous bustled dresses, and they had husbands or lady servants who carry their parcels for them . There several  passages   in Paris or covered galleries that have been preserved very well and Galerie Vivienne is one of them. Its not only beautiful and charming, it also hosts a cohort of little shops, some stylish ones, an amazing bookstore with antique books in various languages, a great cafe to eat a lovely lunch or just great sorbet. This historic covered passage and shopping arcade is a must visit while you are in Paris. Located in the second arrondissement, this passage has beautiful mosaic floor and covered with glass ceilings.

Visiting this galerie can especially be a great alternative if you have to spend a rainy or hot day in Paris. There are plenty of options inside, including a variety of restaurants offering gourmet food and cafes. The passage is also adorned with interesting decorative designs and sculptures. Its considered as one of the most glamorous covered passages in Paris, a Pompeian style masterpiece!

Besides the art galleries, fashion boutiques, and wine tasting, should make special mention of the bookstore it houses  Jousseame, originally called Librariere PetitSiroux, one of the original tenants of this passage.

You should plan on spending at least a few hours in this passage, if not longer to take in the history, architecture, and everything else it has to offer, besides perhaps relaxing at a restaurant or caf. A beautiful place with shops where you can buy things like clothes, souvenirs, pastries, etc. It's like a small mall. I love the dome and the corridor. Galerie Vivienne in France is a captivating destination that transports you to a bygone era of elegance and sophistication. As you wander through its enchanting passages, you're surrounded by a curated selection of boutique shops, charming cafes, and artisanal galleries. The architecture is simply breathtaking, with ornate details and glass ceilings that fill the space with natural light. It's a haven for lovers of art, culture, and history, offering a unique blend of oldworld charm and modernday allure. Whether you're browsing for treasures, enjoying a leisurely stroll, or savoring a cup of coffee amidst the picturesque surroundings, Galerie Vivienne is a mustvisit gem in the heart of France.

They look so very much fit and muscular, wellarmed and their presence is quite intimidating at first but makes one feel safe moving about here.

리뷰:
Very large up scale department  store. Restroom didn't open until 10am and there was a charge to use. I didn't have any Euros on me but it accepted my credit card. Cost me 87 cents, and very clean. Lady attendant was upset w me because I took pictures. She said I was trying to get her fired. I love this mall. It has so many shops and nice stores. Its in the middle of 13eme arrondissement in Paris, close to metro station and has a parking lot. It's quite surprising that this shopping center has managed to secure four stars. In my opinion, a more accurate rating would be around 2.5 stars. It's a bit of a letdown, to be honest.
I moved from the US  CA to Paris. I expected to see something different in the city of light, fashion, and beauty. Instead, it was a "meh"! It reminded me of these desert outlets in the US, but the difference is that this mall structure and lighting need a lot of help. If you expect to go to this mall to have fun with your friends, forget it because how it is designed is depressing, to say the least, with three floors and escalators that can hardly be found. And the shops are like something from the 1990s!! And what's up with Zara women? What's up with their fashion selections in France? I lived in Portugal for a year and visited Spain Madrid, Barcelona, Sevilla.. . Zara offers excellent fashion selections in both countries, so why not in France? Someone has to say something because this Zara in this mall and others in France are the shallow versions of any Zara I have visited or shopped before.
One of the biggest surprises for me was the limited brand offerings at Sephora. I've never been particularly interested in their own brand, and yet, it seems to dominate the store. It's a bit baffling, to be honest.
Also, don't drive to this mall, or you will end up with 12 for 3 hours. This alone explains why this mall hardly has any customers and is almost empty during the week. Liked this mall a lot. They had lots of shops but not much of a variety so don't know how well its suited to tourists. Mostly clothes shops but we did find a shop that reminded us of Tiger. It had miscellaneous items ranging from stationary to bottles to candles. Would recommend Very strict security at entrance and throughout the Mall, English extremely limited, very difficult for visitors... Everything in French... Good luck in getting around and understanding labels... Some familiar international franchises..

리뷰:
BHV Homme store for men. Lots of nice clothing brands Kenzo, De Fursac, Hugo Boss, Galeries Lafayette etc.. Perfumes, jewelry... Access to this store on the rue du Temple side has a courtyard called "blue courtyard" is quite nice also you can relax there while enjoying a coffee, a beer... while nibbling on cakes, waffles, or even hamburgers. The staff of this 4,500 m2 store are quite welcoming and competent. It's a great place to purchase Frenchmade accessories. Clothing is rarely made in France, but American and British products are common Tax refunds are available, but you must purchase more than a certain amount, so keep this in mind when shopping. Calculation is based on the basement 1 floor tools and accessories, lighting, lighting, etc., excluding the clothing and fashion floor. Instead of having to carry items from furniture and accessory stores separately to the checkout counter, you can put them all together in a shopping cart that you drag on the floor and pay at any checkout counter. But if you say you want to pay for clothes and other props at the same time, they say yes. It seems to be a country of trust. They say there's no problem as long as you don't go out the door. Tax refund is done in a small area between the 1st floor and the first basement floor, but you have to request basic receipts and tax refund paper to write down information at the cash register. And don't go through the trouble of going to the Mariage Freres store, which is quite far from Beacheve, and come here. They sell Mariage Frere and Kusumi Tea in the grocery store actually, they were also at the airport..., so it would be a good idea to buy them here while getting a tax refund. The Beashube staff basically doesn't speak English, so if you need anything, please take a picture and show it. Thanks to the truly friendly staff, this is my fifth visit to Beashbeman. Next time I go to Paris, I will go to Beacheve again.

If anyone, like me, stops by here to set up a Maison Objet booth, I would like to give you this tip. We provide free shipping from here to the hotel, so dont just take it away. You can even specify the date, so I guess it was the 6th floor... the floor where doorknob decorations and such were sold... You can talk about it there. The furniture I requested delivery included one shoe rack, one iron table, two iron chairs, and other miscellaneous lighting and parts. I hope it was helpful BHV homme, multibrand department store. Lots of choice but high prices, interesting when they have endofseason sales. Price a little high compared to Japan but nice seller GOOD

A small, local mall with a lot of stores for all your basic needs and maybe more. Don't expect too many fashion boutiques here, but you have a lot of options for such a small all shoe repair, dry cleaning, beauty products Sephora, Beauty Monop, Parashop, an express nail salon, a hairdresser, a quick coffee or pastries at Paul or lunch at Al Boustan, Bistrot Bocaux or Bouddha Rieur, before shopping at the Gant Casino giant supermarket.
It's not overcrowded and it's perfect for the neighborhood. The "Les Belles Feuilles" shopping gallery is located in the heart of the 16th arrondissement, between rue Victor Hugo and place du Trocadro. You can access it by 3 addresses 16 rue des Belles Feuilles, 12 rue des Sablons and 37 Rue SaintDidier. It is also accessible from its secure underground parking, the entrance of which is on Rue SaintDidier. The metro will also allow you to visit us from the Victor Hugo Line 2, Porte Dauphine Line 2, Boissire Line 6, Trocadro Line 6 and 9, or Rue de la Pompe Line 9 stations. Nice place for shopping in Paris Great little shopping centre. The casino supermarket is great. Has a growing selection of hard seltzers. Has a supermarket Casino with all the daily essentials, a few restaurants and also a pharmacy and few clothing stores. Has an underground parking parking.

주소: 9 R. de la Monnaie, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰:
I love how spacious the shopping mall is! Its massive, offering a wide variety of brands, including exclusive Olympic merchandise. The sales associates were incredibly kind and even helped me wrap my purchase as a souvenir for my loved ones back home. The packaging is super classyI'm so impressed! I'll definitely be returning! This is not a department store, its my wealthy friends bedroom, a rooftop restaurant that can transport one to the south of France, a 60s living room with TVs that broadcast from the 1960s.  Service is impeccable.

The history of the department store has unique early 1800s roots where the founder sold women Tshirts across from the mens market on the River Siene where the store is today.  He married a lady from La Marche, the other big store in town.  They never had kids but treated their employees like family.  The creator of the Eiffel Tower made the exposed internal framing. He gave much to the community and they bestowed the nickname Samaritaine to him for his good deeds.  Thank you Richard from Mauritius at the store for the kind knowledge.

Bought by LVMH and reopened 3 years ago after decade long renovation. Huge, impressive, luxurious and therefore not for everyone, or more to the point probably for those with deep pockets indeed.
I was looking for a shirt made of corduroy and this is the only item of the kind I found look at the picture.
Unfortunately not for my pay grade. A posh department store that has been under wraps for a long time, a very impressive structure with its use of steel and glass, the interior is absolutely stunning, and with a trip up to the roof area, whilst browsing the many floors of high end brands. The smallest department store in Paris is just nice for a quick browse and filled with beautiful things you want to see and touch but not necessarily buy because there isnt 20 salesperson hounding you the moment you walk in. The Veuve Cliquot counter has many special items thatll be a nice souvenir and the staff are SUPER friendly.

이름: Le charme parisien des passages couverts
리뷰:
Nice old Arcades Very beautiful Parisian passage with a certain charm and a neoclassical atmosphere. Passages created in the 19th century, with the main characteristics of being covered by glass roofs letting in daylight while sheltering traders, customers and suppliers from bad weather mainly located in the central districts of Paris

Some are absolutely beautiful, with refined interior decoration and a floor covered in mosaics, benefiting from good maintenance while others, more popular, are less frequented and abandoned. Some seem a little disordered like the Passage des Panoramas, but are full of restaurant terraces with various cuisines worth trying if only for the cachet of the decor and the cuisine that you don't necessarily find elsewhere . Others, without being temples of luxury, are rather well maintained and famous for some of their boutiques and their proximity to picturesque places, such as the Jouffroy passage, where the exit to the Grvin museum is located replicas of celebrities in wax. and toy and souvenir shops La Bote  Joujoux or old book bookstores. Others house rather luxurious artisanal businesses like the Vro Dodat gallery, close to the Ministry of Culture and the Louvre Museum. And also, the gallery having been occupied by the JouClub stores, next to Tte Dans Les Nuages , on the Boulevards des Italians...

Most of these covered passages are passable by wheelchair or with a stroller, but be careful of the crowds, especially where there are restaurant terraces facing each other! And the middle of the Jouffroy passage, with a staircase, to be avoided if you are in the cases mentioned above Small shops that are linked together, sheltered from everything. A downside, there are too many catering options, no connection with the place. Especially not to be missed if you pass nearby...

The place is very good and the room where the shows take place is located at the Passage Molire, opposite a bookstore where you can buy books written by the authors who appear on stage. A cultural place, where we can exchange and meet people, there is even a bar. Very warm welcome, warm and very friendly service. Thank you for everything! Nice passage which has no other interest than to make the link between two streets. No store, small private boxes. Not always clean too but that's Paris, the city of dog pee and young Friday night drinkers. Small, almost secret passage classified as a historic monument since 1984. 주소: 3 Cr de la Garonne, 77700 Serris, France
리뷰:
Beautiful place for shopping and  just looking around. The brands are high end but you get great discounts. Its a shopaholics haven. Ts outside Paris. Its not that hard to reach this place once you get the hang of commuting in the metro and lots of walking for 19 mins after  disembarking from the metro. You will be passing through a huge mall with great shops that is more budget friendly. Its Shop till you drop here and La Valle Village  Best of both worlds. A next level of open air high end branded boutique outlet. So many branded stuffs from France local brand and also international fashion labels.
Gucci, Coach, Prada, Tory Burch, Salvatore Ferragamo, etc until the sports brand like m, The north face.
Squeaky clean bathroom, kindly staffs, cute little jardin for waiting area, some of coffees and dessert shops like Pierre Herme, Laduree, CoffeeRalphs, Momus etc
Many cute green benches in front of every outlet. Must go for any shopping lovers!!! It's quite a haven and especially attractive because there is Gucci and Prada there, along with Dolce  Gabbana, Longchamp, Givenchy and Versace. Highlight for me was the Gucci where prices were great and the staff serving me was polite and patient. Definitely recommended and will be part of every of my trips to Paris for sure! Helps that it is convenient by RER, with helpful customer information counters and complimentary private car rides to the Village from the train station. Amazing deals to shop for discounted high brands items. The location itself is very pretty, like a small village. They have restaurants as well for people who need a break to rest. It was rainy when we went but still we were able to look around and shop. I have recently visited the La Vallee Village on  29th of September. We have to cross the commercial shopping centre in order to reach the La vallee village. All the luxurious brands under one roof. The village is so elegantly designed that anyone who visits will be awestruck. Few brands like Timberland, Tissot, Diesel, Armani and few others are worth shopping for as the prices are discounted when compared to outside stores. Even I have purchased for myself from the above brands.
We were not allowed inside few stores like Gucci and Dior, the staff asked for an appointment to enter the store. Which, I personally felt offended and didnt like it.
We tourists come from different countries to spend thousands of euros and dont get the respect which we deserve.

La vallee village closes by 6pm, so plan your day accordingly. You can reach the place by taking a Metro and RER from the city.
This place is a worth visit if you are in Paris.

리뷰: I don't often write reviews, and I don't like giving bad ones, but my experience in this shop today made me want to write one. Very poor customer service. I bought a dress here yesterday, but didn't try it as I had my two month old baby with me. When I got home, it unfortunately wasn't the right fit, and on top of it, I hadn't realised that the buttons were "false buttons". I understand that you can have a no returnno exchange policy for an outlet like the one on display now, but I am surprised of the lack of flexibility the staff in fact the manager showed. I explained my circumstances  I only just bought the dress yesterday afternoon and came back today  I suggested I would change it to something more expensive I would of course pay the difference. Not only was the manager completely inflexible to making an exception, but she was also nonchalant and with little sense of customer service. I like this store, but have often felt the lack of customer service here. Today's experience makes me want to stop coming to this store all together. They sell beautiful clothes, but as a customer, you don't feel in particularly good and welcoming hands. It's a shame. Ordered 500 worth of products  late delivery as shop renovating. More than 6 weeks later I had to return some products and management was extremely helpful and lenient. Would highly recommend, quality of delivered goods on apr with excellent service You should visit. Read. Enjoy each piece. They did the hard work for all of us. Good select stores, pretty good brands although the selection is a bit too eurocentric and thus not unique in Paris. Staff is very friendly  Okay. Cute store with great clothes, BUT they do NOT take care of there clothes we bought white shoes and they had scuffs on them. We also bought a sher skirt and it was stretched out from being on the hanger. I asked for a larger size in a dress and they brought it up to me and it was insanely wrinkled to the point where I cant tell if it was cute or not. I prob would have spent 500 more there but I was so mad about all the clothes being mistreated, I took photos of the brands and am planning on buying them online.

Just such an inspirational joyous shop  It was nice to visit there in general. Sometimes, you dont have to behave too generously to be kind. 리뷰:
Great place to have artisans food! Small island in Paris. Amazing sandwich ever! It's nice to take a quick look around the traditional market. An area I visited by chance I heard that a lot of Parisians go here, so I was curious and visited. There wasn't much to eat, and the watermelon juice was as big as I wanted, but I regret paying 8,000 won for it. Of course, it's fresh fruit, so it's delicious, but the quantity is small, and it's a bit expensive, so... I think it's best to just come and have a look. It is said to be a traditional market with a history of over 400 years, located in the Marais district. I found this place by chance while passing by, and when I searched it on Naver, I found out that it was a famous place. The market is very small in size and has a few flower, vegetable, fish, dairy, etc. stores and many restaurants. The stores are small but neat. I personally enjoyed the lunch box menu at the Japanese restaurant that singer Jaehyung Jeong frequented while studying in Paris, so I recommend it. The most famous one seems to be the sandwich shop. It's been around a long time and is famous enough to be featured on TV, so the lines are long during meal times. You have to make only the seasoned food you ordered very slowly and choose the ingredients, and because of the process of melting the cheese, you have to wait in line for a very long time. It costs around 9 euros, and you need to choose well the ham and cheese to save less. Because it is large, it is good for 23 people to share and taste it. Personal opinion that it is a bit salty and not very tasty. Still, it's worth trying at least once and it's fun to look around. Still, I really enjoyed visiting the markets in Paris. It seems like most places close around 34pm, so make sure to check the time.

There are a variety of international foods so good that you'll want to try them all, so I recommend going there for a meal.

Oh, and the Paris strawberries are really delicious. Be sure to eat it

리뷰:
The Longchamp store at this location has a wide variety of products to choose from, making shopping here enjoyable. The staff is friendly and provides excellent service, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. If youre looking for Longchamp products, this store is definitely a great choice! I went there to buy a bag for my mum as a gift, and it was a top notch experience. The place is comfy, and the sales associates are extremely friendly. I would especially want to say thank you to one of the sales Alphonse. He gave me a lot of helpas I knew almost nothing about bags, and explained super clearly on how to clean the bag, the special thing about the product, and so on. Such enthusiasm and professionalism from him really brightened my day! Longchamp on Champslyses, is the best store on the road. Massive selection on 2 flourishing floors, multiple colors, and a large assortment of style selections. Purses galore! The staff was excellent! I want to give a shout out to Jeremy, who was astonishing with customer service and helpful beyond all measures. He was incredibly wonderful, super attentive, and made sure our shopping experience was nothing short of extraordinary! Although the sales associate was so kind he gave me the wrong size of the bag that I was originally buying. I was about to buy the medium size and he offered me to give the bag that is boxed which is actually thoughtful thing. Given that I wouldnt expect that he couldve gave the wrong size, I didnt open it and check. Today, I opened the box and guess what! I have the LARGE size, which WAS NOT the one I was buying, and now I dont have any chance to change it because I live in Istanbul. SO, a recommendation to each one of you check the size of the bag even if it is boxed to dont be fooled like me. Always have to visit Long Champ when in Paris! The store is crowded but still managed to get an SA! SA was very friendly and helpful. Showed me quite a number of designs but was looking for specific ones.

My sisters Long Champ bag had some stains, he even got his senior to look at it. End up they cleaned the whole bag and managed to remove the stains.

Definitely will go back again.

Dream come true visiting this location and getting my dream bag  My sales associate was super sweet and made sure I got the bag that I was looking for. There was a lot of selection, I was brought upstairs and there was even more.

I arrived 10 minutes before they opened and was let in right away. Although, I am more used to them offering me drinks, but this time around I had to ask because they never did which I didnt mind but it was the first time at a Chanel location where they werent of service. But because my SA was busy finding the perfect bag for me, I completely understand.

Overall, great experience. Made my Paris trip extra memorable. It has been my dream to visit 31 Rue Cambon! Im visiting from Sydney Australia and the team at this boutique did not disappoint! Veronique was my sales associate who went above and beyond and was so lovely to work with. Everyone from the host, sales associates and the person who helps with your tax refund are all so pleasant and seamless at their jobs. Super impressed especially since I visited on a day a new collection launched. Truely a well oiled machine! Keep up the great work  I wanted to visit the original Chanel store during this my first trip to Paris.  I wanted to walk in the neighborhood of Coco Chanel, whose home was  still is above this store.  I was glad to be here to see they have expanded to 29 Rue Cambon as well.  Lovely, and grand store inside with a beautiful accessory selection.  Located at 31 Rue Cambon, Paris Pretty sure they tell everyone there are 13 people ahead of you on the wait list because after about 15 minutes we were now second but it still took another 30 or so minutes to be served.

They had a very large selection of bags which my wife loved.

The purchasing experience was pretty good and the sales people were quite well equipped to answer my questions regarding my VAT refund. As a New Yorker visiting Paris, stepping into the Chanel 31 rue Cambon store was a dream come true, culminating in a memorable purchase of my first Chanel bag. The experience was elevated to sheer perfection by the impeccable service of Anais, my delightful sales associate.

From the moment I entered, Anais greeted me warmly and made me feel immediately at ease. She exuded a genuine enthusiasm for Chanel's products and took the time to understand my preferences. As we discussed various options, Anais offered me a glass of champagne and delicate macaroons, adding a touch of French elegance to the shopping experience.

What impressed me most was Anais's patience and dedication. She patiently allowed me to try on several pairs of shoes, providing insightful recommendations and ensuring each fit was perfect. When it came to selecting my Chanel bag, she went above and beyond to locate the exact one I had my heart set on, making sure every detail was just right.

Anais's exceptional service extended beyond mere assistance she shared her deep knowledge of Chanel's history and craftsmanship, enriching my understanding of the brand. Her genuine passion for fashion and dedication to customer satisfaction were truly commendable.

Leaving the store with my beautifully wrapped Chanel bag, I knew I had experienced something extraordinary. Anais's professionalism, kindness, and attention to detail made this a shopping trip I will never forget. My visit to Chanel 31 rue Cambon was not just about acquiring a luxury item it was an unforgettable journey guided by Anais's exceptional service.

Without a doubt, I will be back, eager to explore more of Chanel's offerings with Anais's expert guidance. She is a true asset to the Chanel team and exemplifies the epitome of outstanding customer service.

리뷰:
I visited this chanel boutique on my last trip to Paris which was last Tuesday on the 20th of August 2024. I was looking for shoes the SA was okay at the beginning, later on I decided to take the shoes, she asked if i can them with no box but i refused because me paying this much amount of money therefore, I need everything to look perfect. Anyway, I paid and left but never got the chance to check them out at the hotel. After getting back home, I unboxed it and was super surprised where the shoes are on the box with no shape keeper, dust bag and not even properly packed. If I was still on Paris definitely I will go back to the store but unfortunately I left. I had the worst shopping experience among all lux brands ive purchased from. the SA Armelle was nice on the surface but super nasty the moment i went back to the shop highlighting defects about my bag. Please dont get too excited buying your bag in the moment and check your bag properly before leaving. How can a classic Chanel yellow leather start flaking off and showing white from one use? Anyway, the discolouration of the straps was not what i expected from Chanel. Anouch was the repair staff who tried to fix the problem and they actually admitted the defect after their experts assessed it. In the end they changed the whole bag for me one for one and i got the Black Caviar Classic and returned the yellow bag. So much for SA Armelle talking over me when im trying to explain it was so frustrating. Also she was insistent that its because i used the bag so i wont get it exchanged, but how would i know it is faulty until it is used? Light usage  leather flaking out is not normal at all. I guess she just wanted to get things done fastest by shrinking all responsibility and get defensive. We could have resolved it much faster if not for her unnecessary comments. The collection has cute colours but the SA not so cute in their service  Went there last November 1, around the store opening 11am. Glad they were open that day. It wasn't crowded. The model looking, Kevin, helped my wife shop for her favorite bag, shoes and sun glasses. Kevin was really helpful, kind and patient. So look for him whenever you visit the store he has a 7star rating from us! Thank you Kevin! Of course its chanel, staff is semi friendly . Could be better, they should provide more seating while shopping since you are standing for more than 1 hr Visited this Chanel boutique during our Paris trip. After quickly figuring out my style, the SA went to a cabinet and found this perfect beauty for me. The SA Nicole, if Im remembering correctly that helped me was very sweet and kind.

I had an appointment for the following day I visited, but popped in the day before as a walkin with no issues. Ive shopped at many Chanel boutiques and this one was phenomenal with selection and service

Nice and helpful staff. Good quality. Better deal to buy direct from France than in Canada. Store was a bit small and too hot in there with only one fan on. The blond lady at this location seems to be super unhappy with her job, I assume shes the manager cause shes always there. This was my 3rd time visiting this location and shes never in a good mood.

The store does not provide refunds, they give you a voucher that you can only use at AMI standalone stores, so if you buy a gift for someone and they dont like it, youre out of money because they dont accept returns.

Meanwhile refunds are possible if you buy one of their pieces at Galeries Lafayette or at Printemps or online. Doesnt make sense

The Forever AMI program for taking back old clothes is ridiculous. They give you credit worth less than 50 of the items original price only if its in excellent condition, if its not excellent by their standards youd be lucky with 20 and they require you to dry clean it for them before?? Seems like too much of a hassle, Id rather donate the items.

For the price of their merchandise they really need to work on their customer service. This brand is really having a laugh selling sweatshirts for almost 400 made of fabric that cost no more than 10  meter , made in Moldavia, their margin is outrageous but that doesn't stop wealthy clueless people to spend their money there and think they are cool in this uniform. What a pleasant experience! Highly recommended way better than the store in Rue d'Alger One star is too much. Warning don't order from AMI eshop. They have a bad logistic and customer service. I have been chasing them since October regarding the refund of a jacket at 720. This is so disappointing. I finally decided to forward the case to a lawyer. NEVER AGAIN amu!!!

리뷰:
I had chanced upon this market activity earlier today which happens to be a Saturday.

Very interesting considering that this is the 1st arrondissement.

Stalls of potted and not potted flowers and small plants, cooked food  chicken, sausages, etc Very noisy with many athletes who use it as a training place dance, skateboard, rollerblades
With an equally noisy freeway with its large terraces.
The passage has been closed for work for 1 year and will be closed until winter 2024 The place is unfortunately abandoned, we console ourselves by contemplating the archive photos.

In the meantime, it's a really unfriendly place. I hope it won't be left abandoned for too long because it has real potential. Who would have thought that 230 years ago a couple of madmen unleashed the reign of terror in that same place that was previously a Jacobin convent and is now a shopping center. Sometimes I imagine that Robespierre and Marat would be thinking right now. Skaters and rappers hang out in this passage that I will avoid at night

리뷰: The layout of gallery is sooo amazing! Its like shopping inside a museum and the building has so much history. The rooftop view not to be missed. The first shopping center I visited in Paris. It is actually two buildings that are connected by a corridor on the upper floor. In one part there are separate shops. Zara, HM, etc. You will find furniture stores on the ground floor and underground. There is also a basketball court. In the second part, you will find a cinema, restaurants, and a shop spread over several floors. You will also find some designer pieces there. Go here! Its amazing! Best department store in Paris. We visited during Christmas holidays. Beautiful decorations and huge musical tree in the lobby Boring men's clothing. Too expensive jewelry. Lots of interesting food area but no where to sit if you don't eat at a specific restaurant.  Very rude staff. I bought a gift pack of mustard for a friend.  The cashier was cold, not at all friendly and did not offer me the option of purchasing a bag to carry my gift in until i asked.  Lots of nice fresh food on the lower level. But overshot a great experience.. The BEST shopping experience of my LIFE!!

It is six floors of everything you could ever want. The staff are helpful and I did not have to wait in line very long to pay Huuuge department store. This is where most French people go to buy stuff for around the house. You will see some tourists but not a whole lot. 6 floors not just clothing and perfume but including bedroom bathroom living and kitchen stuff, decor stuff, even food. If you cant find it here you wont find it anywhere else. And free restrooms on the FIFTH FLOOR!

On 13 July, 2024, my wife and I came here again. I first came here in 1984 and bought a bag. This time we left emptyhanded. Probably THE most famous department store in Paris. Visited it many time already. Huge collection of brands for sure, but I do find the collection per brand became very limited. But i found they have a huge collection of white sneakers! Check out the video I took. Whats a nice surprise this time is that added a Restore give some old clothing a second live. But they still price them pretty high, as vintage.
Dont forget to visit their rooftop, you can see a lot of Paris. Also there is a very big restaurant on the top floor, if someone prefer to wait there while you shop. Very friendly service. Beautiful deptartment store full of luxury items.  If you are keen on vintage browsing, there are excellent used items as well.  Before Christmas, unless you really enjoy holiday decorations, probably not a place to go.  Rooftop has amazing views and probably better on a clear day! a very nice mall with variety of food and not forgetting the MUSTGO rooftop viewing Free. Highly recommended for tourists Wonderful view of the city from the top of the building. I am not a shopping person, but always in Paris, I am visiting for the glass cupola.

Pretty good selection to choose from ranging from crazy expensive to relatively affordable. Dropped by to get sandals to use for a long flight, not a big selection but was able to find a Hoka Ora Luxe for 80 got a tax rebate too, it was US80 stateside so I guess I got a deal. The lady who assisted me said that the max size they carry is US13 so folks with larger sizes are out of luck. They had a tax refund area in the building so that was convenient. I've entered 2 wrong malls until I found this amazing dome. They should rename or more clarify this one. I could write a book on this shop. Though, Ill control myself for Google Review and just do a few lines.

In a nutshell this place is exceptional. People are quite nice and always willing to help  support you in your choice.

Its maybe the only place in Paris where you can compare so many brands so easily all the best and finest brands are sold here.

You have so many choice its incredible !

Last but not least, it looks like they never close.. so convenient !

A participant many thanks again to the whole team of the shirt floor Seidensticker, Hast, Comptoir GL, for their time and advice ! This is the most beautiful shopping mall I've ever seen!  I visited at Christmas time, and the decorations were super cool.

Inside the main bldg, there was a fiber optic light show, every 30 minutes.  It was in the dome above, surrounding the Christmas tree, and featured dancing bumble bees.  The mall itself is 6 or 7 levels high, is positioned along all 4 corners of a major intersection, and includes tons of regular name and high end department stores, for shopping.

MUST SEEDO, WHEN IN PARIS! Like always.
Beautiful decoration and every brand you want to have.
From normal price to high end exclusive.
Very friendly and helpful personal support.

영업시간: no operation time

리뷰:
My husband and I were staying down the street from this Maison Goyard location on our recent trip to Paris. After breakfast, we walked over prior to opening around 945am on a weekday and were third in line. Upon opening at 1000am, we were escorted into the store and quickly met with a very kind SA. We were interested in only 12 bag models and they promptly brought them to us to view and try on. I now understand why they only let in a certain number of customers at one time and this is clearly so they can match up with one sales associate at a time. I ended up not making a purchase however enjoyed the experience and would recommend lining up at this location shortly before opening to avoid a long wait, prepared with a list of models you would like to view to assist the sales associates as they have to go to the back to select the items from their inventory. Would recommend to anyone seeking this specific designer in Paris. I went to this location 2 separate times and had completely different experiences both times. The first time I went, I got in right away because I had an appointment. The SA we were paired with was quite rude and dismissive. He disappeared for 10 minutes and randomly came back. I think because of this we werent able to buy everything we wanted which is why we ended up having to visit a second time.

The second visit, we didnt have an appointment and arrived 10 minutes before the store opened. There was still a line, despite arriving earlier and we ended up waiting about an hour to get in. The SA we were paired with was such a sweetheart and went above and beyond. We told him what we wanted and he showed us options that we didnt even know were options. We had fun conversations that were short and sweet and a successful shopping trip.

Overall thoughts is that your experience will basically be based off of luck. How long you wait on line depends on how long the customers inside take which is why I recommend making an appointment and your shopping experience depends on who your sales associate is. Okay... I know there will be about 1 hour wait, if you do not have an appointment,  but if you are going to get a Goyard item, especially if it is the first time... go to 233 Rue Saint Honore. You've got to. It is an experience, and I love their original store.  The salespeople are friendly and accommodating. They answered every question and requests with patience and a smile. It was so effective that we ended up buying two bags instead of the planned one. If you are visiting, they will help with the tax paperwork and will explain what you need to do. Well well well, as with every Goyard store theres always a line to get in, so you cant complain. The man at the door was polite and was attentive. He gave everyone umbrellas when it rained whilst in the line. Our wait was about one hour, and maybe 20 people were ahead of us? Long wait but it is what it is.

Once inside we were greeted by a sales assistant who asked what we wanted to get or curious about in their stock and was immediately shown to where we can choose. I didnt catch the ladys name but she was polite, very patient whilst making a decision and we didnt feel pressured or rushed to make a decision.

My cousin was happy with her purchase and will definitely come back if we ever visit Paris again Extremely poor service. I went in and politely asked for the bags I wanted, but the sales assistant looked annoyed and unwilling to help. When I asked for more bags, she immediately asked if I wanted anything else so she could bring them all at once. I have never encountered someone so unwilling to serve their customers. In contrast, my sales associate at Chanel is always eager to show me something fascinating, even when I mention that I'm not looking to purchase anything that day. Overall, the service at Goyard is unacceptable.

gourmet grocery shop. Bags are searched upon entry.  a lot of fine goods, small selection of gluten free items but not a big separate shelf, need to read ingredients with individual products. Huge selection, premium brands and everyday delights. You pay more but it's all there, beautifully presented. They vacuum pack your butter for international travel. A grocery store worth checking out. Bought butter and mustard to take home and had it vacuum sealed in the store. So many things Id have loved to take home with me if not the limited space in my suitcase.
This brand of mustard was one of my favorites and the flavor is very subtle. Just as it should be. Best store Ive been to in my life! Cannot wait to go back. They have the best desserts. Still dream about this grocery store to this day! Also a good place to buy chocolate souvenirs. It is one hour from the cdg airport to come here if you take a cab. Which I took g7 taxi over at 12pm. I choose this particular store as is closer to the route to the Louvre.

I love this grocery mall which has eatery and it is a few storey high. I came here to get butter and pate. It has so many things which I would love to spend more time in and has a meal there.

The cashier is so nice and helpful with my not so fluent French in asking for the toilet and also to have my butter vacuum pack for flying. It is one euro to have my 6 butter vacuum packed.

It is food haven in this place. I really enjoy this place.

This was our first time in Paris and obviously we had to go to Louis Vuitton to shop.

We loved our shopping experience. We reached there around 1pm on Monday afternoon and there no wait to enter the store.

Folks recommended this store as the store near Arc de Triomphe usually had 45 mins to 1 hr wait to enter the store.

We ended up buying a bag, belt and shoes and we loved everything. It is an absolutely gorgeous store in a great part of Paris.

I was assisted by a great SA, Morgan at Maison Vendome she was so helpful. She showed me dozens of bags, shoes, wallets what she didnt have in stock she looked up for me and told me where I could get it.

BEST LV EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!! And I love my new bag! Spacious two floor Louis Vuitton Shop with large selection of LV items most of the staff were very helpful
But we had a bad experience with two ladies and their behaviour.

Overall good. I simply adore this brand. Many thanks to them for their attentiveness, sensitivity, and the staff who treat their customers with great love. PierreArnaud Berry was very helpful and nice. One of the best and most beautiful boutiques. First time ever in a Louis Vuitton store. First time ever in Paris! Really enjoyed our shopping experience here! We made an appointment prior to our travel as entrance to the store is by appointment only. Our client advisor Michele was a pleasure to work with! Hes so personable and professional. He was patient with us and showed us everything we wanted to see, minus a bag that wasnt available. Yes, granted we only purchased wallets, but the client experience was superb. We were provided with champagne and our purchases wrapped in Louis boxes and bags. Michele also took care of our VAT tax refund and before we left Paris we were already credited our refund!  Michele also recommended the cutest little tea shop around the corner see my review for Ninas.

If youre in Paris and want to shop at Louis Vuitton, make your appointment at the Vendome store and request to work with Michele! He has the greatest personality! Thanks Michele!!

During the entire time I never felt rushed but was encouraged to take my time to try on creations and to make my choice at my own pace. I was also offered beverages.

We ended up having a great conversation about Chanel, fashion and travel in general, which also felt natural.

Needless to say, this will be my go to store in Paris from now on and I will for sure be asking for Mayumi for future visits. Ines Le Floch took care of us during our visit and provided a delightful experience. We have been to many Chanel boutiques and Ines is by far the most helpful sales representative. We recommend any customers visiting the store to seek her help and guidance on purchasing.

A lady who sold me a cheap croissant in the subways convenient store even impressed me more. I had submitted a complaint to the LV headquarter and yet received no feedback. So i reckon they want their LV brand to be perceived that way. Shame! Thanks to all of you buying this crazy expensive things the owner arnault  is the most billionaire whats the difference from a 200 bag to a 7000 LV just the name they very smart you just wasting your money The shop is in a great Location 

We had a very nice saleswoman.  Very friendly .
My bag was specially reordered because I didn't want an exhibition model.  Everything worked great.

Thank you LV This is the epitome of retail therapy. This amazing team would make you feel like VIP even when Im only purchasing a bottle of fragrance. 주소: Galerie du Claridge, 74 Av. des Champs-Élysées, 75008 Paris, France
리뷰:
On Tuesday, 8th October 2024, the security guard said the store was closed when I was there just before 820 PM. The sign next to the store  online, clearly says the store closes at 830 PM. The security guard even pretended that he doesnt understand English to avoid answering why the sign says a different closing time. I also doublechecked with a male staff member that was there, who also confirmed the store was closed.

Like me, several others were turned away. I noticed in other reviews that this has happened before at this store, even closing up to 30 minutes early. So they are doing this on an ongoing basis, and not doing anything to address it. It was my first night in Paris, and I needed a charging adapter, which they sell, in order to be able to charge any of my devices, and unfortunately, I relied on the stores stated closing time. No trip to Paris is complete without a visit to Fnac, a major seller of music, movies and TV on physical media and consumer electronics, including HiFi equipment. My favorite branch is the one on Avenue des Ternes. Just keep in mind you'll be paying European prices, not the usually lower Asian or American ones. Nice and practical place where you can get a powerbank and charge your Mobile so quickly while walking in Champs Elysees If you are looking for a book or for a camera or for a phone or a new laptop this is your place. They carry the major brands for Electronics . I just purchased a new camera and it wasnt in stock
So Ill update it his review when it actually arrives to the store and it is available for pick up. Customer service needs a lot of improvement wether for the skills and the competence weather for the readiness Steak sauce is unqiue. It goes well with the steak and fries. Queue starts before restaurant opening. We came 15 min before 12 and there was a group of 6 infront of us.

리뷰:
WARNING  Order somewhere else!

Overall extremely poor level and unprofessional eshop. You will get much better service from any seveneleven supermarket.

Shipping partner is UPS. NOTE! They use shipping method, where  is no option to pick up your shipment from UPS access point! You need to be home personally. As UPS inform the delivery time by the end of day so you need to be on watch whole day. Drivers have no phones either!

Shipping time 34 days on the website is not true. After more than two weeks, never received my shipment. No help from customer service, therefore I forwarded my case to the authorities and my credit card bank.

리뷰:
I was looking for the Delicatisserie down the hall and came across this restaurant on the top of Printemps. What caught my attention was the vegetarian French Onion soup, which was perfect on the cold, snowy day.
The server recommended Ros with it, and my only complaint is that I had too much liquids and needed a sweet treat afterwards to counter
Enjoy the view! Enjoy the food! and Enjoy the ambience. This place is fantastic if you are looking for a centralized spot for high fashion. They also host a small outdoor section and are super friendly. During the holidays they go all out at have great window displays. A must for all Paris trips. Yes go to the 8th floor for the view if not for the food. The quality price ratio is average however the service lacks the personality of Printemps high quality. Often I have observed servers arent too keen and close shop earlier than closing time. Had a nice healthy carrot ginger juice however its the view I went for and Im certain you will too. Prices elevated so be prepped. So, I finally got to visit the new Printemps du Got Printemps of the taste. It reminded  me of th Grande Epicerie at the Bon March, but smaller and more formal. You can find some renowned chef or food brand such as Dubernet and Thierry Marx  you can find fine French products, and then go to the rooftop, where Akrame set up his restaurants, one specialized in fish and the other one in meat he has 3 restaurants called Atelier Vivanda in Paris.
You will find also a very good cheese seller,  and a Michalak pastry chef boutique.
We had lunch at Akrame meat. I had the burger, and my friend the tartare. I must say I prefer the Atelier Vivanda. The meat is much better. I think this place is great if you want to admire Paris from above while you eat!
But it's a place to visit. So many gourmet things to see! Its an experience in which youll find luxury wines and champagnes, french food, spices, chocolates, sweets and much more. Its a small place compared to next door. Dont expect cheap prices. You can take a drink on the terrace and enjoy the city view!
