Very friendly sales people.  Took their time, and gave me proper service.  Very pleased with my purchase as they only had one briefcase left in stock in all Paris locations.  I can see where people would be upset at the wait times given there are only 2 sales people working and 20 people in line but the one on one service is great once youre inside. The overall service is quite high standard, but it comes with an arrogant vibe, unlike other brands that feel cozier. The service was also a bit slow when packing after payment. On the plus side, you can get a tax refund in cash after receiving the receipt by going to the Printemps Tourist Service on the B floor. I was worried about  shopping here . The line was short  service was  so nice.   They packaged really nicely.  They will guide you for tax free.  Honestly I was really impressed. Bought two bags  .. with colors I wanted . Done with my purchase within 15mins.
Buy and go, you will receive good service.
Choose and consider, the lady will have unhappy face.
The more senior looking lady at the cashier doesn't seem friendly too.
You're in service line but yet look unhappy always. Buck up your service and don't take things for granted. I was a little hesitant going here from the reviews, but I had a pleasant experience! The two women in the store were welcoming, kind, and patient as they showed me multiple designs and colors to ensure I made the right decision on what to buy. I didn't feel like I was being rushed. They answered all my questions, and also helped me with the VAT refund process. I would for sure go back to this location whenever I'm back in Paris. Oh, and I'm obsessed with my bag!

I agree with the previous comments that this is the worst tax refund place. They keep your money and they dont reply on the emails. When you send them the email again by mentioning tax federal authority , they reply immediately and put you on hold and saying just wait, we will escalate it and then disappear again.

It has been two months since I left EU. Global Blue sent me money back long time ago and huge amount compared to you.
I mentioned by email that I have the form validated by customs with the stamp, I kept my boarding pass, I can send you the stamp from my passport that I left EU and I confirmed that I did not exchange or refunded my goods. The physical form was sent by mail from the airport too.
What else do you need?

Does it mean that you want to keep money for yourself? I am sure 90 people dont follow up because they are very busy but I am for justice and honesty first of all. It should be fair, right? All brands under 1 roof Very pretty Very nice store. Full of history. We go there to walk, wander, see the view, dream, for the luckiest. Buy. For the richest. At Christmas the decorations are great! I told him that the watch, Pasha model, was sold with 2 straps one in crocodile leather and one in steel. This is dishonest on his part. I contacted a person at Cartier headquarters to inform him of this. this story. I do not recommend this store

Waited over an hour to enter this boutique and buy a bag that settled in less than 10 minutes. Don't come here if you don't have an appointment with them. They will not serve you. Kevin was our sale associate and he was professional. I came in knowing exactly which bag to get without spending much time shopping around and browsing. The line was absolutely mayhem right before 4pm and it got going  fast after 1520 mins. We had to share a station with someone since its how busy it was. We were never offered water but I asked for it since it completes the shopping experience. He brought it right out and never lost his cool despair how busy it was. They did have a problem with the card processing for global blue refunds and took a while to figure out. Finally I got my bag and had a happy day. Reduce a star not because of the associates fault but the store could have done a better job of having drinks available for guests without asking and just issue with their checkout process. Worst LV buying experience. Service sucks. All the staffs here totally no smile and sucks big time.

Was queuing at level 0 a very small unit for about 30mins not knowing there is a bigger unit at level 1. As we are already 1st in queue so I ask the level 1 staff can I ask my wife which is at level 0 1st in queue to come up and be 1st in queue at level 1 but was refused. Totally not customer service oriented. I went to the store to look for 2 bags, which were speedy 25 and Never full MM. I was served by a ?Japanese lady, her name was Yoko L. She told me Never full MM was not available and she showed me other models that I did not like.  She did not show any interest in serving me and my friend.  When she knew that I only wanted to purchase just the speedy 25, she became even more rude.  She threw the pen and receipt towards a tray of used glasses of other customers in front of me and asked me to sign on the receipt. After wrapping up my bag, she put it on the table and left without even saying thank you.  This was totally unacceptable and not up to standard for a luxury brand store as the service was even worse than a supermarket.

I then went to the store in ChampsElysees and the staff there was really nice.

DON'T come to Galaries Lafayette store if you want to purchase LV goods. I regretted that I did not read the comment in google before I went. I had a wonderful experience at the LV store in the Galaries Lafayette. Mayumi H. and Axel M. were attentive and helpful. My husband and I arrived around 11am and were escorted to the second floor bc they were less customers and the. immediately sat down to await a salesperson.  Mayumi showed up shortly after and helped me find myself a bag and my husband a travel bag. Since he wanted his initials we left and came back around 4 to pick both up. We did have to wait an additional 3045 minutes bc they got busy but we were seated at a station like earlier andAxel arrived to assist us and kept us informed of the status. Fyi its extremely crowded around 4. The vibe was completely chaotic bc there were so many people in the store. Right when Axel brought out our final bags I sat there long enough to decide I wanted the other bag Mayumi showed us earlier that day as well. Axel was patient as I described it and he went hunting for it. He found it, we purchased it, and he wrapped it up with care. All in all it was a wonderful experience. Oh and I believe it was the manager who was extremely helpful in figuring out the best street to catch and Uber bc we werent going to hop back on the metro with those bags. During our visits we were served champagne and the sodas we requested.

주소: 26 Quai de la Mégisserie, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰:
I scheduled a tour for a Sunday around 430pm. I made the reservation about an hour before the tour on the day of. There was no line to get in however, I went on a day it was not busy. Not everyone will have this experience. There is a reason why they have time slots for the tour and access to the gift shop.

Once you walk through the tour, you will find yourself in the gift shop where they have the chocolates and other goods. There is also access to the cafe. I really liked the short walkthrough tour and chocolates. I will recommend this to my friends my family. Make sure you know what the expiration dates are on your chocolates. I know one of the ones I purchased had a shelf life of 10 days but it was absolutely amazing chocolate. All the other chocolate I purchased had a shelf life of like 23 months. These are great gifts! This place is located around the Louvre Museum. We came here for a lunch and some desserts.  They have a really good architecture and the cafe was amazing. The chef Maxime Frederic put his masterpiece desserts on the menu. We had Hazelnut Entremets as dessert, Veggie Salad Wrap, and Croque Sandwich filled with Ham and Cheese. They were really tasty and high quality products. To drink we had cafe latte and Iced Vanilla Latte. Also they have decaf selection for the cafe. They have accessibility for the handicapped people. There is parking opportunities around the street. The service was so fast and the staff is so kind. Especially Jeremy as our waiter was perfect. Thanks to him a lot  It is a caf and pastry shop that sells Louis Vuitton chocolates and sweets, the staff were very friendly and the sweets were delicious. The first floor area consists of a very beautiful cafeteria with big plants and a view of the Seine, but also an area where Louis Vuitton products are sold. A very nice experience, I recommend it. This is a free exhibition but I would've happily paid for it. The staff are nice and there is the option of have a guide explain highlights of the exhibit. You get to see collaboration pieces from many artists as well as understand the history of the house and it's origins. It is connected to a gift shop that sells new season products as well as actual gifts like notebooks and chocolates. The cafe has a nice view of the Seine and desserts are pricey but tasty. Free entry to the exhibition which is great if you're into fashion and history of. Came to try Maxime Frdric's menu. The Hazlenut Entremet was my personal fav. Friendly staff, nice ambience. Pastries were a little pricey, but what do you expect it's LV

리뷰: Store just for accessories, another store down the same road with clothing. Friendly staff, showing minimum products but placed nicely. Also having sale for accessories. Hello, I noticed that you often leave the lights on in your windows after closing. I wanted to make you aware of current energy issues and the fact that this could be considered illegal. Since October 2022, it has been illegal to turn on lights at night between 1 a.m. and 5 a.m. in France, under penalty of a fine of up to 7,500 euros. We are living through a major energy crisis and it is crucial that everyone does something to save energy. I know it's not easy to comply with all these restrictions, but I'm sure your customers will appreciate this energy saving effort. The vibe and products of this store are super cool! I hope they open a store in Australia soon  Just revamped. love it  ! Great colors, Great sneakers and Great staff  Excellent customer service, I recommend  to go and have a look.

Amazing shopping experience with delicate service.
The staffs are friendly and helpful to all my requests, providing all sizes of the clothes, colour and their professional advice.

Really appreciate the nice client advisor Jordan Delaunay
Highly recommend him to the people who are interested in shopping in this shop

Thanks so much! In October, we visited Moncler with the intention of buying a new winter coat and unfortunately had one of my worst experiences while in Paris. Throughout our interaction with the sales representatives and the manager, there was a distinct lack of customer service. When the sales representative, Nodar T, inquired about our payment method and we mentioned cash, he hurried away. Shortly thereafter, a tall, slim individual, who identified himself as the manager Arnold, approached us. His demeanor was cold, unwelcoming, and exuded a negative aura. My partner and I felt incredibly uncomfortable.

Despite investing a significant amount of money in this jacket, we were disappointed to find that we received no complimentary drinks or any form of proper treatment during our visit. The lack of hospitality made it evident that our extended presence in the store was not anticipated.The overall experience fell short of our expectations and left us considering alternative options for our purchase.

My  jacket was not provided with a dust bag instead, tissue paper was used. This unexpected lapse in presentation further contributed to our disappointment. Later, we visited another Moncler location Galeries Lafayette Haussmann, where we were not only given a dust bag but also encountered a more empathetic and customerfocused approach. While I happy with my choice of jacket, I remain highly dissatisfied with the customer experience at the Champslyses location and would not recommend. Ines Chehidi was fantastic to work with. Super nice. No pressure. Very nice. I was only looking to buy a jacket because it was raining and I left the hotel without it. But she was super nice and I ended up getting boots and a jacket for myself and my wife. She is a great asset to the store. Redouane helped my wife and I with our shopping.  In general he is one of the friendliest and warmest person we met here in Paris.   Professionally, he is very knowledgeable and most importantly he is very patient too.  I had to exchange my purchase with him the next day, and again he was so helpful and nice.  Great store even better customer service. Thanks again Redouane 5 star review for Dara, one of our favorite sales associates at Moncler. He knew exactly our style and was extremely helpful. Great guy and an overall fantastic experience. Come visit him!

리뷰:
My friend and I came to this store in the morning to buy a bag, and we were served by a French saleswoman. Her attitude was excellent. My friend bought a Carryall, and this saleswoman was very considerate, proactively adding stuffing to the bag. The shopping experience was perfect. 

This twostar review, however, is for an Asian male sales. In the afternoon, my boyfriend went to the store to buy a bag for me, and he was attended by this Asian guy. Since my boyfriend saw that he was Asian, he asked if he could speak Chinese. The salesperson replied that he could speak a little, but suggested they speak English instead.

However, in the morning, I saw this same guy speaking fluent Chinese to an older lady right next to me while introducing bags. I don't understand why he refused to speak Chinese to my boyfriend and insisted on using Englishthis is the first issue.

Fine, if English is preferred, my boyfriends English is quite good. But later, when my boyfriend inspected the bag, he noticed many creases and requested a replacement. The salesperson refused. My boyfriend insisted and pointed out that he knew there were three more of this same bag in the store, so why couldn't they replace it?

Only after my boyfriend made this clear did the salesperson finally agree to show him another bag. Moreover, he didnt add any stuffing to the bag, which was a stark contrast to the excellent service we had received in the morning. The shopping experience was worlds apart.

BTW you speak English with a VERY strong Chinese accent 

After I got the bag, I noticed it still had obvious defects. I was really speechless about the quality control.  Visited this outlet in the evening of May and had the most wonderful time. The sales lady sorry, can't remember her name but she was a middle aged lady was very hospitable and patient. I had already made up my mind what to buy beforehand, so she spent nearly an hour showing my friend various bags and wallets. After we paid and got ready to leave, she even gifted us with 4 perfume samples each,  covered our shopping bag with a plastic cover as it was drizzling outside and told us she would be available to serve us again the next evening if we decide to buy anything else. We're super impressed with her excellent service even though we didn't buy as many items as some other customers.
Pro tip do make an appointment before going so you can avoid the queue. I am happy to meet the Wonderful staff name  Bendrer Zakaria He is friendly, enthusiastic and attentive He offered us drinks.will and given advice on product selection very patient .And showed me the latest jewelry collection while waiting. Recommend a restaurant to me at the end . He is so great! Had to queue for 30 minutes at opening to get inside. A staff member was checking availability for customers in line, which was super helpful. All staff members I encountered were really friendly, and I got served a drink while making my purchase  a nice touch that should be a norm but I didnt find at other brands in Printemps.

Big thanks to Terhi for the fantastic service!

Edit I revisited the 14th April and I had the opposite experience due to the incompetence of the lady managing the line. She first told me that the item I was looking for was in stock, hence I joined the queue for 30 mins, only to realised there was nothing I wanted. She also asked me to enter the boutique first and she would assign someone to me, no one after 30 minutes Im deeply disappointed with my recent experience at LV. Despite being a loyal customer for many years, I was treated poorly by the staff. We waited over an hour, which I understand can happen, but the lack of courtesy was unacceptable. This is not what I expect from LV. I hope improvements can be made.

I had the pleasure of visiting Acne Studios, and my experience was truly elevated thanks to Diego, the client advisor. From the moment I walked in, he made the visit memorable. Diego was incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the brand, taking the time to share insights about the store and its collections, which enhanced the overall experience.

He was also extremely helpful in guiding me through the Global Blue program and taxfree shopping, making the process smooth and stressfree. His professionalism and genuine enthusiasm for helping customers made a big impression. If you're considering visiting Acne Studios, I highly recommend it  and be sure to ask for Diego! This is a muststop for anyone looking for not only amazing pieces but also topnotch service.

Thank you, Diego, and Acne Studios, for a fantastic shopping experience! There is a big problem with the service attitude of the blackhaired staff who speaks Korean. She looks down upon you since you enter the door and ignores you. I definitely dont recommend everyone to come to this store. It will ruin the mood of the day In addition to the particularly poor quality of the jeans sold they should last 6 months at most, I note the total absence of aftersales service, which would be a minimum given the hidden defects in the fabrics, and also the fact that the manager of the rue Froissart shop does absolutely nothing to remedy the situation quite the contrary. In short, a brand and a shop to be avoided. Had such a wonderful experience with Suwan An back in April. Exemplary service from start to finish, even serving us champagne to celebrate my birthday. This is what instore shopping should be like. A gorgeous experience Service was great and most of staffs were friendly. Especially the guy who recommended me to get oatmeal colour scarf .. and the other guy who helped me with payment .. complimentary coffee or water still or sparkling can be provided by the purchase

Evgeniyas personalized recommendations and expertise exemplify why Chanel is the top luxury brand. We received a 5 stars treatment and all thanks to Francois for the great service. He patiently listened and suggested what's good for us, especially on the perfume. You just tell him what you want... husky smell, woody, floral, spicy etc and he will give you the best recommendations! They provide packaging service too.

Merci beaucoup Francois for your service! Please find him if you plan to go visit the store. You can thank me later  Fantastic service, great customer experience. She is amazing and gave me outstanding service! Highly recommend. 5 stars! Excellent service! We are American, and everyone at this store was helpful, and went out of their way to make sure we had an informed and smooth and safe! They take care to not let too many people in at once experience. We were made to feel incredibly welcome at all times. Our salesperson brought all the glasses my fianc wanted to see over to him at a mirror so he could look. He gave us details about each pair, and was also very clear and helpful in explaining how we could get our tax refund at the airport when we left.

He also took great care in beautifully wrapping up purchase when we finished, and gave us ample information about warranty and tax savings.

We would 110 definitely recommend this store for your next pair of perfect sunglasses, whether you speak French or not!

I greeted upon entry but since she must not have heard my Bonjour she decided to say it loud to me to make sure I address her again..........Then upon looking through the items she told me to go slowly Hilarious She said the items were old and they needed care when sorting through. Um ma'am how can one carefully and quietly sort through items on a METAL ROD? BLESS YOUR HEART.
I didn't let her rudeness win, and still purchased an item I adored.  Just be mindful of the snarky blonde that wants you to say BONJOUR LOUD ENOUGH FOR HER TO HEAR YOU DESPITE THE CROWD INSIDE THE TINY SPACE. 리뷰:
One of the vintage stores in Paris specially for women. Lined up by colour and you find some great design pieces for fairly good price. You could stay for hours. A MUST GO SPOT FOR TRUE VINTAGE LOVERS! Theres literally everything you could ever dream of in this gem of a vintage store. You can tell that the owners and staff truly care for this shop everything has been selected carefully and organized in color. Theres not only clothing in endless varieties but also accessories to die for! But the best part of the experience was one of the sales people, a young man with dark curly hair and beautiful eyes he was very observant and attentive whenever I had 1 or 2 things in hand that I wanted to try, he offered several times to put them aside for me, while I browsed on in their selection, calm and patient offered to show me to the cash register when I looked ready to pay and was easy and nice to chat with  overall my experience was top notch and I truly recommend it! A new, luxurious approach to vintage shopping. Shop consists of two adjacent store, for men and women. The selection is vast, with lots of high quality luxury pieces covering an entire range of styles, colors and materials. Helpful assistants and a cafe section ate built in to the experience.

Prices are steep, this isn't your thrift store, but you'll find pieces to keep forever. I visited Thank God Im a VIP vintage thrift store in Paris today and was pleasantly surprised to find that there are two separate locations for mens and womens items. I first entered the womens store and discovered a beautiful Etro silk scarf. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. When they realized I was looking for mens clothing, one of the women kindly walked me to the mens store next door.

Upon entering the mens store, I was warmly greeted and began shopping. While I pulled many items off the shelves, I ended up purchasing only one shirt. Unfortunately, a lot of the pieces I liked didnt fit my more athletic build and needed a larger, American sizing. Comme des Garons, in particular, tends to run small even when labeled as medium.

Overall, the store has a great selection and wonderful staff. I hope to find more items that fit my style and size in future visits. Thank you! I visited this store last week. I was asked to leave my bag at the counter... I asked the reason for this request the clerk told me that it was a management request... I saw that some clients on the back Caucasians were having their bags with them... I left the location, telling the clerk that I will not spend my money there.
I call this behavior a RACIAL PROFILING. I felt humiliated and shamed, where YOU should be the ones feeling bad. Your clients need to know who you truly are.
Dont try to fool us answering that you have staff from different background. That will certainly not excuse your disgusting rule and behavior.

To answer to the owners response I know what I experienced. And minimizing what was  a terrible mistake on your behalf, hiding behind pity excuses doesnt help the situation and adds to the wound. It is quite pathetic. I will definitely send you an email.

One of my favorite curated vintage shops in Paris if not my number one!!

They have two locations FYI

The shop has multiple curators. So you get a really good and wide range of selections. Different flavors of secondhand pieces if you will.

This shop is if you like hot girl clothing. But it also has some really great one of a kind exquisite pieces too.

The accessories are fantastic lots of good belts, shoes, bags, and jewelry. But the belts and shoe selection shine.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Definitely a must visit! I found so many unique pieces today! Definitely a happy medium between high end vintage and basement dwelling bin digging. selection was SO GOOD, something for everyone. My sister and I are very bull in a china shop vibes but the staff was SO kind and accommodating. Prices were GREAT! Definitely a range of high and low. Will be coming back when Im in Paris and telling my friends. LOVE! A small selection of used clothes for women and men, some show heavy use. Prices are fairly high. Eva was so wonderful and helpful! This shop has really cute clothes and accessories with reasonable prices. Definitely recommend!! Wonderful gem of second hand and vintage clothes, offering a fantastic chance to acquire beautiful and hardly worn pieces of clothes from high end brands at affordable prices. Lovely and helpful staff. Thank you!

리뷰:
Finally got to visit this store, and was so lucky to have Ji as our amazing stylist!! Thanks to his sensibility, patience, experience and passion for the brands products, we found more products we love than we originally expected. Such a great shopping experience. And the store is beautiful like a gallery.  Absolutely wonderful experience and would visit again for next stay in Paris! The store is well designed and the service is professional and considerate. You could explore different possibility of dressing here with great assistance! Recommend. I went in for a Croissant bag but, thanks to Jis patience and attention, left with a coat and shirt I love. Great experience! If you want to experience the famous Parisian arrogance, you can experience it here.

When I asked for an availability of croissant bag, the brunette pony tail French lady looked irritated and saw me with a scary face as if I was harassing her. She said we might have it, but I dont know. My friend and I were scared.

Maybe the working condition is terrible, and the store is busy, but they dont have to make us feel terrible.

The shopping is also about the experience and from whom you buy it, and its not about being treated as an enemy. No matter the trend, I will never forget this emotion about the croissant bag. For a French luxury brand, the experience was not luxury at all. Came with my group of 4 friends we were all asians and no one came to help us or check on us even though there were available sales assistants! It was only when I approached a sales assistant to help did he ask someone to help us, which took a while. I also felt like I had to beg to try on shoes in my size as it seemed like the lady serving me was not keen at all. Worse still, when I was trying items using a mirror, another sales assistant with his client hogged the mirror and did not even regard my existence there. FYI there are other mirrors around and there was no one at my area, plus I only spent a short time there. If I wasnt intending to already purchase something, I probably would not have done so due to the subpar service. At the counter, after I purchased my item, I received hostile  judging looks from the other staff.
The items are nice, but the unfortunately the service just diminishes the entire experience.

I went to buy some perfume with personalisation for my daughter today and the 2 colleagues there made the whole experience extremely special!  Thank you so much and we will be back when we come back to Paris! I was served by super nice sales named Johnny who proposed me a name customization on the lip stick. It was perfect since it was a gift for my collegue. He also gave me some parfume samples and a mini lipstick. Thank you Johnny !! It was a very wonderful experience of all luxury stores that I've been to. Anni, she was the best! Her explanation about the products and the brand was perfect. We had Sophie helping us and let me just tell you  what a breath of fresh air she is! She was so pleasant to shop with and helpful beyond belief! It was my first time coming in to the store and I have my friend visiting from the US and she made such a wonderful experience for us !! We actually walked out of the store and said wow! That was fun! She showed us different options and and available items . She even suggested my friend laser her bottles to memorialize her trip and my friend took a bottle as gifts for friends back home !! It was just such a nice way to show my friends back home that Paris has some great sales employees , as well! If you happen to come across her, you will be in for a treat! Thank you, Sophie  for a memorable shopping experience that we will remember forever !!

주소: 8 Av. du Mahatma Gandhi, 75116 Paris, France
리뷰:
Even if an exhibit doesn't speak to you, this prime example of Gehry architecture is a masterpiece itself! The gallery spaces are vast and well curated. My only advise would be to go as early as possible and book Amazing architecture modern building  The public transport will include taking a bus. There is a 15 min walk from the metro station.

Next to foundation, there is amusement park around and the kids zoo could be other things to enjoy in the area. Definitely worth visiting! Architecturally the building is gorgeous so many interesting lines, shapes and forms. Once inside the collection is impressive we were able to see Ellsworth Kellys work, Basquiat, and more. Also, they have a fantastic caf called Frank. I recently visited the Louis Vuitton Foundation in Paris to see the Matisse exhibit and was blown away by the stunning collection on display. The building itself is a work of art, with its unique architecture and beautiful design.

The exhibit was incredibly wellcurated, showcasing a wide range of Matisse's works and providing insight into his creative process.

I would highly recommend visiting the Louis Vuitton Foundation for anyone interested in art and culture. It's a mustsee destination in Paris, and I can't wait to go back and explore more of their exhibits in the future. A museum of modern contemporary art with a rotating collections. If you looking to see any LV related stuff avoid, there is none. But if you looking to check art from famous artists check the schedule on the museum website, but in any case I recommend it is worth a visit for overall vibes and atmosphere allow two hours for your visit to see all spaces of the museum

리뷰:
Warning!!! I've ordered a massage chair in August 2021 and paid it in full, including delivery to the door to Serbia from France. It should have been delivered in 10 days. Six months later  still not delivered. I have contacted the Paris HQ, they promised to facilitate, but still nothing. And now they've stopped answering phone calls and emails at all.

UPDATE upon Bodyfriend's reply Bodyfriends reply is a very good illustration of what was happening since I paid for my order on 06.08.2021 till it was finally delivered on 25.03.2022 I have put my comment in February 2022, and their reply comes 2 months later saying that they cannot do anything. I was chasing Bodyfriend to get update on the status of my delivery fully paid to the door, and had no answers for weeks, finally I had to chase local subcontractor engaged by Bodyfriend and pay him for his services to actually get the chair delivered to me. I didnt accept the compensation  they have just paid it without answering my questions, and it mainly covers excessive customs fees that I had to pay due to lack of proper data and communication between Bodyfriend and their engaged local shipper, as well as the cost of his services, which Bodyfriend undertook to be at their expense. I do not want anything extra and do not expect anything from Bodyfirend  this is the worst clients relationships management Ive ever seen in my life. The best place too relax  I went during fashion week and the lady there was very attentive  she explained everything perfectly. I am going to go back to buy a chair when this is over  as I really need this at home now  no more spa massages for me sadly! Perfect place to relax! We received our chair this afternoon. Very fast delivery and perfect product!!
Just like in a store, really highend.
The feeling of being massaged by real hands. As a health professional and a manual therapist, I recommend it  in addition to good care.
I would like to thank ALBORZ again who received us for the demonstration. My wife and I discovered massage chairs in Asia during a trip. Very quickly won over, we visited the Bodyfriend boutique in Paris where we were welcomed very warmly. We purchased the Palace II which was delivered and installed this morning. A big thank you to Kim for her professionalism. This chair is a marvel! We are over the moon

Some of the finest fruit and produce I've seen. Great wines, jams, cheeses, etc. The plums today were great! The staff is friendly and quiet patient with my attempts to speak French. Probably my favorite market in Paris. Instead of stalls the storefronts were wide open, and each store specialized in an item, rotisserie chicken, fromage, pastries, chocolate, etc. Great area to explore with fresh market items and ready made baked good and other restaurant. Lined with wineries. Specialty goods and food. Just amazing.

Visiting from the states I was amazed to see the qualities of fruits and veggies all around.

The street is filled with a lot of history. Visited here during a tour and we stayed to continue visiting until late at night. What a wonderful area! I could return here again. Wonderful market along an interesting street.   There were 2 bands playing to a crowd of people dancing in the streets.   Lots of food items for sale and flowers
We ate at a great Italian restaurant Le Filles.   We had a great time
Highly recommended!

Nice flower shop in the heart of the city.  Reasonably good variety of plants. Prices were a little high but not horrible.  Staff was helpful. Great place to visit. Unfortunately we are flying home in 4 day and could not buy a flower here. But if we lived in Paris, this market would be our favorite. Located on the lovely island, is the flower market, in stunning bloom this time of year, worth a visit whilst cruising around. This place is a dream. I love plants and nature in general and this place makes me feel really happy. There are different kiosks, different owners and each one of them sells different items for your garden or your house.

Unfortunately i couldn't buy anything because i was traveling without much space. But of course, next time i will have to bring a truck. Especially for all those door knobs and the wind chimes.

You won't regret coming here and seeing all the beautiful plants and items here. Well visiting Paris, my wife and I had the fortune to stumble across this beautifully laid out garden center. Here you can find a wealth of beautiful flowers and gardening and florist related items. Flowers to take back to your hotel room or apartment, gifts for friends and loved ones, or even just the opportunity to walk amongst the fragrant and colorful blooms.

Epic selection of fruits and vegetables on the street! Please note if you are not familiar with the practices here, do not touch the fruitsvegetables! They are organic and cleaned, they want to have them kept that way for hygiene. They will provide samples if you ask nicely . The figs were particularly exceptional in my opinion.

If you are veganvegetarian, do not like meat or it grosses you out to see, you may want to avoid the inside meat market. There were animals whole on spits. We recently visited the covered open air market that offered everything from fresh fruits and vegetables to coffee beans, beer, cheese, handmade home goods, and plenty of delicious freshly prepared foods. At 1000 in the morn, even on a Friday, the market was relaxed, welcoming and laidback.
One of the standout features of this market was the sheer variety of items available. Whether you were in the mood for a crisp apple, a bag of locally roasted coffee beans, a cold craft beer, ora piece of handmade pottery, you were guaranteed to find it here. I particularly enjoyed perusing the selection of cheeses and freshly baked breads, which made for a perfect picnic lunch.
In addition to the impressive selection of goods, the market also offered a vibrant and diverse food scene.  Overall, highly recommend checking out this market. With its vibrant energy, welcoming atmosphere, and diverse selection of goods and food, it is truly a gem in the heart of the city. We stayed at Paris de Gare Lyon for its accessibility to other places. Within walking distance, this is a brilliant place where we bought fruits, bread most baguette and snacks to hotel. It's so lovely to see how local people buy things, converse with the stall people and go about their lives. The berries are at really nice price. Love it. Definitely a must go for true local French food and experience.  It is a nice little market with all sort of food with a super Sunday market too.  Ambience is great and busy.   Great place for foodies. A lot of cafe around the area or can just take away some fresh food and eat in nearby park too. Great indoor market! Not overwhelming like some bigger markets.
There is also an outdoor market Saturday mornings that includes antiques and books.

리뷰: Great food market with delicious high quality food at reasonable prices. We went to the Italian place and had some of the best pasta and burrata. The arancini was very good also. Definitely recommend going and eating as it is a great busy atmosphere and food from all over the world. Nice, mostly covered market  it was indeed a rainy day. Some vendors not operating at least on a weekday late morning, but some nice options to buy produce, cheese etc and to eat in, from classic French fare to Italian options. Not super busy when I went, and not all places looked equally inviting. This is not a market for groceries but instead a food court of international cuisine, sort of. You can find food stalls in Italian, pasta and pizza, cous cous, Japanese, oyster bar,....and of course French. Early time in the morning still sees stalls in preparation, the best to visit is lunch hours when all operation is full blown. Was disappointed to see the actual market. Thought itd be something more bustling but it was more of food stalls. We had the worst chicken from the stall Chez Wagner. It was advertised as grilled chicken leg and was expecting a juicy cut. However we were served the breast portion and it tasted like overcooked overnight meat. Only saving grace were the vegetables. Not really a messy farmers market kind of vibe but more of an organised food stall area. Many small stores with standing bars but some store have sitting areas. Only gets crowded during the afternoons. In the morning, there was not much stuff. Beside the Miam miam sandwich place so worth the visit!

이름: MAP - Marché aux Puces de Paris Saint-Ouen
리뷰:
If you love vintage, walk for blocks in this flea market and several others nearby. Your senses will be engaged from start to finish. Find the murals throughout. Beautiful flea market. A hidden gem  for those who like treasures and vintage objects.  Not a cup of tea for everyone,  but for me, it is a maze full of treasures, an adventure where you can find what you are less expecting.  Nice to go to a different place, to see real French people doing business with their history. Undoubtedly the largest flea market in Paris, offering thousands of diverse items, from antique keys and door handles to exclusive furniture and interior decor. Theres also a plethora of Chinese counterfeit apparel, watches, and shoes. Its possible to spend an entire day exploring and discovering unique finds.

I suggest visiting if you want to bring a touch of Parisian uniqueness to your home. So many things to look at. Read up about the various markets. Some are closer to trash and you may be looking for that and others are closer to museum quality with the associated cost. One could should? actually split this review in the hundreds, of little shops that sell antiques there, which are absolutely amazing and sell at very advantageous prices.

Given its proximity to the main stations, its surprising it doesnt attract more tourists. Most clients seem to be locals. The vicinity is a diverse area with ethnic shops from
African and Middle Eastern heritage, money changers, and general goods stores.

Inside the market, many stalls had built in seating for dining on the spot. The main dining area provides additional seating for clients buying from any food stall. The selection was limited as it seemed like there was one of any one kind of cuisineproducts.

Great place to get away from the train station and have some quality food and some tranquillity. Neighborhood spot I was only tourist here for lunch on Sunday.  Went to a seafood stand and got a bottle from the wine shop.  Narrow hours for many places here, but some great eats to be had.  Great variety Very nice traditional French covered market with a good selection of fresh food stalls and attractive florist stand. Everything appears fresh and delicious. Well worth popping in if you are in the area. We live in a hotel right by this market, and we had our breakfast here. It was just so nice. We passed by some different culture restaurants like the Moroccan restaurant. We also bought some cheese and some fruits. When you walk in here its like the men have never seen a women before  perhaps its best to leave tourists alone and allow them to enjoy themselves and allow them to purchase items without lots of questions. Most people prefer to be left alone however I did like this market it was really cute. We came here for the sushi bar only. Best sushi in Paris made in front of us also.

I stop by anytime Im in Paris on a Saturday and have been doing so long enough to see the gradual decline in both vendors just 5 booths today and customers I was the only one browsing during the hour I spent there. That doesnt mean that collectors shouldnt come theres plenty to browse and enjoy. Ill keep coming as long as sellers show up.
Be sure to bargain a bit  marked prices are high. It is smaller than in the past, but if you're a stamp collector and in Paris, this is still the place to go! Fewer dealers, but eight were there on a Thursday and the selection was great! A little difficult to find but once you're there, it's a one of a kind experience. Just imagine you out there with 4 Stamp collector extrordinaries who have spent their entire lifetime on this stuff. I went up to go guy and asked for stamps from China. He responded with " What region? Hong Kong? Taiwan? Macau?" When I replied, he asked what time period. I wasn't ready then but now you know what level of service to expect! Visited the market many times during my travels! What a marvelous way to spend an afternoon! It is interesting and the whole experience was nice, however I was expecting it to be larger  with much more choice.

리뷰:
This market is covered. There are escalators and lift. The market is organised into different sections. There are more furniture and decor stores on ground floor. Some even sells old door panels. On second floor, there are lots of old records store, toys, clothing, posters and small things. In the middle atrium there is a display like an UFO, which is closed. Its a future house.

There is a shop providing shipping service for antiques. See details in last photo. Its a nice place to spend some time looking at old and notsoold things if youre into this kind of stuff.

Im not a big fan of antiquities, but as a tourist I found it interesting anyway, as it somehow tells you what French people love and used to love.

You can find records, CDs and photographs of famous singers, actors, brands, social and political figures, among many others.

If youre not in the area, I dont recommend you to go there specifically to visit this place. However, if youre nearby, pay it a visit. It great to have a different perspective not everything in Paris are big and expensive brands.

However, take into account that a single small photograph can cost you about 30 euros there. No, its not cheap at all. If you like old things you will love this place. Vendors open when it suits them so I have no idea when the place is bustling and brimming with people and activity. Great antiques worth a pretty penny. The vintage clothing scene is small, expensive and real. We found some beautiful things that we could not afford. The street outside also has magnificent shops with amazing things to see even if you cant afford. Real nice with diverse finds from anticques, vintage, fake and completely overpriced. Nice coffe Noir in Nr. 18. Supernice pottery Shop upstairsartist is producing on the spot. Toilet is very very clean wheechairfriendly. Very fancy place in the middle of Paris Flea Market. The main flea market itself wasn't impressive as it has many stalls selling counterfeit products. March Dauphine itself has many artisanal stores selling interesting goods, pretty nice to take a stroll through and look around even if not purchasing anything.

55. Highly recommend.



Follow me for more reviews, tips and photos! Fabulous shop close to the metro.  Everything is made in France and things are not overpriced.  Wonderful assortment of gifts that makes it a 1 stop shop for all the gifts you want to bring home to friends and family! Quite a small store, but some interesting unique things to buy as souvenirs This is such a wonderful little souvenir shop. The owner was so friendly and helpful. There was a good selection of unique gifts at reasonable prices. I was so happy to support a local business. The shop's French Poodle is also a very big plus! He was so sweet and friendly! Far and away the best souvenir shop in Paris. The store only sells authentic made in France items that are high quality and that you wont find in the million other bargain souvenir shops in the city. 리뷰:
I love the story of The Little Prince, so of course I had to pay this store a visit. It's a small store, but if you're a fan you'll find everything your heart desires. There were so many different editions of the book, too! I especially loved the Scottisch version. The prices are fair and the staff is very friendly. The woman who was working when we went was new, but did her best to help us in the best way she could. Like the prince himself, I'd like to think I travelled across the planets and galaxies to reach this beautiful shop, considering I came from Australia. But the staff here are very kind, helpful, spoke English and the store itself, I mean, thanks to Antoine, I could literally buy one of each in the store and still not have enough.

This is a huge must even if you are a remote fan of the book! Staff here was so lovely!! Definitely worth a visit! Great selection of gifts and all so adorable. One of the prettiest shops we went to in Paris. Great for fans of the novel. We literally wanted to buy everything! Too bad the English copy of the book was out of stock we wanted to give our daughter her first copy, so the saleslady pointed us to Shakespeare  Co. near Notre Dame. But still, such a pretty store! The Little Prince Store in Paris is a beautiful and effervescent manifestation of a childhood classic. The store is located in the heart of the city, on the Rue de la Paix, and it is a mustvisit for any fan of the book.

이름: Les Drapeaux de France - Noxa depuis 1949
리뷰:
Wonderful shop full to the brim of metal figurines, lovingly shared and carefully curated into every subject imaginable! Unique shop! A real rabbit hole of wonder! Excellent service .. its a must visit in Paris! One of the most unique stores in Paris! An awesome selection of figurines from all eras, including random small statues, animals, and other antiques. This place is everything I thought it would be.old, dusty, stacked floor to ceiling, friendly service, and a wide range of prices! If you are looking for a unique gift for a collector or history buff, this is the place you need to go. Just dont get stuck in there for hours like I did lol I feel really lucky to have stumbled upon this figurine shop! Tiny, delicate, and fascinating miniature collectables of all shapes and types. From trees, to soldiers, to animals, to machinery including ships and Christmas items.

Just to drop in for a browse is great fun.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.

If youre taking young kids along ensure you control them because they can break things very easily.

And store hasnt got a lot of room but it packs plenty of wonderful stock. This is without doubt one of the most extraordinary shops I have seen in my life. If you like miniatures you must stop by. Hand Painted figurines of every sort, from wwii soldiers, to revolutionary France, to erotica and medieval cavalry. The only drawback are the prices, very very high, e.g. 200 euros for twoinch soldier. This is perhaps adequate given the quality, and the craftsmanship that goes into each one of them is extraordinary. Still, prices are high enough that I was discouraged from buying.

리뷰:
It says it closes at 22h, but the doors close at 21h45, with a very bad behavior from the security responsible Rotten vegetables empty shelves dirty broken fridge This evening we visited Carrefour Market at Paris 33 Rue de Maubeuge at 8.35pm, we barely got through the door before we heard yelling for us to get to the till as they were closing, even though the branch is open until 9pm leaving 25mins to do a very quick shop.

When we managed to get a small part what we needed to the till the bill came to 11.25, I handed over 21.50 to get a 10 note plus the change back and after waiting a while the cashier faffed around a while then I was only handed over 0.25 change, my wife picked this up straight away as soon as the change was put into my hand. When I said I gave you 21.50 the cashier refused to acknowledge this, she called her colleague over and then started counting together the quantity of each note type, even the coins which actually made no sense as the coin change was correct, she only needed to count the notes as I was missing the 10 note, at this point the cashier still hadn't closed the till after the transaction.

Their attitude was negative from the start, when I insisted that it was a 20 they implied it was impossible so I asked to see the manager who was absent so I asked for the name and the contact details but everyone refused, kicking up a fuss asking why do I need that. I also suggested they check the CCTV which they refused. The bouncer  security was as useless as the others saying to me come back tomorrow but till wouldnt give me the name of the manager no matter how much I insisted so I wonder what there is to hide. There is a Carrefour Market place 5 mins up the road at 63 Rue de Rochechouart that is much cleaner, has friendly helpful staff and a much better range of everything so I strongly advise you shop there. If you must shop at Maubeuge double check every cash or card transaction and avoid being served by the cashier with short hair and large glasses, also the cashier with brunette hair which came over to count the money is also just as bad. Probably all make a bit of extra personal' cash from all of this. Just a supermarket that I visit while staying overnight in a nearby hotel. The supermarket had all the basic stuff you expect and a little bit more. Nice fresh cakes, which I choose and great selection of wine. Who does not need some wine with a cake. Friendly staff and easy checkout using a plastic payment card. Paperback to put your groceries in. Carrefour for neighbourhood family shopping. Caters to family needs, groceries. Very reasonable price.

Not really clean, a bit gloomy clearer signages are required. I have visited Carrefour overseas and they look a whole lot better. Weird indeed.

Hi everyone,

Some security guards thought that they can act like a police force whereas they dont have any rights to search you.
One of them asked me several times questions about my ethnic background.
I was appalled and was wondering how can security guards can discriminante this way in France. It was a bad experience. It's a Carrefour Market. Clean and there are many items inside . There are 6 or 7 cashiers or more so dont worry to have to stay in long line for long time . We are staying at the hotel right next to it so it is a little live savior for us.. it is a clean market with fresh fruits and vegetables, drinks snacks and much more.. everything you need for the daily use you can and will find there  Nice place with a wide range of products and reasonable prices, cassiers were super friendly Beware come on time! We arrived at 21u40. At 21u50 one of the staff members was screaming at us that we had to leave because they were closed. I told him I still had 10 minutes to grab my bag of chips. He then even screamed louder and got very aggressive. Prevented me from getting anything anymore and escorted me and other people to the register. Change your openings hours to 21u50 if you dont want to work until 22. Rude staff. Ridiculous.

Massive supermarket with great prices, you will find there absolutely everything start from bakery , fruits, meat to cleaning products etc They almost have everything I needed as a tourist The fruit selection was pretty beat up by the end of a weekend but overall it's a decent grocery store Actually this place is a supermarket of Carrefour as you can see clearly in the pictures. It is a convenient shop to get what you need in your daily life, especially if you stay in a hotel nearby, your hotel does not offer dinner and you don't feel like going out. You will find lots of various items that you would find in major supermarkets, too.
Staff has not convinced me in terms of knowing the products they are selling especially when I asked if they had instant soup. But maybe it was just this one employee.
The store is clean and well arranged and the prices are absolutely pleasant. Close to our Airbnb which was perfect! Had everything we needed, meats, cheeses, fruits and veggies. Nice selection of breads and pastries as well. We even came back later for napkins, TP and toothpaste.  Staff was curtious even though our french was novice level.

리뷰:
Excellent store and great customer service  Top Rated Reviewer Always a good selection of fruits, meats, wines, and alcohols! However, I'd stay clear of the sushi. I became so sick with food poisoning that I had to go to the emergency room and was hospitalized. The doctors struggled to treat it as well. This is a risk of eating raw meats so I'm unhappy it happened but also still go to this Carrefour. The rest of the store is great and can be easily accessed from multiple doors into the mall during daytime business hours. Very nice and big market. Wide assortment. Sunday morning shop is a real thrill. Get in, get out, don't get yelled at. Had the honor of being the final customer at the selfcheckout  however I realized once I got home that the last product I picked up was the wrong thing and I only grabbed it in a panic as I was being rushed out.

They carry several hardertofind vegan products like multiple brands and varieties of cheese but it's kind of hidden and not in the place I would've expected.

Not bad overall, will come back when I've got more time to find all the best organic and vegan products. Great assortment of products. They have different check outs.

리뷰:
Carrefour senior management please take note  Appalling behaviour from a person who appeared to be the supervisor of the shift this evening.
As we approached the cashier, close to but before the closing time of 10pm, she was openly rude and derogatory  she clearly wanted to clear all tills before closing time.
Id like to respectfully remind her, and other passiveaggressive cashier staff, that the store is OPEN until 10pm. You may be tired and want to go home, but that is no reason to be overtly rude to customers.
We had paid for our goods and left the store before closing time  the whole very unpleasant experience was completely unnecessary.
The only shining example of good customer service was a very helpful and kind security guard who  helped us find what we were looking for.
Please promote him to supervisor so he can show the other staff how good customer service works. Never felt so disgusted in my life. I visited on June 4th at 19pm. I shop here everyday but today after taking my groceries from the guard at the entrance I was accused of stealing a 50 cents baguette and my groceries was taken away. Because I bought few things I left the ticket behind at the automatic cashier and the guard was not believing me, making up stories that he saw me stole the baguette. I feel humiliated I will never step into a Carrefour anymore! If you are buying your groceries close to Marcadet poissonniers just go to the Franxprix on the other side of the road. It has everything that it's needed.
The entrance and the exit part could be better.
In terms of qualityprice is okay. Fantastic endless antique and vintage and sundries market. Blocks and blocks of cool stuff Wonderfull place to walk and make picnic aside of th river. Lot of boats pass every five minutes with lot of passengers were enjoing visiting both side of th river and enjoing meals in th restaurent in side th boats. Wonderfull place river side to rest.

Why you hire such a lazy employee. These kind of people deserve to stay unemployed their whole life.

리뷰: Extremely rude staff and horrible experience. I went twice and they asked me to check my bags both times. Last time, they checked everything item by item like I am a thief taking away every shred of your selfrespect. I am here because I can afford to buy, no need to be racist and profile people and embarrass them. Better go to another super market or any other Carrefour. I'm a big fan of Carrefour but this wasn't quite as excellent as usual. It was good but there seemed to be less of a choice and the French wines were rather disappointing. The security guard loitering around the fruit and vegetable section looking at everyone suspiciously didn't help. For daily baguette and coissant, we used the excellent local boulangeries instead. The prices are good and competitive, but the security guards and some other staff consider people as chief in priori! From my experience, for the first time that I moved to this neighborhood , I just went to check what can I find near my home and what products are disponible, so I entered the shop and to exit I was hesitated about the exit door because both doors have exit sign, so I tried to exit from the entrance,... but the security was very brutal! Every time that I am coming back from home and I will go shopping there, the security or the other staff ask me to inspect my bag. Sometimes it is unsupportable. You cannot consider everyone as a thief! It is very simple we can do shopping some where else, a little more expensive but with more respect! In addition, according to law it is just the security staff who can demand to check the bags not the other staff! The more interesting thing is that the quick shopping part is always close and I guess this is because they afraid someone may thief something, and some times you have to stay in a long queue for shopping. You guys can do better with a little respect to others! Very clean. Groceries and produce well stocked. Visited in July when travelling Paris A large supermarket, closed on Sundays. Plenty of choices and a very large vegetables set

영업시간: no operation time

리뷰:
Cute little market. We went Saturday morning, open 72ish. About 1520 stalls including 2 cheese, 1 seafood, 2 butchers, a couple of food stands, flowers, veggies and clothing. Butchers and veggie stands are pretty friendly. The market is open every Sat morning and Wed afternoon, closed for the whole month of August.

Very nice products and price at the veggie and fruit stands.

However, the seafood is not that great. There were bees and insects surrounding the fish products but it was the only one with seafood so not much choice for me.

On top of that, the owner treated each customer differently. The lady before me wanted a piece of salmon and he cut a nice piece from the belly. When its my turn, he just took a leftover piece from the tail, even added another tail after weighing and finding out the first one was too small.

I asked to have a single piece of fish since I am eating alone but he replied he could only offer me tails, while there were still a lot of them with belly at 1200. Finally I just took one.

Almost 7 euros for a small piece of tail of 170g, I will go to the supermarket next time Great to stop by on Wednesday afternoons and Saturday mornings. Markets with many products in the center flowers, cheeses, sausages... Great French products at a very good price. Market overall good but deli stand to avoid! I have never eaten such a bad and watery stuffing and the rest of the products are generally more than average. Wednesday afternoon and Saturday morning.
Flowers and plants at Amel and Benot kindness, professionalism and quality. The cheese at Marie's always offers great discoveries. Fruits and vegetables next to flowers such beautiful products... And don't forget a small bottle of cider or sparkling apple juice... A treat!

They had my package arrived i come to get it they cant find it tells me to xome back tomorrow. Fair enough, they cant find it again, tells me to come back the day after AGAIN, and then they would for sure find it! The person in the back is nice, the man in the front is horribly rude and stinks of alcohol. All 3 times i was there. He refuse to find a solution with me, tells me to call mondial relay, so i do and they ask to speak with him to find a solution and he REFUSES. So rude tells me to leave and that i cause to much problems, and tells me to come back monday to see it was saturday, and the package arrived wednesday before in the end after having mondial on the phone for 30 min i demand to go down and find the package myself and i find it. The was something mistaken with the numbers, maybe mondials mistake maybe their anyways that doesnt matter, the manowner was just extremely rude and not trying to help at all. It isnt posted on their hours but despite being open, they dont service customers as a relay point between 133015H. This is not posted on the mondial relay site either. If theres zero star it would be better.
The guy in the morning is so rude. but wanted to give them 0 stars or even take away the 2.2 they have. Super rude, unaccomodating people. I dont know why these people do a job that they hate... AVOID THIS PLACE FOR ANY MONDIAL RELAY USE.. just generally avoid this place for everything!

주소: St Antoin, 115-117, 115 Rue Saint-Antoine, 75004 Paris, France
리뷰:
Came here several times during my 3week trip to Paris in May 2024.

Definitely like this store instead of Monoprix on the same street. They just seem to have a better selection of food items, and the staff that works up front at the cash registers are so much nicer here! Tip for those who love seafood , please try some if you walk there  there is a side street shop that opens on Fri and weekends in front of that convenience store. All are fresh and tasteful. We tried oysters, shrimps, snails and crab. Oyster  has light, fresh and sweet taste. I prefer the creamy ones from Wales but his ones are wonderful as well.
Shrimps are the best  full fresh, soft and so sweet. I did buy twice in the same day for it.
He prepare all the oysters and all u need is a folkspoon   to enjoy. A worker completely have no mannerism
and logical way of thinking.

I went there around 1 PM today,8 November 2023 to pick up my panier from Too good to go app.
I came up to this 40 y.o guy and said bonjour but the first thing he said was what u want? in a very rude way.
And long story short,He did not believe that i have validated my order even though i showed him the app,the history of order and everything.
Treated me like i was trying to scam.

He even took my phone away from my hand,went inside the back room without asking or saying nothing.
Which showing 0 manner.

And he finally came outside the back room after couple minutes,gave me my phone back
AND STILL NOT BELIEVE AND JUST LEFT AWAY WITH A SAYING no.

So i got nothing from the store though i paid, wasted my time and energy to go there
just to treated this bad.

I dont know if he was working while under influence of drugs,but this is the first time ive ever seen someone working with that attitude.

Regardless what my race is or how much my order cost,that just not how a service works. Conveniently located, have all you need on a daily basis and reasonably priced The shop is perfectly situated near the metro. Convenient if you feel like grabbing last minute lunch or something for dinner. Queue at the cashier is quick and easy. It won't cause you any hassle when you are running out of time.

리뷰: Very busy place in the afternoons.  Good selection of products, fruits, beverages etc.  Friendly staff. I have just left the store on Rue de Tivoli in the Marais and was queuing behind a very elderly ladythis cashier was so rude and aggressive and disgusting in her behaviour towards the lady infront of me that Im taking the time out of my busy day to report the cashier. I cant find customer relations on the website however I hope its seen by management and this cashier is promptly sacked. A very bad reflection on Carrefour! Tired of being hungry in my hotel room at night and even more so of overpriced mediocre food stuffed into a corner since I am a solo traveler, I found this little grocery store. I was very pleased with the place. The guy was friendly and helpful and for 22 euros, I got chocolate, chips, 2 energy drinks, 2 nice cheeses, dried salami, pasta salad, olives and a bagette! Highly recommend as a tourist  2 small bottles of water in a plastic bottle costs 3 euros. Very neat and organised but most of the items were out of stock. It would be better if all items needed were in stock rather than empty shelfs.

리뷰:
Convenient and not crowded with tourists, mostly local folks. Reasonable prices. Choose fruits carefully, some are rotten already as this summer lingering too hot into September 2023. Premade salads, cold cuts, and drinks designed for grabtogo lifestyles in the big city. Not nice when you need to do emergency shopping for the day after and the store is closed at 22.30 when it states closed at 23h. Very friendly staff, young and dynamic.
Bought 3 big bottles of water for less than 2, so not as expensive as the surrounding neighbourhood. The security asked to my boyfriend open the jacket in the middle of everyone suggesting that he was hidden something under the coat, was completely evasive and non sense at all. And even when he saw that he was hiding nothing, he just leave and don't even apologize. I don't know where these people are trained but everyone knows that is a problem worldwide, a guy was murder in Brazil last month by the hands of the security team of Carrefour... Disgusting company! I was not lucky to be the nearest of my home but i will walk more everyday just to not shop there anymore... Variety of products and good prices. All the stuff are very polite

리뷰: my goto shop for fresh vegetables and fruit. Great range of asian sauces and ingredients and not too expensive. the owner is a great guy, very friendly and helpful. there is always something to catch your eye here and inspire your culinary mind. Great variety of Asian sauces, spices and other ingredients at excellent prices. The freshest and cheapest ginger in Paris. They also have 2 essential ingredients for good homemade Chinese food that I could not find elsewhere chili garlic sauce and black bean sauce. A cramped little store with an excellent selection of ingredients for all kinds of east Asian cuisines, from lemongrass and galangal to nori and kimchi, and of course many kinds of rice, vegetables, and frozen seafood.  The prices are somewhat better than what you'd find in the more traditional supermarkets, too.  I only wish they'd be open a little later so it would be easier to shop there on my way home from work. A little bit pricey but it's a nice location so that you don't have to go to Chinatown 13th10th for Asian groceries. Mainly Chinese. Some Korean and Japanese goods as well. Small and a little smelly.

리뷰:
What a stunning store and shopping experience. Beautiful layout and a great selection of brands. All the staff are extremely nice and helpful. Bought so many unique pieces which I love. Poyu helped me get the items I wanted as was looking for particular styles. Service was beyond outstanding. My go to store in Paris..... "Dover Street Market offers an amazing shopping experience. The staff is fantastic, the clothing selection is outstanding, and the presentation of the items is topnotch. A truly enjoyable and stylish shopping destination!" If you like fashion, if you love shopping, you should go Dover Street Market Paris. You will love it. For suer. Definitely!! We arrived at a bit of a hectic time, probably due to the sales having just started. It was so busy! But the staff were incredibly helpful and patient, it made the whole shopping experience very pleasant, thank you! 1. Under staffed
2. Missing prices
3. Sales is not clearly marked so you need to ask check point 1
4. Got told off for drinking water from a bottle while it was 29 degrees in Paris
5. Not enough changing rooms

I feel that the Japan experience was better.

리뷰: Great place, huge! Worth researching before you go as there's about 10 different sections to the market which sell different things. We didn't research before and wish we had. Beautiful Jazz bar in here too, well worth a visit. Easier to navigate than expected friendly stall owners and a better class of vintage vinyl than we get in the UK.  If you have time do it.  I would happily have spent more time here but I did have a train to catch Treasure trove of antiques! Not your usual flea market as its more antique focused but still absolutely amazing. Pickpockets everywhere so be careful as the surrounding area isnt the nicest. However you are guaranteed to pick up some beautiful antiques prices are rising due to popularity Not very easy to get to, located in an unflattering area of Paris, but, great finds, very large area, and welcoming people. I like the flea market itself, always feels like a museum. I just wish it wasnt located in such a shady area. If you are in need of fake AirPods the shady area is for you!

The Carrefour Express is a typical grocery store you would find in Paris. It has all of the essentials that youll need plus they have a nice selection of cheese and a good selection of wine as well. The prices were pretty good for being in a large metropolitan city and the staff seem friendly enough. I recommend you stop here if youre needing provisions. Catastrophic service , very rude guy at the till who insulted me and basically told me
To get lost ! I will be filing a complaint against this person, this happened today about an hour and a half ago, avoid this place plus the wasnt filled out with lots of food Really a great grocery store where you can find most anything and all high quality and at good prices.  I get my foodie family and friend's their souvenir gifts here. Small supermarket where you can find the most needed groceries. Vegetable, drinks etc. Not a high price for the products. Must for every Indian visiting Paris. Have all household stuff.

리뷰: Loved having this little market around the corner from my bed  breakfast. My fianc and I would stop by daily to by wine, cheese, and bread! Being in confinement very close to this supermarket, it is a nice place. Reasonably priced for the area. All what you need, enough fresh and organic products. And being in a tourist area, now almost always really empty. you never have to queue at the cashier also self checkouts Small but therere everything you are looking for. Good range of foods and snacks. Reasonable and of good quality. I frequent their establishments wherever they are present, as their service and quality is good.

리뷰:
One of the only small shops open which can provide a dropoff service for shipping parcels via Mondial Relay. says they accept card on the door, but cash only I could not get my cargo. Absolute nonsense in these comments. These people are always open. I have rarely been there to find them closed and have collected over 50 packages in the last year. Nothing exceptional, but a good relay point to collect your packages if you live near the center. Chaotic!
To retrieve a package is impossible, the young cashier asks the customer to come back or look for it himself in the pile of packages while he calls! A sketch
The store is untidy, traffic is difficult and the smell is unpleasant. To avoid.

During my shopping i got hosted by the most kindest agent i have ever met i beleieve she called salma abderrassoul she was so kind and helpful Great customer service, love Carrefour. Still in doubt Why did the cashier not give me the change?

There is no receipt provided. I bought 2 times in one day. 2 times, and no receipt.
The 2nd time I bought a shopping bag which cost only 4.99, I paid 10 and the staff didn't give me the change!
I admitted I overlooked it. But when I came back to the store after 10 seconds. The staff is still holding my 10 talking with his colleagues and not even thinking of putting it in the cashier!
When I came back and asked for my return, he asked if I had 5 change. I thought he was out of coins, so I searched for coins to pay for that. But I eventually found out he had the change but just didn't want to give it to me. It wasted my extra time to handle this incident he wasn't willing to talk with me about why he missed the change after all. No apologies at all. It was an unpleasant experience. Nice service. Kind and made my day  Ismael Convenient opening hours, friendly staff and good choice of products

주소: 20 Rue du Pont Neuf, 75001 Paris, France
리뷰:
Great place for Korean dry goods. It has lots of drink varieties and even Onigiri! Lots of ramen varieties. Its smaller than the main store in Rue Saint Anne but has pretty much everything you need korean groceries. There are cooked food like bibimbap, japjae, onigiri, gimbab, kimchis. Sojus and korean wines. Korean soft drinks. Korean sauces, instant ramens, chocolates, snacks. Pretty much everything. too small shop compared to the other but staffs are kind enough! Good 1st impression , it's small but has a good enough sample of Korean articles and a microwave always a good option .
I tried the cooked tteokbokki it was my 1st time trying it and it was deliciously hot  .    .  . Happy to find this Korean market near Chtelet Les Halles.

리뷰: I got a corset the other day for 35 euros, and i see now that it is available on SHEIN and aliexpress for 8,99. Exactly the same item and same composition and origin. I come to thrift stores exactly cause i DONT want to shop from these sites. And  i am paying x4 the price of the itemor even more? Not coming back there sorry. Beautiful place, overwhelming if you like that style, which I love. The workers were lovely and made it so much better!! Theres truly anything there that comes to mind. Only downside is the prices, but I dont mind them, theyre worth it when I find something I truly like and I did!! Very organized store with really good selection of pieces. They have a lot of vintage brand names like Nike, Adidas, and more if thats what youre looking for. Tons of Levis jeans as well. The pricing is reasonable as most pieces are in good condition and unique. Staff are friendly and speak some English. Really nice. The girls that tend the store are sweet. Great variety of clothing and cool vibe
